name: Blue Stones
description:
Wargame set in the world of Zargo (see "Zargo's Lords" and "Zargos"). The Wizard-Monks defend the magical Blue Stones against three other races. A classic wargame, albeit with a more tactical scale than Zargo's Lords.

As usual with International Team, no date to be found anywhere. My guess would have been 1970s; listed as 1987 by a German Nuernberg game fair review. Rules in French, Italian and German only! Funagain claims to have an English translation. I suspect the author is Marco Donadoni, who also created Zargo's Lords.

name: Hungry Ant
description:
Here's your chance to get an ant's eye view of life. Suppose you're a starving little ant and some people come along and spread out a lot of mouth-watering snacks for their picnic. You'd really love to get a few but you know it's not going to be easy...

This is a children's (Ages 6 - 12) tile laying game where the players try to connect their ant tunnels to the goodies at the picnic (7x7 grid). They can also play tiles of "baddies" (bug spray, ant-eating spiders, human feet that squash ants, etc.) on the other player's tunnels causing them to go around or play a tile clearing the problem before they can go on. When all the goodies are eaten, the player who got the most wins.

Although simple (only 5 different tunnel patterns to choose from), no dice rolling or memory element helps young gamers develop and rely on their strategy skills instead of luck.

name: La destruction de la 106. Panzer Brigade, Lorraine 1944
description:
La destruction de la Panzer Brigade 106 (Destruction of 106th Panzer Brigade) is a small introductory WWII wargame, simulating the clash in France between the 106th Panzer Brigade and the 90th US Infantry Division.

The game uses a easy movement-combat I-go-You-Go system, each turn game represents 2 hours of real time, a hex is 1 km cross, each counter is a batallion, a company or a squadron.

It is published on Vae Victis Hors-série #6 and includes:
- a 21 x 29 cm map,
- 22 counters to be cut and mounted
- a 2-pages rules in French

name: Alea evangelii
description:
Alea evangelii is from the tafl family of games. The original name of the game is unknown. Alea evangelii is the first words of the twelfth-century Corpus Christ College manuscript 122, commonly known as Corpus Irish Gospels, which contains a description of the game. The game is believed to represent a naval battle and is played on a 18 x 18 game board. The description of the game states that it was invented at the court of King Æthelstan of England (924–939).

Each of the four corners and borders of the diagram is assigned to one of the four Evangelists. 67 pieces are derived from the Eusebian Canons: each Canon defines a number of pieces corresponding to the square of its number of columns. Pieces defined by a specific canon are grouped together on the board: such groups are labeled by a cross and the number of the corresponding canon.

Four more pieces are painted in red (all the others are painted in black) and in the manuscript are mentioned as "different men" (varios viros): two of these four pieces are assigned to the Evangelist John (N14, F6), the other to Mark (N6, F14). The four “different men” are also labeled on the board as related to the passion of Christ.[8] One of the black pieces (E13) is referenced in the manuscript as "the primary man" and "belongs to none of the evangelists"; it represents "the Unity of the Trinity", the one purpose of the four evangelists. Finally, "the figure 1 in the middle of the alea signifies the indivisible substance of the Trinity, or the supremacy of the first canon".[6]

The 16 pieces of Canon I form the diamond at the center of the board. Canons II, III and IIII, together with the four "different men" and the "primary man", form the circle surrounding the central diamond. Canons V, VI, VII, VIII, IX are organized horizontally along the lines of the board. The four pieces corresponding to each of the four Evangelists in Canon X are placed in the four quadrants of the board (C14, Q14, C6, Q6).

The manuscript mentions the existence of attackers and defenders, but the two sides are not differentiated on the diagram, which only presents the details of how the pieces are assigned to the four evangelists according to the Christian allegory which is the main subject of the text. In other tafl games the goal of the attacker is to capture the king and the goal of the defender is to make the king escape from the board, it has been assumed that this is the case also with the game on which the Alea Evangelii moralization was based.

Games of the tafl family only have two kinds of pieces: a king that occupies the center of the board in the initial layout and a number of ordinary pieces divided between attackers and defenders with a 2:1 ratio. The "dukes and count" that appear in Alea Evangelii do not seem to fit this simple scheme. It is tempting to suggest that on his travels, perhaps in Rome, Israel may have heard of the new game just beginning to circulate in Europe, chess, with its comites, milites, and other pieces, and borrowed the idea of different ranks from that game.

name: Svoyi Koziri
description:
Russian card game of attacking and getting rid of all cards. Originally a game for two, three or four players, it's mostly known today in an adapted version for two players brought into England by the Mathematics professor A.S. Besikovitch, and later included in David Parlett's Oxford Guide to Card Games. This version is played with exposed cards and symmetrical hands, giving it a strong strategic flavour.

At the beginning of the (Besikovitch) game each player chooses two sets without overlapping with the other player, typically in a 32-card deck, out of which one is their own trump. Cards are dealt for the first player, who keeps the cards of their both sets; the second player gets exactly the same cards in the other sets and both their hands are filled up with the rest of the cards. As an example: a player who's chosen spades and clubs with spades as trumps keeps the cards in both sets and gives all their red cards together with the undealt cards to the other player, who then selects the analog cards to the first player's in the red sets with hearts as trumps, gives the rest of the red cards back to the first player and finally keeps all the remaining black cards. Both hands are symmetrical, and play can start.

From now on each turn a player lays a card in a pile between both players; before the next player can play out a card of their choice they must throw one that is superior in value to the top card in the pile or a trump. If the player can't or doesn't want to do so they must take the whole pile and forfeit the turn. So, each player throws two cards in a row: one following the previous card, and one to be followed by the opponent. The first player to get rid of all cards in their hand is the winner.

name: BioShock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia – Handyman Figure
description:
Bioshock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia – Handyman Figure is an extra handyman for the founder player. It was released in the Ultimate Songbird Edition and Collector's Edition of the video game. Initially, this figure had no rules associated with it, but the publisher has since instituted the following rule:

Founders may have up to four Handymen on the board at the same time. Whenever the founder player has four Handymen on the board, the Vox Populi player has the following ability: "Once per round you may discard an action card from your hand to search your discard pile for a card of your choice, show it to the other player, and place it into your hand. You may not search your discard pile for the Airship card."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme

name: Gute Nacht Monster
description:
Okay, don't panic now, but monsters are lying underneath your bed. You're quite sure of this because you've seen them first-hand — but wait? How many were there? What color were they? And couldn't some of them actually have been teddy bears?

In Gute Nacht Monster, players roll six dice each round, with the dice showing monsters and teddy bears in three different colors. All players need to remember these dice as quickly as they can because the dice then disappear under the bed and a task card is revealed, with players being asked, for example, how many green monsters are present. All players answer in secret, and whoever is correct moves their figure one step closer to the light switch. Whoever manages to turn on the light wins!

name: Pitchstorm: NC-17
description: An XXX expansion for Pitchstorm: No one 17 and under admitted. "For the fans of dirty and/or offensive cards. This deck is stuffed full of inappropriate content that you should never show your family (unless your family is super cool)."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Dingo Disc
description:
A game of skill, balance, strategy and skill where players must place all their counters on a balanced disk without dropping the counters which have already been placed.

Each player, in turn, rolls both dice. The colour die determines the coloured area of the disk; the 6 die indicates the location to place the counter.

The winner is the player who places all his counters first. Any player who spills all the counters off the disk automatically loses.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Party Game

name: Something Wild! Dr. Seuss
description:
Something Wild is a line of card games featuring beloved characters and collectible Pop! pocket figures. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs. The first player to score three powers wins the game.

Something Wild! Dr. Seuss is a fast-paced, light card game for the whole family! Featuring a collectible Cat in the Hat Pop! figure, as well as your favorite characters from the world of Dr. Seuss.

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Tri*T*Area
description:
Aim to be an accomplished developer who can contribute the most to the new city's development plans!

In this may-follow game, you are aiming to have the most pieces on top of the buildings in each of the four areas or the piece on the top of the tallest building. The people who play the highest and lowest ranked card in the suit which is most present in the trick will earn the right to place their pieces onto the board.

The game plays over three rounds. In the second round, the players will have one unplayed card, and they will earn points if they have the majority of pieces on top of buildings in that area. In the third round, the players will score similarly, but the card must be revealed at the start of the hand.

The player with the most points wins.
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: Pagelaran Yogyakarta
description:
Yogyakarta or Jogja is an Indonesia city state in the heart of Java island. This city are well known for their historical places and arts. Performing Arts also one of the reason the tourist from all over the places came to visit.

In Pagelaran Yogyakarta, Players take role as a new appointed manager of the fictional theater that on the brink of bankruptcy. They are challenged to save this building by manage the show that would interest the tourists that come to this building.

On each turn, a player will going to choose one of three possible actions. Are they going to looking for a funding, looking for show to perform on the next turn, or to perform a show from the show card that they have on their hand? Also there's a debt to be paid on the end of the month (every 4th round)
mechanics: Action Queue, Memory, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkans
description:
Abstract game set in a fantasy world.

Each player has 20 square tiles and each tile is numbered on all 4 sides. On your turn, you place a tile from your hand onto the board with a 5 by 5 grid. The placed tile must be adjacent to at least another tile already placed with all adjacent numbers matching (with the effect that you refill your hand) or (partly) with adjacent lower numbers (with the effect that all tiles with lower numbers are removed from the game).

Game ends after 20 turns. The winner has put down the most tiles in the corners of the game board.

name: Inkerman: The Soldiers' Battle, 5 November 1854
description:
Crimean War Quad: Inkerman - The Soldiers' Battle, 5 November 1854

"Inkerman, 'The Soldier's Battle' is a simulation of the combat occurring between British, French and Russian forces on Inkerman Ridge on 5 November 1854 during the Crimean War. Inkerman is known as the Soldier's Battle because of the lack of higher command during most of the fighting. The game scale is 180 meters per hex ans 30 minutes per Game-Turn."


1 17" x 22" color map
with matte-finish back printed counters
36 Red British
8 Blue French
56 Green Russians divide into 2 commands
14 Game Turn Historical Scenario
21 Game Turn Optional Scenario

name: Cranium Bible Edition
description:
Cranium Bible Edition is a version of the popular party game Cranium. Teams have to complete activities in each of four sections to win:

Creative Cat : A player must clue a word to his or her teammates by drawing it, sculpting it in clay, or drawing it with his or her eyes closed.
Data Head : A variety of trivia questions taken from the Bible.
Word Worm : Players unscramble words, spell challenging words, guess definitions, identify words with letters left out, or spell words backwards.
Star Performer : players must whistle a song, impersonate a character from the Bible, or act out a clue.


Cranium Bible Edition features all-new cards, and a 3-in-1 game board that lets you choose how long you want to play.
categories: Party Game, Puzzle, Religious, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Team-Based Game

name: Brainbox: My First ABC
description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Albi, Brainbox Games Pty Ltd, Green Board Game Co., moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Snack Attack
description:
Hungry dinos everywhere! Fast-paced and easy-to-learn, steal snacks in this family-friendly, competitive card game for 2-4 players!

How Its Played:
Players draw 3 cards consisting of food and flavors. Players then take turns stacking the cards on dishes. Once enough food is on the plate you claim it as yours.

Players can try to sabotage each other by playing Picky Eater cards like bitter and sour, or use sweet and spicy to protect their own snacks.

Cards like Rex and Momnisaur also add variety to the game by returning all food to the deck, or forcing players to share their food.

Scoring and Winning:
Every dish that is claimed is scored at the end of a round. Snacks are each worth 1 point, and everything else is worth 0. The winner of the game is the player with the most points after 3 rounds.

name: Numbers League: Critters Expansion
description:
Super Pets have come to Infinity City! This Expansion deck is to be added to the original Numbers League game. It adds 30 new cards to the base game. Included in this expansion is:

21 heroes building cards (for a total 7 new matching heroes)
6 devices cards and
6 new villains

Note: Expansion needs the base game, it does not stand on its own. For more information on how this game plays, please see base game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math

name: Road to New Eden
description:
An adventure board game in a post apocalyptic universe. Your goal is to find the city of New Eden before others players.

Each player will play a character with 8 characteristics: fighting, shooting, driving, chating and having mechanical, medical, discretion and foraging abilities.

Each turn, players choose one of the 5 possible destinations. On his way to the chosen destination, each player will make an encounter and most of the time a fight will result. But all encounters are not the same. Depending on your opponent you'll try to run away, to pay what he wants or to use one of your 8 characteristics to fight him. If you own a car you also can try to accelerate to evade. Your characteristic plus some items and a dice will decide if you succeed or not.

Depending on the place you've chosen different actions are possible: trying to hide to recover, collecting items, selling or buying items, fighting with other players or exchanging items in between players. Items are in your hand. You may use most of them but some have a cost you must pay to use them.

But in this post apocalyptic survival is not easy. Each turn you must eat and drink. You can get wounded or contract diseases that players with good medical abilities can heal or cure. Players can also improve weapons, vehicles or armors using their technical abilities.

The first player to arrive at New Eden, one of the 5 destinations, wins. But the road to new Eden is more challenging: you'll face 5 encounters on your way. And before entering New Eden you must be free of any disease.

Two additional scenari are available, one with a mission to be accomplished before trying the road to New Eden, and one for a single player.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Break In: Chichén Itzá
description:
To escape, you must first...break in!

Each title in the Break In game line presents a collaborative experience that begins the moment you lift the lid off the game box. Inside, you will see a 3D shape with graphics representing the area you are trying to break into. Your paperwork tells you to STOP and make sure you are all ready before you begin — get your cards laid out, settle in with all the players, read your instructions, then begin looking for clues to solve puzzles!

Soon, you will be told to open the game board and unfold the first of three layers, expanding your board and revealing the next layer you have to explore to uncover clues that will lead you further inside! It's a one-of-a-kind unboxing experience! Along the way, you'll see wonderful things, meet interesting characters, and complete amazing challenges using clever hints and a unique solution system. The final puzzle leads you to your goal — and then you must escape!

In Break In: Chichén Itzá, the year is 1833, and in your studies of the ancient Mayans you have come across clues that allude to secret pyramids and a legendary throne. And now you go in search of them, entering Chichén Itzá!

name: Robots
description:
Create your Robot, there are several models. But watch out for the devastating robot and its gang, dynamite ... and the wickedness of your opponents!
The aim of the game is to win the game by building your own Robot first with 1 Head, 1 Bust, 1 Left Arm, 1 Right Arm, 1 Left Leg, 1 Right Leg.

PREPARATION and VICTORY
Shuffle the deck and place it face down in the center of the table.
During the game, the discard pile (cards played) and the market area (where the Robot-components you have drawn and which cannot be used for your Robot) will be placed on the sides of the deck.
The youngest player starts the game by drawing the top card.
The game ends when a player completes his Robot with the six required Robot-Component cards. If there are no more cards to draw: take all the cards from the discards, from the market and from ALL the deposits, shuffle them and continue the game, repeat this operation until there is a winner.

GAME TURN
Each player during his turn can only perform ONE action from the following:

- Draw a card from the deck showing it to everyone, if the card is a Robot-Component that you don't have, it must be placed in front of you
going to train your Robot, otherwise if it is a Robot-Component you already own, it must be positioned in the market area.
If you lose one or all of the components of your Robot, due to MINI ROBOT DEVASTATOR or BAND of MINI ROBOTS DEVASTATORI cards, you can continue with different components from the previous one, by fishing or buying them on the market at the cost of 3 BOLTS.
The other cards: Bolt, Guard Robot, Mini Robot Devastator and Band of Mini Robots Devastators, must be positioned to the side of your Robot to form an area that we are going to call deposit, and played when you want, in a subsequent turn, when you decide not to draw a card or when you are attacked by an opponent.
If you draw the DYNAMITE card it must be played immediately.

- Use one card from your warehouse: MINI ROBOT DEVASTATOR or BAND of MINI ROBOTS DEVASTATORI to distract the Robot from the opponents or three BOLT cards to purchase a ROBOT-COMPONENTS card from the market.

name: Haselwurz und Bärenklau
description:
From Spielbox:

In the game, the players build up a landscape with six-sided tiles (forest, rich meadows, lean meadows, farmland, lake, village and quarry). The players look for rare plants and animals at the corners of these tiles. There are four face-up animal or plant tiles which indicate which landscape types they must touch in order to be found there. Plants and animals, once found, are worth points.
The players travel as gnomes via dragonfly, badger, bird and grasshopper. The landscape determines which tiles can be crossed with which type of transportation. Players can only use the same type of transportation again after they have used all four at least once.

name: Malvinas
description:
The Falklands ("Malvinas" in Spanish) are a small group of islands in the South Atlantic that have caused a diplomatic conflict between Argentina and the UK since 1833.

On the 2nd April 1982 Argentinian forces invaded the islands, which started the Falklands' War. The British reaction was immediate and on the 5th April the first forces sailed to the Falklands. The Argentinians surrendered on the 14th June.

The Falklands' War was the largest air and sea operation since WWII and highlighted the importance in modern warfare of logistics, missiles (air-air, ship-air), the air forces, professional troops, etc.

name: Polska 1939
description:
1939 marks the twilight of greatest conflict in human history. All started on September 1st 1939 in Poland when German army launched its first strike. This campaign was to prove German warfare superiority and be quick and easy "walk to Warsaw". It wasn't that quick and easy though as defeating Poland took Germans the same amount of time they needed for France - even with help of Soviet backstab on September 17th.

Game allows to play full campaign in Poland. Map covers Polish territory in 1939 and supplies full Polish, German and Soviet forces that were involved in the region. Additional Slovakia, Lithuania and Romania units that could potentially be involved are in the set as well.

There are 2 scenarios in the game: German assault on September 1st and Polish counter at Bzura river. On http://www.taktykaistrategia.pl you can get more including hipotetic conflict USSR vs. Poland (based on Polish plan "EAST") and others.

Number of scenarios was published in Taktyka i Strategia magazine:
- Plan "Zachód" (No. 34)
- Plan Porwita (No. 35)
- 17 Września (No. 33)
- Linia Wisły (No. 32)
- Atak na Prusy Wschodnie (No. 31)
- Plan "Wschód" (No. 30)

name: Dig Dog Dig
description:
Four dogs have buried their prized treasures in the yard — but they can’t remember where! In Dig Dog Dig, players take turns digging up the yard racing to be the first doggie to find all five of their favorite toys! Dig Dog Dig features fast and fun gameplay with a “backyard-in-a-box” that will make the whole family come play in the yard again and again!

Players begin by hiding each other's toys in the yard. On a player's turn they move their dog to a new location and look inside the hole. They keep any of their on toys they find and then re-hide all others. The player to find all five of their toys wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Something Wild! Peppermint Lane Santa Claus Game
description:
Something Wild! Peppermint Lane is a fast-paced, light card game for the whole family! Featuring a collectible Santa Claus! figure, as well as your favorite characters from Funko’s Peppermint Lane.Power

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Pirate Dice
description:
Pirate Dice is an innovative, fast and funny little board game about pirate life. It is full of everyday events from usual pirate life: battles, horror gigantic krakens and old maps. In the game you choose the character to play. It's one of the famous pirate leaders. Each of them has his own ability to help you get rich quickly.

Turn begins with the player opens the top card in the event deck and everyone gets involved in a new adventure, which usually ends with a grandiose sea battles. For example, when the card Trade Fleet comes to play all players may send the quantity of their ships they want to rob that trade ship. In case the raid was successful all players divide the loot among themselves. When the card of Royal Fleet is opened all ships of all players have to take part in this battle. But they also have two alternatives: 1) they may try to escape: 2) or they may buy off those royal ships. There are also places where players may renew their ships. Floating Tavern is such card. The current player rolls a die and adds received number to the modification indicated on the card. This sum indicates the quantity of pirates in the floating tavern. These pirates are the cheapest in the game. They cost just one coin per pirate. After this the players start hidden auction to determine who will be the first in buying the pirates. For the hidden auction they use coins, it means who may buy more rum to the pirates. Most likely, not all players will be able to buy new pirates. The player who collects more victory points represented with gold and ships becomes the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Tentacle Bento: Foil Pack
description: New recruits have arrived to Takoashi University. Increase the mayhem in your games of Tentacle Bento with this 19 card, holofoil expansion pack. Including events, characters, all-stars, and students, every holofoil card in this expansion pack features unique art to make your games more colorful than ever!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Sensu
description:
In the card game Sensu, players collect Japanese folding fans, trying to collect fan cards worth exactly 20 in their hand. Once they do, they can play that combination of cards to redeem one or more of the cards in it, using the redeemed cards over time to build their personal fans.

The first player to complete two fans of different types wins.

name: La Bataille de Friedland
description:
One large-hex map in pastel (84x59 cm) and 498 counters (mainly oblong regimental units, with step-loss breakdowns, and circular pictograph leader units). The oblong counters simulate both line and column formation. Uses Vive l'Empereur system (36-page rulebook) and a 32-page scenario booklet including roster sheets and leaders' hidden orders sheets. Complexity is medium to high. Rules available in English as well as French. Sister game of La Bataille d'Eckmuehl, also by AWE.

Game System:
scale = 250 m/hex;
time = 30 min/GT;
strength = 600 men/SP (Regimental/Brigade Size)

name: Rod Soccer
description:
Rod Soccer is a relatively inexpensive reimplementation of the dome-style hockey games found in many arcade halls. The game combines many aspects and game play of Rod Hockey and Foosball.

Using steel rods, plastic or metal soccer players slide along defined track segments. There are five players and one goalie per side, just like in its Rod Hockey predecessor. Players simultaneously turn and move their five metal rods to pass and shoot the ball. Games can be played using a timer or to a set number of points.

Various field and ball designs have been used over the years, attempting to capture the realistic feel of soccer, while reducing bounce and the ball being ejected from the game.

Skilled players can learn how to alter their shots between "ground" balls and volley shots.

The game is light enough to be played on any elevated surface (such as a dining table or coffee table). It remains as light as the Rod Hockey predecessor.

name: Star Wars: Scrabble
description:
Visit a galaxy far, far away…. with Scrabble Brand Crossword Game: Star Wars Edition. Now you can launch your Scrabble game into hyperspace with two different ways to play: Enjoy classic Scrabble with Star Wars vocabulary added or try Galaxy Mode for a more immersive game experience. Galaxy Mode alters the method of scoring so players of all skill levels can enjoy the game.

In Galaxy Mode, the words you build allow you to move one of four iconic star ship movers the Millennium Falcon, Boba Fett's star ship, an X-wing, or a TIE fighter around the board to collect Galaxy Cards for powerups and points. The Star Wars glossary used for both games modes recognizes the vocabulary of the Empire, the Rebels, and everyone in between!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Contra
description:
Players alternate placing crown and/or player tiles, trying to match colors orthogonally. Perfect matches gain a coin and slightly less than perfect matches have no effect but, watch out!, significantly less than perfect matches carry a severe penalty. Too many missed placements and you're eliminated!

Reimplemented as:

Architekton


(With expanded rules.)

name: Isaac Asimov presents Super Quiz III
description:
This the third in the series of 3 trivia games in the Super Quiz series. Same rules as the original Super Quiz, only difference being the question categories:
Business & Technology, Celebrities, Leisure, Literature, Movies, and Worldwide.

Note: This trivia series continues on in the form of a daily newspaper feature published in many papers across the U.S. and Canada. It can also be found on the King Features Syndicate home page, www.kingfeatures.com.

name: Golfwinks
description:
Golfwinks is a fine tabletop golf simulation that uses felted cardboard modules to create the course and "tiddlywinks" to make the shots. It captures many of the rules and strategies of real golf, and is suitable for older children and adults.

The game box includes:
- 4 coloured plastic golfers
- 4 matching counters to represent the balls
- 4 green felted cardboard course modules (tee, short fairway, long fairway and green)
- 1 plastic flag
- 1 blue cardboard stream
- 3 sand-coloured cardboard bunkers
- 1 green cardboard copse of trees
- 4 plastic boundary fence sections
- 1 score pad
- 18 cards showing the layout of the holes
- 1 amusing rule booklet including strategy tips and etiquette.

name: The Rifleman Game
description: Using the characters from the Rifleman series, players take the role of either Lucas McCain or his son Mark. The object of the game is to move your entire herd of cattle from the corral at one end of the board to the other while the other player moves his from the opposite direction.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rocket Flight
description:
Each player starts as a space faring company in the year 2020 trying to make a profit in trade and technology development. The design utilizes the theories of Lagrange Points, Specific Impulse, and Remote Power Sources.

As of 2003, out of print. As of 2010, completely redesigned as High Frontier.

name: Bullion: The World's Greatest Trading Game
description:
An Australian-made trading game in the vein of Monopoly and Poleconomy.

You have just inherited $2,000,000. You now have to invest it. You now have to invest in either:
BLUE CHIP STOCK which is low risk with steady profits.
PROPERTY which is good risk but expensive.
SPECULATOR STOCK which is high risk but high profit.
PRECIOUS STONES which is some risk but good profit.

The winner is the player who buys the most of the 10 ingots of bullion, or if there is a tie – the richest wins.

Average game takes 1 hour.

Contents: Includes game board, rules, 8 coloured player tokens, 10 plastic imitation gold ingots, 6 plastic imitation precious stones, 2 dice, 52 Star cards, 10 Blue Chip cards, 10 Speculator Stock cards, 12 Property cards, 12 Precious Stones cards, 24 Stock cards and money in $50K, $100K, $500K and $1M denominations.

name: Rubik's Cube Card Game
description: I believe this game was a sort of predecessor to Uno Hearts. In this game, players bet, lead, gain tricks and trumps etc.This game was made in 1982 by Ideal. It contains a score sheet pad, a deck of 40 cards, a pencil, the instructions, and the box.

name: Bloody Beach: Omaha
description:
Very hard-to-find Tactical simulation game of the assault at Omaha Beach on June 6, 1944 by the U.S. 1st Inf, 29th Infantry Divisions and 2nd & 5th Ranger Battalions facing the German 352nd Inf Division.

The game was desktop published but in full color, making it an attractive game once complete but, requiring a bit of work. Scale is 300 meters/hex

The game features a very interesting sequence of play, large playing area and is very fun to play. It had a very small print run, making it somewhat highly sought after.

Components:

(9) 11"x17" map sections (need to be joined together)
(4) counter sheets (US front & back, German front & back)
(2) Order of Appearance cards
(1) Division Display card
(3) Charts & Tables cards

name: Chesstique
description:
From the first paragraph of the instructions:

"Chesstique is a fun strategy game for 2-6 players of almost any age. It has its roots in the classic game of Chess, but don't let that fool you. This game feels and plays differently than other chess-based games you may have played. The rules are easy to learn, [and] you can be playing in a matter of minutes. Mastering Chesstique's new and complex strategies will be a challenge."

The pieces are nicely finished, hand-stamped wooden cubes with traditional chess symbols on five of the six faces. 'Chesstique comes with a nice cloth board in a matching cloth drawstring bag and one double-sided page of instructions. Winning is based upon victory points earned by taking opposing pieces, and several interesting variants are provided.

name: Heavyweight Boxing
description:
HEAVYWEIGHT BOXING is a two-player game with a playing time of about 30 minutes a bout. You are a manager controlling the ring strategy of your fighter, balancing his punching power and offensive and defensive boxing abilities against those of his opponent. You can play two contemporary (1979) or all-time-great fighters creating many "what-if?" situations.
This is not a long-winded, overly complex game but was in the vanguard of beer and pretzels games before the German games invasion. You should be able to read the rules and play your 1st bout within an hour. Advanced optional rules can be added later for more realistic flavor.
Components are meager but complete. Included is a simulated boxing ring with 2 corners divided into sections for each fighter's stance of Aggressive/Counter/Defense. Also included are 2 realistic metal fighters (look great if you paint them), 2 Game charts, and a pad of score sheets, rulebook, 1D6, 20 Contemporary and 20 All-time-great fighter cards.
A turn consists of simultaneously: 1) Secretly choosing your stance, 2) rolling on the "Boxing ability vs. stance" chart for any punches landed, 3) rolling for each landed punch on the "Punching power vs. defense" chart for results, 4) recording points and stats on the score sheet, 5) roll recovery if needed and repeat sequence 3x for each round.
Advanced optional rules include Endurance, TKO, Injuries, Solitaire, Rope-a-dope, Haymakers, Clinching, Stuns, Head Butts, Tiring and everyone's favorite; "add your own" rule.
This game has a real nice boxing feel to it and is remarkably easy to play, especially if you're not the bookkeeper statistician. If you are creative you can come up with modern fighter cards based on their stats.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Turning Point
description:
Players sit on opposite sides of the playing board, with scoring columns in the lower right corner. Each player takes 27 regular chips (one will use the pink side while the other will use the orange side), 2 double chips and 1 stop chip. Each player puts all his chips into the holder and takes 3 scoring pegs in his color. The scoring pegs allow tracking scores from zero to 999.

To begin the game, players alternate putting one chip of their color into any of the 4 center holes of the board until all 4 holes are filled. The first player then puts one chip on the board so his chip traps one of his opponent's chips. Trapping is custodial, as in Hnefetafl or Othello/Reversi, in any of the eight directions from the just-placed chip. Once a player traps an opponent's chip, he turns it over to his own color. Players score 1 point for each chip in the new row which has been formed (including the just-played chip and the own-color cap chips). Players may trap multiple chips at once or chips in multiple rows.

Once a double chip is on the board, any row which contains it is worth double (for either player). If there are multiple double chips involved, they're added together before applying the multiplication (thus 3 double chips is sextuple score, 4 double chips is octuple score).

If an opponent turns over a player's stop chip, this prevents the trapped chips in that row from turning over and voids the opponent's score for that row.

The game ends when all holes on the board are filled. At the end of the game, each player adds one point for each chip of his color remaining on the board.

The player with the highest score wins.

name: Six Gun Sound
description:
From the designer: "Man to man combat and campaign system in the Old West. Fast play and easy to learn Six Gun Sound kicked off the man to man combat games that have become known as the Mayhem series. Not only does Six Gun Sound provide a realistic "quick & deadly" combat system it also has a campaign system. The campaign is centered around the old Southwest and includes Kansas and Texas. The system easily links the various gunfights together to tell the story of the Old West. To see a review of Six Gun Sound press here...."

Skirmish miniature combat for the Wild West.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: All-in-the-Dice Baseball
description: All-in-the-Dice Baseball is an exciting dice game that simulates all of the action found in professional baseball. There are hits, outs, walks, steals, and erros. Although the results of each play are in the dice, it is the player who determines the strategy to be employed. The game has been statistically perfected so that it is accurate within 2% of professional baseball. Anyone with an understanding of the game of baseball will have endless hours of fun playing the game. AITD can be played with 1 or 2 players. The rules are below in the image section.

name: Australian Menagerie: Australian Alps Expansion
description:
Adds new Habitat - Australian Alps, 4 new animals - Broad-toothed Rat, Corroboree Frog, Kosciuszko Grasshopper and Mountain Pygmy-possum and new threat and management strategy cards for Climate Change.

Expands:

Australian Menagerie
categories: Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Auf Teufel komm raus!
description: The little devils haven't been naughty enough and are punished: They have to go to heaven! Of course they don't like that idea much. Each player competes with his/her neighbors for an individual step on the ladder to heaven: The loser goes up one step. The decision about who the loser is can be made by simple die rolls, making it a completely random (but extremely beautiful) game; other mechanisms such as rock-paper-scissors or more complex ones can be (and are usually) used when playing with adults.

name: Full Tilt
description: Full Tilt is a three round tournament between rival teams of Bretonnian Knights who joust for a grand prize, and most important of all, the honor of victory. Players need to provide models of knights, but the cards, counters and cardstock terrain are provided with the game. Points are scored for knocking the opposing knight off of their horse or by breaking fewer lances than the opponent. The winner is the team of knights with the most points after three rounds. Originally published in Games Workshop's White Dwarf magazine, issue #215.

name: IT
description:
Description From Rules

IT is a Mini SF* game that you play by yourself or with one or two other people. It is fast, fun to play, and always exciting. The game is always different each time you play with four scenarios you can use depending on how much time you have and how many people are playing . . .

IT (tm) is the game where you design the monsterous [sic] "IT" war machine yourself; then try to take a planet with it . . .

* Trade mark for the Micro Science Fiction Games of ATTACK INTERNATIONAL, the creators of modern S.F. Wargaming, and the first to create Mini SF* games.


User Summary

IT is a small-format sci-fi wargame that may remind gamers of another asymmetrical conflict between a behemoth war machine and an array of lesser opposing forces. (See: Ogre.)

In this game, the opposing forces are faced off against IT, a sort of mega-tank or robot. The conventional forces must defend a planetary base from IT. The player controlling IT creates a customized war-machine design by allocating IT's 1000 mass/weight units. The variable characteristics include IT's speed, armor, weaponry, defensive systems, and (structural?) integrity.

Each game turn consists of the first player moving any or all his units, followed by that player's combat phase. The second player then executes his own movement and combat phases, completing the turn. Terrain affects movement and combat, with line of sight being a factor.

In addition to the standard IT versus conventional forces scenario, three additional scenarios are provided: a two-player conventional forces battle, a two-player IT versus IT battle, and a three-player battle royale where two of the players control an IT and the third player controls the conventional forces. Rules are also provided for a solitaire game in which the player controls IT against 20 random conventional force units that move and attack as determined by the game system.

Advanced rules variations allow for plotted simultaneous movement and/or combat. Additional optional rules provide for opportunity fire and a two-player "Blind IT" game. The blind game uses two mapsheets so that the IT player can only see units visible to IT. The rules helpfully note that the blind "system only works with a conventional player who does not cheat."

Game Scale

Units = individual vehicles to small groups of combatants.

Hex and turn scales are not stated.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Baseball Challenge
description: A tabletop baseball simulation game from the 1980s.

name: Menaces Sur Ter
description:
The environmental police are out to save this kooky Mobius wannabe world (illustrated by Caza). There are 4 different environmental Monsters that are invading our planet. They start eating up territories of the wrap around "earth". Players are subject to wind conditions a spinner that controls the movement of pollution. The rules are fully illustrated and there are scenarios that are set in comic books. Players are also given missions in comic book form. This game was sponsored by Unicef and 12 other companies and non profits.

There are tons of fully illustrated tiles, and 12 mission books, plus 12 pamphlets for each of the 4 elements of environmental protection. This was only released in French.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Environmental, Horror, Industry / Manufacturing, Political, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Tile Placement, Voting

name: Conquerors and Kings
description:
Conquerers and Kings is a set of ancient rules based on the "square bashing" grid system pioneered by the "Rules for the Common Man" team.

The "square bashing" system, as it has been named, is a departure from normal miniature systems in that it imposes a seven by five square grid over the battlefield. This grid affects movement and combat - doing away with tedious millimeter measurements and allows the player to focus on maneuvering his units and rolling the dice. Squares can be either open (no impediment to movement) or closed (terrain impedes movement).

Troops are organized into units, and graded according to type (close order foot, open order foot, close order mounted, etc), quality (elite, veteran, trained, levy), and armor. The basic system is for units roll a number of dice (number determined by the abilities of the unit) to hit, and defenders roll dice to save the hits (if they have armor). Each unit may have up to four "hit points".

The rules are published in a 36 page binder, and contains army lists for Sumer to the Mognols. In addition to the usual rules for terrain, movement, and combat, C&K distinguishes itself by adding rules for the "setting" of the battle, by including pre-battle effects such as seizing key features on the battlefield prior to the battle, ambushes, and losing troops prior to the battle for various reasons.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Barón Rojo
description:
Juego de simulación bélica editado por la casa barcelonesa Wargame en 1981. Era el número B02 de su catálogo. Basado en la guerra aérea durante la Primera Guerra Mundial,contiene un tablero que simula una zona atrincherada del frente, con marcador de turnos y marcador de alturas; hojas de control para anotaciones y tabla de resultados; libreto de reglas de 8 páginas y las fichas de juego: seis DH-4, seis Spad VII, un Fokker DR I y cinco Albatros D-III, además de diversos marcadores. Muy sencillo de aprender y de jugar.

Spanish wargame, based on air warfare during WWI. It is very easy to play, and only contain one map, rulebook, some control cards, and counters: 6 DH-4, 6 Spad VII, 1 Fokker DR I, and 5 Albatros D-III.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: Ark Royal
description:
This is a naval combat game set during World War II in the Atlantic. It includes several scenarios which show the entire Atlantic Campaign vs. the U-boats.

Players use two identical strategic maps for searching. Cards are used to move aircraft through stages such as landing, refueling, etc.

name: MindRings
description:
The box cover invites you to "Turn your Mind to the Challenge".

A four-in-a-row variant where the board is made of concentric rings that can be rotated. Players place one peg at a time into empty spots and then use that peg to rotate the ring.

The game comes with "standard" and "advanced" rules; the advanced rules allow players to capture pairs of opponent's pegs. In either set of rules, the first to get four of their pegs in a radial row wins.

name: Count Coup: An Anthropological Board Game of North American Indian Ways
description:
Warfare among the Plains Indians was mainly for glory. Through many skirmishes a warrior could gain prestige and advancement within his own tribe. A coup (pronounced
"koo") was a brave deed or act done against one's live enemy: touching a live, fallen enemy, stealing a horse, etc. Upon completing this brave act, the warrior would return to his own tribe to recount for them the full details of his glorious deed--counting coup.

The information in Count Coup has been organized in two ways. First, four large ecological areas can be seen in the map on the box cover: Eastern Woodland, Great Plains, Desert West, and Far West. The tribes appearing on the playing cards are placed in their approximate areas on the map. The colored border on the cards corresponds to the ecological area of the tribe referred to.

Second, the playing cards can be divided into 14 categories: Food-Plants, Transport, Dwellings, Leadership, Tools, Crafts, Hunting, Warfare, Person-to-Know, Trade, Ceremonies, Treating Ills, Social Control, and Tragedy. Four cards appear in each category, one from each ecological area. More information can be found for each of the 56 playing cards in the corresponding Explanation Cards, garnered during the course of the game. These latter cards may be read aloud for a greater understanding of the cultures during the course of the game, or not if a faster game is sought, but the victor must collect four to accompany the movement of his pawns from the Summer Camp to the Winter Camp.

Hazard and Reward Squares corresponding to the Eagle, the Buffalo, Irrigation, and Fire will be encountered in the journey. If rewarded, the player attends the Pow Wow, where he is temporarily safe. A coup is made by landing on another player's pawn.
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Educational, Environmental, Fighting

name: Budget Battlefield
description: Budget Battlefield™ is a tabletop / miniatures rule system for mass battles and skirmish-level combats, focused on ease of play and flexibility to work with any genre or time period. The Origins Award nominated game system is based on miniatures (or cardboard standups grouped on stands) in 25 to 30mm scale, using a modified version of the PlainLabel Game System™ which requires only a single 1D10 roll to resolve an attack and determine losses.Unit stats and all necessary data come on regular trading-card-sized Unit Cards. Conversion of Simply Roleplaying! / Compact Combat characters to be used as hero/leader figures in the Budget Battlefield environment is easy, allowing roleplaying or boardgame characters to join in battles with minimal fuss.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Panzer Leader: For King and Country
description:
This add-on to Panzer Leader: Game of Tactical Warfare on the Western Front variant includes unit corrections for the Armies of the United Kingdom Forces. Also includes new scenarios that put the U.K. effort in 1944 to liberate Europe and defeat Germany in proper perspective.
Ever wonder why the FireFly Tank with its 17lbr is valued incorrectly in the original game? This NEW and exciting variant brings to life the struggle of U.K. forces over Germany - from Dieppe to the Ruhr Pocket!

Variant INCLUDES:
Rule booklet for UK Variant
New Scenario's such as:

Villars Bocage
Operation Totalize
Ibbenburen
Hells Highway
Menzelen
Bieville
Douvres
Bretteville
Saint Lambert
Dieppe

Over 140 Factory DIE CUT Counters

Expands:

Panzer Leader: Game of Tactical Warfare on the Western Front
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Return of: Once Upon a Time in the West
description:
Adds a "campaign" element to the original 3-booklet game "Once upon a Time in the West".

Includes additional rules for "Weather", "Novelty Weapons", "Playing Possum" and more.

Eight extra Army Lists are also provided.

Expands:

Once upon a Time in the West
categories: American West, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Polemos: Great Northern War
description:
From the publisher's website:

The early years of the eighteenth century were a time of great, and long lasting, changes in Eastern Europe. It saw two former ‘Great’ powers decline; for Sweden it was a cataclysmic experience as they were reduced to a small or medium power. While Poland-Lithuania started on the path that would lead to extinction later in the century. It saw two medium sized powers, Denmark and Saxony, fail in their bid to gain, or regain, ‘Great’ powers status. It saw two powers rise; for Brandenburg-Prussia it was an important stepping stone to Great power status later in the century. While for Russia went from being ‘an obscure barbarous nation’ to a Great power thanks to its victories

Polemos: Great Northern War is aimed at gaming large scale actions from this time. It is quite possible to stage, play and complete actions in an evening and even the largest action should be relatively easy to play. The emphasis is on the Great Northern War but other actions from this period can also be fought. The wars against the Ottoman Empire, the Polish Civil War and other actions in the period 1695 to 1725 may also be fought. You can be Peter the Great of Russia and face the cream of what was probably the best army in the world of this period – Charles XII Swedish army. Perhaps instead you could as Peter battle the Ottomans on the river Prut.

The Great Northern War has perhaps not been gamed as much as would be expected for such an important conflict with many interesting battles and armies. To a large extent this is because of the lack of information about the war and its battles. Polemos: GNW will introduce information and army lists that will rectify this. You too will be able to command the combined Saxon, Polish and Russian army at the battle of Kalisz (1706) or re-fight the Polish civil war battle of Koniecpol (1708).

name: ティディス城塞
description:
This is a Japanese game based on the anime "Castle in the Sky", formerly known as "Laputa: Castle in the Sky". The English-language subtitle is "The Game of the Castle in the Sky Laputa". The game in all the pictures here on BGG has the Japanese title 「ティディス城塞」, meaning "Fort Tidisu". (There is another official "Castle in the Sky" board game, titled 「天空の城ラピュタ」 like the film itself. Perhaps the entry you're reading was originally named after that game, not the one in the pictures here, but BGG will not allow the other game to be added to the database without details on its rules.)

This game has three scenarios:

1. Dola's Surveillance Game (Dola gang vs. the Military): The Dola family of air pirates attempts to penetrate the military surveillance net around the airship transporting Muska and Sheeta.

2. Dola's Airship Attack Game (Dola gang vs. the Military): The Dola family attacks the airship itself, as in the opening scene of the film.

3. Pazu's Sheeta Recapture Game (Solo game): Pazu and the pirates try to break Sheeta out of Fort Tidisu, where Muska has imprisoned her. Player plays as Pazu and the pirate gang, and there's a deck of cards that randomly determines the Goliath's actions and the robot's actions.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: Im Wassergarten
description: This is a game of perception. At the beginning the 48 photo tiles are laid out to form a water garden. All tiles must be completely visible. They show all that one would find in a pond: Frogs, fish, sea-roses and other aquatic plants in the most multicolored colors. After the water garden is laid out, all players receive a tablet on which four pictures are shown. The players must find the pictures of their own tablet faster than the fellow players.

name: Menhir
description:
Menhir can be played by two types of rules; the fast rules or the more advanced ones.

The players are korrigan (little elves from Brittany) tribes and they battle each other, year after year, in order to have the biggest field full of menhirs. In order to achieve that goal, you need Menhir seeds, which are given to you by the giant who's guarding the mountain. Afterwards you need magical fertilizer in order to make the seeds grow. But don't forget to make sure they don't steal your seeds!

You can get a free download of this game at:

http://pandocreon.com/jeux/menhir/ (site in english, rules in french)
http://pandocreon.fr/jeux/menhir/ (site in french)


You can also buy its micro-edition version (wood box, real stone pebble as menhir seeds):

http://pandocreon.biz/?l=en (site in english)
http://pandocreon.biz/ (site in french)

name: Zombie Plague: Canisters
description:
This expansion introduces Trioxin canisters into Zombie Plague. "Misplaced" by the military, these objects may prove to be the source of the plague... or they may just bring further complications to it.

Expands:

Zombie Plague

name: Monster Hunters
description:
Monster Hunters is a card game where players are trying to either be the last hunter standing or the hunter with the most bounty points. The game involves a fair amount of screwing over other players. Monsters are killed by rolling against their rating with a six-sided die.

The game comes packaged simply in a plastic zip-top bag, with thick, laminated cards and a brief (but concise) rulebook.

name: Z Cardz
description:
Z CARDZ are special pre-punched cards that can be assembled into 3-D models.

Z CARDZ the Game allows you and an opponent to build an army of these Z CARDZ. Through the use of special formation cards, you try to be the first one to KO all of your opponents Z CARDZ.

Booster packs contain 5 models and a matching playing card for each model. Pack contents consist of 3 normal models and 2 "special" models, colored in either metallic silver (rare) or metallic gold (ultra-rare). 60 different models are available in booster packs, each having a normal, rare, and ultra-rare version, resulting in a set size of 180 models.

name: Official Rules of Card Games
description:
This is a book of rules for common card games published by The United States Playing Card Company. It also includes suggestions for how to choose which games to play, etiquette, and how to teach children to play card games. (This description refers to the 84th edition.)

This long running book is published by the same manufacturer of the popular Bicycle card brand of standard cards.

The new version of this book is now called: Bicycle Official Rules of Card Games

For the Hoyle Up-To-Date versions, see Hoyle's Games
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Der Räuber Hotzenplotz
description:
A co-operative game for children from 5 years up. The "Robber Hotzenplotz" from the well known book by Otfried Preußler, has stolen pieces from the grandmother`s cake and trying to get them safe in his hiding place. The players try to catch him and the pieces first.
There are four figures walking along square fields, in which the board (looking like a landscape)is divided. The Hotzenplotz-figure is independent from a single player. It walks after all four players rolled their dice and walks along a spiral way from the outside to his hiding place, crossing the squares. He always walks to and fro, stealing another piece of cake and gets it to his hiding place.
If he comes to a square with one of the four figures on it, he captures it. But if the players manage to place two figures on the square with the robber (otherwise it is forbidden to place two figures on one place!), then he is captured in prison and the piece of cake saved. Of course, the robber starts from the prison right away again to steal more ...
There are different variants, making it easier or more difficult for the players to reach the goal of saving four pieces and winning the game together.
Nice co-operative game for the youngest gamers, starting discussions after every dice-roll where the figures should walk.

name: Car-Soc
description:
A soccer game where a deck of cards regulates the movement and scoring aspect of your players. Released circa 1930-1940's.

"Each team has 27 cards which control the movement of players and the ball. When both sides have used their decks its the end of the half. The wooden "players" are like chess pawns but with a nubbin on the top which the ball attaches to when the player is in possession." (H.P)
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: The Battle of Hoth
description:
This game was published in Star Wars Gamer vol 1, Issue 6.

From the introduction to the game,

Battle of Hoth is a game for 2 players. One player commands the Rebellions' Echo Base Garrison, the other the Imperial Blizzard Force.

This is essentially a small tactical level wargame. The chits are DIY style (cut out and stick on cardboard) and features familiar unit with Speed, Armour and Firepower attributes. The magazine comes with a plain white hexed folded map.

There are 3 scenarios of varying complexity. Each turn, players roll 2 dice and use the higher roll as command points to activate the corresponding amount of Unit.

Battles are resolved by rolling a D6 equivalent to the unit's firepower. A hit results in a 4, 5, 6 roll unless there are penalties or bonuses applied (for terrain or units).

A good fairly quick game.

name: NFL Game Plan
description:
(From the Game Plan booklet)
NFL Game Plan is a realistic game developed in cooperation with the National Football League. It is exciting and easy to play and it will introduce you tot he professional way of thinking football.

There are sixteen offensive plays to choose from and eight basic defenses -- real plays and defenses used by NFL teams. You get the fun of using these plays to outwit your opponent.

And as you play you will being to think like a pro.

How does the quarterback use one play to set up another one? How does he know which play to call on third down? Why does a certain play backfire on him?

You will answer these questions yourself as you and your family and friends sit down to play NFL Game Plan.

name: Max's Advanced Rules for Axis & Allies
description:
This is an unofficial expansion to Milton Bradley's Axis & Allies. It features a large collection of optional rules for use with the game. New rules include ones for alternate victory conditions, paratroopers, kamikazes, more technologies, a two-player Pacific scenario, and more.

Expands:

Axis & Allies


Expanded by:

Totally Untested Volume 2 of Max's Advanced Rules for Axis & Allies
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: World War II Expansion 3: The Battle of Midway
description:
This is Gamers Paradise's third expansion for Axis & Allies and focuses on the Pacific Theater, adding rules to make the conflict in the Pacific more realistic and interesting. Includes rules for recreating the bombing of Tokyo by the Doolittle Raid through the historical events that led up to the Battle of Midway in June of 1942. This expansion contains a large 30" x 50" full color heavy duty polypropylene map, the "Midway Scenario" rulebook, and 40 color counters.

Expands:

Axis & Allies
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: APBA National Football League: Pro Bowl Edition
description: An introductory version of the APBA football game. Pro Bowl lineups of 31 players from each conference are provided. Play results are based on offensive players only -- defensive player ratings come into play only to determine the run back on a fumble or interception.

name: Donnerwetter Sapperlot
description:
Donnerwetter Sapperlot is a memory game. Players move around the board and try to remember where the different symbols are hidden. When your guess is wrong, you lose a clown-card (the smiling clown is turned over to a crying clown). The last player with a smiling card left, wins the game.

Contents: 1 gameboard, 1 die, 12 symbol stones, 12 covering stones, 4 pawns, 36 cards.

Donnerwetter Sapperlot was on the 1992 Spiel des Jahres Auswahlliste.

Artwork: Armin Mayr

name: Bulldogs Away!! Modern Fast Attack Craft Rules 1950 - 2010
description:
Modern Fast Attack Craft Rules

by David Manley

Current Edition 1.0

36 pages; recommended scale 1/600, 1/700; complexity: 6/10; level of detail: 5/10; avg game length 2 hours; dice required: D20, D10, D6

View Summary of Contents

The rules are for the recreation of small naval engagements with Fast Attack Craft such as missile boats and smaller warships, mainly in coastal waters. The period covered runs from the late 1950’s onwards, and allows also for the use of aircraft and helicopters.

An important aspect of the rules is that the units can start as unidentified “blips”, which might be dummies, and there is a simple detection and identification system that changes the status to “contact” (detected as an enemy vessel) and “target” where the model is deployed. If you can get out of radar “sight” then you can revert to “blip” status again.

The shooting system allows for guns and missiles of various types, and damage is recorded in a graded system with 5 states from intact to sunk. Vessels can take Special hits when damaged which further degrade their ability. There are simple rules for operating helicopters from ships, as well as rules for anti aircraft fire with guns and missiles.

There are also additional rules for unconventional craft, mine warfare and operations against coastal targets.

They are rounded off with extensive data tables for missiles, torpedoes, guns, rockets, SAM systems, Air to Air missiles, ships, helicopters and aircraft. (There are 140 sets of ship data from over 40 countries).

Summary of Contents

INTRODUCTION

SETTING THE SCENE: Vessel Descriptions; Command and Control; Play Area

TURN SEQUENCE AND INITIATIVE

MOVEMENT: Moving Astern; Turning; Collisions; Drifting; Grounding; Towing

TARGET DETECTION AND IDENTIFICATION: Detection / Identification States; Managing “Blips” and other markers; Moving “Blips” and “Contacts”; Notes on Detection and Identification; Radar Detection; Detecting Radar Emissions; Sharing Detection Data; Visual Identification of the Target; Random Visibility; Sharing Identification Data; Starshells and Flares; Countermeasures

FIRING: Weapon Firing Arcs; Eligibility of Targets (Lines of Fire); Gunfire; Missile Fire; Torpedo Fire; Salvo Rocket Launchers and Rocket Pods

DAMAGE: Basic Damage Table; Damage Control

AIRCRAFT AND HELICOPTERS: Altitude; Aircraft and Helicopter Detection and Identification; Surface to Air and Air to Air Fire; Aircraft Damage; Air to Surface Attacks; Launching and Recovering Helicopters

UNCONVENTIONAL CRAFT: Semi Submersibles; Surface Effect Ships; Hydrofoils; Hovercraft; Ekranoplans; Suicide Craft

MINE WARFARE: Types of Mines; Hits on Minelayers; Mine Laying; Detonation; Minesweeping; Mine Hunting; Minesweeping Helicopters

LAND FORCES: Troops; Vehicles; Buildings; Use of Naval Weapons against land targets

TABLE OF ACRONYMS AND ABBREVIATIONS

DATA TABLES: Air to Air Missiles; Anti-Ship Missiles; Guns and Rocket launchers; SAM Systems; Special Craft; Torpedoes (Unguided); Torpedoes (Guided); Bomb Systems; Typical Helicopters; Typical Aircraft; Notes on Ship Data Tables

SHIP DATA TABLES
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Wahlparty
description:
Wahlparty is an election game in the political system of Bundesrepublik Deutschland. Players try to collect sets of cards for 16 federal states to gain the majority. The cards are all dealt out and then players must engage in real-time open trading to assemble majorities.

This game was published as a supplement for Fairplay, a German print magazine for games. Wahlparty is a small booklet and you have to cut out all the cards yourself and build a box out of the booklet.

name: Lo Tarot
description:
Lo Tarot is edited for the purpose of "easiest Tarot trick taking game with full 78 cards".

This game is played with 4 players. Only one surviving bidder becomes the declarer and plays against the other 3 players (1 v.s. 3). The purpose of a normal game is take and get enough point-cards.

1) You must play a card of same suit as lead from.
2) If you have no same suit card as the lead, you must play a trump.
3) If you have no same suit card as lead and trump, you may play any card.

If all players pass the bid, the object of the game changes to something called Ramsch. Ramsch means not to take point-cards. At Ramsch, every player fights each other (battle royal).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Papagra
description: Papagra is a perfect-information abstract strategy game for two, played with Go stones or glass beads on a hexagonal grid. In the game, opponents try to form what are called "matched groups". A matched group is a group of connected pieces, the size and shape (but not necessarily orientation) of which match the size and shape of a connected, enclosed group of empty spaces somewhere on the board. The player who forms the largest matched group during the course of the game is the winner. Papagra is a brain burner that rewards strong pattern recognition and visuo-spatial skills.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Scout
description: The aim is to move your scouts from one side of the board to the other. The board is a transparent plastic case in which you push tiles which make up a 6x8 rectangular maze. Each tile has a different 3x3 arrangement of pathways and hedges. There are 49 tiles and on each turn you push the extra tile into one of the rows (in which you have a pawn) to alter the maze (and push out a tile from the other end). Both before and after you do this you can move any of your scouts towards the far side of the maze.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Piecepack Letterbox
description:
This game is based on the real-life outdoor sport of letterboxing.

Players hide "letterboxes" somewhere on the board and write clues for the other players. Everyone then attempts to find as many letterboxes as possible. A player gains victory points both when she finds other letterboxes and when other players find hers.

The game ends when one player has found all other letterboxes. The player with the most victory points is then the winner.

This game won the first Mesomorph Games Piecepack Competition in 2006, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the four seasons expansion.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Spice Raid
description:
Board & card game for 2 players. Man to man combat on the surface of Arrakis. Takes place in the Dune Universe.
Pick your force: Atreides, Harkonnen, Fremen, Sardaukar Each figure represents one warrior.

Plays on a standard 8x8 chess board. Move and attack, card driven combat game.

http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/SR.html
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Dirtside
description:
DIRTSIDE is a D6 based rules system designed for playing out table-top miniatures actions simulating Armour and Infantry actions in a Science-Fiction setting, whether on Earth or other worlds.

It is a generic system allowing players to generate arms and armor from any setting they choose.

The rules are aimed primarily at 1/300 miniatures but can easily be used at any scale.

Rules cover Infantry, Armour, Artillery, Air Support and even Battle-walkers.

Some of the mechanisms include Multiphase turns, Overwatch, Line of Sight, ECM and Time-on-target.

This set of rules was followed up by the more detailed and better produced DIRTSIDE II rules (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/5687).

name: Build a Village
description: Build your own colourful little village! Complete your very own village with houses, tree and cars in 6 different colours. The village on each playing board can be joined together in many different ways for more creative play. The perfect dice game for little ones. Ages 3 and up. A beautiful color game with rich components made in wood. Very simple to play and very funny for little children.
categories: Children's Game, City Building, Dice, Educational, Environmental, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Hon slukades av vargen
description: A game similar to "taboo". You are supposed to guess what word your partner are describing.

name: Wampanoag
description:
From the Publisher:

As the Pilgrims arrive in Massachusetts, the Wampanog face tough choices: There is a time to trade, and there is a time to Stand and Fight. In Wampanog, manage the actions of your people in war and peace.

name: Battle Royal
description:
This is one of the scarce Pepys boardgame editions.

It came in two versions: One with separate board and small components box and one with a large box, containing board and components.

Game consists of 54 playing pawns in 4 colours (small wooden cylinders), 3 sets of 4 movement cards (depicting one to four knights plus a Zero-knight card, and a large game board depicting a fictious medieval countryside.

Aim is to capture the opponents capital, starting in your own at the opposite end of the board.

At first you have to enter all your pawns onto the board square by square and then move the existing chain of knights towards the other capital.
This is done with the randomly chosen movement cards. The number depicted is the allowance to move as many knights (pawns) from the end of your chain to the front of it.
Obstacles hinder a smooth movement, and you can capture opponents knights or even cut his knights-chain off !
For all these actions you have to show the right movement card, some actions require 4 knights.

For the time edited (around 1950) a very good strategy game with much room for decision making what to do best with the random movement card. The beautifully designed gameboard adds to the atmosphere...

name: Undir sólinni
description: Undir sólinni (Beneath the sun) is a trivia game with 4000 questions about everything beneath the sun. The questions are in four categories (Icelandic history, the Icelandic language and literature, childrens' questions and common questions) and each category has two difficulty levels (easy and hard). The players decide at the start what category and difficulty they will answer and then whether to use a six-sided die or twelve-sided die. The object is to travel around the four-part track, gathering stars for correctly answered questions which can be used to advance more quickly.

name: Magnytour
description: If you like cycle races, then become cyclist, coach, strategist! Discover cycle race emotions by leading your own race. Thoughtful playing, strategy, team racing, very little odds. The game contains a board featuring two circuits of flat open country on the front and of mountain on the back, 3 bags of 6 cyclists, 36 identification labels, an instructions leaflet and a dice.

name: Alarm
description:
The players are thieves at night and try to break into a building, remaining in the shadow and unnoticed. But the police is in the area. Make sure the alarm doesn't go off! Each play is different because of the system that triggers the alarm.

The game is won by the first robber to steal the gold from the bank, without setting off the alarm. You must then escape to any getaway point without being caught by the cops. Watch out for hazard squares and short cuts.

name: Detective Conan Clue:  The Secret of the Lost treasure
description:
A version of Clue/Cluedo based on the Japanese comic/animation "Detective Conan" (known as "Case Closed" in America).
As an addition to standard Clue, there are event spaces and clue spaces in the corridors. On the clue spaces you can draw a clue chip, and you must discard one clue chip each time you make an guess in a room, and two clue chips to make a final accusation. The event spaces trigger an event from the draw pile, mostly beneficial for the player drawing the card.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Real Fishing
description:
OBJECTIVE:
Catch and bring in the highest total weight of fish.

GAME PLAY:
Draw a boat, choose your fishing "jigs" (rods) and lures, then set out to catch fish. You decide how far to travel (up to your boat's max speed) on each turn, but you have to slow down if you're in the weeds or in a dock zone.

Travel around the water "casting" and "flippin'" fish, and make sure you have the right jig for the type of water you're fishing. If you're "flippin'", you can get right up next to a fish, but if you're casting, you have to stay a few spaces away and roll the die to see if you've caught it. (Takes some initial strategy to make sure you have enough of the right jigs for the area you're planning to fish.)

And those fish are crafty - you might lose a rod or a lure or pull in a mermaid or old tire instead of a fish. And sometimes you have to throw one back.

Get back to your starting dock within 32 turns or start losing fish.

Includes rules for "Recreational" play and "Tournament" play.

GAME COMPONENTS:
1 Lake playing surface (board with small hexes)
6 boat cards
48 lure cards
36 "jig" cards (rod and reel)
12 sets of fish markers, of 5 types (two types have 3 sets, the rest have two)
6 Strategy statistic reference cards
1 six-sided die
6 colored plastic round boat markers
1 score pad
15 plastic re-usable bags
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Ping Pong
description: The idea of PING PONG is to find correct words in given categories as fast as possible and to drive away the time monster in the opposite direction. If the time monster eats the opposite caterpillar, you earn yourself a point. Each point pushes your own joker forwards on the score list.

name: Prototype Competition
description:
This is a card game. Players are World War II aircraft manufacturers trying to design the best fighter plane of WWII. They can literally put together their dream plane, from jet-engined Zeros to Mustangs bristling with 50mm cannons.

The game comes with 117 cards.

This game is a spin-off from Tank Extravaganza that was published in Game Journal #61, also from the same game designer. The designer also subsequently designed a similar game called Naval Competition.

Published in old Game Journal #64.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Celtic Warbands
