description: “Theme: Continental Celtic Intertribal Warfare circa Fifth Century BC. Poker type mechanics. Victory: The first player to win 5 turns wins the battle. Background: Each player controls a band of rival Celtic Warriors. Each game represents a battle between these opposed Tribes. Each hand represents a Champion: His weapons, traits, etc. Each turn represents a duel between 2 Champions. The winner of the turn takes the severed head of the losing Champion.”

name: Launch Fighters!
description:
Launch Fighters! is a hex-and-counter tactical space battle wargame available for free from the following website:
http://www.launchfightersgame.com/

Each counter represents a single fighter-carrying ship or a squadron of fighters. Players manoeuvre their ships and fighter counters to attack the enemy. Combat is decided by rolling a number of dice against a target number.

Advanced rules allow players to construct their own ships.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Damn Battleships Again
description:
The designer's laconic introduction: "This is a set of wargames rules for pre-dreadnought naval battles between 1890 and 1913 (no dreadnoughts fought before 1914!), prompted by the re-discovery of some 30-year-old 1/1500 models, but equally suitable for contemporary 1/6000 models."

Focusing on manoeuvre rather than the technical detail of ships, the rules allow large actions to be fought in a reasonable amount of time.



=DBSA is one of the prototype DBA-like Rules Phil's had out for a long time,while he released a prototype set (never further developed or released commercially) players have modified this and a collected set incorporating modifications, variants and optional rules has been in widespread use since 2007


NB DBSA was also the original name for the first version of DBA released at Wargames Developments Conference, UK

name: The Age of Might and Steel
description:
15mm fantasy wargame rules.
The rules aim to make it possible to resolve battles involving about 100 to 200 miniatures on each side in an hour or so.
Army lists and a point system are included. The book also lists four scenarios and a mini-campaign.

name: Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal: Welk Woord?
description:
It's the second expansion of the game Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal. There are 4000 questions in 3 different challenges.
This expansion is a word game based on the major dictionary of the Dutch language.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Korea 1995: ROK Attack
description:
This expansion found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr3, page 26, provides a 6th campaign scenario for Crisis: Korea 1995.

Contents:
One page of background, setup and victory conditions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Battle of Ayrene's Woods
description:
Small fantasy wargame, depicting a battle between a defending Elven army and a dwarven one, both aided by magic users and spellcasters.
Based on the Battle of the Middle Ages system (Legnano, Arsuf, etc...) by the same company, it is a FREE introductory wargame, coming with a 2A4 map, around 120 counters and 5 pages of rules.
It is a print & play game, available through several sources (wargamesdownloads, arima, grognard).

name: Shop!
description: Players spin a needle to move the two elevators. When an elevator stops at a floor, all players can get on of off if they want. Players try to stop at the right floors to make the purchases on their list (tiles in front of each of them).

name: Heavy Gear Tactical Miniatures Rules
description:
From the back of the book:

Terra Nova is a land full of beauty and mystery: rolling grasslands, rocky precipices, misty jungles, thick forests and harsh deserts. Through them all, the military forces of Terra Nova wage their deadly contests in the hopes of besting one another. The Heavy Gear Tactical Miniatures Rulebook now allows players to experience this struggle in miniature play format. This rulebook includes:
- Quick Start Rules to allow you to get a game up and running in no time, whether in Tactical, Skirmish or Toy modes;
- Advanced rules, such as Hull Down, Burst Fire and Detailed Damage to spark up gameplay;
- Instructions and techniques on building and painting miniatures and terrain, presented in glorious color;
- Basic listings for the Northern Guard, Southern MILICIA and Earth CEF armies;
- Rules for building your own combat regiment or Rover band and upgrading your vehicles with extra equipment;
- Six ready-to-play scenarios plus a detailed generator to construct your own.
A few six-sided dice, miniatures, pen and paper are required to play the game.

Stock number: DP9-106

name: Kugel Hupf
description: Content: One hexagonal board with 61 hollows, 48 balls in 4 colours. There are three possibilities to move your balls: "creeping": move to an adjacent hollow; "hopping": jump over an other ball to the next free hollow; "eating": "hopping" plus removing the ball you jumped over. The first player, who fulfills the chosen goal (e.g. "build a line of five balls in a row" , "build a single group with all your balls") wins. There are nine goals = variants, in each variant you may use one, two or three of the moves described above.

name: Make an Offer
description:
As a real estate entrepreneur one must aggressively make offers greater than your opponent in order to obtain the best properties available at the best price. However, the property value of any particular home depends upon the properties around it.

In this two person card game of property acquisition each player must offer an amount for a property greater than their opponent. If successful, the player with the greater offer receives the value assigned for the property based upon its adjacent property.

The person with the most points after three rounds wins and earns the title of Master Entrepreneur.

The game consists of 48 total cards.

24 "Offer Cards"
24 "Property Cards"

There are 8 unique Offer Cards marked $10,000, $20,000, up to $80,000. There are three of each denomination.

There are 4 unique Property Cards. There is a Mansion, a Ranch, a Trailer, and a Cardboard Box. There are six of each type of Property.

In addition to the standard game rules I have include two different variations (Blind Man's version and Blind Man's Bluff version) in the rules that can be played to increase the difficulty of the game.

name: TLRising
description: TLRising is an abstract tile laying game in three dimensions. The board is built from modular blocks with four colors of squares. Players lay tiles on the board or on other tiles, matching the colors of the squares below.

name: War for Edaðh: The Art of Conflict – Huaos-Dzaa
description:
One of the first two expansions for War for Edaðh: The Beginning. Not playable on its own - requires base set. From the website:

"Expands War for Edadh with new Huaos-Dzaa Troop Cards, Combat Masters, Battle Master and Standards together with new Stratagem and Terrain Cards, together with the new Conflict Cards and a set of Angueth influenced Mastery Cards.

Now you can play with Secondary Terrain Cards and Conflict Cards as well as explore the multi-player games.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame

name: 18BE Pocket
description:
18BE Pocket is a train game over the early belgian railroad network.
Belgium was the first european continental country to have an operating railway, linking Brussels to Mechelen in 1835.

The $tock Market Expansion is included, allowing for easy customization of the complexity level of the game. This is also a good way to progressively introduce players to more complex train games.

The game was created for a publishing contest launched on BGG by Chad Ellis ($1,000 Budget Design Contest: Get Published!).
It requires submissions to fit in a ziplock format, using at most 5 5x7" cards for the complete game.

This format requires a very streamlined rules set, so this game is not a true member of the 18xx family of train games, hence the 'pocket'. It does however bring a full featured train game on the table, with network building, locomotives evolution, and if the $tock Market Expansion is used, an alternance of stock rounds and operating rounds.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Canine Troopers (fan expansion for Starship Troopers)
description: Canine Troopers: It's The Bark, Not The Bite is an expansion for Avalon Hill's 'Starship Troopers', published by VAIPA Express issue #2, containing rules and counters to use canines ('Neodogs') in Starship Troopers scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Fast4Words
description: Within 4 minutes, players take turn placing 8 of their 10 letter cubes into the two sided grid and then find as many word combinations as possible on their side. Players with the most points WINS! Fast Paced, Fast Action, Fast Scoring, FAMILY FUN!

name: Komm mit durch Deutschland!
description:
Komm mit durch Deutschland! is a trivia game for children focusing on German cities and other places of interest. Players draw cards with towns, popular sights or landmarks from a number of cards placed next to the board. The place on the card should be very close to a neutral figure on the game board which is a map of Germany.

After that, the cards are turned and you can see where the places really are and the players put their figures on that place on the board. The player who has his figure closest to the neutral figure can answer a question to get closer to this figure. If he can't answer the question, the second player can answer the question and so on. After that, the closest players score points.

The game includes two maps of Germany: a more detailed map with cities and rivers on it, and another one without it.

name: Wine Teasers
description:
Whether it's 2 people or 20, your next gathering will be filled with laughter and learning! More than just a trivia game, Cork Jester's Wine Teasers wine game combines questions, hints, chance, and even the occasional diabolical maneuver to provide the most fun wine learning experience possible!

Cork Jester's Wine Teasers is perfect for wine-tastings, informal get-togethers, staff training, and even personal reference for learning or when shopping for wines.

The game comes with 100 questions, each with its own hint and discussion paragraph; 30 wine bottle cards with labels, description, and food pairings for real wines available throughout the U.S; quick-start rules card and full rules sheet; pronunciation guide; and 4 hint credits.

name: What Blind Ninjas?
description:
Each player has sent their ninjas into a room to hunt the enemy ninjas. Unfortunately the ninjas are blind and can only use their amazing sense of hearing to locate enemies.

What Blind Ninjas? is a battleship style game where the players send their blind ninjas out to hunt their opponents ninjas. Players use deduction and the knowledge of their opponents previous attacks to try to deduce the best location for the next attack. The last player with a living ninja is the winner.

Materials:

One Icehouse stash per player.
For a two player game, each player needs a 4 x 8 grid (half a chess board).
For a three or four player game, each player needs a 8 x 8 grid (a full chess board).
A folder or other divider for each player to hide their grid.

name: Total East Front Pack I
description:
Total East Front Pack I is a scenario compilation released by Critical Hit, Inc covering action on the Eastern Front during World War II. It includes eight scenarios and three overlays:

TEF1 #1 Eye of the Needle - German SS armor and mechanized infantry attempt to break out westward from Vienna (1945) as Soviet infantry and armor attempt to close the noose around them.

TEF1 #2 The Last Waltz - Russian infantry supported by lend lease tanks and engineers attempt to push the weakened German SS troops out of Vienna (1945).

TEF1 #3 Panzers in the Park - German SS troops with tank support attempt to hold a large park in Vienna from the advancing Russian infantry supported by lend lease tanks during the last days of fighting in Vienna (1945).

TEF1 #4 Squeeze Play - A light German reconnaissance unit attempts to hold the way open for retreating formations as the Russians attempt to close the noose on Vienna (1945).

TEF1 #5 Panzer Pioniers - A German Pionier Company with tank and artillery support attempts to eliminate a mixed force of Russian troops that had been interdicting supply columns during the drive on Leningrad (1941).

TEF1 #6 The Battle for Pisino - To protect the city of Rzhev from a direct Soviet attack an ad hoc force of German SS must seize a fortified village on the Soviet’s flank. This village is protected by a company of infantry with support on the way. This battle takes place with temperatures of -45 Celsius during the Soviet winter counteroffensive of 1942.

TEF1 #7 Last Line Before Oboyan - German Tiger tanks clash with Russian T-34’s as German infantry attempt to dig the Russians out of their fortifications during the early moments of the Battle for Kursk (1943).

TEF1 #8 Olin’s Surprise - A large German armored force that includes Panther tanks lays a trap for advancing Russian T-34’s in this large tank battle for a rail bridge over the Bug River during the Campaign to Destroy Army Group Center (1944).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Risk 2210 A.D.: A Call To Arms – Celestial Dawn Command Deck
description:
From the publisher's site:
At Insurgency Gaming we've now release our seventh expansion deck for Risk 2210 AD and as such we'd like to give you the opportunity of adding this exciting new deck to your collection.

With the release of our brand new A Call To Arms - Celestial Dawn command deck, alongside our six other existing decks including it's sister deck, the A Call To Arms command deck, we've introducing a new twist.

Unlike our previous command decks which were designed to be used as stand alone decks, the decks in the A Call To Arms range have the additional options of being used together. You can mix and match them to your hearts content into either an all new 20 card command deck or, use them all to form a 40 card supreme mother of all command decks.

The A Call To Arms decks are designed to be the first of the next generation of command decks that will ultimately bring more and more new deck combinations into the fold allowing players to customise the Risk 2210 AD even more.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Loaded Questions: Parenting 101
description:
Expansion for the the best-selling board game with more than one millions sold! There are much funnier questions than ‘who is going to change the diaper’, and we compiled 200 NEW ones for your enjoyment. Whether you’re a parent, an expecting parent, or simply wondering just what your parents were thinking, sign up with Loaded Questions for this hilarious course of Parenting 101!
Play with the enclosed components or with the original game

name: Crazy Mates Card Game
description:
Crazy Eights with a pirate twist!
Deal the cards and match numbers and suits. The first player to get rid of all his cards first, wins! It’s simple, but it’s not easy! Lay down a Crazy Nate 8 and you can turn the game to your advantage.
Each player plays a card of the same number or suit as the top card in the discard pile. For example, if the top card is a 4 of Scurvy Sam, the player may discard any 4 or any Scurvy Sam. If the player does not have a 4 or a Scurvy Sam, he must pick one card from the draw pile, unless he has a Crazy Nate 8. A player may discard a Crazy Nate 8 and change the suit to any suit of his choosing. The first player to get rid of all of his cards and shout "Shiver me timbers" wins!
For a more challenging game you can add variations - for instance, when a 2 is played the next player must play 2 cards and if he can’t, he must draw 2 cards. Variations are listed in the instructions.

Components:

48 cards

name: Pipeline Duell
description:
Between the two players, there is an upright grid formed by seven poles. The players now take turns inserting tube tiles which have different sides. While a tile might be advantageous because it connects tubes on my side, it might also help my opponent with the tubes on the reverse side - so it has to be carefully considered how to align a given tile.
Tiles are randomly drawn from a bag. The first player to connect the base to the top of the grid on his/her side is the winner.

(user summary by HilkMAN)

name: Fritz Froschprinz
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Princess Frieda Frog wants to give away her heart! In Fritz Froschprinz, you and Prince Fritz Frog go on a diving competition together. Who can collect the most golden balls?

name: Polemos S.P.Q.R
description:
Polemos SPQR rules are designed for those who wish to recreate the epic battles of the period of dominance of the Roman Legionary. You are placed firmly in the position of the General. Can you repeat the famous exploits of Caesar or Arminius: Now is your chance!

The booklet contains detailed listings and descriptions of eleven armies from Britain to Parthia featuring a unique army generation system as well as historical information and background.

name: Rout Pak III
description:
Eight tournament-sized scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader.

Rout Pak III contains the following ASL scenarios:
RPIII#1: THE DRAGON'S CLAWS; 22 May 1940; Mont-Saint-Eloi, France
RPIII#2: FLAMED IN FRANCE; 23 May 1940; St Omer, France
RPIII#3: A FUNNY KIND OF WAR; 22 October 1944; Hertogonbosch, Holland
RPIII#4: SAVING MADAGASCAR; 5 May 1942; Near Antsirane, Madagascar
RPIII#5: A ROOM WITH A VIEW; 12 December 1939, Hevosalmi, Finland
RPIII#6: HAMPSHIRES ON THE HILL; 190 July 1944; Maltot, Normandy, France
RPIII#7: DECAPITATION; 27 February 1943; Artelnoye, Russia
RPIII#8: ANOTHER DAMN BRIDGE; 21 December 1944; Malmedy, Belgium
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Splice
description:
Splice is an evolution of Spline that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in three colours (white, black and red).

Start: The board starts empty.

Play: Players take turns placing either:

1) a ball of their colour on any hole or any platform that contains
at least one red ball, or

2) a red ball on any hole or any platform.

End: A player wins by making a flat line spanning side to side, or
corner to corner, on any level, composed entirely of friendly and
neutral balls (at least one of each).

If the placement of a red ball achieves this for both players, then
the mover wins.

Strategy: White should place at least one red ball on the board level,
otherwise Black can force a win due to parity. White should defend
this red ball so that Black can’t exploit it.

name: Slalom
description:
At the starting gate the tension is very high, the snow is perfect, the atmosphere is the one of the big occasion. In an explosion of force, power and technique you face the first run of the giant slalom during the first meeting of the white circus.
You are one of last season's best skiers and lots of fans are expecting a great result from you and you cannot disappoint them. You will count on your incredible talent, your explosive strength, your cold lucidity. As cool calculator you will fight against all the hazards of the track to the best of your abilities.
Win the race and be on the cover of the most famous sporting magazines of the world.

Slalom is a game for 2 to 4 players (the single descents serve only for training). The competition is divided in 2 runs where every skier in turn tries to descend in quickest possible time to complete the slalom. The skier will move on the 14 tiles, using the values of the card they received at the start and at the two intermediate times.
Every move on the race tiles will be followed by a positive or a negative change of the starting time.
The hourglass will force the players to organize the sequence of their plays in the available time, in order not to lose precious hundredths of second.
The cowbell represents the support of the people near the track and it will help the skiers during the critical moments of the race...

name: Spight
description:
Spight is a ball stacking and connection game that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set. It uses a board of 4x4 holes, 8 white balls and 8 black balls.

Setup:

Place 8 black balls and 8 white balls according to the figure.

● ○ ● ○
○ ● ○ ●
● ○ ● ○
○ ● ○ ●

Rules:

Two players, White and Black, alternate turns moving a ball of their colour either:

a) jumping like a chess knight from a hole to another empty hole or...
b) jumping up from a hole to an adjacent 2x2 platform or...
c) passing if there are no available moves.

Notice that other balls may drop as a result.

Aim:

Win by connecting all your pieces into a single group.

Rules for this game are included in the soft cover Shibumi Rule Book

name: Kemozako
description:
Party word game with old words from history of the French language.
Object of the game is both to invent the definition of a word in order to bluff the other players, and also to find the true
definition.

Players place their tokens to the "Start"-space.
In his turn player draws one "Kamizako" card and sets out to define the word (be careful not to specify its spelling). Each player must then draw its own definition of his paper: it can let your imagination time to an hourglass. The card are mixed
and the Game Master must read each definition, giving them a number of way, without arousing suspicions of the other players in skinning a word. Then each player must write the number of the definition he thinks is the correct definition. When a player vote for the true definition or when other players vote for its definition, player aheads 2 spaces on the board.

Player who finish first is the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sparro
description:
Sparro is an adaptation of the game Captain's Mistress (think Connect Four) for the Series: Shibumi game platform. It differs from the original in that the goal is to be the first to get three in a row rather than four and the board wraps around the Shibumi pyramid. It is about as simple as it gets but has more depth than tic tac toe. Sparro is quick to play, has a surprise or two now and then, and is fun.

Sparro is played on the four faces of the three lower levels of the Shibumi pyramid. (There is no crow's nest.) To set up the board, create a 2x2 pyramid using five white marbles in the center of the 4x4 base. This pyramid will support the placing of marbles on the outer faces.

One player uses twelve red mistress marbles and the other uses twelve black pirate marbles.

Red starts and places a marble on any empty space. Players then take turns playing a marble on any empty space or 2x2 platform.

The first to get three in a row wins the sparring match. See the figure below for all the legal 3-in-a-rows on one face of the pyramid. If no one wins outright, Black wins. This compensates for Red having the initiative at the beginning of the game.











Extended Play Variant
The standard rules for Sparro apply but with the following three changes:

1) Play continues until all 24 marbles have been played. The player with the most three-in-a-rows on the board at the end of the game wins. Note, when counting, count all unique three-in-a-rows. For example, four-in-a-row counts as two three-in-a-rows. Rows can intersect.

2) To resolve ties the following mechanism is used. A tie-breaker token, for example a gold doubloon or a white marble, is given to Black at the start of the game. From then on, the token belongs to whichever player last created a 3-in-row on the game board. If there is a tie between players for number of three-in-a-rows, the possessor of the token wins.

3) On Black first turn, if Red played to a corner space, Black must play to one of the eight edge center spaces, or, if Red played to an edge center space, Black must play to one of the four corner spaces. Thereafter, there are no further restrictions on either player. (This rule is to prevent symmetric play and an automatic win for Black.)

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: March to the Sea
description:
A solitaire game where the player takes control of an American armoured brigade as it tries to battle its way from the Czech border to the German coast, fighting against an aggressive but unprepared German military machine.

The object is survival of as many American units as possible, whilst under constant German attacks from all directions, effectively a "tower defence" type game.

During play, you will position your American units within the column-of-march to meet the oncoming enemy forces, trying to place the most effective units for each threat type in a position to gain most advantage.

Separate tracks have to be managed as well. One tracks your progress towards the sea, another the number of wounded within your column and a third the opinion of the German people.

A deck of event cards must be played through, each event either helping or hindering your cause, and hand management is critical during play.

You have to strike a balance of careful manoeuvring, card play and threat management in order to reach the destination with as many of your units as possible.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Tâb
description:
Tâb is a traditional Egyptian abstract game played in a number of Arabic-speaking countries. It is classified by the game historian R. C. Bell as a "running fight" game and by the game historian David Parlett as a "linear war" game. Games in these categories are relatively rare (Tablan, Puluc, and Daldos being virtually the only other known examples).

The game is played on a board with 4 rows and anywhere from 7 to 15 columns. One player fills the bottom row with playing pieces; the other player fills the top row with his or her pieces. Four casting sticks are used to randomly generate moves for the pieces. The two center rows of the board are treated as a looping track along which pieces move linearly in a counter-clockwise direction once leaving their home row. It is primarily on these two central rows that the battles take place, with a piece capturing an opponent piece by landing on its square. A few special movement rules add complexity and strategy to the game. A player wins by capturing all of the opponent's pieces.

There is some speculation among game historians that Tâb may be a descendent of the ancient Egyptian game of Senet (similarities include linear movement and the use of casting sticks).

name: Adventure 1: The Mountain Keep (fan expansion for HeroQuest)
description:
The Game of Hero Quest lives on in these new adventure series of games. Each adventure is a single story that are 14 quests long. The Heroes start out with their beginning status and build up their strength as they fight their way through each castle. In the end they must have a fight with Zargon to survive. Will they succeed?
These games' pdf files are available for downloading. They are made in a way that will allow you to make the books and cards. The pages are available at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "Hero Quest Game board" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play. Your adventure awaits!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: World of Motor Racing: Indy 500
description:
A module for Lambourne's "World of Motor Racing".

This statistical replay game recreates the Indy 500 race. It uses the same basic rules as the base game, but adds specific rules unique to the Indy 500 race, such as different starting grids, Yellow Lights Phases, start procedure and pit stops.

As in the basic game, everything you do is handled by a roll of two dice and different tables for each driver, car and track section. The outcome of this roll and a number of modifiers tell you how many spaces you are allowed to move.

name: Grow
description:
Grow is a solitaire game where the player guides a growing forest towards safety from the lumber industry.

The Player builds his/her tree through a series of rounds using hex tiles representing branches and leaves. The leaf tiles provides energy (used as Action point) for the player to spend growing his tree further or expanding his tree population.

As the player's tree grows bigger, it also becomes more profitable to cut down. The lumberjack token will become more active and more powerful as the game progresses. The player loses the game when there's no more trees for the lumberjack to cut down!

The game is a free Print-and-play game available to anyone! Counters are provided but standard wooden cube are suggested for convenience.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: MythWars: Clash of the Gods
description:
MythWars: Clash of the Gods is a CCG (customizable / collectible card game) for 2-4 players, aged 12 to adult. A typical two player game takes less than 20 minutes, while four player games have been known to last over an hour.

In the game, each player controls a team of 4 gods, goddesses, and/or other entities, each with a different ability: some abilities may help their teammates, or hinder the opposing teams; others grant special attacks, or bring in extra reinforcements. New gods and/or goddesses are revealed as the game progresses, and each one in play gets an attack each round. Attacks are determined by comparing the attacking entity's Attack score (plus a die roll) to the defending entities Defense score (plus a die roll). Similarly, two entities may Clash, comparing their Energy scores (plus die rolls), with varying results. Entities remain in play until they run out of Energy points, at which point they are removed from the game, and the winning player is the last one with any gods and/or goddesses left.

The gods, goddesses, and other entities come from various mythologies, and are grouped together by their culture of origin. Each culture has eight Entity cards (gods and goddesses), and each "Battle Set" has two cultures, for a total of 16 cards per set. Battle Set 1 (Greeks vs. Norsemen) was released as a print-and-play game on August 25th, 2012. Battle Set 2 (Egyptians vs. Japanese) will be released similarly on September 9th, 2012. Battle Set 3 and 4 are slated for early and mid-2013, respectively.

The game itself has a deck building element, as any four gods or goddesses can be brought together for a team, and some combinations are more useful than others. There is also an element of luck, as dice are used in determining attacks and Clashes, and which is amplified by the game's Critical Roll system (wherein a roll of 6 "almost always" wins).

The full rules and the card information (including the card images) were publicly released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0) license.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Affen Wippe
description:
Balancing game. To set up for play, you must assemble a palm tree and place the monkey on the point of the top of the tree. He will balance there very precariously.

His limbs are so arranged that you can slide one of your plastic bananas on to a couple of limbs. Every success scores you a point. If succesful, you get to balance another and so on until you make him fall or you drop a banana or you get all 16 bananas on which would score you bonus points.

You play three rounds and the one who has accumaleted the most points, wins.

name: Munchkin Beißt! 'Baum' Booster (Set 1)
description:
This booster contains 20 German-language Munchkin Bites! cards. Seventeen of the cards come from Munchkin Bites! 1 and 2, and they form a rigged demo that can be used to teach the game. The remaining 3 cards are new and there are no corresponding English versions. All 20 cards have a jack-o-lantern as the icon.

The packaging for the booster set is clear plastic, and there is nothing inside but the cards themselves (no rules, etc.). Thus, the name of the booster, 'Baum', comes from the top card that's visible through the packaging.

The cards in this booster were originally released as part of the Munchkin Bites Halloween DVD set, which is now out of print. The DVD set, unlike this booster, includes the rules on how to run the demo.

The 3 new cards are:

Dragwolf
Eine Frau wie Dynamit
Omen XXIII


Note that these 3 cards have been re-released as part of the Munchkin Sammlerkoffer, but the icon is the Sammlerkoffer icon, not the jack-o-lantern.

Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: La Hache & le Feu: la Porte des Damnés
description:
This expansion add 10 adventures to the campaign of the basic set and the rules for the use of event cards.

Components:
8 new dungeons floor tiles
10 cardboard figurines
8 new monster cards
8 new treasure cards
10 event cards
1 booklet
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mahta Mahti
description: Mahta Mahti is a very different kind of card game. It is challenging enough to interest adults and experienced gamers, but simple enough to appeal to kids old enough to put a thought into something. It is designed for 3-10 players, ages 12+, although we've seen 10 year olds play quite well. Cards are played from the hand onto a play area that is 16 cards square; four rows of four cards. The novel nature of Mahta Mahti cards is that as uniquely square cards with matchable numbers on all four sides, each card is rotated to find the best match. Even more unique is that the scoring landscape constantly changes as cards are played on top one another. Right card; right spot; best match; best score. It's that simple. A little strategy, a little arithmetic and a lot of fun. The kind of game that makes kids dream of college, not monsters.

name: Gunship: Anti-Fighter Turret Promo
description:
Available at GenCon 2013

This is a ship part (single card) that provides specific anti-fighter defenses to your ship.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Sink the Titanic
description:
Sink the Titanic is a 1-2 player board game that pits you, the icebergs, against the evil Titanic. You must stop the Titanic from reaching its destination, but be careful, the captain isn't all there.

When playing a solo game, roll the two dice to determine the Titanic's speed and direction, then move each of your icebergs one space. In a two-player game, the player controlling the Titanic rolls the speed die, then determines which direction to move; the iceberg player then moves each of his icebergs one space.

The icebergs win if one of them moves across the Titanic's bow or if the Titanic runs through an iceberg.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: LEGO Hockey
description:
Hockey was a subtheme of LEGO Sports introduced in 2003. Hockey is unique from the others in the LEGO Sports family because several of the sets did not include actual Minifigures, instead hockey players are built out of TECHNIC pieces.

LEGO Hockey is a dexterity game for two players played by moving around hockey players attached to wands and knocking the LEGO puck around until somebody scores a goal.

name: Options: Strategic Game of Numbers
description:
Options was a game that 3M apparently planned to publish in their bookcase game series, but it never appeared. At least one prototype exists.

The game is played on a 12x14 grid. Each player has an identical set of number tiles (two each of 0-9) plus two "proxy" tiles and two blocking tiles. The board is seeded with the proxy and blocking tiles and then players take turns playing a tile or replacing a proxy with a matching regular tile and placing the proxy somewhere else.

When a tile is played it must be next to or one space away from an "object" tile, and must either be one lower or higher than that tile, or equal to it if the play is on one of the starred spaces in the center.

Points are scored for getting scoring tiles (those numbered 1, 3, or 7) in scoring rows; a scoring row is an orthogonal row of three or four of a player's tiles, but if there are three they must be in sequence (with wraparounds allowed). Points are also scored for creating situations in which the opposing player cannot play.

name: 1914: Austria-Hungary at War
description:
On 28 June 1914, Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife were shot dead in Sarajevo, by Gavrilo Princip, member of the Black Hand, a political organization seeking for a merging of the Balkan area into a Greater Serbia or a Yugoslavia.

Austria-Hungary subsequently issued an ultimatum against Serbia. As the ultimatum was rejected, Austria-Hungary then declared war, marking the outbreak of the war.

While France and Russia immediately sided with Serbia, Germany joined the Austria-Hungary and started a surprise offensive in the west with the objective of quickly defeating the French, to then turn east and knock the Tzarist Russia out of the war.


1914 is a game of World War I conflict simulation at the strategic level. It recalls the most decisive battles fought by Austria-Hungary on both the Balkan and the Eastern Front in 1914. Although based on historical events and battles, the players in command of the two factions can modify the evolution of World War I.

The game is recommended for two or four players, but has a good solitaire suitability.

Developed with a system of wooden blocks and cubes and played out over 2 70x90 cm multicolor mapboards, with more than 300 wooden/plastic components created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

The rules are divided into three major sections which can be learned one at a time:
• The Basic Game Rules introduce the basic concepts and enable players to start playing the game without too many rules to remember.
• The Advanced Game Rules provide more specific and detailed rules for enhanced realism.
• The Optional Rules are for those who want to get the most out of the game, with rules for Strategic Warfare, Amphibious Landings, and more.

In 1914, 1 cm is approximately 10 km, a turn is 1 month long, and a full-strength counter represents a major military formation, normally corps size with some divisions and brigades.

The game can be played with "Fog of War" on (with the faces of wooden blocks hidden from the opponent) or off (all units are visible).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Mimtoo Famille
description: Mimtoo Famille is a simple game of miming and gestures that is played in teams. One player on the active team draws both a character card and an action card, then silently acts out the card combination – for example, a bowler imitating Tarzan. This player's teammates have one minute to guess the answer, collecting a card if they do so. The team that collects the most cards wins!

name: Pillage / Burn
description:
Pillage / Burn is a pirate themed bluffing game for 2-8 players that takes about half an hour.

The board shows a mystery ship surrounded by a set of pillage/burn spaces for each player. Start by placing all of the loot in the center of the board. On each turn as the scout, you'll roll the die in secret and try to trick the other players. Everyone who got it right collects some loot, and everyone you tricked pays you.

Once all the loot has been collected, the pirate with the most wins the game.

name: Hiyoko Drip
description:
Enter the world of the Mame-ista Championship! Who will be the best Hiyoko dripper? \"Hiyoko\" means chickpea, but these chickpeas are so cute they almost look like little chicks.

Players take turns in trying to tip out a combination of beans. But you need to be careful as sometimes 1 bean may tip out...or a LOT! Only the player who is able to get the right combination of beans over a certain amount of rounds (depending on the number of players) can be declared the Mame-ista winner!

On a turn you tip out some beans, if you get a blend/straight combination you can try one more time to get another combination. If you are unsuccessful, you remove 1 bean from the ones that fell out, and try one more time.

name: Beasts of Burden
description:
Beasts of Burden is a quick-playing card game of treachery and debauchery for 2-6 people.

The central theme and mechanic of the game is managing encumbrance:

You and your backstabbing pals can only carry so much stuff yet, you will need certain treasures, tools, and weapons to survive monsters, traps, and puzzles. For example, Party Orcs can be defeated with either weapons or a barrel of brandy, while the Monster That Can Only Be Defeated By Flaming Arrows can only be defeated by... uh... flaming arrows.

Each player has a hand of 7 cards, drawn from the deck. There are three categories of cards, Items, Encounters and Effects.

You can only have 10 weight worth of weapon, tool, treasure and container cards in front of you, but you'll need a variety of item cards to defeat monster, quest and puzzle cards that are played in a 3x3 grid in the center of the table. Encounter cards are worth points, and the person with the most points after one of the four quests has been completed wins.

Throw in some fiendish traps and game-altering effects, and you have a table full of mayhem as players juggle weapons, treasure and sacks full of kittens as they navigate an increasingly absurd dungeon.

name: Facility
description:
In Facility, a small group of invaders breaks into a well-guarded facility - skulking in the shadows, sneaking up behind guards and taking them down silently, dragging the bodies out of sight - with the goal of stealing valuable corporate secrets, or assassinating the enemy strategist, or sabotaging top-secret industrial production.

What's the catch? You don't control the team breaking in, you control the guards. Although 'control' isn't quite the word; you watch as your team follows their patrol routes, then - via a hand of cards - interject with that casual glance over the shoulder or decision to switch direction at a critical moment, to catch the intruders... off-guard.

Facility is a solo game that plays out as a cross between a deckbuilder and an AI-driven miniatures game. The player controls the actions of his guards by buying and playing cards from his deck, while the intruders follow a simple set of rules to sneak up behind the player's guards, knife them in the back and drag their bodies out of sight.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: 5Pax
description: A collection of fast and lite, two-player dice games that employ a variety of mechanics. Dice are used as markers, as projectiles and as dice. The core package comes with 10 microgames, including: Save the Princess, Horse Racing, TwentyOne, Bowling, Trapped, Football, Tennis, Dodgeball, Marbles and Morph Chess. Rules are easy to learn and the average game lasts 5 to 10 minutes, making these great as filler games, and gateway games to introduce new players to tabletop gameplay.

name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: 2258 Edition Vorlon Empire Starter Kit
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Spaghetti Junction: Lay it again Sam!
description:
From the back of the box:

Gulf of Mexico, halfway the 20th century (sic): the installation of platforms and pipelines in the Gulf of Mexico has started. Challenging times for visionary pioneers! Who will b the player with the necessary vision, daring and skill to expand his pipeline network in the fastest way? Who lives by the principle "if you can dream it, you can do it" and outsmarts all the other players?

Purpose of this game:

connect 4 platforms and 1 landfall by pipelines...
choose the best starting point for your pipeline network...
install one of two pipe joints per turn...
foresee the moves of your fellow players...
and use their installed pipe joints for your network!

name: California Water Crisis
description:
Can you solve the drought? California Water Crisis is an educational game about California water politics. Take the role of one of California's three main regions (NorCal, SoCal, and the Central Valley) and try to find a solution to the fundamental cause of California's drought: there's more water demand than there's water.

Based on extensive research on California water history and current conditions, California Water Crisis will expose you to real world challenges such as special interest groups, groundwater depletion, and population growth.

Providing realism and replay value, the 3 regions have different starting resources, weaknesses, and potential strategies. This game takes about 10 minutes to learn and about 40-60 minutes to play. In addition to the main game, there are also two scenarios: one set in the late 1800s in the bad old days of reckless resource exploitation, and a cooperative scenario set in the mid 21st century.
categories: American West, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Political, Print & Play

name: de Bono: Two Smart Games
description:
This two-game set includes Edward de Bono's L-Game and 3-Spot. Both are games of pure skill, designed to improve thinking skills. They can be as challenging as chess, yet as easy as playing tic-tac-toe and can be learned in minutes.

In L-Game the objective is to move your L-shaped piece and one of 2 neutral pieces to block the other player's pieces. There are 16 (4x4) squares on the board with 18,368 possible moves.

In 3-Spot the objective is to move your piece and the neutral piece to cover the spots on a nine (3x3) square board. The unique feature is: a player can, at any time, change strategies from an offensive tactic to a defensive one, or vise versa, and WIN!

name: Thicket
description:
Thicket is a variation of "Dots and Boxes"

MATERIAL
A printed 6x6 grid made of dots and two pencils.

PLAY
Players take turns.

Connect two dots by drawing an orthogonal line segment between them.

A chain of line segments that borders an area of empty squares, is claimed by the player who draws the last line segment of that chain. This player then draws his initials inside this area of empty squares and draws another line segment.

Once an area is claimed, players are forbidden to play inside of it.

No dot on the board may have more than three-line segments drawn out from
it.

The game ends when all areas have been claimed.

Players count all the square spaces within their claimed areas.

The player with the largest number of square spaces in his claimed areas is the winner.

name: Dungeon Escape Micro Edition: The Classic Game of Memory
description:
From the designer KS page:
Micro version of the card game that plays like the game of memory with a fantasy twist, adding heroes, battles, equipment, and more. The micro edition of Dungeon Escape is a fast paced game of memory for 2 players, taking no more than 5 minutes per game and perfect for ages 5 to adult.

name: Friday the 13th: Promo Pack
description:
A promo pack of 3 cards release by Iello. One cat, one mirror, one ladder.

All cards have a zero value

name: Foto safari
description:
Photo Safari is a simple game for younger players. Each player has one figurine. The figurine represents off road vehicle in which are visitors of safari park. There are different paths.

On the board are counters with pictures of different animals. Players collect counters (photos) by standing on marked filed next to counter. During the game, players need to collect as many counters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Bürokratopoly
description:
To become important in society players have to rise in political-social position from laborer to the Secretary General of the ruling political party. The player who reaches this position wins the game.

Each player has 5 pawns and 3 action cards.

The players select an action and reveals it at the same time. The starting player will perform his action and in clockwise order the next players will.

Actions are:
Wahl (Voting): players role dice, winner moves up and takes a Wahl card.
Meuterei (Position challenge): players role dice, winners take higher position.
Beförderung oder Versetzung (Promotion or Relocation/Transfer): move a pawn up to higher position or place a pawn in another position on the same level.

When all positions in the center circle (Politburo) are filled, a vote for the highest function (Secretary General) can take place. The winner of that vote wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pocket and Biscuit
description:
Pocket and Biscuit is a game of collecting delicious cookies. Tiles are laid face down (pocket showing) in a 6x6 grid, and players must find the cookies they want to eat. If you start by finding a single cookie, then two, then even three or more, your cookies can add up, but you always have to put something back in your pocket for later.

Players take turns finding cookies until someone's pockets are full, at which point the person with the most cookies wins.

name: Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-4: Advanced Mode
description: These are the cards that will make you sweat. There are 2 new game mode cards that allow the players to choose how difficult they want to play. Plus special meat power cards that take the bosses to the next level of difficulty. Also includes 6 new checkpoint cards and save files. Requires Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Xindus Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Temporal Cold War.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Q Continuum Card Pack
description: This card pack is the grand prize for the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Q Continuum. It consists of 3 Upgrades, 1 Captain and 1 Admiral.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Stranded No More: The Mutiny
description:
The prequel to Stranded No More, SNM: The Mutiny, is a solitaire game where you lead a crew through a series of missions as Captain Oscar Locke. Years of “poor treatment” has caused the rumblings of a mutiny among the crew aboard The Scream of Atlantis. There is no agreement of who should usurp the Captain but some pirates are angrier than others. As the Captain, you’ll need to balance the anger each of your crew members has while also keeping the mutiny meter below the combustion line. If you can successfully complete all of the missions while keeping your crew happy, will avoid a mutiny and won’t get stranded.

The goal of the game is twofold: get through the chosen missions while avoiding a mutiny and to accumulate the most amount of gold possible. To do the former it’ll likely come at the detriment of the latter. Your ability to manage the levels of anger and mutiny while pressing your luck will determine your success as a Pirate Captain.

name: The King's Armory: Asphar the Barbarian
description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Sitting Ducks Gallery: Give Peace a Chance
description:
Promo card handed out at Essen in 2006.
When played, all crosshairs are removed from the play area.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Ohio (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Ticket to Ride: Ohio is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride series created by Alan R. Moon. A tribute both to Ticket to Ride and the great state of Ohio, this expansion is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or playtested this expansion.

Unofficial Fan made expansion - Symbols & Graphics Copyright 2004-2016 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Get Adler! Deduction Card Game: Whispers
description:
This intriguing expansion adds The Mole (player 7) and French Agent Bonnet (player 8).

The objective of The Mole is to pass vital information to Adler (and Kate Collins), while the mission of Gigi Bonnet is to intercept enemy communications and pass that intelligence to her colleagues.

Note: This is expansion was never produced, and according to the publisher's posts on it's Kickstarter campaign, will not be produced. Instead, it's content was added to and made available in the Premium edition of the base game.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Role Playing

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Kohlar's Battle Cruiser
description: This ship is the competitive prize for "The Trouble With Tribbles" episode Organized Play event. It is a Klingon D7 class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: High Speed Hover Tank
description:
It's the future! Tanks can fly, and they're super-fast! Bang-bang-bang kerplow!

In a post-nuke irradiated hellscape, mechanized warfare evolves into its ultimate form: nuclear-powered Armored Flying Vehicles. Now, split-second death-duels are fought in the skies over the wastes of North America: from bootleggers to mercenaries, imperial armies to rock 'n' roll warlords, they all want their piece of the pie called Mega-Detroit.

High Speed Hover Tank is a fast-paced, card-driven-ish, dice-slinger's paradise. Ten unique models of Tanks - from the slick, speedy Viper, to the paralyzing Falcon, to powerhouses like the monstrous Tiamat - give players new tactical and strategic challenges in each scenario. A deck of Action Cards enhances your options, and keeps you in doubt as to what your opponent can do, while the aptly-named Kerplow! Deck can change the battlefield dramatically or suddenly bring the game to a close. No scenario is going to play out the same way the second time around.
To top it off, there are 10 scenarios for you to choose from. Punch a hole through elite Canadian armor. Out-bid your opponent for the services of Dido Blackhammer and her Death-Dodgers. Fight it out at point-blank range in the middle of a radiation storm. Or try to befriend Ethel, the Deranged, Homicidal, Also Terribly Lonely, Sentient Nuclear Tank.

High Speed Hover Tank is a glorious sandbox of action and excitement. So, fire up your nitro-boosters, roll your dice, and knock 'em out of the sky!

name: You're Fired: Interns
description:
They’re pretty useless on their own, but when combined with other cards, they can actually be pretty useful! Who knew?

An Intern may copy any one ability from any card in your hand. This can be a standard ability or a reactive ability and would be played as if it were written on the Intern card.

name: Shopping Madness
description:
This British Gibson party game consists of 12 cards each listing 12 items to be purchased, with a price and another item to be purchased next. The cards are placed in various locations around the house or garden, and each player is given a shopping card that begins with a first item to be found.

The players move from one list card to another in search of the right items, noting the price of each. The first player to correctly fill a shopping card wins. Prices are used to check accuracy.

While the game is undated, it was probably issued in 1971 or shortly thereafter, since prices are listed in decimal pounds and pence, including the half penny. The game would have been a fun way to get used to the new decimal system, launched in 1971, and certainly preceded the elimination of the half-penny in 1984.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – All Stop Resource
description:
The All Stop Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "Baiting the Romulans," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Klingon Civil War.

When using this resource, you place 5 Mission Tokens on it at the beginning of the game. Once per round, any one of your ships can choose to disregard it's chosen maneuver and instead not move (and skip it's action step). When you use this ability, you remove one Mission Token from the resource, and once all 5 tokens are spent, discard it.

It costs 5 SP.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Play House
description:
Play House is a card game in which players place rooms of a house and place items and people in each room. The objective is to be the first player to play all of your cards.

Items can only be played in the room in which they belong; for example, the Cookie Jar can only be played in the kitchen. People cards lock a room so that no other objects can be played in the room until the room is unlocked by a Key card.

name: Project: ELITE – Spawn a Boss Promo Card
description:
Promo card given out by Artipia Games at Spiel 2016.

Card text:
Discard this card and spawn an Alien Boss in its place. It still counts towards the number of Alien cards spawned this round.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Top Fantasy
description:
In Top Fantasy one player each round picks a card from the deck, then tries to make the others guess what's shown on this card in the manner indicated on the top card of the deck: using only the hands; using noises and sounds but no words; telling a story about the card; and creating a statue with your body.

All players have only one opportunity to show their guess by placing their finger on what they think is the face-up matching card on the table. If the card is guessed, the active player keeps their card and the one who guessed takes the twin card from the table. If the card is not guessed, the active player places the card under the deck. In both cases, the next player in clockwise order becomes the active player. The first player to collect nine cards wins.

name: Kwintessens
description:
To impress the king, players in Kwintessens try to be the best alchemist.

In ancient times, all elements were thought to be built of fire, water, earth and water, which were represented by triangles. In the game, each player tries to outwit the others by building four pure elements, i.e., triangles surrounded by triangles of the same element. To do so, the players can and probably will use the triangles played by other players.

Timing is essential in this quick, tactical game, especially since other players can break down a previously built pure element by mutating one of its parts.

One essential part of the game is the "kwintessens" triangle, which can take any shape the players want.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: It Started Here
description:
The First Fight of Many

It Started Here LZ X-Ray is a simulation of the air assault by the 1-7 Air Cavalry Battalion into the Ia Drang Valley in mid-November of 1965. This platoon level game tells the story of the Air Cav's desperate fight for survival against the overwhelming strength of three North Vietnamese Army (NVA) regiments. This newly revised edition comes complete with new maps, counters and updated rules. Test your strategies and outthink your opponent, using infantry platoons, machine-gun sections, mortar batteries, and helicopter sections in furious jungle warfare.

Requirements: Two six-sided dice are required to play this game. This game contains some previously released material from Brothers By My Side and Line of Fire. No other product is required to play this game.

Complexity: 4 out of 10

Solitaire: 7 out of 10

Ages: 12+

Players: 1-2

Time: 45-90 Minutes

name: Dice Derbi
description: Dice Derbi is a dexterity dice tossing game where players form teams, casting lures (dice) onto one of two game boards, trying to hit the honey hole and catch the largest fish. Based on fishing yet easily played by all ages.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Party Game, Sports

name: Gads Hill 1874: 2. Expansion – Jesse James
description:
Gads Hill 1874: 2. Expansion – Jesse James is an expansion for Gads Hill 1874.

Three solo puzzles added.

name: Alexander's Campaign: Mini Expansion
description:
The mini expansion includes 3 new Alexander's generals in the game:

- Seleucus (player mat, special ability tile and conquest point token)

- Perdiccas (player mat, special ability tile and conquest point token)

- Lysimcachus (player mat, special ability tile and conquest point token)

name: Manimals: Tierpark Hellabrunn
description:
In Manimals: Tierpark Hellabrunn, which features animals found in that particular zoo, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Monopoly: Doctor Who Villains
description:
Geronimo!

"Run you clever boy, and remember!"

Join The Doctor and his companions on some of their greates adventures! Celebrating the series since its 2005 re-launch, you will travel through all of time and space with The Doctor for his most memorable exploits against many of his greatest adversaries, including The Silence, Cybermen, The Master, and even the dreaded Daleks! It is up to you to save the universe, so grab your trusty sonic screwdriver, hop in the Tardis and set a course for adventure.

Includes 60-minute Speed play rules!

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pokémon TCG: Base Set 2 Expansion
description:
Base Set 2 is an English-language expansion with no corresponding Japanese-language expansion; the cards brought the English-language game scale into rough parity with the Japanese-language game.

The expansion includes 130 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon Expansion
description:
Sun & Moon is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Collection Sun/Collection Moon.

The expansion includes 163 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Russian Roulette
description:
The Russian Roulette card game is a beer and pretzels game that contains all the thrills and excitement of the real game of chance without the potentially lethal risks.

The rules are very light and the games are fast. It’s a quick and portable game that can be played on the go. It’s great for downtime on game night, also while waiting at a restaurant, or standing in those long lines at your favorite conventions. The rules cover the basic 2 player game along with some variant rules. There are also advanced rules that add a scoring system which allow for more players and longer games.

Set includes 22 Cards of which there are two types of game cards and rules cards.

10 Empty Cylinder
10 Single Bullet
2 Rules

A Russian Roulette deck consists of 5 of each type of game card. This set has enough cards for two decks.

Card Specifics:
US Poker-Size 2.5” x 3.5” Printed on premium card stock, 11.8-pt. thickness, 305gsm black core card stock, Rounded-corners and Low-gloss UV Coating.

name: Big Bluff Quiz
description:
Big Bluff Quiz, a.k.a., BBQ, is a question game in which you can win even if you don't know any of the answers! You may pretend you know them, be self confident, and end up a little lucky. Do not push your luck either as BBQ may "grill" you.

To set up, place fifteen tokens numbered 2-16 in the middle of the playing area. One of the players takes a card and reads the question. All players may then take one of the numbered tokens, which represents both their bet and the number of answers they think they know. If the question asked you to name the planets in the solar system, for example, a player who took the #5 token is saying that they know five planets and are betting 5 points. One of the players is then chosen to give their answers. They win their bet if they succeed and lose it if they fail. The other players win their bets even if they didn't know any of the answers!

name: Räuber Hotzenplotz: Hinterhalt im Räuberwald
description:
Famous Räuber Hotzenplotz has esacped. Grandmother, Kaspar, Sepperl und Wachtmeister Dimpfelmoser are getting on his track to catch him. They want to be fast but have to avoid to stumble. Otherwise Räuber Hotzenplotz will be alarmed and move on.
By secretly picking up movement card players try to be the playing moving the fastet. But they have to avoid to get more than 6 movement points. If so the stumble and have to go back one space on the track while Hotzenplotz moves on.
The fastes player moves forward 2 spaces. When hitting exactly 6 movement points he even moves 3 spaces. When Hotzenplotz arrives at his hideout, he wins. When one of the players passes or reaches Hotzenplotz on the, the players win.

name: Mega Billionaire Banshee
description:
An expansion as well a compilation of Billionaire Banshee, this game has you choose positive (perk) and a negative (quirk) to make the right dating match for you, based on the judgement of other players.

Mega Billionaire Banshee includes the base game of Billionaire Banshee, the Sexy Foil Pack expansion, and 10 ThinkGeek exclusive cards!

The Sexy Foil Pack cards may be removed before playing with teenagers. With the Sexy Foil Pack cards included, Mega Billionaire Banshee is recommended for age 18 and older.

Contents:
208 main game cards
20 Sexy Foil Pack cards
10 exclusive cards from ThinkGeek

name: Zombie Road
description:
Zombie Road is a blood spillin', Zombie killin' race to the Oasis for 2-4 players!

Zombie Road allows you to choose between an awesome group characters, each with a unique ability, and attempt to accumulate enough miles to escape to a zombie-free zone. Watch out for disasters, stock up at gas stations and keep your guns loaded because zombies could be lurking nearby! Do you and your fellow survivors have what it takes to survive?

During each turn, a player will draw one card from the deck and then has one action to either kill a Zombie (if drawn), Remedy a disaster or accumulate miles...reach 100 miles to win the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Jake and the Never Land Pirates: Speed Match Game
description: Players take turns rolling dice to reveal the combination of image (a character from Jake and the Neverland Pirates), background color and perimeter color that all players will search for among 54 revealed combinations on the modular board. The player that finds the correct combination places her token on that combination on the board. The first player to place all of their tokens on the board wins the game.

name: Perú Cocina
description: Perú Cocina is a card game about famous Peruvian dishes. Claiming dish cards requires playing all the necessary ingredient cards in the correct order. Each ingredient card shows two different ingredients (in a Dominos style design) of which you can use only one in any given situation, so players have to think carefully which side to use. A player on their turn either places a card or cards near a dish to help preparing it, or places one of their cards into an open pool where anyone can use it. When a player places the last ingredient card for a dish, they claim the card which scores points at the end of the game. The player who finished the most valuable dishes is the winner.

name: Kirby no Kopitoru!
description:
A strategic card game featuring Nintendo's Kirby and his friends and rivals, with three different gameplay modes for different audiences and numbers of players. Cute, cheerful artwork and simple rules allowing for good depth and strategic play make it accessible to a wide audience.

"Copy Power Battle" involves choosing Kirby cards from your hand to defeat enemy cards on the table, after which you can gain different copy powers and abilities based on the type of enemies you've defeated. The player with the highest victory points after seven rounds wins, based on the cumulative point value of the enemies they've defeated throughout the game.

"Simple Battle" is a variant on the above gameplay with simplified rules that works better for younger or larger numbers of players.

"Single Battle" is a single-player variant involving a similar gameplay flow to Copy Power Battles, but incorporating waves of enemy cards that must be defeated to see how far you can progress without having your Kirby cards defeated.

Components:
112 Cards (Kirby card ×54, Enemy card ×48, other cards× 10)
Instructions
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Monkey Balance Tower
description: Monkey Balance Tower is a game of strategy, luck and skill for 2-8 players. Roll the dice and strategically place monkeys to build a tower in this challenge that is played on 2 levels involving colors and motor skills. Each player creates a new tower level until it falls. The player who knocks over the tower loses.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Shield of Baal – Exterminatus
description:
The 3rd release in the Shield of Baal campaign. Exterminatus is a two-book set containing:

The 152-page campaign book includes:
– The story of the final acts of war in the Cryptus System featuring the combined forces of the Blood Angels, Adepta Sororitas, Astra Militarum, and the Flesh Tearers versus the Tyranids of Hive Fleet Leviathan
– An explanation of how the Necrons of Cryptus awoke to lend their aid to the beleaguered world along with the fleet of Anrakyr the Traveller
– Example armies that took part in the climax of the campaign
– Background of the heroes and famous regiments of the campaign
– Stunning new artwork that brings the background to life and illustrates the regions of space around Cryptus

The 64-page rulebook includes:
– 8 new missions based on the events of the narrative book.
– 8 new datasheets for the Blood Angels 1st and 2nd Companies, Flesh Tearers, and the Necrons of the Mephrit Dynasty. That’s the equivalent of four Codex Supplements in one book!
– New warlord traits, relics and force organization charts for all four armies
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ninjaaa'Tack
description:
In Ninjaaa’Tack, communicate with your teammate to be the first ones to assemble your Ninja clan.

When your team manages to collect 4 identical cards of the same clan, your team earns a Clan token.
To do this, you and your teammate must collectively have all 4 identical cards.
When you think your team has assembled a clan, tap the gong and shout, “Ninjaaaa!” If it's correct, the team wins the clan's token.

A team wins the game when it has 3 differents tokens!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Tim Burton's Nightmare Before Christmas Merry Mayhem
description:
Join Jack, Sally, and all the residents of Halloween Town in a fast-paced, card-playing frenzy! Race to play all your cards as you madly match and stack characters. Then use your Moon cards to snatch piles and score. get the most points, and you'll be the Pumpkin King of Merry Mayhem!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Super Dungeon: Jorogumo
description:
Jorogumo is a Kagejima themed dungeon boss for your games of Super Dungeon. She brings potent new abilities and treasure to the game that are entirely unique to this must-have character!

A horror, a cautionary tale, and a powerful opponent, the spider women called Jorogumo are useful, if questionable, allies of the Dark Consul. They descend from a witch of Kagejima that rescued the unwary or unfortunate from drowning in lakes and rivers. Claiming to rehabilitate them, she actually slowly poisoned and paralyzed them for use in dark and terrible spells. As her magics grew too much, Kagejim itself cursed her with a shape that evoked her horrid nature. This terrible judgment carried to her offspring who came to bear her name.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Iconoclash
description:
Iconoclash puts you center stage in the ultimate tabletop platform fighting action. You’ll join the fray as one of 11 characters, leverage clever card play to collect items, rushdown rivals, create powerful combos that launch them into the air and off the stage to outplay the competition. 'Iconoclash' captures the fast paced action and tactics of a platform fighter. Choose your favorite character from a variety of board game universes. Each character has a unique deck and playstyle. Then select which map to fight on.

Each turn you’ll play two attacks, each with three different effects to choose from. Meaning that every character has over 500 unique attack combinations. Some attack options require you to spend a Power Token, giving them an added kick to deal massive damage. Attacks also send your opponents flying, potentially launching them off the edge of the board to deal extra damage. All the while, you will move across the stage to keep your opponent in range, dodge stage hazards, collect items, and avoid attacks. Reduce your opponent's HP to 0 to win.

Featuring three Multiplayer Modes for up to 4 players:
Classic Mode: Last one-standing wins. This mode is for players who love the classic no-holds-barred, last-one-standing action.
Battle Royale: The player to deal the most damage after 4 rounds wins. This mode is great for players who prefer game play that is about maximizing combos and want to avoid player elimination.
2 v 2: Team up with a partner for the win! This mode is perfect for 4-player action.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Jotunheim
description:
Need to retrieve Mjolnir from the giants? Must be Thursday.
Need to retrieve Freyja from the giants? Must be Friday.
Two retrieval teams ensorceled to think the other is actually giants?
Just another day in Jotunheim.


Jotunheim is an asymmetric abstract game with Norse myth-themed variable player powers. The object is to trap your opponent so that they have no legal moves (or, conversely, to avoid being trapped as long as possible). Your pieces need to keep moving and the board quickly fills with blocks, forcing you towards the endgame.

Each player has a power based on a mythological character, creature or artifact. They have one prize and two rescuers.
