Each turn they must move their prize (leaving a block behind) then one of the rescuers (which then builds on or excavates from a neighbouring space). Since pieces can't move up more than one level and spaces become blocked off, one player will eventually run out of legal moves and lose -- usually when their prize is trapped by a combination of pieces and terrain.

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Dwarfs
description:
Warhammer: Dwarfs is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dwarfs faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Lizardmen
description:
Warhammer: Lizardmen is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Lizardmen faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Vampire Counts
description:
Warhammer: Vampire Counts is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Vampire Counts faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Block by Block: The Battle of Huế, 1968
description:
Block by Block is a two-player conflict simulation of the 1968 Battle of Huế. Players must balance the military difficulties imposed by the challenges of constrained urban warfare and unique terrain of the Huế Citadel, with the overriding considerations of each side’s respective political goals. The North Vietnamese player must hold the city for as long as possible, to create a media event and lay the groundwork for a new revolutionary government. The South Vietnamese and American player must retake Huế before this process can advance too far, but not also jeopardize their own political sensitivities from casualties and heavy-handedness.

The map covers an area of 13 square kilometers (approximately 5 square miles). Each turn represents four to five days. Units represent platoon/detachment to battalion sized units.

—description from the publisher


Published with Modern War #48.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: So typisch!
description: So typisch! is a co-operative and communicative game full of stereotypes and clichés! All players fight together for the victory and play against the game. Each round, a single player decides which item to assign to a person, then everyone else must assess how this player has decided. In the end, players win only if they've made more matches than mistakes.

name: Monopoly: Canadiens – 1909-2009 Centennial Edition
description: This is the classic Monopoly game based on the Montreal Canadiens hockey club.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kintsugi: Student and Master
description:
A 4 card expansion for Kintsugi that introduces a 4 player team version of the game.


Released in the February 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Dobbers: Quest for the Key – Clockwork Expansion
description:
Adds 10 new cards to Dobbers: Quest for the Key

3 Creatures
1 Location
6 Adventure Cards
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Memory
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Il Mio Safari
description:
Want to challenge your speed and memory in this safari trip? Six different environments and more than 30 different animals are hiding in the landscape and waiting to be found. Stack the tiles, flip the first one and "go!": whoever first indicates the animal hidden in the landscape earns the tile. When you collect 6 tiles, you are the winner!
Designed for young explorers who love nature, it also teaches the alphabet with the new "Letter" tiles.

name: Paper Pinball: Chromastodon
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: A Firepower Campaign
description:
These optional rules provide a system for "linking" individual battles into an abstract campaign game, and is recommended only for very experienced players of the game. Basically, Campaign Turns are made on a "strategic matrix" and, when both players are willing, battles are resolved using the FIREPOWER game. Due to the number and size of the individual battles that will be fought, plan on a campaign game extending over a number of gaming sessions.

This expansion was first published as an article in The General, Vol. 21, No. 6 (1985).

—user summary
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Bottletop Chicks
description:
In Bottletop Chicks, competitors play for their country—and their corporate sponsors—in a futuristic aerial combat game that marries brutality with brilliance.

Two to four players attempt to avoid or counter attacks from their opponent(s) while delivering maximum damage of their own in the arena (represented by a 7x7 playing board). Players have identical decks from which to select their moves, so a player’s success relies upon their ability to anticipate opponents’ maneuvers while disguising their own.

In other words? It’s just your typical stock-car-racing-meets-MMA-meets-chess throwdown with a little patriotic pride thrown in for good measure.

—description from the publisher

name: To Ur is Human: Pre-biblical Warfare in the City-States of Mesopotamia
description:
To Ur is Human is a set of table top rules written specifically for games set in the period of the Mesopotamian city-states, such as Akkad and Ur. Using a gridded playing area and easy to learn innovative rules, To Ur is Human allows for quick play games with a unique feel and approach. The author is a historian, wargamer and blogger who has written several sets of wargames rules and games, some of which were published by the Society of Ancients as re-subscription incentive games, when there was such a thing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: 18Dracula
description:
18Dracula is a print-and-play 18XX board game where the players buy and sell shares in fronts, and operate those fronts to hire monsters to send on rampages to harvest blood. The winner is the player who is worth the most blood at the end of the game - being their blood supply, and the combined value of their shares in fronts.

Functionally, the game is very close to being a retheme of 1830. Despite lacking trains, it is very much a train game.

Besides its theme, it is also novel for its map, monsters (which replace trains), and associates (which replace privates). The map uses cubes and nodes instead of tiles (like most 18xx games). You clear routes by removing cubes from the routes.

Some monsters have special rules - such as a ghost being able to pass through a token, or a werewolf that roams adjacent towns instead of a solid route. Associates have some odd abilities, like opening a route between any two towns.

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Path to Glory
description:
Warbands rise to power in every corner of the Mortal Realms. Mighty warriors and dread sorcerers marshal their forces as they set out to crush all who stand before them. This is Path to Glory, where legendary heroes and terrifying enemies are born in bloody battle.

In this book, you’ll learn how to place yourself in the blood-soaked boots of a powerful warlord, dragging an ever-growing band of fiercely loyal followers into savage combat across the Mortal Realms. Starting with a single champion and a few followers, you’ll – assuming your capacity for violence is enough – gradually turn your warband into a rapacious horde of killers edging ever closer to eternal glory.

Contained within:


The Rise of Gulgaz – the story of the meteoric rise of Gulgaz Stoneklaw and his warclan, who expanded into a veritable juggernaut of an army;
a detailed explanation of the Path to Glory campaign: how to create a warband, how Glory Points are accrued and spent (and the rewards they bring), and how to achieve eternal glory – the final victory in a campaign;
a Warband Roster – this is a blank roster on which to document your warband and its exploits – you’re free to photocopy this;
6 Battleplans – essentially, missions you can use in your campaign, each with a different objective that changes the way your games are played;
Warband Tables – these are the rules used to determine the champion, followers and rewards for your warbands. Included are tables for the following factions: Khorne, Tzeentch, Nurgle, Slaanesh, Beasts of Chaos, Skaven, Clans Pestilens, Kharadron Overlords, Stormcast Eternals, Fyreslayers, Sylvaneth, Seraphon, Order (chosen from Human, Aelf and Duardin models), Ironjawz, Beastclaw Raiders, Bonesplitterz, Destruction (chosen from Orruk, Grot and Ogor models), Flesh-Eater Courts and Death;
Start Collecting! Warbands – if you’re itching to get going, but don’t have the right models for a warband (or just fancy a new one…) then these are the rules for you – they’re designed to work with the Start Collecting! boxes of Warhammer Age of Sigmar models. Simply pick up a box, assemble the miniatures and you’re good to go – these rules have been fine-tuned to offer immediacy and balance.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Queen's Landing
description:
Winner of the 2nd Roll & Write Competition

Every town has it’s secret societies, the shadow rulers, and Queen’s Landing is no exception.
You are the founder of one of those societies and your objective is to influence the Queen, the Bishop, and the Knight and to secure your secret position as the true ruler.
The game is played over multiple rounds and the player with the most Influence Points at the end is the winner.

Welcome to Queen’s Landing.

Overview: Queen's Landing is Roll & Write with area control and resource gathering.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Nerdier Red Flags: A Geekier Expansion to Red Flags
description:
Nerdier Red Flags is an expansion to Red Flags that adds even more nerdy goodness to your terrible dating prospects. Now your date might own a penthouse apartment in Wakanda, but they'll only sleep with you after they polymorph you into a sheep.

We wish you luck in the dates to come!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Lords of Vegas: Underworld – Vegas Shutdown Promo Card
description:
Every Vegas Shutdown charity promo card purchased will help Three Square Food Bank take care of workers affected by the shutdown of the casino industry. This promo card does not come in the Underworld Promo Card Pack; you'll need to add it to your pledge separately.
It is available as an add-on in the pledge manager for all Kickstarter backers of Lords of Vegas: Underworld.

Card description:

When this is discarded from the Underworld board, each player receives $1m for each of their dice in every casino and parking lot they own. Do not draw a property card this turn.

Final card text:

When this card comes off the deck, set each casino's highest dice to 3. Set each other die to 1. Discard this card. The next property card pays all casinos.
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Random Production, Tile Placement, Trading

name: צ'יקן (Chicken)
description:
A variant of L.L.A.M.A.

Differences include:

7 of each card instead of 8.
Lower player count. 5 instead of 6.
The game is over when a player reaches 50 points instead of 40.
An additional single wild card. When played, it counts as 1 higher than the top card. When scoring, its value is equal to the last-played card.
No tokens. Players must provide their own score-keeping method.
Instead of returning tokens, a player who plays all their cards rolls two dice, which determine how many points are reduced from the score. The dice have the values 1,2,3,4,5,10. Your score can't go below 0.


—user summary

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Onryo
description:
Sometimes, the dead cannot rest. Onryo died in terror, in rage, and in great pain. Now, she torments any travelers who come near, or those who remind her of the family that murdered her. Far too many have followed her distant, phantom figure flickering between trees and joined her small bones in a black and lonely pool.

Onryo is an all-new Dungeon Boss from the realm of Kagejima!

CONTENTS:
1x Onryo Masterclass Miniature
2x Chochin-Obake Masterclass Miniatures
1x Onryo Dungeon Boss Explore Card
1x Chochin-Obake Creep Explore Card
1x Onryo Dungeon Boss Arcade Card
1x Chochin-Obake Creep Arcade Card
1x Onryo Boss Fight Card
1x Unique Relic Card
6x Unique Treasure Cards
3x 25mm Black Bases

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults – Twin Attack Armory Pack: Knight Gatling Gun vs. Orc Twin Crossbow
description: Expand your Knights vs Orc Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults battles with this three expansion for the Battleground: Crosbows & Catapults game.

name: Fluxx: Twist Gaming Promo Cards
description:
is a New promo pack for Fluxx. It was offered as a reward to certain tiers in the "Twist Gaming Kickstarter - Year 4" campaign.
The pack contains 8 new cards to add to the game.

name: 나랏말싸미
description:
‘나랏말싸미’ is a party game for all ages using tiles that describe Korean alphabet, Hangul.
Unlike other alphabet games, ‘나랏말싸미’ strengthens more on fun party game but carries an educational function at the same time.

In the game, players make their own words using tiles and guess each other’s words. But due to the limitation on the number of tiles and time, players should hurry to find the tiles they want. Either to guess the answer or see the hint, opening one of the faced down tiles, players pay one coin. If you guess correct, you will get reward coins as much as the tiles that are not revealed yet. Otherwise, you just loose one coin. The game ends when all the words are open and the one who has the most coins wins.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Monopoly: Garbage Pail Kids
description:
Relive the classic trading card game in a whole new way with MONOPOLY: Garbage Pail Kids. Featuring authentic licensed characters fans know and love. Collectible tokens include the Zit Goo Tube, Melting Eyeball, and Swirly Dog Poop as players move around the board to collect the iconic Garbage Pail Kids.

Includes
1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Zit Goo Tube, Fish Bones, Melting Eyeball, Overflowing Trash Can, Guillotine, and Swirly Dog Poop
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Never had a Chance Cards
16 Community Chester Cards
Custom Monopoly Money
32 Houses renamed GARBAGE CANS
12 Hotels renamed DUMPSTERS
2 Dice
Rules

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Odkrywcy: Sahara
description:
Journey to distant Africa. Discover hot desert, life giving river Nil and hidden in the sand Oasis. Meet incredible animals, which lives there. Don't be fooled by mirages and remember about magic talismans, which can change Your faith.

This is a simple square tile placing game where each corner can have a different color which have to match when placing the tiles next to one another. Players score immediately after placing their tile and moves their pawn on scoring track based on the number of connecting animals with additional points matching animal kind, plus star symbols.
Each player has set of special tokens allowing unique actions. After using special action mysterious oasis tile is added to the game by the active player. To reveal it needs to be surrounded from all sides. When flipped over it adds or reduces points based on animals around it - whenever it turns out to be a mirage or actual oasis.

name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Promo Pack 1
description:
This pack includes:

1 Suave Photographer
1 Elm Street
2 Survival Guides
2 Banjoes
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Campaign Trail: Saxophone Serenade On Late Night TV
description:
This promo action card was made available as part of the Game Boy Geek's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

It has the following Politick action:

Play immediately after taking your first action on your turn. Remove 1 voter of any opponent(s) from up to 3 cities (returning them to their party's registered supply) and replace each with 1 of your registered voters.
publishers: Cosmic Wombat Games, Grey Fox Games

name: LINKAGE
description: LINKAGE is a game about tactile sensation where players balance sticks between their hands. Each player is given a color, and cards showing their color and fingers are shuffled with the cards of other players' fingers. When two cards are revealed, those players must balance a stick between those two fingers by pushing against it.

name: Math Rush: Multiplication & Exponents
description:
Think fast in Math Rush, a totally thrilling cooperative math game that will make your heart race and your head rev. For three rounds, up to five players must balance strategy and speed, properly sequencing products and exponentials before the timer runs out. Crunch the numbers in a hurry and rack up more points; make an error and miss your goal. Whether you beat your high score or not, it's more fun that you calculated.

Math Rush is a timed, co-operative card game for 1-5 players who race to complete sets of matching cards in the right order.

In Math Rush: Multiplication & Exponents, the cards show products and exponentials that must be played in ascending or descending order, meeting the requirements of the goal cards (such as "Perfect Squares Only").

—description from the designer

name: Muumien hillojahti
description:
A flicking game in the Moomin world for ages 4 and up. You try to collect fruits and berries in a jar for Moominmamma to make jam out of.

You flick a basket along the board and if it ends on a fruit field, you collect that fruit in your jar. After you have collected all 6 different fruits, you need to flick the basket inside the Moomin house at the end of the board to win. Watch out for Hattifatteners!

name: Umbra: A Solo Game of Final Frontiers
description:
UMBRA is a science fiction map drawing game that tasks you with the unenviable task of starting a colony on a hostile alien planet. As the game progresses you will dig into the planet's core in search of an ancient weapon known as The Reaper's Gambit but be warned, no matter how dead a planet looks on the surface, there is always something awful lurking underneath.

Inspired by Rimworld, Startopia, and various sci-fi horrors like Alien, The Thing, Predator, but don't worry, for all the horror on display UMBRA lets you take the lead on what your colony will look like and what your story will be.

After choosing what kind of planet you land on, you explore by drawing a playing card to determine what you find on each turn, if there is combat, it's simple and turn based. After exploring, you can trade your resources and build your colony (rooms and security systems), then you can recruit new units. You also need to balance foond and power so your colony survives. You win by finding the Reaper's Gambit, a special alien weapon that might be saving your species.
categories: City Building, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cloisters
description:
Cloisters is a simple but surprisingly deep two-player game, creating the look of a delightful complex of ancient cloisters as play progresses.

Two players take it in turns to place one of the wooden blocks following a simple rule. As new cloisters are formed the monks switch their allegiance, and only a stonemason can make a new opening in the outer wall. The player with most monks at the end wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: L'Neuvieme: A 9-Card Chase
description:
The notorious thief L’Neuvieme has just committed their latest dastardly crime! Police tracked them to the small town of Nonaville, but the trail went cold there. As the world’s foremost private detective, you have been called in to track L’Neuvieme down and put them behind bars.

L'Neuvieme is a solitaire hidden movement and deduction game that can be played entirely in-hand. Over the course of nine turns, you will move around the quiet town of Nonaville, and receive clues as to L'Neuvieme's movement. However, some of these clues may be misleading, so you will have to use all of your deductive skills to pin down where L'Neuvieme is hiding.

At any turn, you can attempt to corner L'Neuvieme if you are confident you have found them. However, for each incorrect attempt you make, your score will decrease, and if you fail to successfully corner L'Neuvieme by the end of the ninth turn, they will evade you for good!

L'Neuvieme features 12 scenarios, and a number of optional modular variants, that add plenty of replay value to this quick game of cat-and-mouse. Do you have what it takes to send L'Neuvieme back to prison?
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Print & Play
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 18 Hex Hex
description:
A solitaire railway building game consisting of 18 turns, in each of which you fill two hexes with passenger rails and stations, goods rails and factories, plus forests and spoil heaps.

Each turn you roll 7 dice, 4 blue and 3 red. The blue dice are used for passenger lines and stations; the red dice are used for goods lines and factories. You may also use dice to purchase modifiers for use in future turns, including extra dice.

You will gain points mainly for connected stations and factories, but also for a long passenger route and a large group of connected factories. However, you lose points for being forced to place spoil heaps.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Arcadia Quest: Monkey Queen
description:
What began as an arranged marriage with Wukong blossomed into love, or so Yuling imagined. The Queen is more than a little put out with Wukong dumping her with the kids and an ungovernable kingdom of apes to traipse off on some stupid adventure. Placing the first minister (a baboon with a rather fetching red bottom) in charge, the Queen has journeyed to Arcadia to drag her husband hime, and pity any foolish vampires that stand in her way!

Monkey Queen is a promotional character for Arcadia Quest.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Mole Control
description:
It is a nice and breezy summer day. The perfect day to do some gardening. Then a pile of dirt catches your attention. On closer inspection it appears to be a molehill. Panic! Moles may look cute, but they are a menace to your beautiful, flower filled garden. You need to get this mole under control, now!

In this game for 2 to 5, players take turns to add cards with stinky flowers and tasty insects (or so the Mole thinks) to the communal gardens. After that, you get to move the Mole to one of the gardens. The garden occupied by the mole is off-limits until the Mole is moved to another garden.

Once you run out of cards, you must claim one of the gardens. But, make sure to pick a garden the mole doesn't like, or your flowery oasis will soon be nothing but dirt and bumps again...

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Farming, Memory
mechanics: Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Investment, Push Your Luck

name: Lady Up
description:
The colourful and cheerful dance of the bugs is about to start! Ladybugs, bees, beetles, and spiders gather in the meadow to have a wonderful time. They are going to perform an amazing dance, spinning around, doing somersaults... up and down in a fun and joyful choreography. Can you replicate the bugs' moves and create the same choreographies?

In «Lady Up», you compete against the rest of the players to be the first one to place your Bug tokens on the table forming the same pattern shown by the Choreography card in play.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching

name: Balkan Wars: The First Balkan War
description:
Relive the First Balkan War in this exciting and quick playing game. Having recently lost Libyan and Adriatic territories to the Italians, the Ottoman Empire has shown its weakness. Serbia, Greece, and Bulgaria now see this as their opportunity to expand and claim the Balkans for themselves. Will you maintain the Empire and hold lands held since the 14th century for the Sultan? Or will you take your rightful lands from the sick man of Europe and secure your place on the Balkan peninsula?

Designed to play quickly and easily, The First Balkan War will allow you to easily teach younger audiences, and anyone knew to board gaming, how to play A&A style games. Move and recruit armies, rolls dice, and conquer the map. For those veterans of A&A, you already own all the pieces you need to play! Just buy the rondel packs and any relevant units you want for a more immersive experience. Test your strategies against each other and determine the fate of the future powder-keg of Europe!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Fallschirm
description:
Game covers several air landing operations performed during World War II by the German airborne units (Fallschirmjager). Scale of the operations varies, from small actions (like attack on Corinth channel) to the major battles, like attack on Crete.

Among these battles are two hypothetical ones - German attack on Malta (operation Hercule) and Italian attack on Maltha (Folgore). All the rest are historical battles, along with such less known battles like landings on Kos and Leros islands.

Game uses B-35 system, which is company/battalion scale system of the high complexity. It is the oldest Polish wargames system, developed since early 90's and still getting new games. Current edition of the B-35 is 4th.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Hivemind
description:
Hivemind is a reimplementation of The Mind, using Looney pyramids instead of cards. Hivemind is a real-time cooperative game where no communication is allowed (any sounds, gestures, et cetera). Each player has a random set of pyramids hidden behind a screen. Players try to play these pyramids in order without knowing which pyramids the other players have, and without communicating. There are no turns, so you have to 'guess' or 'feel' when to play your pyramids.

—description from the designer

name: Kick The Bomb
description:
The most explosive card game! Challenge your friends and be the last one standing.

Kick The Bomb is a party game where players have to throw (kick)/place bombs (remote mines, grenades & nuke) to each other using their cards. Players takes turns using different types of actions (defend, attack, draw a card, detonate) until there is only one player remaining, that player is declared the winner.
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Sabotør
description:
A game about cooperation, bluffing and deception.

Sabotør ("Saboteur") is a game where good cooperation is the key to success! Together with your teammates, you must cross the Atlantic Ocean in a galleon, but there are secret saboteurs who have only one goal in mind: Make sure the ship never reaches its destination, without being revealed.

This is a game where it can be fatal to trust other players. A game where your best friends will never hesitate to throw you into the sea and where you still depend on working together to reach the goal.

One person is Captain, changing each turn, and everyone gets 2 action cards they can play any time. Each round good and bad cards are passed around, everyone removing 1 card secretly and the Captain reveals the 3 remaining cards. He rolls a dice and the ship only moves forward if the roll is higher than red cards. Provision is automatically depleted by 1 each round. Everyone can get more action cards, shooting eachother, making someone walk the plank, get fish for extra food and so on. Hopefully the ship reach the destination, so the Saboteurs doesn't win!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Traitor Game

name: Bot Hunters
description:
Each bot is precious to a young Bot Hunter, who wants to get a good name among peers and to prove to be the best. Wild bots can be found everywhere and to catch them a hunter needs to fight them. To catch bots also means to gain their trust and their valuable help in completing your mission. Unfortunately, you will frequently meet other mysterious masked hunters, who won’t mind getting in the way and you will have to fight.

To catch bots, to use their powers to catch other bots, to defeat all masked hunters, and to create winning combinations to gather Victory Points. The game takes from 7 to 9 rounds. At the end of the game, players count their Victory Points: Victory points obtained from their bots ($), from combinations of bots, and from other bonuses received during the game. The player with the highest number of Victory Points is the winner.

name: Arm's Length
description:
Cards
52, ranking AKQJ1098765432 in each suit.

Deal
Deal each player 13 cards, one at a time and face down.

Object
In each round one member of each partnership aims to win as many tricks as possible and the other as few as possible. The difference between the numbers of tricks they win is their 'arm's length'.

Play
After examining their cards two partners agree which of them will take the high road and which the low. The player at dealer's left leads to the first trick. There is no trump suit until someone can't follow suit to the card led. Whatever they then discard to that trick establishes trumps for the rest of the round.

Any card may be led to a trick, but the rules of following are 'forcing'. This means that you must seek to win the trick if you can (even if, as the low player, you don’t want to).

The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led or by the highest trump if any are played, and the winner of each trick leads to the next.

Score
At end of play each partnership scores 10 times their arm's length plus the number taken by the high player.

name: Mel
description:
Back in 1994, in a demonstration which took place in Belgium, the sentence “If the bee disappeared off the face of the Earth, man would only have four years left to live” was exclaimed.
In Mel, you’re the queen bee and your purpose is to collect nectar and produce honey with the help of your swarm. Will you get your swarm of bees to feed you and your larvae for the good of the ecosystem?

The goal of the game is to be the queen bee with more nectar or honey points at the end of the game.

When it’s your turn, you have two options:

-Place one of your bees on the central flower crown (or the beehive) of the game board and move it compulsorily. The movement has to be either vertical or horizontal and has to reach the furthest clear flower crown or beehive of the chosen direction; it’s forbidden to jump over another bee.

-Move one of the bees which is already present on the game board. The possible movements are the ones stated in the previous step.

In either case, when your turn is over, the central flower crown (or beehive) can never be occupied. Now, it’s the turn of the queen bee situated on your left.

The game can end because of two different situations:

- When there are no bees left to play. When a queen bee places her last bee, the game ends for her, but the rest must go on.

-To cause a Mel: when you place a bee in the center of the game board, and you can’t move it anymore.

In that case, you need to add up the obtained nectar (or honey) points and the player with the highest score is proclaimed the winner. In case of a tie, the player who has a bigger group wins. if the tie continues, the player who has the second bigger group wins, and so on and so forth.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Movement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Zone of Control

name: Color Brain Go
description: Color Brain Go provides 200 questions across the color palette. It can be played independently, but also works as an expansion to the basic game Color Brain with up to 6 teams.

name: Quick & Tactic
description: Roll five coloured dice and two white dice to cross out values in a five coloured columns, in a game very much like Qwixx.

name: Moustache Gracias
description:
Welcome to the Loteria Mexicano: a real tradition in Mexico! Choose your character and bet on the number of tricks you plan to win. Try to aim right because if you lose, you remove as many clothes as the gap between your bet and the folds won! Bluff and audacity are your key words. The first one who ends up naked... lost!

-description from publisher's website

The game lasts for 6 rounds. In each round, players bid for the number of tricks they can win. The sum of bidding cannot equal to the number of cards dealt that round. The first round has 5 cards, then 4, 3, 2, 1, 1. In a trick, players must play a card higher than the previous one or fold. At the end of a round, if players cannot match their bid, they have to close cloth cards (7 at the start of game). At the end, the player with most clothes wins the game.

-user summary

name: Black Stories: Tsokos
description:
A Black Stories Edition with new stories from forensic pathologist Prof. Dr. Tsokos.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game

name: Mójate el Potito
description:
Mójate el Potito is a party/filler card game composed of 2 card types: Questions and Challenges. In each turn the players will draw a question cards, read it out loud and count down from 3. Once the count is over, everybody will point with their fingers to the person in the group who is the answer of the question (for example, "The aliens arrives looking for intelligent life. Who they would not take with them?"). With over 120 cards and 3 optional mini-expansions (included), will provide lots of fun and laughter.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Mójate el Potito es un juego de cartas para disfrutar y cagarse de la risa con tus «amigos» respondiendo preguntas que a más de alguno lo hará sudar la gota gorda.

Mójate el Potito tiene castigos para él o los ganadores del juego. Supéralos y disfruta de este juego perfecto para tus fiestas, juntas y carretes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Pirate Blast!: Battle for Monkey Island
description:
Ready to play like a pirate? In this exciting fast paced card game, you are the pirate. Throw cannonballs at your friends ships. There are monkeys, parrots, coconuts and more to help you become the ruler of the seas. Pirate Blast is fun for all ages. See if you AARRGH the craftiest pirate and claim Monkey Island.

Using the cards you draw, sink your friends ships while trying to keep your ship afloat. Have the least damaged ship when everyone runs out of cards to win! Game contains enough cards for four ships. Each player gets 19 supply cards that includes monkeys, dolphins, cannon balls, bananas, coconuts, rum bottles and an octopus.

name: Cat & Co.
description:
In Cat & Co., you're worried more about the company than the cat, trying to keep track of everyone you see at the animal party.

Each player starts with a set of twelve animal cards in hand. On a turn, a player shakes the ten animal dice in the box, lifts the lid for a brief time, then covers the dice once again. Starting with the dice shaker, players place one card from their hand into a row, trying to play cards to match which animals have shown up at the party. If you can't remember or don't think your cards match the dice, you can pass.

Once all players have passed, remove the lid once again and place dice one by one on the cards in order. If a player played a card that doesn't match a die, they receive a cat token worth -1 points. All cards that match the dice are removed from the game; all cards that collected cat tokens are returned to the hands of the appropriate players.

Keep playing rounds until someone has no cards left in hand or someone has collected at least three cat tokens. Each card left in hand is worth -1 point, and whoever has the best score wins.

name: Empire of Swords
description:
The fate of the empire hangs in the balance. You are the final champion. Grab your sword and prepare for battle. It has come to this. Centuries of war have brought death and destruction upon the people of the empire. Warriors from the every clan have ravaged the once beautiful landscape, in an effort to bring their masters closer to complete domination. It is only now that all sides have reached a stalemate. The only remaining solution is a duel of champions. With their glowing swords of power, the fabled blade masters have been summoned to one final contest to determine not only the fate of your clan,but the future of the empire of swords.

Set up the game by shuffling the 18 cards and dealing 7 to each player. Gameplay consists of each player playing a card from their hand face down, then simultaneously revealing. Thrust beats slash, slash beats chop, chop beats thrust. If your card beats the opponents card, you land a HIT. Parry blocks any of those. A successful hit after a Parry lands two HITs. There is also an unlockable strike card that cannot be stopped.

The game ends when either or both players run out of cards or someone receives 5 hits. The one to run out of cards or the one to have received 5 hits loses. If both players run out of cards and neither player has received 5 hits, the player that landed the most hits wins the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Corrosion: Man vs. Meeple Engineer Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Suit: Gray
Grade: 4
Action: Produce 1 small/medium gear, 1 chrome gear, and 1 special point

name: Fishing Lessons: Weather
description:
The difference between sun and storms is all the difference when fishing. Better check the forecast before you get out on the water!

This 5-card expansion for Fishing Lessons introduces Weather cards. On any turn in which you replace a card in the Lesson Row from your hand, draw a Weather card and follow its specific placement rules. Each of the 5 unique cards adds a twist to your fishing trip: altered movement, flipped fish, and more!


When a player elects to replace a lesson card in Step 1, they draw a weather card. The weather card is drawn after the lesson card is placed, and is read and activated before Step 2 is resolved. Each weather card is different and has a unique effect on it.

Example card: Sun - The warm water drives some fish deeper. Select a type of fish, and flip all of the cards with that fish face-down.Ignore this effect if all lake cards are face-down already.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Programmed Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Holdout
description:
In the Near Future...

The global catastrophe wiped out billions of lives, leaving only pockets of the heartiest survivors struggling to create a new life among the ashes. After many trials, you have found a favorable spot to set up your new home in the heart of the unforgiving wasteland. Using the remains of an old roadside structure, you manage to build a makeshift room that will provide protection from the harsh elements. In order to survive here longer than a few days, however, you will need to find a means of collecting water and food, expanding your settlement, and maybe even finding other survivors willing to join your new community. With a little ingenuity and a lot of luck, you see a glimpse of hope - until a band of roving raiders enters your settlement and threatens your life. This settlement is your last hope, and you therefore give it an appropriate name: HOLDOUT.

Holdout is a roll-and-write resource management game in which you must grow your wasteland settlement and achieve certain objectives by the end of 7 game rounds. You must carefully manage water, food, shelter, community, ingenuity, and defense, the latter being important for repelling attacking raiders at the end of each round. You will also encounter wanderers in the wasteland, who will offer their skills in return for your help. Survive until the end and meet the scenario objectives to win the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, City Building, Civilization, Dice, Economic, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Random Production, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Shiner
description:
Shiner utilizes stylized art deco illustrations to immerse you into the world of 1929's moonshining under world.

Players draft, steal, and swap their cards around the table to try and build the best 5 card moonshining operation possible, or grab the feds to turn rat and raid your opponents. The first player to score 50 points across the rounds wins the game.

This 18 card game has 15 unique cards falling into 5 categories.
Mash is used to set your base score. Cooks multiply the score. Federal Agents reduce the value. Muscle counters Federal Agents. Transport cards have no direct use but can be combined with cards of other categories to complete Raids or Special Operation hands.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection

name: Potato Carrot Tomato
description:
Get ready to till the soil and sow the seeds of success! In our new single player tile laying game, you will become a master farmer, harvesting crops for the most points possible. Carrots, tomatoes, and potatoes are the crops of choice, and your goal is to cultivate the most fertile fields and maximizing your harvest. With easy to learn gameplay this game will challenge you, test your skills, and bring out the farmer in you! So grab your tools, get ready to get your hands dirty, and become the top farmer in the land.

—description from the designer

Pick up a random tile from the face down pile and place it down. Try to connect and chain the crop types so that you can get a higher market value for that crop. From the beginning, only one of the crops values are shown and later in the game after you scored 10 points the other two's values are revealed.

name: Monstrio
description:
Halloween is in full swing! Laura and Mike decide to explore the haunted manor in search of the monsters' sweets, but not all the monsters have sweets and if they come across the same monster three times they lose their entire haul.
In this stick-or-twist game, the players have to know when to take risks – but not too many – to win.

—description from the publisher

name: Punch 'em All
description:
Contestants, wrap your hands and put on your gloves! Everything is prepared and the round-one bell rings. The crowd is full of excitement and expects nothing less than your strongest punches! Are you ready to become the best fighter in the ring?

In this set-collection game, players will battle each other, comparing the strength of their fighters' punches! The player with the strongest team will add the fighter cards to their Hall of Fame. Then, both teams will be replaced with new cards. These blow-for-blow battles will continue until someone lands the winning punch by fulfilling one of the win conditions. This will immediately end the game, granting that player the champion's title!

—description from the publisher

name: Triversi
description:
Triversi is a three-player version of Reversi (Tri-riversi). Similar to the traditional two-player Reversi, you flip the opponent's pieces by sandwiching them with your own color pieces. However, unlike the traditional Reversi with black and white pieces, this version uses red, blue, and yellow pieces. This introduces the thrill of not always gaining points when flipping pieces. Players have the option to place a piece face-down. It is a strategic abstract game.

—description from the publisher

name: Имаджинариум: Персефона (Imaginarium: Persephone)
description: Персефона ("Persephone") is an addition to the Imaginarium that will help you take your mind off the usual maps and make the game even more diverse and interesting. References to famous books and literary works, recognizable characters and pictures with a philosophical plot - all this is here.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Turczi Junior Promo Pack
description:
A collection of eight promos for a selection of David Turczi games. This promo pack was originally offered through a campaign on Gamefound to celebrate the birth of David Turczi's first child, and featured seven new baby-themed promos and one reprint.

1. Tekhenu: Obelisk of the Sun – Warmth of a Cat mini-expansion
2. Perseverance: Firstborn Adventures Promo and Tramping to School promo cards
3. Imperium: Progeny Promo Pack
4. Voidfall: Stellar Nursery
5. Vengeance: Roll & Fight – Baby Boss Promo Card
6. Venice: Nursery Promo Tile
7. Trickerion: The Secret Workshop
8. Tawantinsuyu: Children of the Inca

name: 猩猩相惜 (Orangutan Love)
description:
In the melon field
A group of orangutans were fighting over who was the wisest gorilla in the world
At that moment, the orangutans pulled out a little green box...
It's a never-ending conversation starter
It's also a friendship detector that tests tacit understanding
It's a thought-provoking thought experiment.
And a philosophical debate.
It can get you caught up in the glories and bleaknesses of human nature
Or it can make you obsessed with digging up other people's secrets.
It's ....

name: Battleship Royale
description:
Many will sink. One will survive. Face off with up to 6 players and compete to be the last afloat in the Battleship Royale game! In this exciting party game take on the beloved Battleship search-and-find game, all players share one Battle Grid to mark hits and misses. Instead of placing physical ships, they're dealt Ship cards that reveal their fleet and where their ships live on the grid. The cards slip into handheld Command, so players can secretly track hits. Roll the die to fire to fire on opponents. The last one with a ship left on the grid wins! Ready to level up? Play in Advanced Mode and create an elite fleet with the addition of submarines, which can share coordinates with ships and have ship-detecting Sonar capabilities! The Battleship Royale gameboard stores easily and has built-in trays for pegs. It's a thrilling game for Family Game Night and makes a fun gift for kids ages 8 and up!

BATTLESHIP PARTY GAME FOR GROUPS: The Battleship Royale game is the first-ever Battleship game that lets players face off with up to 6 opponents! Who will be the last afloat to win?
SHARE THE BATTLE GRID: Inspired by classic Battleship search and find gameplay, this fun family game features 1 shared Battle Grid: players track ship locations by marking hits and misses on it together
SECRETLY TRACK HITS: Each player is dealt Ship cards revealing their ships' locations on the grid using coordinates. The cards slide into handheld Command Centers that let players secretly track hits
MANY WILL SINK, ONE WILL SURVIVE: Roll the die for the number and location of shots on the grid, and fire! Mark a hit or miss with a peg (or two). The last player with a ship left standing wins
LEVEL UP WITH AN ELITE FLEET: Amp up the strategy in Advanced Mode with the addition of submarines, which can share coordinates with ships and have ship-detecting Sonar capabilities

—description from the publisher

name: Eis am Ziel
description: Little penguins love ice cream too. Today they’re all excited because Eddi’s ice cream truck is stopping by at the South Pole again. Which team of penguins is the quickest to hop over the icebergs from the penguin school to the ice cream truck? With a bit of luck and tactical skill, it might be you! But watch out! Sometimes a penguin plops into the water and has to start all over again.

name: Gewimmel im Dschungel
description:
Discover the jungle and find rare flowers. But mind those who contain an well hidden animal.
Who will find the most correct cards and gathers those in his basket?

In this game, players will go through their deck of 20 cards, to find a certain flower and gather those in their basket. The player who finishes first, ends the round and the other player need to stop - even though, they are not through their entire deck.

The player who found the most cards with that flower, wins the round - as long, as you do not have a wrong card in your basket.

From the second round on, you will search another flower and add an animal, which must not be on the cards.

The first player to win two rounds, will win the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Erkundet die Tiefen des Dschungels, um die seltensten Pflanzen zu finden. Aber Vorsicht! Haltet euch unbedingt von den Tieren fern, die sich im Dickicht verstecken. Wer sammelt die meisten Pflanzen, ohne die Tiere zu stören?

Ein Wimmelbild-Spiel voller Fallen: Im Kinderspiel Gewimmel im Dschungel begebt ihr euch auf eine 20-minütige Dschungeltour, um die Tier- und Pflanzenwelt im Dickicht zu entdecken. Hierbei ist Eile geboten, denn ihr alle deckt gleichzeitig die Karten eures Dschungelstapels auf und versucht blitzschnell zu erkennen, ob sich die von den Aufgaben geforderten Tiere und Pflanzen darauf verstecken. Wer am schnellsten die richtigen Pflanzen sammelt und die Tiere dabei nicht stört, gewinnt!

Gewimmel im Dschungel bringt rasanten Spielspaß auf den Tisch, der euch immer wieder neue Herausforderungen bietet. Bei einer Partie bleibt es nie!

—description from the publisher

name: Monster Hide and Seek
description:
Get ready to play hide and seek with monsters — but they won't just stay where they were. They will appear here and there in the blink of an eye, so you might need to use candies to attract them and catch them!

Monster Hide and Seek is a memory game that uses double-sided monster cards to trick your memory. On your turn, flip any two monster cards. If the flip sides match, you win the cards. If they don't, simply put them down WITHOUT flipping them back. Do you remember what's on the other side of these two cards? Don't let your memory fail you!

name: Bohei
description:
Bohei is a dynamic party game for 3 to 8 players aged 12 and up.
Packed in a compact box are 110 cards and rules to navigate the chaos the game is filled with.
The game includes Action Cards with unpredictable twists, Challenge Cards testing skills, and Rule Cards for unique gameplay.
The objective is to collect seven cards, but navigating the chaos of "Bohei" turns this seemingly easy task into a wild and laughter-filled adventure. Perfect for breaking the ice and creating memorable gaming experiences with friends or family.

—user summary

Bohei – brich das Eis & stürze ins Chaos!

Das ultimative Partyspiel für 3 bis 8 Personen ab 12 Jahren.

Willkommen in der chaotischen Welt von "Bohei"! Ein Kartenspiel, das sich weigert, vorhersehbar zu sein. Treffpunkt: Zwischen Lachanfällen und Augenrollen. Egal, ob du mit deiner alten Clique, der verrückten Tante oder frisch gebackenen Freunden zockst, "Bohei" lässt das Eis nicht nur brechen, es pulverisiert es!

In dieser kompakten Box verbirgt sich ein Feuerwerk an 110 Karten, das deinen Spieleabend ins Unermessliche katapultiert. Dazu gibt’s eine Regelablage, weil – nun ja – Chaos braucht auch ein wenig Struktur, nicht wahr? Drei verschiedene Kartenarten sorgen für jede Menge Abwechslung:

Die "Aktionskarten"? Denk dir eine Party mit Überraschungsgästen, die einfach so vor deiner Tür stehen – so fühlen sich diese Karten an. Je nachdem, wer gerade Jeans trägt oder wer einen süßen Hund daheim hat, muss entsprechend der Kartenvorgabe Karten ziehen oder abwerfen.

Die "Challenges"? Ein Wettkampfplatz für Showoffs! Wer kann länger einen Ton pfeifen, ohne blau anzulaufen? Und wer wirft die Spielkarten wie ein wahrer Olympionike? Wer gewinnt wird mit zusätzlichen Karten belohnt oder darf überflüssige Karten abwerfen.

Aber dann die "Regelkarten". Das Sahnehäubchen auf dem "Bohei"-Dessert. Mal sprichst du wie ein Neandertaler ohne Verben, mal musst du mit hochgezogenen Schultern spielen bis der Nacken krampft. Vorsicht: Lachmuskelkater vorprogrammiert!

Dein Ziel im Auge behalten? Sieben Karten sammeln. Klingt easy, oder? Aber wenn du dich einmal im Strudel von "Bohei" befindest, wird aus "easy" ganz schnell ein wilder Ritt!

—description from the publisher

name: B-17 Solitaire
description:
Prepare to face the infamous German Luftwaffe Messerschmitt 109s and relentless German Flak as you head towards your target in B-17 Solitaire. Command an American B-17 Flying Fortress bomber during the 1942-44 bombing campaigns of World War II.

Your B-17 missions will take you to various locations in Europe during the war, from the skies of France to the heart of Germany. Your plane and crew will face bad weather, chance circumstances, Axis air defenses, and fighter planes determined to stop your bombing missions. The Axis forces are an autonomous artificial intelligence (AI) BOT player. The goal is to earn victory points from successful bombing runs and downed enemy fighters, all while keeping your crew safe.
The Axis forces have stacked the deck against you. Still, success and survival can be achieved with careful planning, good flying, and keeping the target in sight. Good luck!

To play the B-17 Solitaire Bookgame, you will need to provide a pen and at least one six sided die, we recommend two. Each set of Map and Plane pages have 3 different missions, with 30 unique missions in total. There are two chances to play each mission, in Book 1 and Book 2 which provides a total of 60 missions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 1759: The Siege of Quebec (Second Edition)
description:
1759: Siege of Quebec (Second Edition) is the remake of the first wargame of the "Worthington's Great Sieges" game series. These wargames highlight command decisions for players against a solitaire game engine opponent. They have been designed for easy set up and quick game play. Game unit placement is shown on the game board and units are wooden markers representing troop and ship formations. The game was developed for solitaire play and players can play as either the French or the British against the solitaire player game engine. There is also a two player version of the game. Both sides require you to make great decisions based on good strategy, keep your wits about you when orders do not turn out well, and press on to victory.

Any time one side's morale reaches zero during a turn, the other side wins the game.
Also, the French win if they hold out until the British Navy departs.
And the British can win by taking Quebec.

Highlights of 1759: Siege of Quebec (2nd Edition):

New art style to the game board and cards
New rules and game pieces for artillery
New white French/red British/brown Indian pieces
Updated rules

name: Fourhanded Checkers
description:
Uses 9 instead of 12 checkers for up to 4 players, either in teams or individually. Has 4 pots (1,2,3 & 4) for first king, first double jump, first triple jump and winner.

This is an interesting 4-player variant. The 4 pots add to the interest if filled with something of value or even titles, i.e. "King of the World". Quick and unpredictable game with the four players coming from all sides.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Star Players Card Pack
description:
A splendid deck of 24 cards covering all the Star Players from Death Zone Seasons 1 & 2, as well as the Blood Bowl boxed game – this is a treat for all sports fans. Each reference card features handsome (well… mostly handsome) artwork, along with the player’s name, race, statline, skills and a list of the teams they’re willing to play for. For a price (which is also listed on the card, handily!)

The Players:

Barik Farblast
Bo Gallanté
Eldril Sidewinder
Glart Smashrip
Griff Oberwald
Grim Ironjaw
Guffle Pusmaw
Hakflem Skuttlespike
Helmut Wulf
Horkon Heartripper
Jordell Freshbreeze
Karla Von Kill
Kreek Rustgouger
Mighty Zug
Morg 'n' Thorg
Madcap Miggz
Prince Moranion
Ripper Bolgrot
Roxanna Darknail
Scrappa Sorehead
Lucien Swift
Valen Swift
Varag Ghoul-Chewer
Willow Rosebark

-Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Shoot
description: French hex and counter game of soccer simulation. Includes several teams and a pretty big playing field. Every player has his own stats printed on the counter. Low complexity. Counter and playing field quality are about the same quality as most Steve Jacksson games.

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Orient Express & Disoriented Express
description:
Special preorder-only maps that are challenging in new ways.

Orient Express is the classic European channel between Paris and Istanbul, where moving passengers quickly and effectively is your goal. On the other hand, Disoriented Express will have you scratching your head trying to undo the knots created by foreign, yet familiar landscapes. ​

These two maps are available ONLY as part of the Spiel 2011 AoS/Steam map pack from Bézier Games.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Witch & Bitch
description:
Witch & Bitch is a board game in which each player plays a witch, in order to save the world from the threat described in the chosen scenario or to determine who is the most "bitch" in a ruthless battle to the last spell. Satire and magic, in the new game by Immanuel Casto, illustrated by Marco Albiero.

Witches will have 7 schools of magic available: Fire, Ice, Thunder, Kinetics, Light, Darkness and Seduction. For each school there are 6 spells, for a total of 42 spells to combine to make each game different.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Tierisch bedroht
description:
The players are animal rights activists, who have the goal to save as many endangered animals from extinction. Only when they work together on strategies and skillfully utilize the available resources, they succeed to retake the habitat of the animals. Animal welfare is teamwork!

The cards represent the threatend species from three different habitats (green: land, blue: water, orange: air).
There are 5-6 (depending on the number of players) animals laying face down in the middle of the table, so every player can see the habitat, but not the needs of the animal (like "2 air and 1 money").
Now the players have to choose a "strategic card", which gives one player a special move (like switching a card on the table, or looking at a card).
After that, the players have to play ressources from their hand face down on an animal of their choice. When each player has played their card (now communication allowed at that point), the animals and ressources are revealed and all animals, where the ressources match the needs are saved.

name: Target! Bearing 093 degrees!
description:
Target! Bearing 093 degrees! Is a solitaire card based game, where you take control of a submarine trying to sink the maximum tonnage of enemy shipping before you run out of ammunition and fuel.

You play a card to the board to reveal the target ship and decide if you wish to get closer. Play another card to determine the escort defence level, and decide if you want to attack. Choose how to attack and play another card to see the attack outcome. A final card play determines the cost of escaping from the targets escort.

You track fuel, torpedoes, gun ammunition and tonnage of ships sunk.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Something Is Missing
description:
Something Is Missing is a picture book written and illustrated in Taiwan that has now been adapted into a memory dexterity game. This game not only provides you with the book's images faithfully represented, but also brings you back to experience Taiwan's rich traditional culture.

Through the game, players are invited to carefully appraise the images, and the one to first successfully recall the missing object scores. Through this lighthearted 3-7 player game, everyone can experience both fun and nostalgia for the past.

name: Santa's Sleigh Ride
description:
The object Santa's Sleigh Ride is to race other "Santas" throughout the world, stopping at highly populated cities along the way to deliver gifts. The first player to arrive back at the North Pole wins the game. But, watch out! Your journey along the Candy Cane Path will be filled with a few twists and turns.

This fun, fast-paced and educational game will provide a great way for your family to come together at the holidays or any time of year.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hush 'N Rush
description:
The forest animals were playing outside and did not notice when evening fell. Now they have to return home, but a wolf somehow fell asleep on the path. How can they get past without being noticed?

Every player has a group of three animals to safely pass the wolf and return home.

Each player rolls the die and must take one of his animals and move as many steps as are shown on the die. Choose with caution, because each animal can only hide from the wolf behind a bush of his shape or behind a stump.

If the player rolls the die to show the eye symbol, the wolf is waking up! All animals that are not behind a stump or a bush of their shape are frightened away, run back to the start, and have to begin again.

The game ends when one of the players succeeds in returning home with all three animals.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Desyllas Games, Gigamic, Granna, Keller & Mayer, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, LOGIS, Ludolux

name: Geek Out! TableTop Limited Edition
description:
Geek Out! is the outrageous game that finds out once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite pop culture subjects!

In the game, you will draw cards asking you to list things which fall under a certain category. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!), by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to “out-geek” their friends. Will you Geek Out!™ over comic books, fantasy, games, science fiction and more?

You don’t have to be a geek (but it helps!) to win this amazing social interaction and bluffing party game of geek lists!

The Geek Out! TableTop edition takes the game to the next level and finds out once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite geeky pop culture subjects!

This Limited Edition includes a bonus deck with additional lists.

name: LEGO X-Pod PlayOff
description:
Play 1 of 4 LEGO X-Pod models (Yellow/Red/Green/Blue) and construct a team of special units from set plans to deploy in head to head combat against those of your opponents. Move your units across a 9x6 grid game board with various obstacles to score in your opponents home row. The first player to score 3 units wins the game.

Each X-Pod has unique strategies and abilities: The yellow Aero Pod has many flying and Jumping units, which allow it to navigate the board very easily. The Red Wild Pod has a wide variety of units and abilities, including the special EAT action, which allows its unit to destroy a weak enemy unit and repair itself simultaneously. The Green Robo Pod has very slow units, but it is very good at disassembling and destroying opposing units. Finally, The Blue Auto Pod. This pod has the fastest units in the game, allowing them to score quickly.

An additional X-Pod is included in the Game Pack. This black pod is a recolor of the Robo pod, and is included as a special edition pod.

In 2005, Lego released 4 more pods. A lime green pod with a Dragon theme, an orange pod with an Arachnid theme, a purple pod with a Monster theme, and finally a light blue pod with an aquatic life theme. Although these pods are not included in this or any other Game Pack, they can be used to play the game, using downloadable cards and boards available on Lego.com.

The five individual pods included in this pack are available individually under the names stated above, however they will not include any X-Pod Playoff game content, such as cards. If purchased individually, the cards, boards, rules and Inventory sheets must be acquired off of Lego.com
mechanics: Grid Movement, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Hachi-Hachi
description:
Hachi-Hachi (means 88) is the elegant culture of Japanese Cardgames. Not even from its Hanafuda deck, but also from materials (like cake tickets, Dharma tiles, war-fan, monthly track plate and small baskets), you will discover its uniqueness and grace.

Game system is very similar to fishing games like Casino, or Scopa, but only Japanese Hanafuda (and Korean Hwatu) includes turning a card from draw pile at your turn. And sometimes, splendid combination of taken cards becomes big score. These rules make the game more thrilling and brilliant. Hand combos are a bit complex but the basic is easy. Soon, you can learn them from charts. Because these hand combos have handicap points, you can select to play even with such a weak hands. In this case, turning a card becomes more thrilling.

After seen your hand, if you decided no chance to win, you can drop from the round like Poker. But you must pay dropping fee to the pot (winner of the round get the pot). This system may teach players self control.

It is convenient game for playing with 3 to 7 players. Active players are always 3 (or 2). Thus voluntary or not, other players should drop (If you have to drop involuntary, you can get compensation). Its playing style is loose paced, you shall feel the time of gentle (but hot hearted).

MOVIE : https://youtu.be/PW-_zUlbtzs
publishers: (Public Domain), Japon Brand, Man-indo, Nintendo Co., Ltd.

name: Peaky Blinders: Faster than Truth
description:
Step into the lawless streets of 1920s Birmingham, where lies travel faster than the truth. In this competitive card game for 3-6 players, can you bluff and trick your way to the top?
To get the upper hand and gain enough influence to beat your rivals, you’ll need to play your cards close to your chest. Your resource cards, that is. Win by collecting five of one type without your opponents catching on. Money, muscle, prestige—which resource will be the key to your success?
Intrigue cards can be used to sabotage your rivals, help you gain resources, or even steal those resources from right from under your opponent's nose. Keep an eye on your opponent's resource stash, and pick your moment to play your cards right.
When playing an intrigue card, you can either play it safe and tell the truth, or gamble on a lie.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Universal Fighting System: ShadoWar
description:
In a history that never was, the greatest empires of Earth's past stand at the apex of their glory. In Rome, gladiators do battle in the Circus Maximus. The Pharaohs of the Nile raise great pyramid monuments to their own mortality. China builds its Forbidden City, and in India a young prince sits under a pipal tree and finds Enlightenment. In the north, the furious Vikings launch their long ships for another season of plunder and pillage, and beyond the Great Wall the Mongol clans gaze at the great Empires with greedy eyes. But behind the opulence and grandeur of the empires, beneath the petty border conflicts and barbaric raids, rages a hidden, secret war… the ShadoWar.

Keepers of a forgotten truth, the Order of the Celestial Dawn devote themselves to bringing Enlightenment to all mankind. They are opposed by the Covenant of Twilight, a secret organization bent on using their power to rule all the empires of man. With guile, wisdom, treachery, and stealth they fight in the shadows for the destiny of humanity, turning the course of history towards their own ends.

Throughout this land of mystery and wonder walk men and women possessed of supernatural power and ability. With bodies and minds honed by constant practice, these warriors are the forefront of the ShadoWar.

ShadoWar is a Customizable Card Game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Four Blind Mice
description:
Introduction:

Four Blind Mice are loose inside a cheese factory, but these furry little fellows need your help! Find the shortest route for each mouse to claim his rightful piece of cheese and win the game! The fame, glory and fortune of a million mice is in your reach.

Objective:

Each player must determine the shortest possible route to get the currently selected mouse to the appropriate chunk of cheese. The player who finds the shortest route, collects the cheese as his reward! The player with the most cheese at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Consensus Music Edition
description:
Description from BoardgameNews

Consensus Music Edition uses the same game play as the other Consensus titles released by Mindlogic: Ten things are laid out on the gameboard – song titles in this case of this game – then players are presented with a category, such as "Song most likely to be on Bill Clinton's iPod," and secretly choose one thing that they think best represents the category. If you match someone else's answer, you scoot ahead on the path to victory. All things chosen by a player, whether matched or not, are removed from the gameboard and replaced with new cards. The first player to reach the end of the path wins.

name: Dice Trip: Belgium
description: Dice Trip: Belgium is most likely akin to Dice Trip: Switzerland, but with a few twists.

name: Yomi: Panda vs G.Panda
description:
Yomi is a fighting game in card form in which physical dexterity is replaced by hand management skills. Just like in a fighting game, you have to know your character, know the matchup, and know your opponent. Each character has a deck that follows the same conventions as a deck of playing cards. This makes it easy to learn the contents of your deck: numbered cards are normal moves, face cards are special moves, and aces are super moves.

Yomi: Panda vs G.Panda — which can be played as a standalone game or as an expansion for either the first or the second editions of Yomi — features two kinds of panda decks, one inspired by the bluffing in the game Pandante.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Bananadrama
description:
Bananadrama is a simple party/dexterity game where players balance banana playing pieces on their bodies.

At the beginning of a turn, a player draws a card. This card will either tell you where to hang a banana on your body, or to perform a certain type of action. During either of these, if a banana is dropped, it is returned to the banana draw pile. If you can perform an action (from the action card) without dropping the banana, you get to hang another banana where you wish.

The first person to successfully hang 10 bananas is the winner!

name: Who is Lu?
description:
Who is Lu is an intriguing guessing game for 3-8 players with curious minds, wit and imagination. Whether the group knows each other or not, they're getting to know.

In each round only one person knows who is Lu: All other try with the given questions to find out who of themselves is Lu.

If you have a guess, you can put on a bet on a person. The earlier you bet you can choose amongst the best betting cards. Who bets later, has more information but probably also less points.

After each round of questions the mystery is solved by the player who knows. Each players pawn now moves forward (or backward when guessing wrong) on the board.

Content

121 question cards
64 player cards
8 betting cards
3 reveal cards
1 game board
8 characters
1 set of instructions

name: Woodlands
description:
War has broken out in the otherwise peaceful Woodlands. Raccoons are attacking Skunks. Even the Squirrels and Foxes are invading the Badger's burrow. To insure their survival, players must choose their loyalties wisely.



Aim of the GameThe aim of Woodlands is to influence the war in your favour, and align yourself with the right Clans at the game's end. This is a done using a hand of 7 Warrior Cards. As the game progresses, players will shift their loyalties to suit their agenda. But only at the end will their final allegiances be revealed.

Players collect 1 Loyalty Cube for each successful attack or defence between their chosen clans. The player with the most Loyalty Cubes wins the game.



Gameplay OverviewOn their turn players will be placing 1 or more cards from their hand, next to a chosen Burrow. These represent Warriors preparing to attack or defend a Burrow. Players will then draw back an equal number of cards from any of the 5 Burrows. This continues in a clockwise manner, until 2 of the 5 Burrows have been emptied of Warriors (there are no cards left to draw).

Once the war has ended (2 of the 5 burrows have been emptied of warriors), the most loyal players score points for their chosen clan's successes. Each player's loyalty is determined by the 7 cards in their hand. The player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Totem Zen
description: Game of skill: The box filled with wooden beads is placed on the center of the table. A challenge card is taken which indicates the totem to be realized with the beads. As quick as possible and all together, the players rush forwards to pick the beads using their wands! Once all the pieces are recovered, they hurry to build the totem with their hands. The first player who is successful wins the card and records his score. At 20 points the game is won!

name: My Story: Designer Promo Cards
description: A set of three promo cards given out at Spiel 2017, depicting the designer of the game. One additional life story, one extra Occupation, and one extra Project.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Turn Order: Time Track

name: 9-Card Circus
description:
The circus is a nasty business. There are people to pay, animals to take care of, messes to clean, accidents to fix... and that's before you've even put on the show!

9-Card Circus is an in-hand resource management game for 1 player. Over the course of 4 years, you will work to make the best circus you can by rotating, flipping, and re-arranging cards. If you're careless, however, you'll be forced to start over from scratch, as your reckless management draws public ire and government regulations.

Every decision has consequences, and you'll need to think multiple turns ahead to ensure success. With deep, interesting mechanics, a lack of reliance on memory, and a small footprint, 9-Card Circus is a game you can take and play anywhere.

9-Card Circus also has a series of campaign challenges, which each modify a rule of the game and force you to change your strategy in order to succeed.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fairy of Perfume
description:
Once a year in the land of fairies, there is a competition to decide who is the best perfumer in the country.
You, a human being, have been invited as a special guest.
The goal is to create a perfume that will captivate the fragrant fairies.
Come enjoy the annual festival with us!

On your turn you can perform 2 of 5 actions:
- buy one new gem, when you buy a gem you place it on your board, not in your bottle!

Each gem means something else:
Yellow gets you 1 coin
Green gives you 1 Fairy point
Red gives your neighbours a black coal
White gives you 2 Fairy points
Blue gives you 3 coins
Purple does nothing but scores 6 points at the end of the game

- place all your gems on your player board in your bottle
- shake gems from your bottle. You have a minimum value of gems to take out (bottom left on your player board) and a maximum. If you ever take out more gems than your maximum, you need to take a black coal and place it into your bottle immediately! If you empty your bottle, you need to place 2 coals in your bottle immediately. Black coals are bad, as they score -2 points at the end of the game.
