- discard one gem from your player board (meaning from the ones you shook out of the bottle or ones that you bought, can also be black)
- activate an ability or end game scoring card. I just mentioned you have a maximum and minimum amount of gems you need to shake from your bottle, indicated by the cubes your your player board. You can increase either of the values by taking the cubes and placing them on either an ability or goal card. However, doing this costs you X Fairy points.

Abilities can be: you can buy an extra gem, discard an extra gem, if you take out an odd number of gems you get a coin, an even number gives you a point, or when you shake out a green gem you get a point.
Goals can be a specific set of gem colours, no gems of a specific colour, most or least gems or coins. There are 10 different goal cards in total, so enough variety.

When the purple gems are all bought, the game is over! Score points for the objectives with your marker on them, the points you gained throughout the game, purple gems and deduct points for the black coals.

By the way, you can also call the help of the fairies, meaning you can spend X fairy points to perform an extra action on your turn.

There is also a B side to the player board, about 12 different goals and different player powers, which means enough variety and interesting choices.
mechanics: Contracts, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Tightrope: A Balance & Blocking Strategy Game
description:
Players will flip for Tightrope, the simple yet intense strategy board game that is sure to entertain kids and adults alike! Take turns placing marbles on rubber bands that sway and bounce, adding to the suspense of this exciting family board game. But be careful, if you don't find a fair spot for your marbles, they may fall off the tightrope and right back into your pile. Win by having the least amount of marbles in this fun and educational game that builds decision-making skills and improves hand-eye coordination. Enjoy this family board game with the kids or bring it out for game night with friends. This strategy board game is a thrilling addition to your collection of board games for adults and families!

—description from the publisher

name: Hexagone
description:
Hexagone is an accessible abstract strategy game for 1-4 players. Claim the most Hexagones to win the game. Compete against your friends to make the most connections, or play solo to discover your inner grand master.

Build the block, roll the dice, connect the colours and claim the Hexagones.

On your turn you have 2 rolls of the dice. The colours rolled dictate which Hexagones you can move. To move a Hexagone simply swap it with an adjacent piece of any colour. Connect 3 or more matching coloured pieces to claim them. If you roll a double, you get to swap a piece of that colour with any piece on the block.

The board evolves with each roll of the dice, make sure your victory pile grows too!

—description from the publisher

name: Sideboards
description:
Each player in Sideboards creates an eight-card sideboard, then sees how they fare against everyone else.

In more detail, the deck contains sideboard cards that each feature five differently-colored drawers on top of one another, with drawer handles of three types. On a turn, everyone plays simultaneously, choosing and playing a card from their hand, passing their remaining cards clockwise, then drawing a new card. After everyone has played eight cards, you tally your score.

What are you scoring? Three task cards are in play each game from a deck of thirty. One task challenges you to arrange drawer colors in a particular pattern. Another forces you to consider the arrangement and type of handles. The third lets you score for creating rows of color or handles.

Sideboards includes a solo mode in which you compete against yourself for a high score.

name: Res Publica: 2230AD – New Horizons
description:
Res Publica: 2230AD is expanded through the New Horizons. 5 new planets with different missions in order to increase the replay-ability of the game.

Stradus II: An earth-like planet with an unusually large axial tilt causing extreme seasonal changes. Both the northern and southern hemispheres experience harsh winters, with cold nights that can last for weeks or months at a time depending on latitude.

Loorte: A habitable planet with a pleasant climate, homeworld of the Loort species. The Loorts are a friendly species with a simple agrarian society and limited scientific knowledge. While they are not capable of spaceflight (and seem to have no interest in leaving their world) they nevertheless interact with other species.

Khone: A large terrestrial planet with high gravity. The curious thing about this planet is that life has evolved on a miniature scale.

Cenai: An extremely hot planet with high levels of CO2, sulphur dioxide, and carbon monoxide in the atmosphere. The planet was probably once like earth, but runaway global warming has turned it into a barren wasteland.

Alura Prime: An earth-like planet with a breathable atmosphere. One large continent stretches from the north pole to the south pole, dividing the planet's large ocean in two. The super-continent is home to a species of intelligent but primitive frog-like creatures.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game

name: Magikon
description:
Magikon is a simple Role Playing Game published in Italian + French only by International Team in 1984.
The guide to encounters includes 22 different kind of people with illustrations made by Mauro Moretti.
The background: Every 1000 years, the shadow master organizes a competition between magician-knights to chose who will succeed to him as governor of the Magikon castle and the surrounding region.
The players will explore the roads around the castle to find monsters, traps and villages. Every player has the same kind of background, so the team working is not necessary and usually, each player explores different areas.

name: Oddball Aeronauts: Snowtide Event Cards
description:
Snowtide Event Cards is a mini-expansion for Oddball Aeronauts and/or for Oddball Aeronauts 2, which contains 5 cards. It was added as a funding reward to all backers of the Oddball Aeronauts 2: Double the Trouble Kickstarter campaign in 2014. The 5 cards are: Mermaids, Gift Ficklers, Icemordbergs, the Snowfather, and the Snow Maker.

From the Kickstarter page:
"Swaying and spinning their way down to this Kickstarter through the myriad flakes of snow, the Gift Ficklers have brought 5 Snowtide Event Cards (one including the Snowfather himself!)."

name: Dry Bones
description:
Dry Bones Adventurer
-The Card Game-

The dusk is falling slowly as you are visiting the last nomadic town and its ruins. Amongst the old sands of the Thar desert’s heart, your guides mount the deras - tents of a small, improvised camp. Under the starry night, around the fire, sipping a chai and recovering strength accompanied by the rhythm of Nangara, you listen to the ancestral song from tribal traditions with which the old stories begin. It is in that moment when you hear this story:

"An old legend says that in the time of the Chaldeans..."

Is a card based game where you play as a traveler in the desert, trying to solve the mistery of the Yejez.Qe'l and the dry bones to revive them.

You will have to deal with storms, collect items, turn seals,
open portals, complete misions and many more.

Beat Death! Conjure!
Conjure the Spirit of the four winds!

GAMES OF LIFE

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Educational, Exploration, Music, Travel
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: El tesoro de San Borondón
description:
El Tesoro de San Borondón is a family game for 2-8 players. In this adventure, an expedition of explorers will arrive in balloon to the mythical eighth island of the Canary Islands to find a fabulous treasure. The terrain is dangerous and the objects that can be carried are few, so all the players have to work together to be able to advance, find the treasure and return to the balloon.

The game consists of a board made of 49 reversible tiles and 10 tiles that form the treasure map, so that each game will be completely different. In addition, 12 inventory items and two decks of cards will make this journey a true survival adventure. As if this were not enough, a volcano in the middle of the island threatens to cover it all with lava, so the search will have to be against the clock.

In every round, players will make a movement (up to 3 tiles), reveal an event card and make an action (resolve the event with objects from the inventory, help another player, etc). The last phase of the round is to place a new lava tile.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Movement Points, Tile Placement

name: Robin Hund
description:
In Robin Hund, a circular track is laid out using tiles. Two robber cards are placed openly in the middle. A stack of treasure cards is put at the side. Each player gets a dog-meeple and places it on the castle tile.

The active player picks up the two robber cards in the middle and either keeps them or gives them to one or two other player(s). A card may be kept only if the player doesn't have this card yet. (There are five different robber cards.) When the active player gives a card to another player and that player keeps it (i.e. doesn't have it yet), he or she may move his/her dog as many tiles as the number of cards the receiving player holds. If the receiving player has the card already, however, s/he shows it, discards one of the two and the active player's turn ends.

When a player has five different cards in his or her hands, he or she can draw a treasure card. If a dog moves around the track and reaches the castle again, the owner also draws a treasure card. The first player with either five treasure cards or 10 gold coins shown on treasure cards is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Medieval, Memory, Novel-based

name: Deity
description:
Deity is a 2 player game that is designed to played in about 10 minutes.

Each player is a rival deity that is trying to gain followers to establish superiority. Will you gain followers peacefully or cast a plague on your opponent’s followers? With only 4 tiles composing the entire contents of the game, Deity can be played just about anywhere.

Deity is a submission to Mike Barlow’s (Reprint on the geek) contest to develop a print and play game using only 4 pieces.

Enjoy.

name: Fuzzi, Heinz und Schlendrian
description:
One of the recommended games for the Spiel des Jahres 1983, the theme features ferrying passengers via trains to their appropriate stations. The game shares some characteristics with Ludo/Parcheesi, except with two moving tracks and cards instead of dice.
A variation using a color die instead of the ticket cards is: Stop the Train !
In 2020 the game experienced it's reincarnation with LAMA Express published by Piatnik.

Roughly translated from Jurgen Herz's description on the Spiel des Jahres site:
http://www.spiel-des-jahres.com/spiel/1983/fuzzi.html
On a small round track made from plastic rails, run two trains, each with five cars. Each player receives four passengers - colored wood pieces - who must be brought to their destination station. A passenger can only board a railroad car if the vacant car is directly before their entering space. Once a passenger is on their way, it may happen that the railroad car stops at a changeover station. Then the passenger must leave and wait for the next free railroad car to come by. The movement of the trains is determined by small colored cards, which are drawn from a deck. Since one can choose which of the two trains one moves, here begins the tactical possibilities of this game, which lift it above the mass of simple dice games for children.

name: Miss Bernard is a Wild Card: My Weird School – The Game
description:
In My Weird School, players collect cards to build a crazy five-card sentence on their boards where the first two words rhyme. After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Welcome to Ella Mentry School, the weirdest elementary school in the history of the world. Things just got even weirder with the arrival of Miss Bernard, a new teacher encouraging kids to say whatever they want... about the other teachers! And that is just what you’ll do in this sentence-building game that proves school can be serious fun and certifiably weird!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Novel-based, Word Game

name: Ringel-Rangel
description:
The gameboard is completely made of wood and shows a garden with six colored rings. In addition three branches can be put into prefabricated holes in those rings. The playing pieces are made of wood and are shaped like turtles. Multi colored balls that have one round ring on them are used. Each player decides at the beginning which ball color they will play. Afterwards one mixes the balls still hidden, and distributes them evenly on the gameboard. They are now uncovered. Then the turtles are mixed and put in two separate piles beside the playing field. On ones turn, one selects one of the two turtles from the piles and puts that turtle on the edge of playing field on a colored starting point. From there it must be pushed with a finger onto the colored ring. Only if the turtle achieves its goal, the course of the player ends and the next player takes a turn. , it must traps of animals or balls of the board the player actually take and keep. With balls in opposing color one must additionally take another turtle of the same color off of the field. These Each turtles and extra balls count as one point of punishment at the end of the game. If one succeeds in pushing he ball error free through the gameboard, one may put another ball on to the playing field.

If all 24 turtles from the pile arrives at the end of the playing field, the game is finished. Winner is the one who possesses the fewest punishment points.

Comment: Ringel Rangel is a very beautiful game to play. It teaches children about the dangers of nuclear chain reaction releases. It helps children learn about planning ahead.

Ages 4 and up

name: Famous Monsters
description:
From Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": Humans enter young Dr. Frankenstein's castle in an attempt to rescue Elsa from an assorted group of monsters. All are represented by metal figures that can be decorated with supplied paints.

A player takes the side of either the humans storming Frankenstein's Castle or the monsters inside. The human player's goal is to rescue Elsa, the fiancee of Karl the Hero. Karl is joined by Dr. Van Helsing, a police inspector, the burgermeister and a handful of villagers. The monster player's goal is of course to prevent them from doing so, by killing them or driving them off. Dracula and Frankenstein's Monster, along with respective brides join the Wolfman in defending the castle. Dr. Frankenstein and Ygor are conflicted occasionally switching from one side to the other, depending on the whims of fate.

Contents:
15 metal miniatures (~25mm)
10 paints, including primer and matte coat
11x17 manila gameboard
Rules (4 pages)
Paint guide and character data (4 pages)
Paintbrush
2 six-sided dice

name: Cuba: Region Occidental (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: The Cuban map for Ticket to Ride comes in a lengthier format, similar to that of the Italian map. It is 2 pages high and 4 pages wide. The board layout contains several long routes. Although several routes pass through water, the map works on the original Ticket to Ride rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Stuka Leader Exp #6: What If...?
description:
Includes 3 new campaigns, 4 new targets, 4 new aircraft, 3 new bandits, 2 new bombers and 1 new events.

What if the amazing weapons the Germans had on the drawing boards actually flew?
Fly aircraft like:
E-555 Amerika Bomber. Long range bomber
Ar-234 Jet powered light bomber
Ho-299 Jet powered Batwing Fighter
Ta-183 Precursor to the Mig-15

name: Star Trek: Discovery – Black Alert
description:
The ultimate weapon of the U.S.S. Discovery isn't its phasers or torpedos, but rather its unique propulsion system: the spore drive. Now the Discovery has accidentally slipped into the mirror universe where the previous I.S.S. Discovery has been destroyed. Several members of the I.S.S. Charon would like to capture the Discovery to use it for their own aims.

In Star Trek: Discovery – Black Alert, players divide into teams, and each team represents key members of either the U.S.S. Discovery or I.S.S. Charon crew. Players take turns activating locations on their ship, navigating through the network, and attempting to accomplish missions. One crew is trying to return home, while the other wants to capture their ship. Which team will emerge victorious?

— description from the publisher

In Star Trek: Discovery - Black Alert, the U.S.S. Discovery has slipped into a mirror universe and now they are being pursued by the I.S.S. Charon. This is a team vs. team game where two crews are trying complete missions. The crews will finish these missions by activating locations on their respective ships and navigating their ships across the mirror universe's board. The goal of the U.S.S. Discovery crew is to make it back home safely, and the I.S.S. Charon crew will be seeking to capture the U.S.S. Discovery so they can use the ship's spore drive for their own purposes.

— description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Timeline
description: A "time-travelling" 4-dimensional chess variant played on a grid of 16 miniature chessboards. Each player has 2 rooks and 2 bishops, each in its own warm or cool color. As each piece moves, it literally leaves a paper trail of cardboard chits showing its progress through the game. A piece can be captured at any point on its timeline by landing on a square containing a chit, and any actions taken since then by that piece are reversed. In this way a piece can capture an opposing piece 'earlier' than when that piece captured a friendly piece, thereby returning the friendly piece to the board. The game continues until all four opposing pieces have been captured.

name: Smack-it
description:
From the back:
A fast recognition and reaction game.
The first player to smack their speed disc up to the top wins one point. When you roll the dice and they come up matching...smack it.
Keep score. When you win 5 points you win the game.

name: Tokar's Arcana
description:
From the White Mask Productions website:

Tokar's Arcana is a simple, yet in-depth game of strategy and warfare. For the most part, it plays very similar to Chess. Each player has 8 common units and 8 special units, each with their own unique abilities. The object of the game? To capture the other player's general, of course. However, if you are playing a worthy opponent, this will not be an easy task...

name: Blood Master
description:
Fantasy Warriors fight in an hexed arena. Each character is defined by many hex-tiles, with an action drawn on it plus any information useful to the game (bonus, movement, attack, etc). Each turn each player secretly selects an hex/action to use, then actions are resolved in random order.

Deluxe Edition contains basic game plus Black Fire expansion.

Expanded by:

Black Fire
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sexy Slang
description:
Mechanically similar to Pictionary & Charades, but with risque clue words.

Separate into two teams of roughly equal size. Each teams clue-giver reads the same clue card. Then the clue-givers race to convey the clue to their team without speaking or pantomiming, but only making line drawings on a dry erase board. The first team to correctly say the term earns one point. First team to ten points wins.

Components


500 Sexy Slang cards
Two Sexy Slang Dry-Erase boards
Dry-Erase markers
Sexy Slang Scorepad
Timer


Home Page: http://www.sexyslang.com/
categories: Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Carrier War: the War in the Pacific 1941-1945 – 1944-1946 Expansion Kit
description:
Carrier War is a strategic level simulation in Pacific. The 1944-1946 allows players to complete the war. New rules expand upon those of Carrier War: The War in the Pacific 1941-1945 covering events which occurred late in war. The expansion also includes the British Pacific Fleets.

Contents:

1944-1946 Expansion booklet
400 full color die cut playing pieces
7 play aid cards


Expands:

Carrier War: The War in the Pacific 1941-1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: TriXKick
description: A tactical soccer boardgame without luck element. No dice or card deck. Corner kick, free kick, one-two, four chain, penalty, shot at goal and offside: In soccer there is nearly nothing that cannot be replayed with TriXKick. No luck element can compensate tactical failure. Tactics and strategy are the magic words to win this game.

name: Tumbling Down
description:
Tumbling Down is an abstract-strategy game played on a checker board with 58 pieces in two colors.

Gameplay involves moving stacks of pieces by tumbling them in one direction. Tumbled stacks leave one piece of the stack on top of anything on a square for each square it travels in that direction. The object is to capture your opponent's largest stack.

Online Play

boardspace.net realtime against live opponents or robots
Richard's Play-By-eMail Server (PBEM)

name: TetraTrax
description:
Drop in and win!

"Shape up" strategic thinking skills with TetraTrax. Players slip their puzzle tiles down the rails into the clear tower, and score 1 point for every opposing tile their puzzle tile touches. Watch out, though...you'll lose a point if you leave open spaces in the puzzle. The tension builds as the height of the puzzle grows. Includes game tower with built-in score keeper, 24 game tiles in two colors, and guide. For 2 players.
Grades 1 and up.

name: Carpet Bowls
description: Carpet Bowls is an indoor version of Lawn Bowls. The players take turns rolling their balls such that one of their balls is the closest to the Jack after all the balls have been rolled. Hitting the other player's balls to move them further from the Jack is allowed, along with hitting the Jack itself. The balls are specially weighted so that they will curve to the right or left depending on how you roll them.
publishers: Brooks & Adams Ltd., Loncraine Broxton & Partners Ltd, Townsend Croquet LTD

name: 1099: Domus clari Geminiani
description:
In 1099 started the construction of Duomo di Modena (Modena Cathedral) one of the greatest Italian example of Roman-Gothic architecture.
Strongly acclaimed by citizens the construction was initially committed to the architect Lanfranco and the sculptor Wiligelmo and to the disciples of their schools.
7 years later Saint Geminiano Memorabilia were moved from the old church to the new Cathedral, escorted by 6 miles guard and 12 cives guards to avoid thefts. In the following centuries the Cathedral construction was committed to Anselmo da Campione and his disciples.

The goal of this card game is to retrace the stages of the construction trying to be the one to best contribute.

Players will use materials deck to build up the different part of the cathedral. Between the first and second stage of construction they need also to take part in the Memorabilia movement.

This game wins an international competition held by Comune di Modena in 2008 for designing a game about Duomo di Modena construction

name: Titanium Wars: Bloody Jane
description: Bloody Jane is an additional leader for Titanium Wars. Her homeworld is the Ship-world Lexander, and she bears the standard income, building slots, fleet size, and hand size. Her ability allows her to sabotage a Conquest participant's Unit, of a semi-random type.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: CIRCUS! Viola Volente's Sensational Show
description: In CIRCUS! the players compete to become the new director of the circus. By laying down groups of the same artists applause points are earned. More artists in the act means that the applause will be louder and more points are earned by the player. The player with the most applause points wins the game and the becomes the new director.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Human Barbarian Fire Cult Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Fire Cult Warrior Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Superhero Solitaire
description:
Superhero Solitaire integrates super powers into a mix-and-match multi-deck twist on the classic game of Klondike/Patience. Take on the role of a superhero and choose which villain you will face. Shuffle your deck of 52 cards together and you are ready to play!

Power cards showing your hero give you positive abilities while power cards showing the villain hamper your game play.

Win by playing all cards from your deck (HQ) and tableau (City).

A single deck provides hours of single player enjoyment. However, multiple decks allow players to mix-and-match characters as well as unlocking the ability to play a two-player variant.

One hero can make a difference!

name: Tanks: Achilles Tank Expansion
description:
The Achilles was a British variant of the American M10 tank destroyer armed with the powerful British Ordnance QF 17 pounder anti-tank gun in place of the standard 3" gun. This upgrade allowed the Achilles to face off against all but the heaviest German Panzers.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Achilles tank
1x Achilles tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Mont-à-mots Agent Secret
description:
Your mission: to identify the secret agent and discover the country where he is hiding.

Roll the dice, formulate mathematical equations and get information about the secret agent you're looking for. Filter the information and decode the name of the country where it is hiding.

Secret Agent, from the Mont-à-mots family, promotes learning and developing mental math skills with this suspenseful game where your deduction spirit is strongly sought.

Essentially, each turn, the player rolls 4 dice. If he can formulate a mathematical equation (+ - × ÷) with at least 2 dice to equal one of the numbers on the board, he can look at the related hint. The hint can be the and encoded version name of the country (which can be decoded using a wheel), a clue about the appearance of the person to find or if there is a traitor among the informants. A player win as soon as he guess who among the suspects is the wanted person as well as the country where he is hiding.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Math, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Targeted Clues

name: Zoom Out
description:
In Zoom Out you play as photographers from the planet Barruffus in a trip in the outher space: on these travels, the planet's inhabitants revel in curious Photo ZoomOut photographing all the details of their planet, like super zoom detail of small insects or cities in all the universe. The worst enemy of the photographers is the famous Space Toad, which has developed an answer to this hobby all its own, called the "photobombing".

During the game you have to get rid of all the cards in your hand, always raising with a highest value and paying attention to the cards with the Space Toad, that give the opportunity to the fastest player to get rid of an extra card.

The goal of the game is to get rid of the seven cards that are dealt at the beginning of the game as quickly as possible. A card is flipped over to start the discard pile

Each player on his turn can do one of the following actions:

Discard a card if its value is higher than the top card in the discard pile or if it has the same value and is the first card of equal value (there may never be more than two cards with the same value)

Playing the Photobombing paper, exclaiming the word photobombing loudly. When the card is played all the other players try to get rid of one of their own cards, only the fastest one will get rid of his card. The game will resume from the player after him

Drawing a card if you can not (or do not want to) play, the card can not be played immediately, so you have to wait for the next round.

Play continues until one player is out of cards and they are the winner
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time, Space Exploration

name: Adorable Monsters
description:
Terrifying, maniacal, eight-legged… cuddly?! You’ve always yearned to have the scariest, most powerful pet monster by your side. Now you’re finally ready to achieve your dreams by creating a monster so heinous, just a four-word description will make even the most steadfast of men quake with fear… but you’re not the only one. Competing pet monster creators are working on their own beasts, and aren’t above sabotaging your monster with adorable features or an awkward waddle. Can you overcome their insufferable meddling to craft the most terrifying of monsters? Find out in Adorable Monsters!

Each player is dealt a hand of 7 adjective cards and draws 2 monster cards. Each player selects which monster to use and places that monster face up ion the table. You can only play adjectives that match the colors on your monster card. All players simultaneously make their monsters scarier by placing scary adjective cards on the table next to their monster. Once everyone has played their scary adjectives on their monster, everyone draws back up to 7 adjective cards.

During their turn, a player can challenge any other player to a Scare Off. The scariness of each player's monster is the number of scary adjective cards displayed next to their monster card. The winner of the Scare Off takes the losing player's monster card as a victory point, and does not daw any cards. The loser of the Scare Off draws 2 new monster cards, chooses 1, and draws back up to 10 adjective cards.

The first player to collect 3 victory points (opponents' monster cards) wins the game!

name: Monster Meister
description:
Yellow and three-eyed??? Help!!!

If you bring many of the right monsters into the light of day, you can chase the creepy creatures away from your own front yard. But soon, the monstrous memory aids rush to help the players with weaker memory skills! Monster Meister is a curious memory spectacle in which memory gaps can successfully be closed with more and more new monsters.

Each player has a set of 16 monsters. The cards are shuffled and arranged in a 4x4 cards grid face down. Now a task will be revealed, i.e. face up 6 cards of your choice in your grid. Blue monsters will count 2 points while yellow ones count as -1 point. The player that counts the most points that round will loose one of his face up monster cards, while the player with the least points gets one roaming monster (from a pile) in addition. All monsters are flipped back face down. The next task will be revealed. Task after task you will learn which type of monster hides in which position in your grid. After ten task cards, the player with the least number of own monsters will win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Jungle Runners
description:
Roll three dice and choose whether to move your Elephant, Tiger or Monkey. You must get all three across the finish line before the others to claim the victory in this wild race across the jungle!

—description from the publisher

name: Santa Fe
description:
In Santa Fe, the players — western heroes that they are — aim to take as many tricks as possible during the eleven rounds of the game, in addition to collecting as many points as possible.

Unlike most games, lower-valued cards are worth more as the deck contains fewer of them. The players can challenge each other, as well as the sheriff, to the Mexican standoff. After a duel, only one player is left standing, and this player takes several tricks at the same time. The player who fights a duel at the most appropriate time and collects the largest points — as well as the highest number of special bandit cards — will be the final one standing when the game ends.

—description of publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: As Good As It Gets
description:
As Good As It Gets is a card game created to be the perfect ice-breaker and general get-to-know-you party game for family and friends.

The game is simple. Each player will compete to win points by enticing the judge to pick their good scenario.

But there’s a catch! Each player will also try to sabotage another player’s chances of being picked by the judge by giving each other’s good scenario a bad catch.

The judge must choose which scenario (including the catch!) they would rather most have happen to them.

—description from the designer

name: El Señor Dix
description: El Señor Dix is a card game that invites you to think and associate. It has two decks: one for drawings and the other for qualities. To play with children from 4 years old, and with different levels of difficulty, the drawings must be associated with one or more characteristics to accumulate cards and win the game.

name: Interspace Conference on Earth
description:
ウチューカイギ (Uchu Kaigi) is a trick-taking game from Japan, about an "interspace conference on Earth".

The players are trying to be selected as the ambassador for an alien conference on Earth. By providing entertainment for the delegates from seven different worlds, a player tries to curry favour. But if they give too much to one of the aliens, they will be penalised for favouritism. They will lose points, and their rivals may gain.

The game follows normal trick-taking rules, players following the colour lead. The cards shows an alien and the amount of hospitality the player is offering. Winning the trick gets the player the host spot and the cards go to their tableau.

Rounds end when a player exhausts their hand. The game end when somebody reaches enough points or enough rounds are played. The player with the most points wins.

However, the different alien races trigger effects, either when the card is played or scored. For example, a player might be forced out of a round, or lose points for having too many cards of one alien. This means players have to make more choices than simply playing high cards.
user summary

name: Fluxx: Party Favors
description: 9 Party themed Fluxx cards from Looney Labs to celebrate 20 years of Fluxx-ing things up

name: Foodfighters: the Grains Expansion
description: Another high-carb expansion faction! The Grains faction also includes nine new fighters tiles, three Grains-only power cards, and a sheet of nine thought bubble clingers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Swing State
description:
It's a presidential election and you need to win the Electoral College. Campaign, fundraise, advertise, and win the swing states! SWING STATE is designed around the electoral college and the strategies involved in winning the 12 swing states during a US presidential election. It is super fun, super suspenseful, and the most realistic "game" about running for president you will ever experience.

The game can be played between 2 players. It can also be played between 2 teams, ideally with 2 players for each team. One is the presidential candidate for the red team -- she chooses which states to visit each turn. Her teammate is the campaign manager for the red team -- he chooses where to spend the money on advertising.

The game begins with a map that reflects the way all 12 swing states actually lean. Pennsylvania leans Democratic by 4 percentage points (based on a historical average of recent presidential elections). That 4% point lean is reflected by four blue chips placed on PA during setup. Virginia, as you can see in the image, leans Red by 5% points (chips). As players campaign and advertize in these states, the chip stacks rise and fall and often flip from one color to the other.

A big part of the fun is that Swing State is a game that is easy to learn, easy to set up, and easy to play, but has a very rich mix of strategies that change each time you play. There are seven turns before election night. And what makes this one of the most exciting games you will ever play is that the results of how each state will vote are not revealed until the very end. At the end of the game -- election night -- all of the campaign funds you have invested by playing cards face down on each state are finally revealed.

name: Fisch & Flausch
description: In Fisch & Flausch (Fish & Fluff), you play cats who are hunting for the most amazing toys and the best fish. Over eighteen rounds, you secretly bid with your cards on fish that having varying amounts of desirability. Whoever ends up with the most points wins.

name: Warrior Heroes: Legends
description:
Warrior Heroes Legends is a set of rules for fantasy wargaming. The game can be played with any miniatures the player already owns. The system emphasizes group cohesion, leadership, and interactivity. The traditional turn sequence (move, attack, resolve attacks) is often interrupted by mini-sequences involving quick reactions from the miniatures in play, including those of the non-active player. This ensures that all players are involved in the action at all times.

Warrior Heroes Legends can be played competitively, cooperatively, or solitaire, and includes a detailed campaign system.

From the publisher's website:

LEGENDS AREN’T BORN, THEY’RE MADE.

And in Warrior Heroes – Legends here’s your chance to become one. You start life as an independent sell sword or perhaps an inexperienced caster of magic. But whichever you choose there’s nothing special about you as you start your story. But as the saying goes…

IT’S NOT HOW YOU START BUT HOW YOU FINISH!

In Warrior Heroes – Legends the goal is simple. Gain Fame through your exploits and Fortune through your deeds. Start as a Warrior but finish as a King? It can happen and it’s all up to you. But before you can be King let’s start a little smaller. Like leading a small band of adventurers.

Warrior Heroes - Legends includes:
Multiple character classes and races.
Over sixty Signatures and Skills to personalize your character.
An easy to use Economics System with little book keeping.
Quick and easy Magic rules.
Complete environment to adventure in.
A variety of scenarios and a how to for making more.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Rally Round
description: This game is a simulation of car rallying. It simulates both timed and checkpoint rally conditions. There is a card draft at the beginning of the game, where players select their car's characteristics from those that are still available. This game is pure skill. Routes must be chosen carefully to arrive at the checkpoints on time. Not to early, not too late, as both are penalized. Many factors make this a difficult game to master as every game plays out differently.

name: KOREA 2005: The ROK Goes North
description:
KOREA 2005 The ROK Goes North is an update and expansion for Korea '95 that appeared in CounterAttack magazine #4 in 1992.

Lt. Colonel Henry C. Meyer (Ret) was involved in updates, revisions, and analysis of the Korea '95 game and found that his works were rich enough to render an expansion to the original game. Hence the full production from Just Plain Wargames for his efforts.

Korea 2005 was available as a standalone game (containing Korea '95) or an Expansion set.

This expansion includes:

rules and scenarios booklet (12 pages - 6 scenarios)
20 counters
folio cover (front) / 11 × 17" deployment chart (back)
3 8 1⁄2 × 14" deployment charts
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Wargame
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Pacific Rim Publishing

name: Hippodrome
description:
Hippodrome is a multi-player (works best with 3 to 5 players) "Euro style" mini-sim card game of Roman chariot racing. The emphasis here is on strategy, not on becoming a demolition derby! Includes the biggest map ever published in Panzerschreck (11" x 25") in two parts, rules, with game markers and chariots on cardstock in full-color, which must be cut out prior to play, and you'll need to provide a standard deck of cards. (Yes, there are still whip attacks and ramming!)

Published in Panzerschreck #15.

name: Future Card Buddyfight
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.




Future Card Buddyfight is a Japanese collectible card game from the same creators as CardFight!! Vanguard and Weiß Schwarz. It was released in January 2014 alongside an anime series by the same name. A manga adaptation began circulation in November 2013.

In it, players take turns playing monsters and other cards in an attempt to reduce the opponents life points to 0. Monsters are played in one of three zones—center, right, left. If the center space is empty, that player is vulnerable to attack.

There are five card types: Flags, Items, Monsters, Impacts, and Spells. A player’s deck consists of 52 cards: 1 Buddy (a monster card), 1 Flag—both of which start the game in play—and a main deck of 50 cards which cannot contain more than four copies of any given card.

1 booster box contains 30 booster packs. Each pack contains 5 random cards. The rarities of cards are categorized into Common (C), Uncommon (UC), Rare (R), Double Rare (RR), Triple Rare (RRR), Buddy Rare (BR) and Special Parallel (SP).

name: Monopoly: Bob's Burgers
description: It's Monopoly with a "Bob's Burgers" twist! Same as original Monopoly, with all of the board spaces, cards, and tokens done over in a Bob's Burgers theme. Includes 6 collectible pewter tokens.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: GUATAFAC 'Unos Vicios'
description:
THE SPICIEST VERSION OF GUATAFAC! 480 new cards and very daring tests!

⚡️ SIMPLE RULES: Discover the worst thoughts of players in 8 seconds with this hilarious board game. Win points by answering correctly before your time ends!
The one who's answered more questions correctly in time wins the game :)

PLAY IN 15 TO 45 MIN, from 2 to 15 players and MILLIONS of possible answers. +16 years.

♻️ CARDS PRINTED IN THE EUROPEAN UNION with paper from sustainably managed forests. 1% of the profits are donated to charities. (FEDER, 2021)

—description from the publisher

name: Zooloretto: Tierpark Hagenbeck
description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, given out by Abacus at Spiel 2018 in Essen.
This expansion consists of 1 tile with Hagenbeck Zoo.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player, who fills his 6-space enclosure, takes the tile with the "Tierpark Hagenbeck" as a bonus from the middle of the table, placing it below his zoo board. It remains with this player until the end of game.
Once per game, when the player adds tiles to his zoo, he may put 2 coins at the "Tierpark Hagenbeck" to place an animal tile of a second type in one of his enclosures. From now on, animal tiles of both types may be placed to this enclosure.
Leopards may never be in an enclosure with another animal type!

name: Gunship: Mk II
description:
As the war continues endlessly, many new weapons roll off the factory floors of the Warship Guild!

The Gunship Mk II doesn’t have the classic lines of her predecessor, but she packs a powerful punch! Dual Torpedo Launchers and two Multi-Purpose Weapon Pods give the Mk II a wide variety of explosive ordnance to crack open an enemy Assault Carrier or mercilessly hammer their positions on the ground below.

This accessory for Gunship: First Strike! gives Players access to a new Gunship option. The Mk II looks, customizes, and fights in ways that are different from the standard Gunship included in the core game. When you’re ready for a new experience, the Gunship Mk II makes a great addition to your fleet!

name: Catalyst: Promo Goal Card E
description:
This is the Promo Goal card marked as "E" for the game Catalyst. The game comes with 4 Goal cards marked A through D, and this is the fifth one in the series.

To use it, simply shuffle it together with the Goal cards from the basic game, and select one at random.

The Goal card E awards points in the following ways:

- Blue building: Score 1 VP for each Catalyst card in the color of which you have the most in your Scoring Pile.

- Green building: Score 1 VP for every three Catalyst cards in your Scoring Pile.

- Yellow building: Score 2 VP for each “5” Catalyst card you have in your Scoring Pile.

- Red building: Score 2 VP for each set of “1”+”2”+”3” Catalyst cards in your Scoring Pile (regardless of their color).

name: Loups gris en Atlantique
description:
Loups gris en Atlantique (Grey wolves in Atlantic) is a single player game which simulates German patrols of a U-boot during WWII.

The player is a U-boot commander and his mission is to sink a maximum of allies boats during the beginning of 1941.
He has choice between 4 types of submarines (VII, IX.B, IX.C, IX.D2) with their own specificities and he can personnalize his character and crew with points.

Rules are easy and, like many solitaire games, needs a lot of dice rolls.

name: Scotland Yard Duell: Happy Meal Edition
description: Scotland Yard Duell - Happy Meal Edition is a miniature version of the original "Scotland Yard". This game was distributed as part of the McDondald's Happy Meals Menu.

name: Teamwork: Urlaub
description:
How's this supposed to work again? What happens when a team of two explainers are supposed to describe a concept but can only say the sentences together? But it gets better: the players can't discuss what they want to say ahead of time and must build the sentence while alternating words! A good time is guaranteed because the rest all try to figure out what the concept is at the same time. Who will have the most points?

This set of Team Work "Urlaub" covers the topic vacation.

Expands:

Team Work Original

name: Spurt að leikslokum
description: This game has 1620 questions in 6 categories, no board and no dice. There are four ways to play the game, some of them use a 6x6 table on a paper with a symbol for each category.

name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Babylon"
description:
April 1947. When the Blutkreuz Korps unearthed records of an ancient alien energy source hidden in Mesopotamia, they started working on plans to recover it. Now their plans are coming to fruition.

Operation Babylon thrusts the Neue Deutches Afrikakorps (NDAK), the New German Africa Corps, into Allied territory in central Iraq. Opposing them are the elite 4th Marine Division of the United States Marine Corps and the Spetsnaz special forces of the Sino-Soviet Union (SSU) raid both sides, intent on setting the region ablaze.

Operation Bablyon is a campaign book for Dust Tactics.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Cities of Darkscorch
description:
Cities of Darkscorch is a, decidedly adults-only, fever dream of a game in which players take on the role of ambitious rock bands, traveling from city to city and battling both the other players and a deck full of rival bands for supremacy. If a player can defeat a band in each of 16 cities, they can then move into the center city, and attempt to win one last battle to score a record contract, and win the game.

The band names and logos, printed onto the old-school wooden 45rpm record adapters that are used as the player pawns, the board, and the card art and text combine to portray a world out of the school notebook of some mid-1970's Led Zeppelin loving, Dungeons and Dragons obsessive teenager.

Players take turns moving around the board a number of spaces determined by the roll of a standard die, either fighting a band battle, rolling for movement again, or passing play depending on where they land. Each player holds a hand of five "Fate" cards, which might be one of four kinds of band members that can be played in front of the player, and persist from turn to turn; bonus cards that can help the player in battle; and cards that can be played to penalize other players. During a battle, the player draws a "Foe" card, representing a band they will battle, rolls a four-sided die to determine which band member will battle, and plays Fate cards to boost their chances. The result of the battle is found by rolling a twenty-sided die, plus whatever bonuses from the players own Fate cards, penalties from cards played by other players, versus a score on the Foe card. If the player wins the battle, they collect the "banner" for the city, tracked by each player on a card reminiscent of an auto-bingo card. Play passes around the table until a player collects all 16 of the banners, allowing them to finally enter the center city, "Numenor", and battle one last time in a bid for victory.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: 2259 Edition Psi Corps Starter Kit
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Caster / Eric Summerer & Army of One / Sam Healey
description: A set of two promo cards featuring podcasters Eric Summerer and Sam Healey. These were given out in the 2015 Dice Tower Kickstarter Campaign.

name: Herr der Ringe Mau Mau: Mordor
description:
This game is based on the public domain game "Mau Mau", which is basically the same as "Crazy Eights", but it has some twists: There is always a location card active providing an ongoing special rule (the location will change several times during a game), and the Palantir card is not played to the discard pile, but in front of a player and can be stolen by other players for extra points at the end.

This set can be combined with the Free Peoples set. Or each can be played on their own. The two are not just reskins of each other. They actually have different rules (while sharing the basic Crazy Eights mechanism).

Few minions in film history are as iconic as those from "The Lord of the Rings", and with Herr der Ringe Mau Mau: Mordor Sauron, Saruman, Grima, and a horde of Orcs and Uruk-hai can now settle their differences.

name: Disgruntled Decks: The Army Edition
description:
A Cards Against Humanity style game targeted at veterans and members of the military. The game is composed of 75 OD green Mission Cards and 225 gray Course of Action cards.

From the publisher's website:
Disgruntled Decks is a new card game for military service members and grizzled Veterans who require offensive and inappropriate conversation to function normally. We understand that humor is on the same level as nicotine and caffeine when it comes to Veterans' survival needs.

Disgruntled Decks can be played by itself or integrated with a Cards Against Humanity deck. The Army Edition will be the first deck released because, being Army Vets, that's what we know best.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Looterz: Promo Pack
description:
A promo pack for Looterz give away on convention.

Add 10 new looters (20 cards) to the base game and one new feature

Sleep : a card that sleeps is turned on the side and can't be activated but can still be targeted and sacrified.

At the end of your turn your sleeping card awake (turn up again).

New looterz : Fortune teller, Black Widow, Drummer, Scholar, Ghost, Nanny, Princess, Paladin, Leech, Medusa
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
publishers: BoardM Factory, CMON Global Limited, Cool Mini Or Not

name: Feed Ze Troll
description:
Loot the caves of your opponents by avoiding to take the blow of club which will make you lose all your booty. To help you: Observe, listen and analyze what your opponents are doing ... unless they bluff you!

In each round, one player defends his cave (of 5 levels) from the attacks of the other player who want to loot him. Place your traps on the different tiles of each level and bluff (or not) the other players to try to hit them and keep your booty !!

The other players can try to loot you on different level of your cave with the risk to fall on a trap or stop the loot and secure their booty on a barrel.

After all the players have defended their cave, the player with the most important booty behind his screen win the game.

name: トリ天気 (Trick-Take BIRD & WEATHER)
description:
Stable weather attracts various birds. And the birds call their friends. Everyone is trying to dominate in a corner of a small neighborhood.

"Trick-Take BIRD & WEATHER" is a trick-taking game where the tens digit represents the weather, and the ones digit represents different birds. However, functionally, the cards do not have suits. Players must follow the lead card with a card that shares either the same tens digit or ones digit as the card that was led, if they can. The highest card which followed will win the trick, and the player earns a number of points equal to the lowest ones digit of all cards played.

However, there are certain exceptions when the tens digit is a 1 where the low card may win the trick, and the highest ones digit may be the points awarded. There are additional exceptions when the tens digit of all cards played match, or when the card that would be scored has a 0 in the ones digit.

The game plays over one round (nine tricks), and the player with the highest score wins.

Enjoy a new & strange type trick-taking game.

name: The Grand Tournament
description:
Each year, the Arena of the Elements welcomes the country's greatest martial arts experts for a spectacular and merciless competition. Only one will be declared grand champion at the end of his term and this year, you intend to be the lucky one.
Your whole clan is counting on a victory but, between the traps set by your opponents and the whims of your senile master, the final is still a long way off!

Le Grand Tournoi is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher
publishers: FoxGames, Makaka Editions, Van Ryder Games

name: ROOM: Agus and Monsters
description:
Tada! This is Agus Pianola, a very absent-minded and a bit cheeky boy who should tidy up his room, but he always waits for his mother to remind him of that because he never finds a good moment to do it. And obviously, in a messy room you can lose many things such as: balls, video games, essays... but you can also find others...

What would you do if one day you woke up and you found your room full of monsters?

HOW TO PLAY
The game is played in rounds until all the cards have been played. A different player starts each round!
The starting player decides which category rules (books, clothes or food) and then, each player, in turn order, places 1, 2 or 3 cards facing up on the table.
If you play a character card, you shall think which effect it will have!

When all the players have made their play, the one with the most icons of the ruling category, scores all the cards.

Then it’s the turn of the player on their right and another round starts. And we continue like this until all players run out of cards.

And if a player has no cards left, their turn is skipped and it’s next player’s turn.

WHO WINS?
When there are no cards left, each player will count the monsters drawn on their scored cards (the ones which they won!).

The player with the most monsters is the winner!

In case of a tie, Mr. Flat scores double; if there is still a tie, you shall play again to break the tie!

—description from the designer

name: UNO: Minions – The Rise of Gru
description:
UNO with Minions theme, but with a special rule that let's you strike a pose in the game.

There is a card called the Wild Dumb Fu card. If you play it, the next player in line skips their turn. Instead they have to hold a martial art pose until the next time, their turns comes on. If they move before it's their turn, they have to draw 4 cards. It also is a wild card so when you play it, you can choose the color to resume in play.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Vandrouki: Европа
description:
Each player is a traveller with the unique citizenship. For instance, in order to go to the long journey, Russian citizen need to get internation passport. Belarusian citizen has internation passport by default, but he can visit a little amount of countries without visas.

A board is a map of Europe. The goal of the travellers is to collect as many points as they can for visited countries. And this is not always about countries' quantity.

In the beginning of a game a player gets citizenship (Russia, Belarus, Ukraine or Kazakhstan), 100 euro and three bonus cards. A player puts his meeple on the board in a country of his citizenship.

In a player's turn he can do one of the following actions:
- to visit a new country by bus, by plane or
by hitchhiking. A player moves his meeple to new country on the board. In order to do it he needs to pay corresponding money (price for bus travel or plane travel) or roll a dice (using luck in hitchhiking).
- to earn money by working in a player's current country.
- to make Visa (Schengen Visa or UK Visa). Without Visa it is impossible to visit most countries in the game.
- to make international passport.
Also a player in his turn can play bonus cards.

For visiting new country a player gets a flag of the country and gets corresponding points; then he gets a bonus card.

A game ends when all countries are visited. A player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Income, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of Life: Jurassic Park
description:
Hold onto your butts! A hurricane is closing in and the Park is in danger. In this The Game of Life Jurassic Park Edition board game, players race around Isla Neblar, collecting Dinosaur Eggs and rescuing Park Rangers as the storm advances and dinos escape! Jurassic Park fans will love the nostalgic nod to the film with blockbuster-inspired twists and turns. Move around the island and draw from interactive cards featuring quotes, characters, and iconic objects from the original film. Be careful! Hungry dinos lurk everywhere! Played in 15 rounds, players have 2 ways to escape the island. Who will play it safe and who will risk it all to save more Eggs and Rangers? Escape the island and get 1 point for every Egg token collected and 3 points for every Ranger in the SUV. The player with the most points wins. This family board game is for ages 8+, and it's a fun choice for a family game night.


THE GAME OF LIFE JURASSIC PARK EDITION: Fans can celebrate the nostalgic classic film and favorite movie moments with movie-related details, gaming components, and a dynamic unboxing experience
WILDLY-DIFFERENT GAMEPLAY: Life finds a way! A hurricane is headed to Isla Nublar. In this immersive gaming experience, players collect dinosaur eggs and park rangers, and try to leave the island before the storm hits
GAME-CHANGING DINO TOKENS: Dinosaurs now roam the park! In this fun board game for ages 8 and up, players avoid the dinos and try not to lose eggs and park rangers as they race to escape the island
ESCAPE THE ISLAND TO WIN: For the first time ever, players finish this The Game of Life game in 15 rounds. Those who don't will be stuck on the island with hungry dinosaurs as the hurricane hits
FAMILY BOARD GAME FOR 2-4 PLAYERS: This family-friendly game features perilous blockbuster-inspired twists. It's a great gift for old and new Jurassic Park fans. The game is for adults and kids ages 8+


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric, Racing

name: Time Machine
description:
A roll&write game in which we set the time machine in such a way as to visit the highest scoring historical events. With the help of 2 dice we set the machine's clocks in successive turns and thanks to that we move on the time track. Requires very careful planning of subsequent moves.

We use 2 D6 dice each turn. Using their results we decide how to set the 2 hands of the clock, one result directs one of the hands, the other the next. The result is also compared to the other clocks (whether it is greater, lesser or equal) which can give a point bonus. Next, we move a given number of fields on the time map in such a way as to stop exactly on the field with the historical event which gives a lot of extra points. The game lasts 6 turns after which the player who moved back in time the most while visiting the highest scoring events wins.

-description from designer

name: Corée 1950
description:
Corée 1950 (Korea 1950) is a game simulating the beginning of the Korean war from June 1950 to January 1951.

It contains by 3 scenarios:

Invasion (June 1950)
Counterattack (September 1950)
Intervention (November 1950)


Each turn represents 10 days. One player commands the "communist" forces (North Korea, China, Soviet support); the other player UN forces (South Korea, USA, other UN countries).
Corée 1950 is an operational game in which troops management, supply and reinforcements are as much important as combat resolution.

The game system take the same mechanism from Opération Husky, Sicile 1943 (Vae Victis #101) by adapting the scale and the situation.

Components:

A3 map
108 die cut counters
16 pages booklet with rules and scenarios


Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis website.

Includes one counter (Japanese 75mm cannon) and A4 map (GC) for En Pointe Toujours !: Guadalcanal.


"Special game edition" Vae Victis magazine #107.
Also sold without magazine.

name: Warpath
description:
Warpath is the science fiction combat game and miniatures range from Mantic Games.

The galaxy is burning. The malevolent Corporation is ever expanding its sphere of influence, annexing more and more star systems. Their strategy is to make contact with alien civilizations, dazzle them with a few gifts of techno-bauble and then offer membership ‘as equal partners’ in the Great Galactic Co-prosperity Sphere. In the space of a few years, of course, the governments of those worlds will be changed by bribery, corruption, political intrigue, blackmail, threats and assassination, into puppet-states. They will devote all of their planets’ resources to enriching the Corporation and the few local bureaucrats that ‘run the business’ for it, while their populations plummet into a state of poverty and servitude...

Warpath is a 28mm sci-fi wargame, in which you control teams of soldiers around a wartorn landscape. Warpath follows a new concept for mass battle miniature wargaming -- a game that is both easy to learn and fast to play! With few and simple rules, there is little to get in the way of the fun and slaughter.

This is a challenging game of strategy, where you can pit your wits against your opponent without devoting half of your brain power to remember a plethora of convoluted rules.

And that’s not all, the innovative turn structure allows you to play using a time-keeping tool (like a stopwatch or a chess clock) to time your moves. As the seconds tick away, the pressure and excitement this adds makes Warpath unlike any science fiction wargame you’ve ever played before.

Units are given simple ratings such as'Melee Attack', 'Defence' and 'Nerve' and then augmented with special abilities that characterise the different races that inhabit the universe.

It comes with 8 races struggling for power, as far four have been revealed; the Marauder Orx, the Forge Fathers which are technologically advanced Dwarves, the Human Corporation Marines and Enforcers, and the mysterious rat-like Veer-myn.
categories: Collectible Components, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Armageddon
description:
This is a Japanese fantasy game published by Epoch and its about different pantheons of gods fighting it out for control of the Earth.

Its a 3-6 player territorial conquer type game. There are 150 cards as well to probably make it too much a hassle for me to translate anytime soon. Each player plays a god, and your power increases throughout the game (of course, the other gods' power to destroy your armies increases as well).

name: Corner Center Match
description: There is no "taking turns" in Corner Center Match! All players race to match the corner on their cards to the shape and color on the card in the center of the table. Don't forget to check the back sides of your cards if you get stuck, but be quick!

name: Under the Sea
description:
In the Basic Version, all the players work together in order to match all the animal shapes with the corresponding tile.
The player turns a tile face up showing it to all the other players.
Then, they insert their hand in the bag and search for the shown animal shape without looking into it, just through the touch. When they find the one they think is correct, they then take it out and show it to the other players.
If you managed to match all the animals with their tiles, then you win… Well done!

In the advanced version, the first player then tries to find the tile corresponding to the animal shape among those face down on the table; they then choose a tile and turn it face up.

The player who first manages to match all the animal shapes with
corresponding tile wins. Well done!

name: El Último Hombre
description:
"El Último Hombre" is a card and counter Tactical level board-wargame in which a command of soldiers or partisans work together to face a mission. On their way to the target they must overcome different dangers in the form of soldiers, tanks, etc.

Juego de cartas y fichas en las que un comando de soldados o partisanos trabajan juntos para afrontar una misión. En su camino hacia el objetivo deben superar distintos peligros en forma de soldados, tanques, etc.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Blockers
description:
Blockers is a two-player variant of Chinese Checkers, as players race to move all their pieces from the starting location across the board to their home spaces (that is, the spaces originally occupied by their opponent).

The game is played corner to corner on a 10x10 board, with 15 spaces of each neutral corner not in play, resulting in a 70 space playing area. Pieces advance by moving to an adjacent space or by jumping an adjacent piece. Multiple jumps are allowed, in any combination of a player's own pieces or their opponent's.

Each player has 10 Runners and 3 Blockers. Runners may only advance forward toward their goal, never backward toward their starting location, while Blockers may move in any direction. Blockers may also jump over a contiguous line of pieces in its own colour. Finally, no piece may jump over a Blocker, not even another Blocker.

Success is determined by stringing "jump ladders" along for multiple pieces, and by judicious placement of the Blocker pieces.

name: The Ythri
description:
An early zip-lock bagged sci-fi wargame from Metagaming. It is based upon Poul Anderson's novel The People of the Wind. It simulates the Terran Empire's invasion of the planet Avalon.

It features a separate space combat map and a planetary ground combat map, plus a few rules for interactions between the two.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: King Me! The Toilet
description: The toilet is a special space that players may move a character to, instead of moving him to a higher floor. There can only be one character in the toilet at a time and he can be moved from the toilet to the next higher floor as a normal move. He still counts towards the character limit for his floor and scores only 1 point when the king is elected while he is in the toilet.

name: KO Heroes
description:
In KO Heroes, the five Gameboy-like cartridge cards are laid out in the middle of the playing area. Players take turns flipping over the top card of a deck, with each card showing either a mirror, a potion, or a map printed on the back. The action that players take depends on the target card revealed and what's on top of the deck:


If the top card shows a mirror, slap the card with the same character type as the target.
If the top card shows a potion, slap the ca with the same character color as the target.
If the top card shows a map, slap the card with the same background landscape as the target.


Whoever slaps the proper cartridge card first claims the card just flipped over. After the deck runs out, whoever has collected the most cards wins!

name: Marvel Battleworld Mega Pack
description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos! Battleworld is a revolutionary cooperative, expandable, collectible adventure game featuring dozens of characters from all over the Marvel Universe! Players get to crack open the mysterious Thanostones during the course of play to reveal the mystery character inside for a constant sense of surprise and delight! Mega Packs let you jumpstart your collection with six characters: four starting Heroes (including an exclusive Negative Zone Spider-Man variant) and two more trapped in Thanostones! Choose your favorite hero, and use their unique special abilities. Roll to attack and win three battles to achieve victory!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Unlock!: Les Escape Geeks – Échappez-vous de la Tour Eiffel
description:
Unlock! is a series of escape adventures for up to six players. With one hour on the clock, players work through a deck of sixty cards as a team, searching for clues, combining objects, and solving puzzles. The free Unlock! companion app runs the timer while also providing clues, offering hints, and confirming successes. Once the team has reached a solution and entered the correct code into the app, they will escape and win the game!

Unlock!: Les Escape Geeks – Échappez-vous de la Tour Eiffel ("Escape from the Eiffel Tower") is a level 1 adventure featuring Alex and other characters from the Unlock! novels from author Fabien Clavel and publisher Rageot, but no knowledge of these novels is required to solve this challenge.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pieces as Map, Real-Time, Storytelling

name: Noobs: Das Probespiel
description: A small free Demo Game version for Noobs in Space with two scenarios on 30 cards.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Pot Pourri
description:
Gustav Germ, the famous gourmet critic, is whirling through the city and is once again distributing his coveted gourmet stars. He also visits the restaurant “Oily Oyster” – your chance to put your culinary skills to the test!
But there is a problem: To prepare delicious dishes, there are only three cooking pots available that you have to share with the competition. ... and there’s that annoying pot lid that’s always in the way and prevents you from completing a recipe. Anyone who, despite all the hurdles, prepares their dishes reasonably correctly and receives the most gourmet stars will be personally awarded the golden toque by Gustav Germ.

On your turn, take 1 out of 3 actions.
You can either

Draw 2 new ingredients, or
Draw 2 new recipes, or
Place 1 or 2 ingredients into a pot + move the pot lid!


Pots are placed in the middle of the table and are available for everyone. As soon as one pot is filled with ingredients (amount = 6), everyone has the chance to show one of their recipes and collect points. The more matching ingredients someone has, the more points they get.
Always keep an eye on the displayed menu! You can get even more points if you show the right type of recipe at the right moment.

The game ends after someone has served 6 meals. The player with the most points wins the game!
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Matching, Open Drafting

name: Upwärts!
description:
Upwärts! is a fun dice game where the players can pile the numbers they have rolled into a grid. Depending on the different options to get points (arranging numbers in lines, snakes or bricks) the players have to smartly stack the rolled numbers to win. As an additional challenge, the players can use the optional "event die".

How to play: When it's the players turn, he/she rolls all three dice. All players put down the shown numbers on their notepad and smartly sort them into the grid by letting them "fall" into the rows. Each player decides how to stack the numbers to get the highest possible number of points. The different lines, snakes or bricks have to be made up of the same number, for example, a player could attempt to build a line of number "5" whenever a 5 is rolled in the game.

When the notepad is filled out completely, the players can count the points.

name: Nine Dice Kingdom
description:
Rolling-coloring game set in the Nine-minute Kingdom universe.
Create your own Kingdom by coloring the zones and drawing the symbol in this roll and write type of the game.
The game consists of 18 rounds in which players roll a number of dice. Next they draft the dice results, which will determine what they will draw each round. Dice will determine which fields will be colored, what color should the players use, and which symbol should be drawn.
After the game is finished players check which King's Edicts they managed to fulfil and check the points for a group of icon on a territory. The player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Battle Cry!
description:
Battle Cry! is a man-to-man wargame covering infantry battles on a tactical level between US Marine units and the Imperial Japanese army units. The scale is 10 metres from hexside to hexside and each counter represents a single infantry.

Four maps are provided which simulates the typical terrain found in the Pacific War. The maps include a beach map, jungle map, mixed terrain map and rough terrain map.

Each individual unit will have a performance rating (PR) which requires that a performance check (PC) be made before moving, firing, observing or assaulting.

The advanced game includes armoured fighting vehicles (AFVs), crew-served weapons, anti-tank weapons, mortars, flamethrowers, mines, hidden units and more.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Tactica: An Historical Approach to Ancient Wargaming
description: This rules system is an attempt at producing an historically accurate portrayal of ancient warfare. Attention is paid to how units formed, moved and fought. Several periods and armies are covered including the Greek wars and the Punic wars. The game requires large numbers of figures. Army lists are pre-made and are only marginally customizable. The rules are fairly simple and quick.

name: Elemon
description:
Players are alchemists that collect elemons in order to make potions that grant Alchemy points. The first player that achieves 9 Alchemy points wins the game.

On each turn players will roll the die to activate one of the elemons on the board.

They will then get two action tokens that will allow them to draw elemon cards, play elemon cards, summon gigamons, activate gigamons, make potions and ultimately make the Philosopher's Stone.

Potions and Gigamons grant Alchemy points that will make you win.

name: Heroes of Fairy Tail
description:
Assemble your favorite characters against your rivals to become the greatest heroes of the Kindgom of Fiore!

In Heroes of Fairy Tail, based on the manga written and illustrated by Hiro Mashima, the Fairy Tail guild needs you. Danger is everywhere in the kingdom, and only you can help! Over three rounds, you must recruit heroes by drafting cards and assembling them in the best way possible to use all their abilities and face as many challenges as possible.

Activate actions to fight adversaries, acquire precious advantages, and accomplish quests before the other players to gain prestige. If you have the most points at the end of the game, you will become the greatest heroes of the realm!
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Buró, Don't Panic Games, Gen-X Games, Reflexshop

name: Penny Arcade: The Game – Fruit F***er Prime Boss Promo
description: This promo card set adds one new boss fight with loots to the base game Penny Arcade: The Game - Gamers vs. Evil or Penny Arcade: The Game - Rumble in R'lyeh.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Rails
description:
