Ruta is a game of card drafting and network building, inspired by the popular game Ticket to Ride. A 5x3 grid of cards is used to represent the people and places with which players are trying to establish trade routes. Players take turns drawing cards and playing those cards to claim routes (orthogonal connections between adjacent cards on the map). Tokens are used to mark each player's routes.

Points are awarded for each route that is claimed, and players earn bonus points for their longest continuous route. When one player is out of tokens, the game ends, and the player with the most points wins.

This game requires a Decktet extended deck and 20 tokens in 2 colors (10 of each color). Suit chips may be used.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Bloodlines
description:
It’s an age of kings and kingdoms, heirs and assassinations. You and your opponents are vying for control over the four royal bloodlines. To emerge the victor, you must carefully manage a mismatched court of nobles to create the most prestigious kingdom the world has ever seen.

Bloodlines is a micro game using 20 playing cards and 5 cubes. Each player drafts a hand of cards, each of which has a special ability and a point value that contributes to your influence in that suit's bloodline. Once all cards have been played, the prestige of any lines you control is based on presence of cards of that type in your opponent’s kingdoms.

Each card you play has an associated special ability, and that card remains in your Kingdom as influence in that bloodline. The card abilities are:


Ace (1 Influence): The Assassin may eliminate any unprotected card from the game, including any heirs placed on the card.
10 (2 Influence): The Castle protects all of the played cards in your kingdom from the effects of the Assassin and the Jack.
Jack (3 Influence): The Jack may swap any two unprotected played cards of equal Influence value. You may swap for a lower valued card if swapping from your own kingdom.
Queen (4 Influence): The Queen may produce an heir on any card you have played, including herself and cards in Castles. The heir increases this cards influence in that bloodline by 1.
King (5 Influence): The King has no ability, but he may be played directly into an empty Castle already in your Kingdom.


Full Rules available in the files section below

name: The Salem Conspiracy
description:
It's 1692 and dark magic runs rampant in the New World. A covenant of magic users is plotting to kidnap the members of 4 different merchant families that have been talking a little bit too much to the magistrates in charge of the witch hunt. But this is not an easy task: the practitioners will first have to collect the ingredients for the powerful spells – Lucky Clovers ♣, Bleeding Hearts ♥, Dead Man's Spades ♠ and Powdered Diamonds ♦. Only then they will be able to kidnap the members of the merchant families and bend the authority to their will!

The Salem Conspiracy is a dice drafting game that is played with seven character cards, a standard 52 card deck and four 6-sided dice. At the beginning of the round, players roll the dice, which determines which of the seven character cards that are laid on the table can be used that round. Players take turns assigning the four dice to the different character cards and execute their abilities, which allows them to draw cards, impair their opponent or manipulate the deck or their hands of cards. If players are holding three cards of the same suit, they can choose to discard them at the end of the round and take a J, Q or K of the corresponding suit, provided they have used the specialized character on that round. The first player to get one J, Q or K of every suit under their control wins the game!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Flora
description:
Plants grow, flower and wilt away as they produce seeds for the next year.

Flora is a quick and simple game played through four short seasons. During Winter, the game is set up. During Spring, players add tiles into an empty play area to form an initial group in any shape. During Summer, the group changes and grows as the players add two tiles and take one away each turn. The first gist of the game is that all these three actions must be used on different colours. Finally during Autumn, only one player takes a single tile and the game ends.

The second gist is that at the end of the game, the value of a collected tile is based on the tiles remaining in the group: multiple small, separate areas of the same colour make it valuable, but many of them might vanish or be easily connected into one large area, resulting in lots of negative points. Players also have control over the game's length and Autumn can arrive unexpectedly.

The basic two-player game has no structural hidden elements, it consists only of 11 red tiles, 13 blue tiles and 15 yellow tiles, and the rules are easily adaptable for thematic additions and personal variants.

name: Gunship: Afterburners!
description: Not every score in the Gunship universe is settled on the battlefield. Each season, the best of the best Gunner crews are selected for the Gunship Death Race. This gladiator-style tournament features a deadly obstacle course that must be navigated as the combatants do their very best to destroy each other. Weaving through Asteroids, sprinting through open space and then diving into a Trench on the moon below, each Gunship must find a way to not only be the first to complete laps, but also to survive loads of enemy fire! There can be only one Winner – the victorious crew earns glory and instant fame among warriors and civilians alike. The losing teams get sent back into the war, IF they survive!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Wiseguys
description:
Set in the Golden Age of organized crime, players head rival crime families attempting to gain control of organized crime in the city. In the vein of Citadels, deceive your opponents and deduce their strategy as you gain wealth and respect in your rise to power. Plot and alter your own strategy as the game unfolds and as fortunes change hands quickly and unexpectedly.

Each round, players select characters through a secret draft. After all players have selected a character, they take their turns in order depending on the character they have chosen.

In the first part of each player's turn, they will use their character's tactic to their advantage to either earn cash, to take cash from their opponents, or to derail their opponent's progress in some way. Each character has his own unique tactic. As the game progresses, bluffing and deduction become increasingly important to gain an advantage over your opponents.

In the second part of the player's turn, each will have a choice of three different illegal operations to perform, and may perform any one of the three before ending their turn.

The first player to reach the required level of respect wins the game.

name: Zombory
description:
A card-game about the Zombie apocalypse.

The game features 30 card pairs each consisting of a human and his or her zombie version. While the cards can be used for playing a classic memo-game, it also offers three unique zombie-themed game modes of increasing complexity, which can be played seperately or as a campaign:

1. Outbreak: Like in the classic game, the goal is to find as many pairs as possible. However, when it's his or her turn, the player turns over cards for as long as the cards are of the same type (i.e. human or zombie). Only when a differing card type is upturned the round ends.

2. Survivor: Find as many human survivors as possible and keep them alive until the end of the game.

3. Exodus: In the final mode the players have to guide their team of humans across zombie infested terrain, find more survivors and get out before the military nukes the entire area.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Zombies

name: Стань супер-злодеем
description:
Have you ever dreamt of becoming the Supervillain? Well, it's easier than it seems. All you need is a personal planet, several billions of faithful yet simple-minded minions (preferably small-sized and green-skinned) and a dozen of cunning plans. Or two dozens for your own piece of mind. Who are your archrivals? No superheroes I assure you as they are just mythic figures from graphic novels. So, you should beware your competitors, other villains who are eager to add the prefix super to their proud title.

Today becoming the Supervillain is even simpler than ever! A new boardgame by Right Games and Anton Lozovskiy provides you with everything you need for this fascinating activity. But for opponents — I assume every self-respecting villain must have some.

Become Supervillain is a boardgame for two—five players aged 12+. While competing for the title of the principal anti-hero, players spend their minions to complete secret projects, spin vicious intrigues and shatter opponents' plans with meteorites. You must be first to collect secret projects valued 5,000 points to win the game. Besides, the game can end earlier if all plan cards have been drawn. Then a player with overall maximum points becomes the Supervillain.

There're two types of cards: plans (they are also secret projects and meteorites) and intrigues (they are also minions). Before the game starts, cards are shuffled into two separate decks and each player draws two intrigues. At turn's start, the active player draws a card from each deck, puts the intrigue in his/her hand and decides what to do with the plan card either by playing it face-up as a plan or face-down as a meteorite. To complete plans you need minions: as soon as the total value of minions on one of your plans become equal or exceed its cost, it becomes the secret project and yields victory points. Often it also gives you special abilities. If you don't want to handle some plan, you may turn it into a meteorite and send at somebody as a valuable gift. Then the card is put face-down with the arrow pointing at your victim. The latter has time before your next turn to deal with the flying meteorite (some intrigues allow shooting them down or even redirecting them). If your meteorite has successfully hit the victim, you draw an extra card from the deck and — the most important — destroy a minion on any of his/her plans.

Intrigue cards can also be played in two ways. First — as an intrigue itself, in accordance with its text. Their effects are versatile and cunning as true villain's thoughts: take cards from opponents, charge meteorites, protect yourself, accelerate plans, etc. Second — as a minion, by placing it on your plan (its value is indicated in the upper part of the card). During your turn you may play only one intrigue and one minion or just keep them for some better time.

Become Supervillain is a speedy and funny parody boardgame with simple rules and lively gameplay. It learns not only to be cunning and vicious but also to shatter other villains' plans. Finally, if our world has to face the Supervillain, let it be you and not some thorough scoundrel.

name: Winterstorm: the German Offensive to Relieve Stalingrad, Dec 1942
description:
(from Strategy & Tactics website):

Winterstorm: The German Offensive to Relieve Stalingrad, Dec 1942, covers the December 1942 effort by a scratch German corps to break the Soviet ring around Stalingrad and rescue Sixth Army. The German begin the game on the Aksay River, and must cross the entire map to reach the roads beyond the Myshkova River leading to the Stalingrad pocket. This is the fourth entry of Joseph Miranda's East Front Battles system, which emphasizes the importance of command control. Combat units are battalions of not just infantry and armor, but a variety of supporting weapons. Each unit type has strengths and weaknesses, and all must be coordinated by a headquarters to fight at full power. This game pits German mobility and flexibility against Soviet numbers and combat power.

Originally published in World at War magazine #36 (Jun-Jul 2014).

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 days
Hex: 1.25 miles / 2.0 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Corps

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 9/16" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15

name: Titanium Wars: Mok Tok
description: Mok Tok is an additional leader for Titanium Wars. His homeworld is the Planet Tomacalco, and he bears the standard income, building slots, fleet size, and hand size. His ability rewards you for having lower Technology, by granting compensatory income.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: One-Minute Bulge
description:
One Minute Bulge is an Operational level wargame depicting the Ardennes Campaign that began on December 16, 1944. This is a solitaire challenge with the player representing a group of high-ranking German military commanders like von Rundstedt, Model, Dietrich, and von Manteuffel. The player must strive to achieve a decisive victory by capturing Antwerp while avoid a confrontation with the volatile Fuhrer.

Playing time is approximately one minute. Counters depict the seven armies that participated in the campaign... Patton's 3rd Army, the 6th Panzer Army, etc. Map scale is about 75 miles to the hex. The single turn represents about two or three weeks of action. Rules include surprise attack, weather, supply depots, and the dreaded Fuhrer Conference.

This is intended to be a free "Print & Play" game.

name: Moriyamics
description:
User summary:
モリヤミクス (Moriya Mikusu) is a Japanese card game based on the very popular fanfic game series Touhou Project (aka Project Shrine Maiden).

In this game, the objective is to simply get rid of all your cards. In your turn, you can play a card with a higher number than that of the previous player.

Furthermore, cards with the same number can be played together with their sum counted as their number, providing a speedy game experience!

If you play strong card(s) carelessly, another player might take over your strength and turn the tables, so play your hand wisely for victory.

Publisher's summary:

ゲームの目的は自分の手札を出し切ること。わかりやすい！

手札を出すのはとても簡単。前の数字より大きい数字なら出せます。

しかも、同じカードならまとめて合計値で出せるから展開がスピーディ！

ところが、迂闊に大きく出すと他の人に成果を乗っ取られて逆転されてしまうかもしれません。

手札の使い方を上手く計画して勝ち抜きを目指しましょう。

name: Alien Uprising: Cliff/Corner Crash Map Pack
description:
Both the Cliff Crash and the Corner Crash maps provide alternate crash site scenarios for Alien Uprising.

Cliff Crash
The idea behind Cliff Crash is, the right edge of the board acts like a natural shield for the crew of the Pioneer (the crashed space ship); but this is also a curse, as the number of spaces they will have to move to get to debris will be so much farther away!

Corner Crash
Similar to the Cliff Crash, the Pioneer is naturally shielded on the crash site. However, the far corners of the crash site are really difficult for the crew to reach!

Both maps greatly increase the difficulty of the game and should be considered "advanced" scenarios.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Monopoly: Apeldoorn
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Apeldoorn, a city of the Netherlands.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Captain's Wager: Kickstarter Promo Cards
description: Adds a new crew type (Thrifty Engineer) and treasure type (Scrap Metal) to the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Equilibry
description: A game of balance that consists in placing as many parts on the stand as possible without them falling off. Children will improve their motor skills and ability to reason when deciding which pieces they should place on the stand. All pieces are made out of wood and painted in bright colours.

name: Psychiatrist the Game
description:
Psychiatrist the Game is a hilarious new spin on charades! With dramatic scenarios, outrageous personalities, hysterical actions and clever wordplay, Psychiatrist the Game is perfect for families, friends, and anyone in-between! The Psychiatrist must gather as much information as possible from his or her patients in order to diagnose their crazy symptoms.

Psychiatrist the Game is both easy and fun, allowing anyone to play & enjoy it for hours on end! The game starts when the group chooses a Psychiatrist. He or she must then leave the room while the group draws a card.

Each card will list 2 symptoms - as a group, choose the symptom you'd like to play, and call the Psychiatrist back in. Remember, everyone in the group has the same symptom.

The Psychiatrist then asks the group different questions - these questions can be as generic or as detailed as you'd like! Whoever is being asked the question must then respond by blending in the symptom they chose.

Once the Psychiatrist catches on, he or she can diagnose the symptom! If the Psychiatrist guesses the symptom correctly, the round is over, and a new Psychiatrist is chosen to leave the room!

name: Nemesis: The Battle of Abbey Ardenne, June 7 1944
description:
Nemesis: The Battle of Abbey Ardenne, June 7, 1944, The battle of Abbey Ardenne was marked by a level of ferocity and savagery that would be continued for the rest of the war whenever these combatants met. The massacre of Canadian prisoners by the SS, who viewed such measures as rather common-place when they fought on the Eastern Front, was never forgotten or forgiven by the Canadians. The conduct of the fanatical 12th SS Hitlerjugend unit made it very clear what the war on the western front would become, and what the stakes were in this conflict.

Each copy of Nemesis is comprised of the following:

--One 11 by 17 inch hex map with game charts and tables
--52 double-sided, un-mounted counters
--4 pages of rules with designer notes

Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and resolve some game events. A six-sided die is also needed to play the game. A complete game takes about 1.5 to 2 hours to complete. Designed for two players, Nemesis is very interactive, and is also very solitaire friendly. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh with graphics by Bruce Yearian.

A cardset for Nemesis, that replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, is also available. It features appropriate graphics and rules reminders on pertinent cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Shadow Strike: Ninja Combat Game
description:
The 6 Clans of Strike Island were... Bored. Because of the boredom, fighting broke out and chaos ensued. The elders of the clans got so piffed from kissing booboos all the time that they decided to do something about it. They would hold a contest with each clan's best warriors...

In Shadow Strike, you take control of a small group of ninja warriors; trying to be the last ninjas standing on the map. You will fight using each ninja's personal inventory, consisting of Shuriken, Smoke Bombs, and... Candy Bars. Throughout the game you will gain access to better equipment for you ninjas, such as Swords and Grappling Hooks. You will also earn precious action cards that will really screw over your enemies.

Shadow Strike mainly focuses on movement tactics on a hexagon board, as well as dice rolling and "take that" card play. Once only your ninjas are on the board, you win!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Virgin Seas: Red Beard's Booty!
description:
Red Beard's Booty! adds a new layer of strategy and excitement to Virgin Seas. Now instead of each island being worth the set amount indicated on the card, players draw random gems from the bag and seed the island. Players draw a number of gems equal to the number on the island card, and different gems scores in a different way.

Red Beard's Booty! includes a red velvet pouch, 48 acrylic gems (four different colors) and instructions.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Pirates

name: High Concept
description:
The game of guessing, guessing and pitching movies

Most box office successes can be described in a single sentence. A perfectly formulated pitch that makes actors and producers alike drool over the opportunity to work with you. It's that magic sentence this game is about!

In High Concept you score points by guessing which movies are associated with what pitch - and you also get to create your own movie pitches with the help of prewritten pitch cards. Winning requires both trivia knowledge and winning pitch rounds.

name: Ordleg
description:
Ordleg ("Word Play" in English) is a word dice game with game play the same as Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes. On your turn, you roll the 15 letter dice and arrange them into a crossword puzzle structure within the one minute time limit. Your score is based on the value of letters used. The player with the highest cumulative score after 10 rounds wins.

Two dice have one blank side. The game comes with two sheets of blank stickers so that you can cover these blank sides (or any other side of any die) and change the letter distribution to suit your preferred language.

Although the game comes with rules for 20 languages, including Greek and Russian, the game uses only the Latin alphabet. However, it comes with 100 blank stickers, enough to cover the sides of all 15 dice.

name: 8-Bit Mini Mafia/Werewolf
description:
The box includes both games Werewolf & Mafia. Werewolf & Mafia are simple party games for 7+ players. Both games are a masterful creation of bluffing, paranoia, and mob rule. Mafia was created by Dimitry Davidoff in 1986. In 1997 Andrew Plotkin turned the game into werewolf. We love playing both of these games and have published a regular size deck but with the mini deck its even more discrete and portable.

Whats in the Box?

28 Werewolf Game Cards
28 Mafia Game Cards
Size: 1.75" x 1.25" (63mm x 44mm)
Finish: Magic (similar to a deck of Bicycle playing cards)

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Delta Flyer II
description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "Drive" episode Organized Play event. It is a Federation Delta Flyer class ship, and is the successor to the original Delta Flyer.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Dokusaisha wa Tsurai yo
description:
User summary
独裁者はつらいよ (Dokusaisha wa Tsurai yo) is the card game Dictator wa Tsurai yo (in English 'It's tough being a dictator').

Dictator wa Tsurai yo is a card game with a theme of a dictator in old Soviet Union. This games uses nine sets of four identical cards. Your objective is to score points by completing sets of four cards in your hand.

Each turn, you ask another player to give you a specific card. If that player has any, all of them are given to you, otherwise you draw a card from the deck. If you have a set of four cards in your hand, you display them in front of you and score victory points (similar to Old Maid or Go Fish).

A special effect is activated when a set is made. A set of chancellors has may purge a person (remove one displayed card from the game), a set of generals may kidnap a person (steal one displayed card), and so on.

When a player is betrayed by people, that player takes a horseshit token, which counts as negative points.

The highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher summary
旧ソ連の独裁者を題材にしたカードゲームです。
手札を４枚づつ配り、手番プレイヤーは手札に持っている番号を、任意のプレイヤーに持っているか聞きます。
聞かれたプレイヤーは、それを持っていた場合全て引き渡します。持っていなかった場合、聞いたプレイヤーは山札から一枚ドローします。
これを繰り返し、同じ数字が手元に4枚そろったら公開して得点札になります。
公開したタイミングで、各カードの能力が発動します。
カードの能力で得点札を拉致されたプレイヤーには「馬糞トークン」がなすりつけられます。当然得点はマイナスになります。
より多くの得点を得たプレイヤーの勝利です。
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Political

name: Santriviago
description: Santriviago is a trivia game with more than 700 questions about Santiago, Chile's capital city: places, people, history, architecture, streets, myths and facts.

name: HOT 16: A Game of Dope Rhymes
description:
To play HOT 16 A Game of Dope Rhymes, you and your crew each provide a sample line that everyone needs to rhyme with for 1 bar (or line). Everyone writes 4 lines that rhyme - without seeing what anyone else is writing. Then you perform. How serious you are about the performance aspect is up to you. Sometimes the rhymes are silly and the songs are weird - sometimes it all comes together, and sounds like you're ready for the studio.

You perform your cleverly crafted masterpiece in rounds, with each rapper leading for a verse, and the rest following. The rapper who ends the current verse starts the next verse, and so on, until the song is done! Then you get hype!

HOT 16 A Game of Dope Rhymes is an old school rap crew party game. It's interactive, cooperative, and requires no musical talent whatsoever (though if you have some musical talent, it sure doesn't hurt).

name: Numeracy Legends and The Gluttony Dragon
description:
Numeracy Legends and The Gluttony Dragon is a logic thinking and group confrontation game. Players are divided into two teams, the heroes and the boss (Gluttony Dragon), equipped with weapons and armors, defeating one another through speculation of the opponents’ actions.

Three steps to understand how it works:

Step 1. Choose character roles. All players are divided into two teams, the hero team and the Gluttony Dragon. Survive and beat the other team to win the game.

Step 2. Each turn, the dragon player draws two equipment cards, chooses one, and gives the other one to the hero team. After the heroes decide whom to equip, all players secretly choose a combat token and present it together.

Step 3. A calculation is made for the turn by determining the combat type each player chooses along with adjustments of weapons and armor. The team to first defeat all members of the other is the winner.

--
Other games from Numeracy Legends Trilogy:

Numeracy Legends and The Rainbow Unicorn
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/224454/numeracy-legends-...

Numeracy Legends and The Zerda Fox
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/224749/numeracy-legends-...
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Fighting, Math
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: The Europa Incident
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Europa Incident is a science fiction boardgame about the control of the most strategically and economically useful sites in the Main Asteroid Belt of our Solar System by mega-corporations, transnational agencies, and armed organizations. The game uses a partially random hand of card with deckbuilding mechanic through which it is possible to use available resources for infrastructure construction, technological development and conflict management. The Europa Incident mixes typically “managerial” gaming elements to strategic expansion and conquest dynamics enhanced by a chit-pull combat resolution system. Effective expansion of control zones is the key and it must be fast. Fighting, on the other side, can be useful, but it will be the one who first consolidate its own expansion to be more likely to win.
Set 1 features 4 factions: Anglo-Atlantic Alliance, Central Scientific Committee, NeoViridians and ZhangSpace
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Pentaquark: Colliders (Kickstarter edition)
description:
Colliders is a 3-card micro-expansion for Pentaquark that brings a new level of complexity to the game. One of three condition cards are drawn the beginning of the game to aid you in your efforts.

This entry is for the Kickstarter edition, which contains ALICE, ATLAS and LHCb Colliders.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Critical Fumblers In the Dungeon of Intellectual Doom...and the insanity that awaits them!
description:
The dastardly mindflayer, Balzak Rimwrecker, Dreamscarrer from the Nigh Beyond (not Canada), has built a dungeon that only the most adept heroes can conquer.

These are not those guys.

Critical Fumblers is a solitaire, map-making, dungeon crawler that satirizes this genre. It won 3rd place in the 2017 Solo PnP Contest under the "dungeon crawler" category, and 10th place in Best Overall Game.

Since this dead horse has not been beaten enough, I took the lamest and most outrageous monsters from my years of playing D&D (not the gelatinous cube, because that's the most awesome monster!) and combined them with some of our group's more entertaining fumble events to bring you a game about a party of idiots fighting the stupidest monsters ever, all explained in this huge run-on sentence.

In this game, you draw your map, move from room to room, encounter a lame monster, and fight using a dice-placement mechanic. Corner rooms have a slightly different mechanic, and the end game is a sort-of Choose-you-own-adventure storyline. You win by visiting all Corner Rooms and then returning to the center of the map. You lose by running out of light or a party wipe. All of this combined will give you about an hour of a comedy of errors... err, entertainment. Enjoy!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Worker Placement

name: Saga of a Dying World
description:
Take control of one of the colorful characters and do battle with your opponents across a world that's tearing itself apart. Plan your strategy and stick to it as the ground underneath you shifts, or take advantage of another player's sudden move to devastate them with a quick attack. Take your turn, defeat your opponents, and touch the all-powerful Omega-Nova!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Sigurds Danmarkshistorie på spil
description:
Quiz game about the history of Denmark based on Sigurd Barretts books about the history of Denmark.

The players are famous characters from the Danish history, i.e. H.C Andersen or Margrethe the first. The players have to collect six treasures related to their character. The treasures are randomly spread over the board picturing Denmark.

To collect the treasures the players have answer multiple choise questions about the Danish history. There are three difficulties of questions.

name: Bee Happy
description:
The Basic Variant is for 2-year-old kids and is a memory game.
Take 2 sets of “easy” tiles with red and yellow borders and add 4 random tiles with orange borders.
The youngest player starts, then play clockwise. The player takes a random tile from those face down and turns it up:
If you find a tile with just 1 figure, then search for the corresponding bee and “make it fly” taking it up. The turn passes to the next player.
If you find a tile showing all 5 bees... what a pity! Something scared them away and made them fly away! For this turn, you can’t try to make anyone fly.
When you complete an entire line of 6 tiles of the same type compared to those with just one image, you win, well done!

The Advanced Version is for 4-year-old kids. This is a competitive variant.
The youngest player starts and then the others in a clockwise direction.
The active player receives the pile of tiles.
When everyone is ready, the current player says "Happy!" And turns the first tile of the stack quickly, resting it on the table face up so that it is clearly visible to all.
In games with 5 or 6 players, the active player simultaneously turns 2 tiles instead of 1.
All the players try to get to "fly" the bees indicated by tiles turned just taking them and raising them.
The player or players who remain without a bee...
....is forced to take a token web at random which must be kept the secret to their opponents until the end of the game.
Replace all the bee shapes on the board and discard the tiles used. The stack of tiles is then passed to the next player clockwise.
If there are not enough tiles to play a new round, shuffle those already used and discarded earlier.
When just 4 or less web tokens are left, the game ends.
All players turn over their spider web tokens: the player who has collected less spiders wins. In case of a tie, the player who has fewer spider web tokens and in case of further tie there are several winners.

name: Sacculus
description: Sacculus is played on several rounds in which players try to get gems worth 15 or more points using their cards. In each round, four stones are randomly drawn out of the pouch. Both players then pick one of their cards and place it hidden in front of them. They then try to guess which card their opponent played. If they do, the guessed card will not work. Players whose card were not guessed will do what's on their card and can get some points. At the end of the round, all cards are returned to the players and the game continues until a player reaches 15 or more points.
publishers: český skaut, Tiskové a distribuční centrum, z. s.

name: Royal Roundup
description:
The medieval strategy game!

Giddy-up! The castle is under attack! Choose a horse and follow the winding paths to save the price, princess, and precious treasures - each with their own point values. Race along the paths until all of the people and treasures are safe from invaders. The one who rescues the most treasure points wins the game!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Medieval

name: Dark War: Roleplaying in a World Gone Mad
description:
A Simple Game
Dark War uses a simple system, based on a single rule. Anytime you role a 4 or greater you get a success. That success might mean you pump two AK-47 rounds into a werewolf, or that your nurse heals a team member, or a witch gains control of a weak-minded soldier, forcing him to fire on his comrade. What varies are the dice that you use. When building your own character, you assign a fixed number of dice (4 x D4, 3 x D6, 2 x D8) to seven attributes--Shooting, Melee, Speed, Intelligence, Charm, Will, and Dodge-- to determine what type of individual you control. The more dice and the better the dice assigned to an attribute, the greater chance you have or rolling successes. But the customization doesn't end there. You can use experience points to buy Kickers, such as "Rifles," which adds an extra D6 when firing a rifle or "Power of Prayer" that allows a character to heal a teammate within two squares. Two many options? Just choose a group of pre-generated characters from the bestiary, slap them on the provided map, and have at it. Or, if you prefer, you can fight out one of the three, included skirmishes

Obviously attributes such as Charm and Intelligence can be put to great use when roleplaying, but Dark War's unique Action Cards ensure they are relevant even when fighting a quick skirmish. For example, when an opponent activates a character you can slap the Fear Action Card on them, forcing them to pass an Intelligence test or lose all their actions. Other Action Cards can reload a weapon, add a die to melee, or even heal a wound.

When the fighting breaks out, characters determine initiative by rolling a combination of their Speed and Intelligence dice. The total determines when they act (higher is better, obviously) the number of successes determines how many Actions they have. Simple, fluid, and highly interactive.

Many RPGs say "Here are the rules, now go buy your own stuff to play with." Dark War is different. In each game you get the core rule book, 18 Action Cards, a 17" x 22" battle map depicting a West German village, and 70 1" square counters that include Russian and American soldiers, civilians, werewolves, vampires, witches, dead folks, zombies, and more. Better still we include a handful of stands, enabling the counters to functions as standees. It's like having your own set of Dark War minis. Furthermore, the rules include three ready-to-play skirmish scenarios (In the Beginning, Stranger Things, My Enemies' Friend) and a beginning-level, one to two session adventure titled, The Escape, complete with generated characters. When we say "Ready to play," we mean it.

It's a small unit skirmish game, it's a roleplaying game, it's straight-up fighting or weird war combat. It's whatever you make it. It's the Dark War Roleplaying game.

Frequently Asked Questions
Can I play the skirmish game solitaire? Sure, you just have to play each side to the best of your ability.
Can I use my own miniatures? Of course you can. You can use your own minis, terrain you have made, 1" square battle maps that you have bought, or even hex maps. Nothing in the game precludes that. The difference in Dark War and many RPGs is that you aren't REQUIRED to buy that. We give you everything that you need.
categories: Horror, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Square Grid

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Dark Elves
description:
Warhammer: Dark Elves is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dark Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Kamikaze
description:
A battle royal in wich all the crazy things are permitted!

Kamikaze it's a fast and dinamyc card game for two players. The game is a duel where you can use a huge, crazy and variated weapons arsenal like explosives, fire weapons, biological attacks... even you can manipulate the weather conditions or taming wild animals to achieve your evil purposes.

GAME GOAL

Be the first in eliminate the 20 lives of your opponent.

To destroy your adversary take attention to the almost infinite objects combinations that will make each game unpredictable. The combos will raise the damage points, the more cards you use the more lethal attack will be.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: The Road to Bethlehem: Journeys Through Time and Space
description:
The Road to Bethlehem - Journeys Through Time and Space is a family-weight, Christian-themed, RPG-style, cooperative game where players must work together, guided by a GM, to journey through ancient Palestine to arrive in Bethlehem to witness the Nativity and encounter the newborn infant Jesus. Players play as modern day travelers who have been spirited away by the Archangel Gabriel (the GM) to partake of this journey. Players must go through a series of scenarios, drawn randomly, during which they are offered choices by the GM which then dictates what challenges and choices they next face. Players must conserve equipment and, most importantly, time on their journey, while also working to increase their individual attributes of Authority and Reputation. The game uses the REAL System - a mechanic where the players do actual, physical interactive challenges at various points as part of the gameplay, the outcomes of which determine their progress in the game (such as identifying objects moved by the GM in a given room, finding commonplace house items within a certain time limit, or dexterity challenges). Once the players have gone through all 8 scenarios, they arrive at Bethlehem where which ending they've achieved is based on how much time they used on their journey. The GM guides the players using 'The Book of Adventures' which contains step by step instructions for each scenario and narrative text that is read to the players.

The game is geared primarily towards families and can be played by multiple age levels from age 8 and up, but with the caveat that an adult always play as well and serve as the GM. The total campaign with all the scenarios takes 4-6 hours to play, but the game can easily be saved between the scenarios, with each scenario taking roughly 30-60 minutes to complete.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Gates of Tau LLC, Via Lucis s.p.

name: Gadzooks it's the Apocalypse: Roleplaying Renaissance Skirmish Rules at the End of Time
description:
Gadzooks it’s the Apocalypse is a fantasy battle game set in the first half of the seventeenth century, a time of widespread warfare, religious strife and general unrest. It was a time when very bad things were happening and when people saw signs of the end of days and the coming of the Apocalypse. So we thought - that sounds like fun times lets make a game!

Each player in the game will control one character figure and a bunch of dubious looking henchmen. The character will have a detailed profile, a number of skills and qualities that can be improved upon if scenarios are survived and experience is gained. Henchmen are cheap and expendable and there are always plenty more to hire. But players should beware, evil forces are at work at every turn and as their characters grow in power, the temptation to follow the path of evil will be strong. Will characters risk their humanity by gaining sinister new powers or will they take the path of good. All will have to decide as the end time approaches.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing

name: Rolling CUBES ABC
description:
Rolling CUBES ABC is a game that allow you to have fun coming up with long words with the letters you rolled.

The box contains 13 wooden dice of different colours based on the letters and symbols that appear on them. The symbol "=" allow you to copy a letter already present in your word, while "≠" can be used instead of a letter that is not present.

You can play 3 different games (as standalone or as a tournament) and a variant based on YAHTZEE (playable solo). The idea of all 4 games is to throw the 13 dice and make the longest word possible, also trying to score bonuses (using the same letter multiple times for example).

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Match Inducements Card Pack
description:
Inducements! They can be literally game-changing, but how often have you reached the end of the second half and realised you forgot all about an Inducement that you paid hard-earned GP for? This deck of 26 reference cards will help you keep track of them during your games and read the rules without breaking up the action. Plus, you’ll get a handy set of double-sided reference cards to boot!

CONTENTS
– 11 Inducements that can be used by any team: Bloodweiser Keg, Bribes, Extra Team Training, Wandering Apothecaries, Horatio X. Schottenheim, Hireling Sports-Wizard, Frog, Specialist Assistant Coaches, Temp Agency Cheerleaders, Weather Mage & Halfling Master Chef.
– 10 team-specific Inducements: Kari Coldsteel, Fink Da Fixer, Papa Skullbones, Galandril Silverwater, Krot Shockwhisker, Chaos Sorcerer, Druchii Sports Sorceress, Plague Doctor, Horticulturalist of Nurgle & Igor.
– Scatter template / Throw-in template
– Passing chart / Agility table
– Weather table / Weather conditions tracker
– Kick-off table
– Team Card / Match Record

This card pack comes loaded with reference cards for Blood Bowl's many inducements. No more flipping through various Spike journals or Almanacs just to remind yourself what your inducements do. Rules and an FAQ for using inducements are located in the Blood Bowl 2018 Almanac on Page 135.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape in Space
description:
Escape in Space is a cosplay game set in space, with the aim of all the players from the evil aliens to escape to the destination point.
In each turn, roll six original dice to determine one or more eyes, and move your tiles (frames) on the board in a jaunting manner according to the final determined eye movement distance.
Because it depends on the die roll, the luck factor is higher, but there are numerous tricks and system dimension that are scattered across the board.
The level of difficulty is a little higher, but I think you can enjoy it casually.

name: MechAge: Attack of Varanor
description:
Your Mech's trial mission was a success! You even managed to clear a den of Cat Mutants. The Sprawl should sleep soundly tonight.

Just then, a blast rocks the hanger and reports pour in. A Lizard Mutant, bigger than anything ever seen, has emerged from the water and is destroying the city. Swarms of large parasited attack anyone nearby.

Your work today isn't over yet. Fire up the reactor, reload the magazines, and let's see what this Mech can do...

Adventure scenario expansion for MechAge.


The scenario consists in 1 Scenario card and 2 Mech cards:

Rules booklet
Attack of Varanor Scenario card
Power Sword Mech card
Heavy Cannon Mech card


Players are expected to provide their own tokens for this scenario:

1 DEFCON Tracker token
1 Monster Health token
1 Parasite Strength token
1 Population Damage token
1 Property Damage token
2 Unique tokens for Varanor and your Mech



Released in the March 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package, together with MechAge base rules.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Mein erster Lernspielzoo
description: The zoo is in uproar today! The monkeys are acting up, the greedy rhino is devouring everything in sight, and the chameleons are constantly changing color. With ten different games to play, players improve their concentration, their sense of touch, their understanding of quantity and numbers, as well as their recognition of colors and shapes.

name: Gemblo Trio
description: Gemblo Trio is an abstract strategy game with translucent, colored pieces, each of which is made up of one to five hexagons. Each player has an identical set of pieces in a unique color. The goal is to get rid of all of your pieces by placing them on the hexagonal game board. Each piece that you place after the first cannot touch previously-placed pieces of the same color; instead each piece must be a distance of "1" from another piece of the same color, where 1 is the length of a side of one of the small hexagons. Another restriction is that the distance being measured can't directly cross another player's piece, but it can lie at the junction of two pieces. Once all players have placed as many pieces as they can, they count the number of hexagonal units in the pieces they couldn't place, and the player with the lowest score wins.

name: Farmanimo
description:
A GAME OF COOPERATION AND TOUCH RECOGNITION
OBJECT: guide at least one animal to the pasture before the tractor returns to the farm.
To move an animal, feel around in the sack to pull out the corresponding playing piece, but beware—only a white piece moves the animal forward. If you pull a black piece, the farmer moves forward! If one of the animals arrives at the meadow before the tractor arrives at the farm, everybody wins! If not, everyone will lose.

+++ The different shapes of the animals help identify them by touch.

—description from the publisher

name: ego GOLD
description:
A Jubilee version of Ego with an assortment of questions and dilemmas. Roll the die to determing which question to get, and secretly answer the question using the answer tokens. Everybody else will now bet one or two chits on their ability to guess your answer.

—user summary

name: Mardi Gras Madness
description:
Mardi Gras Madness offers the fun and frenzy of a Mardi Gras parade all year long! Compete for a wide range of throws and earn points for what you catch, how much you catch, and for matching sets of throws. The strategy lies in beating the crowd to the throws you want. But watch out! Another player can toss a well-timed “Throw Me Something” card to change the parade and put your best laid plans in jeopardy. Of course, you have “Throw Me Something” cards, too…. Are you ready for some Mardi Gras Madness?

Winning Mardi Gras Madness means catching the best combination of throws to score the most points at the end of your parade. Each “Throws Card” has a value from 0 to 6, and collecting the right sets of matching cards can boost your end game scoring.

When two or more players try to catch the same throws, a roll-off occurs. Highest roll wins all the throws!

"Throw Me Something" cards are specific advantages that allow players to break the rules. You earn them when you lose roll-offs. So no matter what happens, players are always working to improve their standing at the parade.

Mardi Gras Madness has a challenging solo mode, authentic artwork, a family-friendly theme and a fun pace!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Boba Boss
description:
Boba Boss is a fast-paced, brain-twisting, color and word association game. The game is crazy simple and easy to figure out. It takes less than a minute to learn and even less time than that to play it. A round can be over in mere seconds!

Boba Boss can be played with 2 to 6 people, but packing the table to the max is more fun. Everyone plays as an employee at a boba tea shop. Your goal is to win employee of the minute, by filling all of your your seven tea cups before anyone else finishes filling theirs. Complicating the situation a little is the fact that not only are players filling their own cups, they’re also spilling their opponents cups at the same time.

The game cleverly employs the stroop effect to test players' deciphering abilities and reaction times. Insani-tea is inevitable and that's a big part of the fun. The cute boba ball theme and the delightfully simple game play make this game accessible to most anyone who isn't afraid to rub elbows at the table.

Do you have what it takes to become the Boba Boss?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Little Town: Palais des festivals Promo Tile
description:
A building tile distributed during the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) in Cannes.
Cost: 1 Wood, 1 Fish, 1 Wheat.
Effect: At the end of each round, gain 1 Coin per Worker on the Palais des festivals’ 8 adjacent spaces.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: The Game of Real Life
description:
The Game of Real Life is a fun and simple way to cultivate these skills for living. The Game is based on the principles of Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT). The goal of DBT is to help us live in the moment, cope healthily with stress, regulate our emotions, and improve our relationships.

The Game teaches DBT skills by presenting a Conflict card. Each player must use a dealt DBT Skill card to argue why their Skill is best suited to solve the conflict and win the round. When you win a Conflict round, you gain points towards your Life Goal card.

There are two ways to win The Game: 1) Win the most rounds of Conflicts; or, 2) come closest to reaching your Life Goal Card points. And even if you're not playing The Game, you can always refer to the Skill cards when you feel overwhelmed, or you need to make a difficult decision.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Lords Of Zanora
description:
The players take the roles of the Lords of Zanora in this fast paced card game. The realm of Zanora is the home of five sentient species, all having unique abilities. The Lords seek to bring peace and prosperity to Zanora, but it will not be easy to unite the factions after the long years of war.

Player must take 2 of 3 possible actions: draw cards, play cards to form one or more columns/alliances or attack another player's alliance. The topmost faction card of a column has a special ability. Using this abilities does not cost any actions. The first player to form one alliance of all the 5 different cards is the winner of the game.

Each turn you will have to decide when to expand your alliances, when to block your opponents and which abilities to use to accomplish your goal: the unification of Zanora.

Will you succumb to the web of grudges and destruction or will you be the Lord that brings hope to Zanora?

name: Camp Pinetop: Observation Tower
description:
The Observation Tower expansion will add another great twist to Camp Pinetop. During set-up the Observation Tower will be placed out on a random map tile. During gameplay when you are on a random row or column with the Observation Tower you will gain additional benefits.

Adding the Double Supply Cards will give an added strategy to the game. During play you will rank up and this will decrease the amount of cards you can have in your hand. The Double Supply Cards can count as two supply cards of that kind instead of the standard one.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Tall Tales: A Game of Competitive Story-Writing
description:
Tall Tales is about writing little stories out for each other and coming up with a fairy tale together. It takes something that a lot of people find intimidating and lonely—creative writing—and tries to make it lighthearted, fun, and just a little competitive. (Maybe more than a little for some of us.)

In Tall Tales, your group will write an original story together. Players each write their own scenes and submit them to the group in the hope that their scene will be chosen for the group’s tale. A player wins by scoring the most points, which players score by having other players vote for their scenes and also by voting for the scenes that are popular with other players.

Tall Tales begins with a warm-up called the Quest Round in which players begin to imagine the world they're building together. After the Quest Round, the game plays out over three Scene Rounds. Players in the Scene Rounds each draft a scene for the tale and then anonymously vote on which of the scenes best meets the criteria for the round. The scene with the most votes becomes part of the tale in each Scene Round until your group has a final, three-part tale.

At the end of Round 3, players should count up their point tokens. The player with the most points wins the game. The winner of the game reads the completed tale aloud to the group, and all players live happily ever after.

-description from designer

name: Rail Raiders Infinite: Cowpuncher Candy
description:
This is an expansion that comes with a miniature and a card explaining her special rules.

Rob the rails with this all new Raider! With her surprising blaster skills and can-do attitude, Candy has developed quite the reputation and a devoted fan following. She does save what she can from her heists to someday fulfill her own dream; to sample every candy and soda shop in the core worlds.

CONTENTS
1x Cowpuncher Candy Plastic Assembled Model
1x Cowpuncher Candy Raider Card
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Trice
description:
Will you be the dice king? With Trice, you can play and train your brain at the same time! Roll the green die (starting letter), the red die (ending letter), and the white (number of letters). Within one minute, write down as many words a possible that have the starting letter, ending letter and length that you have rolled. Each word is one point.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Wo(o)rd jij de dobbelkoning? Met Trice kun je spelen en tegelijkertijd je hersens trainen! Gooi een groene (beginletter), rode (eindletter) en witte dobbelsteen (aantal letters). Schrijf binnen één minuut zoveel mogelijk woorden op met de beginletter, eindletter en het aantal letters dat je hebt gegooid. Elk woord is 1 punt.

—description from the publisher

name: Good Question!
description:
The goal of Good Question! is to prompt your Alexa-enabled device (not included) to say the word on your card without saying the word yourself.
Play consists of questions from five categories of cards like “5 Second Shout,” “Streak,” or “Impossibles.” Players may ask questions such as: “Alexa, what are synonyms for cross-country?” or “Alexa, who sings Hound Dog?” and get Alexa to say the word on the card.

Every time Alexa says the word on your card, move one space forward on the board. Be the first player to make it all the way around the board and to become the Good Question Master! Good Question! is a party game for two to six players.

—description from the publisher

name: Lantris: Königliche Landschaften
description:
In Lantris, you are a candidate for the coveted position of royal landscape architect and have the honorable task of designing the kingdom according to the wishes of your liege lord and thus help him to new glory. With your landscape cards, you build lands that please the King and earn you the most victory points. Whoever has gained the most points in the end is the new royal landscape architect of Lantris.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Tile Placement

name: Surviving Quarantine
description:
Surviving Quarantine, a fun and fast paced card game that brings humor, silliness and much needed insanity to our current situation. No pregame setup required, just deal and go!

Pass the time dodging a virus by......well......surviving really ridiculous viruses in our game with your family and friends.

The rules to the game are simple

It takes less than 5 minutes to learn to play and can be played in 10-20 minutes or longer if you want.

It's easy, you just try to avoid getting stuck with the virus cards, and if you don't you are out of the game.

If you have a Virus Card in your hand, during your turn you can play it and give it to any player by naming them......If they can't survive with the cards in their hand they are out......If than can survive somehow play restarts with them.

It is now there turn to play another card.

Attack other players, skip players, gang up on friends.....sometimes its a crazy mashup of surviving and knowing who to eliminate. The last person remaining is the winner.

There are many ways to survive with silly anti+dote card combinations or even more crazy vaccines.

The simplicity of the cards allows all ages to enjoy playing......and the game modes allow players to be more strategic with the game.

-description from publisher

name: Chronicles of Crime: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Cards
description:
Three new character cards. These, combined with Chronicles of Crime: Dice Tower 2019 and 2020 Promo Cards are part of a brand new adventure that will launch on the app later in 2021.

Available as part of the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter Pack D.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: Turbo Sleuth
description:
A murder most foul has been committed! Old Miser McGreedy’s body hasn’t even been laid to rest, and the murder suspects are already seeking to divide up his fortune. Was it his wastrel of a son? The nervous maid? The shady business partner? Or the oddly nonchalent butler? Can you nab the culprit before time runs out?

Turbo Sleuth is a puzzly speed-solving game in which players compete simultaneously to find the solution to the round's challenge. Choose one of five cases to solve, with dozens of possible solutions depending on which cards are drawn. Search quickly for the right clues, some of which might look right at first glance, but will lead you astray...

Only the first few players may attempt to solve the case, but rush to a hasty wrong judgment, and the murderer will up the ante for the next round!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Race, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Goldenstar: the Galactic Tournament
description:
Goldenstar: The Galactic Tournament is a 2-4 players asymmetric, deck building, King of the Hill Board Game.

The Goldenstar Tournament is an event organized by Galactic Empress every 5 years to honor Goldenstar, her favourite buddy cop movie. Now the tournament gathers the most dangerous duos which come to fight for eternal glory and fame on arenas scattered around the galaxy.

Start with a deck combined of two challengers’ unique skill sets. Become crowd favorites, dominate your opponents and level-up characters. Upgrade your arsenal in Black Market and ultimately challenge everyone in THE FINAL FACE-OFF.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Rainbow Unicorns
description:
Gallop over the rainbow towards the pot of gold in this magical, mystical twist on heads and tails!

Players take turns to pick up tail cards and match them to their unicorn heads. For every unicorn they successfully match they move one step closer to winning the magical pot of gold at the end of the rainbow! Featuring friendly unicorn characters and a rainbow playing board that children will love.

name: Knights of the Hound Table: Sails & Tails
description:
In Knights of the Hound Table: Sails & Tails is the first expansion to date.

It adds two new breeds of dogs: Corgis and Huskies. It also adds new comeback mechanics and a phase of the game that helps give players synergy for pairing similar colored hounds together.

—description from the designer

name: Los Buscapistas
description:
Based on the famous series of juvenile books, with Los Buscapistas, you will play with Pepa Pistas, Maxi Casos, Bebito and Pulgas, to try to solve as many mysteries as the city of Basketville.

Los Buscapistas is a card game with a simply "worker management" you can win mystery points. The player who wins more points will be the winner of the game. The game contain 60 cards, 8 big cards, and personalize dice.

In your turn, move you character to location cards to get new clues, help or try to discover mysteries to win points. The first player who win 30 points will be the winner of the game.

Los Buscapistas is a family game for 2-4 player, 6+ or more age and 20 minutes of game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Novel-based

name: Sector
description:
WINNER of Best Innovative Mechanic in the 10th Roll and Write Design Contest
RUNNER UP in Best Written Rules, Best Game Sheet and Best Multiplayer Game

A FREE One Page low ink Print And Play game of search and rescue in the depths of space.

You can’t remember how long you have searched but somehow you have kept going. Your ship just barely holding together you find yourself dazed and adrift in uncharted Space. You will have to scrape together all the resources you can to survive and maybe, at long last just maybe, find The Lost Pilot.

Accompanied by a unique soundtrack (linked by QR code on the playing map) and using just a couple of dice and some coloured pens, one to three players must each navigate this SECTOR of space in order to find their Lost Pilot and escape. But along the way they will have to face terrifying creatures, a crumbling ship and ultimately each other.

Link to a print copy of the Playing Map
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/229289/sector-map

Link to a PDF copy of the rules
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/229298/sector-rules

And the current development thread is here. It also contains everything you need to download and play and you’ll find a link to the Carpenter/Vangelis/Badalamenti inspired soundtrack there too.
https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2727772/wip-search-and-resc...
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: February
description:
February is a trick-taking game mixed with majorities in which players compete to schedule events at a popular venue.

The game gets a new way to play each February. The original 2022 version was a decently cutthroat competitive game. The 2023 release is a friendly teams-based version.

The deck consists of two each of cards numbered 1-28, with each card representing a day in the month of February (one card is daytime, the other is nightime). Each week (1-7, 8-14, 15-21, 22-28) is a different colored suit. Additional special cards (such as a "Leap Year" card and a "Reschedule" card) are included and worked in based on player count.



2022 Rules
Players must follow either the colored suit of the lead card, or the must play a card of the same day of the week. Thus, the "1" card could be followed by either a card of that suit (a 1-7) or another Sunday (the 1st, 8th, 15th, or 22nd).

The highest card played which follows wins the trick (cards not following can't win the trick); in the event of a tie, the nighttime card wins. The winner gets to mark the day on the calendar as theirs; if a marker is already there, it gets replaced. The card winning the trick is removed from the game.

Once a full hand has been played, players shuffle the remaining cards, adding in a pre-determined number of special ability cards, and then play another hand, again competing for calendar space.

Having the most markers in a particular week earns two points; ties are broken by the marker closest to Sunday. Having the most markers on a particular day of the week (i.e. Monday) earns one point; ties are broken by the earliest date. Most points wins; ties are broken by the earliest date.



2023 Rules
Players must follow the colored suit of the lead card. Unlike in the original game, players cannot follow by playing the same day of the week. However, the latest day following either the colored suit or the same day of the week will win the trick.

The winning team gets to mark a day on the calendar as theirs; if a marker is already there, it gets replaced. They can choose any space represented by a card in the trick. The card winning the trick is removed from the game.

Once a full hand has been played, players shuffle the remaining cards, adding in the special ability cards, and then play another hand, again competing for calendar space.

Having the most markers in a particular day of the week earns two points. Teams also get points for their largest contiguous set of markers. High score wins.

—description from the designer

Victims of an attack, the plans of an unprecedented technology have been stolen from the powerful Solax laboratories.

In 2070, you play as a group of elite agents: an android, a martial arts expert, an alien, and a mercenary. Your mission is to intercept the spy droid in the streets of Rome. Nobody dares to imagine the consequences if you fail...

Investigation, traps, fights, survival and puzzles await you, but will you be able to work together to succeed in your common hunt without being distracted by your individual secret objectives? Play alone or with others, make the right choices of paths and actions and weave your own adventure because YOU are the heroes!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction
publishers: Blue Orange (EU), Hobby World, Makaka Editions, Van Ryder Games

name: Vandrouki: Азия
description:
This game is an expansion for the "Vandrouki Europe" game, so the rules are the same as in the "Vandrouki Europe" game.

With this expansion it is possible to play up to 6 players.
Also this expansion includes a board of map of Middle Asia with 25 new countries.
New visas are available: Saudi Arabia and Iraq.

name: Tipni si!: Česko
description:
You don't have to have a bloated head like a balloon in the Take a Guess! You just need a good guess or try your luck. How many people write in the Czech Republic with their left hand? How deep is Macocha? How many times has Karel Čapek been nominated for the Nobel Prize? The game is packed with lots of interesting facts, curiosities and records, so you only need to get at least three players and you can start betting.

Players bet on the dates, population, area and many other variables, earning points for the right tip or for betting on the opponent's correct tip.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Nemusíte mít hlavou nafouklou vědomostmi jako balón, v párty hře Tipni si! Česko stačí dobrý odhad nebo zkusit štěstí. Kolik lidí píše v Česku levou rukou? Jak hluboká je Macocha? Kolikrát byl Karel Čapek nominován na Nobelovu cenu? Hra je napěchovaná spoustou zajímavostí, kuriozit a rekordů, takže stačí sehnat alespoň tři hráče a můžete se pustit do tipování.

Hráči tipují letopočty, počty obyvatel, rozlohu a spoustu dalších veličin, přičemž body získávají za správný tip nebo za to, že vsadili na správný tip soupeře.

V této párty hře na vás čeká 1188 otázek rozdělených do 6 okruhů - Zeměpis, Dějiny, Kultura, Příroda, Sport a Různé. Tipni si Česko je možné zkombinovat se základní hrou Tipni si.
Hra Tipni si Česko obsahuje: 396 karet s otázkami, 6 mazatelných destiček, 6 fixů s mazátkem, 80 plastových bodovacích žetonů, 6 barevných hráčských žetonů a pravidla.

—description from the publisher

name: Guess what!
description:
Gæt mig! consists of cards showing pictures. One player describes the picture in the card with mime (blue cards) or sounds (red cards). The other players try to guess the picture. Whoever guesses first wins the card. When the deck is empty, the player with most cards wins.

—user summary

name: Paperbag Dungeon: Mind the Mushrooms
description:
Mind the Mushrooms is an 18 card solitaire, tile-laying dungeon builder, with elements of "tower defense," hidden puzzles, and resource management.

Each turn you will choose a card to add to your dungeon. Build carefully because one wrong tunnel could let in monsters that have the ability to dig through walls, open doors and crash your Dungeon Gate.

MTM can be combined with the original Paperbag Dungeon.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Puzzle

name: Professor Charlies Reise durch die Zeit
description:
The game in 24 episodes - playable in one piece or over 24 days.

Professor Charlie has found a strange document in his letterbox. The mission in it concerns Charlie's latest invention: his time machine. Can you help Charlie on his journey through time and uncover the fabulous secret of the 24 Guardians?

The puzzle game in 24 episodes can be played in one go or on 24 days, i.e. also as an advent calendar. If you solve a puzzle every day, you will need between 5 and 15 minutes. If you play the game in one piece, you should plan around 3-4 hours.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: World of Børe: Runes & Ruins
description:
Runes & Ruins is a single player adventure set between Skulk Hollow and Maul Peak. You delve deeper into the World of Børe lore as an Arctic Fox scholar.

Embark on this solo, narrative adventure choosing your path through 30 cards.
You make the choices as you play through a series of story moments scratching off your choices and solving puzzles.
All of your choices along your adventure will result in a Foxen character that can be used along with an Ancient Relic in any Skulk Hollow or Maul Peak game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Złota Rybka
description:
Once upon a time, a fisherman who lived in a simple hut on the shore of a lake caught a goldfish who fulfilled his greatest wishes. It is said that the goldfish has been seen again, swimming near the shore.
So go to the lake and search for the goldfish! Perhaps the goldfish will make your wishes come true, too!

HOW TO PLAY

Roll the dice and move your pawn by the resulting value.
If you catch the goldfish, select a tile and see whether it fulfills one of your wishes.
When the goldfish fulfills all your wishes - you win.


—description from the publisher

Pewien rybak, żyjący w skromnej chacie nad brzegiem jeziora, wyłowił kiedyś złotą rybkę, która spełniła jego
największe marzenia. Plotka głosi, że złotą rybkę znów zauważono pływającą niedaleko brzegu.
Chwytaj za wędkę i wyruszaj na połów. Może złota rybka spełni również Twoje życzenia!

JAK GRAĆ?

Rzuć kostką i przesuń pionek o wskazaną na oczkach wartość.
Jeśli wyłowisz złotą rybkę, dobierz kafelek i sprawdź, czy spełni ona jedno z Twoich życzeń.
Gdy złota rybka spełni wszystkie Twoje życzenia – wygrywasz.


—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Chipe Cocos
description:
STRATEGY GAME
Hidden in the trees, troops of monkeys are fighting over coconuts. Which troop will be the best organized and collect the most coconuts – all while driving out their opponents before the tiger arrives?!

A strategy game where players will have to move with precaution and anticipation in order to avoid being attacked by the other players and to get the maximum of coconuts. When there are no more monkeys or the 3 tigers are out, each player counts his points: 1 point per coconut and 5 points per monkey captured!

-description from publisher

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #01 – Night Carnival
description:
The Night Carnival is in town! With an assortment of debatably "fair" midway games, fried mysteries, and questionable safety measures, it's curious this place is even still open. But what it doesn't close is your thirst for quests and you may just find your next adventure here!

—description from the publisher

Expansion 1 - Night Carnival expands Quests over Coffee, offering new cards:


4 New Items
5 New Quests
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Ani Bee, Ani Mee
description:
Ani Bee, Ani Mee is a fun cooperative memory game. You are all in a band with the same goal: to sing your best at a farm festival! Your task is to recreate the sounds of 9 animals, in the order they appear on stage. This must be done before the melody points end. Get ready to make noise, and be careful not to make mistakes.

Ani Bee, Ani Mee to zabawna kooperacyjna gra pamięciowa.
Działacie jako zespół, w którym wszyscy mają ten sam cel: zaśpiewać jak najlepiej na festiwalu farmy! Waszym zadaniem jest odtworzenie 9 odgłosów zwierząt w kolejności, w jakiej pojawiają się na scenie. Trzeba to zrobić, zanim skończą się punkty melodyczne. Przygotujcie się na odtwarzanie dźwięków, ale uważajcie, by nie popełniać błędów.

name: Mini Crimes: Scavando a Fondo
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

'In Mini Crimes: Scavando a fondo' (Mini Crimes: Digging in the deep), an important archaeologist, Thomas Wright, is found lying on the ground in the center of the excavation site to which he was dedicating his entire life. Who wanted him dead, and why?

-description from editor
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Dingsbums
description:
DINGSBUMS - "Das grundverkehrte Partyspiel" is the first game in DENKRIESEN's Party Fever series and has 336 cards on board with a total of 900 unique, crazy and funny sentences. Replace the "DINGSBUMS" in the statements with creative and funny answers and find out which text is from Dr. DINGSBUMS. This game guarantees rousing party fun for the next game night and is ideal for guessing, deception, camouflage and riddles. Easy to understand, DINGSBUMS comes with a clearly high addiction factor for young and old. Thanks to included game block and pencils for up to 8 players, nothing stands in the way of instant fun.

—description from the publisher

DINGSBUMS – "Das grundverkehrte Partyspiel" ist das erste Spiel aus der Partyfieber-Serie von DENKRIESEN und hat 336 Karten mit insgesamt 900 einmaligen, verrückten und lustigen Sätzen an Bord. Ersetzt das „DINGSBUMS“ in den Aussagen mit kreativen und lustigen Antworten und findet heraus, welcher Text von Dr. DINGSBUMS stammt. Dieses Spiel garantiert mitreißenden Partyspaß für den nächsten Spieleabend und ist ideal zum Raten, Täuschen, Tarnen und Rätseln. Einfach zu verstehen, kommt DINGSBUMS mit eindeutig hohem Suchtfaktor für Jung und Alt. Dank enthaltenem Spielblock und Bleistiften für bis zu 8 Spieler steht sofortigem Spielspaß nichts im Wege.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Story Teller
description:
This is a story-telling game that follows the structure of classic dramatic formulas. As a result, the stories created by players will have a complete structure and include exciting conflicts and twists.

The basic game consists of 6 rounds, each representing a chapter of the story, in order:

Purpose
Obstacle
Breakthrough
Defeated
Turning Point
Ending


Each round consists of four steps:

1. Ideation and Card Play
All players brainstorm and think about the plot for the current round's chapter. For example, in the first round, players must state the story's purpose and include one or two cards in their hands.
This step is not round-specific; any player can play his/her cards face down and place his/her marker at any time once he or she made the story in the head.
As soon as three players have played their cards, this step ends.

2. Story-telling
According to the order of play cards, players reveal their cards and describe the content of their story.

3. Vote for the Plot
All players take one of their Admire tokens and hold them in hand, then simultaneously place them on the story they like the most, excluding their own.
The story with the highest number of votes becomes the main plot.

4. Scoring and clean-up
The highest-voted cards are placed on the Chapter board for this round, reminding everyone of the main plot's content.
The players who told stories received Admire tokens, earning 1 point each.
The players who voted for the main plot receive a Scroll token, earning 1 point each.
Each player can adjust their hand of cards and then discard other cards played this round.
