QUICKSingle Card Cricket is a card game with a theme based on the game of cricket.

Game Contents:


40 bowling cards (bowling deliveries)
60 batting cards (batting shots)
60 fielding cards (fielding positions)
Re-usable scorecard
Erasable pen
Coin (for the toss)


It is a game for 2 to 4 players. In the standard 4-player form of the game, the game has two teams - the fielding team and the batting team. On the fielding team one player takes the role of the bowler while the other takes the fielder role. On the batting team the two players each take the role of the batsmen. The batting team will have ten overs to score runs, unless the bowling team can take ten wickets first. The team with the highest score wins.

How it works: The game contains three decks of cards; batting, bowling, fielding. Each over, the batter, the bowler and fielder receive a new set of possible deliveries(bowling cards), shot options (batting cards) and field positions (field cards).
The bowler will try to restrict runs, bowl the batter or appeal for LBW. The batter will try to smash a six. But no, you'll only be able to get a single off that one.

There are optional rules for a two-player game.

The game is broadly speaking a trick-taking card game where the player controlling the batsman tries to follow suit and play a lower-valued card than the bowler. Play then moves on to the fielder who tries to follow suit and play a card that's equal in value to the batting card played.
Home Page: http://homepages.slingshot.co.nz/~ckc/index.htm

name: Timeline: Korean History
description:
Timeline: Korean History, a card game in Timeline series, consists of 110 cards that depict various historical events in Korean history. Each card has two identical sides, except that one of them shows the year that the particular event happened.

Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the year on it. If the card was placed correctly with the year in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise, the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all their cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, that player wins; otherwise, play continues until a single player goes out.

name: Word Rich
description: Make a word by selecting letters from the board. High scores are obtained, by turning over face down letters from the bonus squares and using them in your words. You are able to choose the types of bonus you want to go after. Bonuses are given for word lengths, and words using one color of letters. However, if you can't make a word using all of the letters selected, you score minus points.

name: Belleau Wood: The Yanks First Big Test of WWI
description:
"Belleau Wood: The Yanks First Big Test of WWI".
The year is 1918, the Germans are pushing the French back. Paris is in trouble and could fall, will the Marines of the 5th Division hold the Huns back ?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Share A Berry
description:
The small bear collect berries. Do you want to accompany it? How many berries have you collected? Count with the small bear and experience the exciting counting world.

Every round you open a card and you receive berries. Last two rounds you have to give some berries to you left or right neighbors.
It trains little kids to count and share things with others.
publishers: Brain Games, Gigamic, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, LOGIS, SimplyFun

name: Saint Petersburg (Second Edition): The Exclusive Spieleschmiede Expansion
description: A set of five counters, one in each player color. Each counter allows a player once during the game to refill the display up to 10 cards (only during the nobles or exchange rounds), or is worth 3VP at the end of the game.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Economic

name: The Andy Griffith Show Trivia Game
description:
The game is simple, easy to learn, and perfect for large groups. As few as two people, or as many as four teams of any number of people can play. One must, however, have been at some point in time a fairly regular viewer of the show to stand a chance or get any enjoyment out of the game.

The object of the game is to answer questions from The Andy Griffith Show, move around the board, and land on the final square. One of four different categories is indicated on each square around the game board, and, you cannot move off of a square until you correctly answer a question from that particular category. After three consecutive turns, however, if you still cannot answer a question from that category, you can declare yourself "stuck" in order to move to a different square. If you are stuck, however, you have to roll the die and move back the number of spaces indicated. The four categories are: "True/False," two categories called "Questions With Specific Answers," and "Multiple Choice."

name: VerkehrsChaos
description:
The board represents a city and has 4 roads on it with 3 intersections. The player has 12 cars which he has to move along the board as quickly as possible. The trouble is that you can't pass another car so you get traffic jams. A player can also give the opponent a flat tire.
The player who gets his cars off the board first, wins the game.

The prototype of the game was called "Stau!", which means traffic-jam. It had player-aids representing parking-spaces to hold a player's cars, these were omitted in the production version.

name: Race for the White House
description:
With just the right mixture of skill and luck (this is politics, after all), you'll find yourself increasingly caught up in the excitement of a hard-fought Presidential Election that goes down to the wire. Find out what it really feels like to be a politician forced to take positions on issues that please and placate--but don't alienate--the various constituencies and interest groups necessary to reach the critical 270 Electoral Votes needed to win the election.
You decide which states to focus on, which interest groups to cater to, and which regions of the country to concentrate your efforts in. The game reflects actual current demographics and issues. The Democrat will have difficulty winning traditionally Republican states and vice-versa. Eleven states are key swing states, the same states that were considered "battleground states" in the 2004 election.
Larger states tend to stay undecided through most of the game keeping the final outcome in doubt until the very end. Other aspects of the game allow a player who is behind a constant possibility of being able to catch up. Once you start playing you won't want to stop. Once you finish a game, you'll want to play another.
It is a great 2 or 4 player game. In the four player game each Presidential candidate has a VP running mate.
As teammates they each focus on winning states in different parts of the nation.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Great Lakes Cargo
description: This is a game of shipping on the Great Lakes, involving picking up and delivering loads for profits while avoiding the many dangers of traveling on the Great Lakes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Challenger 2000: Ultra Modern Wargame Rules for Battle Group Level Games 1970 to 1995
description:
Challenger 2000 is a rulebook focusing on modern warfare from 1970 up to 1995. It is at 6mm (1:300) scale and focuses on battle groups (company level). It introduces rules for new weapons and equipment, such as Explosive Reactive Armour, modified missiles to deal with it, countermeasures (including anti-missile systems) and sensors.

Major changes from Challenger II to Challenger 2000 include:
a) A new move sequence.
b) Area fire is treated as a combined firefight rather than a number of individual elements firing.
c) A new morale system based on sub-units.

Products Published by Tabletop Games for Modern Warfare Rules
Wargames Research Group 1950-1985 Rules for Armoured Warfare
Not actually a Challenger Expansion
1980 Ultra Modern Army Lists and Organisations
1982 Ultra Modern Army Lists and Organisations Second Edition

1982 Challenger (1st Edition)
1983 Challenger Revised Edition

1984 Battlezones - Scenarios for the Ultra Modern Period

1985 Ultra Modern Army Lists and Organistation Volume 1
The Central Front
Nato Warpac
European Neutrals

1985 Utlra Modern Army Lists & Organisation Volume 2
Middle East
Africa
Far East
Latin America
Intervention Forces

1986 Digest No. 3 - Challenger / Corps Commander
Engineering Equipment Data
Engineering Lists
Engineering Scenarios
Equipment Data Update
Army List Update
Challenger Rule Amendments
Challenger Close Assault Rules
Coprt Commander OMG Reinforcements
Armoured Recovery Vehicles
The Australian Army

1988 / 1989 Challenger II (Second Edition)

1989 Digest 4
Ultra Modern Army Lists for Challenger II Rules
The Central Front
NATO
Warpac
European Nuetrals

1989 Digest 5
Ultra Modern Army Lists for Challenger II Ruels
Middle East
Africa
Far East
Latin America
Intervention Forces

1989 Modern Aircraft Handbook - Aircaraft Details & Weapons for Challenger II
1992 Revised Modern Aircraft Handbook - Aircraft Details & Weapons for Challenger II (Ammendments + Challenger 2000 Modificaions).

1992
Challenger 2000 (Third Edition)
1994 Challenger 2000 Modern Equipment Second Edition Part One
1998 Challanger 2000 Modern Equipment Second Edition Part Two

name: Legend of the Moonsword
description: In this game based loosely on the world of Grimms' fairy tales, each player takes on the role of a Child, Damsel, Man or Beast on a quest to find the legendary Moonsword in order to defend a fantasy kingdom. Different character types have different strengths and weaknesses, and each player starts with a different Quest card explaining exactly what objects and locations must be found in order to obtain the Moonsword. Players then wander the board battling monsters, acquiring objects and drawing random event cards. The first person to meet the quest goals, obtain the Moonsword, and find their hidden magic gate is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Ratz-Fatz
description:
The box contains 36 different wooden figures (egg, duck, hare, chair, boy, star, ring, tree, ...), and a rule book with several variants and stories.

In the basic game, one person reads a story. When the name of an item appears in the text, each player tries to grab the corresponding figure. Goal is to get most items.

Other variants include memory elements, creating your own stories or poems, and recognize words within words.

Expanded by:

Ratzolino

name: Spice Islands
description: "A game for 2-5 players of investment, transport and company ownership set in the time when fortunes turned on the arrival of a ship from the Spice Islands. That is, if it got past the pirates. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins."

name: Wordfare!
description:
WordFare! combines the fun of Scrabble with a good bit of strategy and random chance. Like similar word games, you don't need to be a mastermind to be good at it.

You can learn the rules in a few minutes. Here are most of the rules:

1 Draw 20 tiles at random, pick the 10 you like best and put them on your row #1 (the row facing you)
2 Roll 2 dice, select one and move a tile that many spaces in a straight line. Save the other one to use later.
3 Your opponent does the same. As your letters move together, you can form words with either player's letters.

You score based on how far away from your home row the letters are, times the length of the word. There are blank tiles and a special * tile, used to replace any letter. The * tile can only be used by the player who owns it; the blanks can be used by either player. There are a couple of other simple rules involving capture of letter tiles, but you get the idea.

The board and pieces are made of hardwood and are laser engraved. Even the box is made of hardboard and is engraved.

name: Under the North Star: The Finnish Civil War 1918
description: A two player simulation of the Finnish Civil War that cost the lives of over 37,000 Finns. The war was fought in Finland from 27 January to 15 May 1918 between the forces of the Social Democrats led by the People's Deputation of Finland, commonly called the "Reds", and the forces of the non-socialist, conservative-led Senate, commonly called the "Whites". The Reds were supported by Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic, while the Whites received military assistance from Sweden and the German Empire.
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War I

name: Schnipp Kick
description:
"Schnipp Kick" is a turbulent skills quartet. There are 16 pictures of animals arranged in a generous wooden frame. All the 16 animal pictures consist of four single square pieces that can individually be taken out of the frame.
From each corner of the wooden frame, a player flips his wooden ring across the pictures and takes the quarter of the animal picture on which his wooden ring has come to rest. The objective of the game is to collect quartets (thus as many of the full animal pictures) by skilful flipping. Choice wood materials, brilliant colour prints and child-friendly illustrations are characteristics of this top-class game.
The game is especially suited for pedagogical or therapeutic institutions.

name: Primo
description:
Each player has a hand of 6 cards and his turn, he will write his cards with a 'PRIMO'-word. But also some cards has special abilities: 'Star' can replace any letter or some cards make coffee break losing a turn to Your opponent.

To win the game, you have to be the first to write 4 'PRIMO' words: 'PRIMO 3' (word of 3 letters), 'PRIMO 4' (word of 4 letters), 'PRIMO 5' (word of 5 letters) and a 'PRIMO 6' (word of 6 letters), in any order.

name: Yummell
description:
Many years ago, Yummell was a race of luck and dexterity in the fantasy world of Kfoorp. The race carried the participants across woods, plains, swamps, and all kinds of magical terrains.

In Yummell, the runners are fantasy characters, from Flamm the swamp dragon to Fulmergh, the caretaker Elf. The mapboard is created anew each race by assembling map tiles that bear the different terrains.

Each player has a hand of cards, and each turn the player plays one of his movement cards, then has an encounter where his character ends its movement. The game also includes event cards, creature cards that characters can meet, and artifacts that can help during the race.

The first character to reach the end of the track wins.

name: Wild Wild West (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Card expansion for Ticket to Ride

In addition to the original Ticket to Ride rules, the 30 Wild Wild West event cards are shuffled at the beginning of the game. Three cards are distributed to each player. Each player reviews his event cards and decides which ones to keep. A player must keep at least one card but may keep two or all three.
Playing the event card will cost one action to play an event card.
There are variety of interesting events in this card deck like: "Double the value of any of your completed Destination tickets worth 6 points or less, at game's end" or "This card is revealed at game's end. If you are the first player with 2 or less trains score 10 additional points. Otherwise, lose 5 points. "

PNP files can be found in the files section of Ticket to Ride or
english version
french version
spanish version
cards back
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trivia
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Myth: Spriggan Hero
description:
A Hero Will Rise to Face the Agents of Darkness.

The Spriggan model is unique to KS, but the deck used is not.

The Spriggan uses spells. It has two types of spells: attacking spells that awaken nature to attack the darkness like Bee Swarm or Gaia's embrace, and spells that equip the Spriggan with temporary items: like Oaken Armor and Willow's Kiss.

The equip spells provide the Spriggan with items it can equip and use with it's more standard attack cards. These items have limited hit points or do limited Blood. When they are spent, the item goes away.

There will be only one miniature for the Spriggan. We consider it genderless.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Hug me more
description:
First Hug Me expansion.
Contains 21 cards:
- 2 new Room Cards type (4 cards, 2 each room)
- 10 new Item Cards
- 7 new Characters
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Villains and Vigilantes Card Game: Mind over Matter
description:
The adventure continues with new heroes, villains, missions and super-powers to explore.

Maxima is the ultimate warrior-woman from the future. She has extraordinary strength, steel-hard skin, and lightning reflexes. No one can match the speed and strength of this woman without equal.

Marionette is a diminutive villain with the power to take over the minds of others and use them as she wishes. Her partner in crime is the psychic vampire known as Temper. He can control the emotions of crowds, inflame passions, turn allies against one another, and grow ever stronger from the inevitable chaos.

This expansion contains two new fully-playable pre-constructed decks featuring the mighty Maxima and the sinister Temper and Marionette. It features all-new power cards that showcase Maxima's extraordinary physical prowess and the villains’ powers of mental manipulation. In addition, these decks introduce new minor characters, heroic allies, cherished friends, and potential victims of these nefarious villains.

This expansion is fully compatible with the Villains and Vigilantes Card Game base set. You can mix and match cards to create your own combinations of heroes and villains, powers, plot twists and missions.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Double Play
description:
This is a deck of 50 cards that uses the Versatiletters system. Each card displays a letter, which becomes a different letter with a different point value when the card is rotated 180 degrees. The instructions include rules for:
i) The Final Word, in which two players take turns forming words from a selection of 12 cards. The player who forms the final word keeps the cards that were used to form it. Twelve more cards are drawn; the process is repeated; and the player with more cards after four rounds wins;
ii) Finders Stealers, in which 3 to 6 players each play two cards simultaneously face up onto the table. The player who is able to form the longest word within 30 seconds keeps the cards used to form that word, and the player with the most cards after three rounds wins;
iii) Word Wars I.II.III, which has its own BGG entry; and
iv) Solitaire Dare, in which each of five columns contains ten overlapping cards, with only the bottom card in each column face up. Make a word with the letters on the face-up cards, set aside the used letters, flip the uncovered cards, and repeat. Win if no unused cards remain at the end.
categories: Card Game, Game System, Word Game

name: Alphabetickell
description:
Assemble an alphabetical sequence.

Players take turns choosing to take or pass a card, which they must place on a single line, keeping it in alphabetical order.

Letters will often be skipped and can't be later inserted. So if you go from N to R, you'll never get to play O, P or Q. Is that a sensible move?

Maybe not given the likelihood of an O, but it also depends how many cards you already have, whether anyone else wants the card, how close the round is to ending...

Once someone gets 11 cards, everyone scores a point for each card and you start a new round. If someone accumulated 26 pts total, they win!

This is one of many games playable with the Wibbell++ deck.

name: Carnival Games
description:
You and your companion (child, grandchild, spouse, girlfriend, boyfriend, younger sibling, significant other, etc) are going to the carnival and you have promised to win for them a JUMBO prize!

To accomplish this lofty goal you will go on a few rides, eat yummy food, and play all the carnival games. You'll also need to manage your tickets as you only have 50 to spend. Once they're gone it's game over.

To win a JUMBO prize you must first win smaller prizes by playing the mini carnival game at each game booth. Trade in your small prizes for bigger ones until you get the JUMBO prize.

Have fun visiting the carnival!

Carnival Games is a 1-3 player cooperative game and was entered in the 2018 9-Card Game Design Contest. It is a print and play (pnp) game which consists of a rulebook and 9 double-sided cards (full color or low ink options).

Players will need to provide the following components:
-1 Small Paperclip or cube
-7 Dice
-10 Cubes
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Number, Print & Play

name: Tanks: Semovente
description:
Although initially intended as a close-support artillery piece, the fact that the Semovente carried a bigger gun than the tanks it supported led to its use as a tank-destroyer, and then as a tank in its own right. By the time of the Tunisian fighting, the Semovente made up approximately half of the Italian armoured force in theatre, giving them significantly greater punch than in earlier battles in the desert.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Semovente tank
1x Semovente tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
4x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Penguin Brawl: Heroes of Pentarctica – Battle of the Gods
description:
Penguin Brawl: Battle of the Gods is the first micro-expansion for Penguin Brawl and adds 30 new cards to the game which comprise of six new character cards and their associated gear, spells and instants.

Battle of the Gods also adds a brand new mechanic to Penguin Brawl in the form of Blessings. Blessings work in a similar way to curses wherein they must be played the moment they are drawn, however Blessings, as the name suggests, do nice things, unlike their curse counterparts which are specifically there to ruin your day.

New characters include Zeus, Ra, Odin, Ah-Muzen-Cab, Anansi and Jupiter. This expansions characters are based on the Greek, Roman, Norse, Egyptian, Mayan and Akan pantheons.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Penguin Brawl: Heroes of Pentarctica – Nuclear Winter Expansion
description:
Nuclear Winter is the 2nd micro-expansion for Penguin Brawl and adds 30 new cards comprising of six penguins and their associated gear, spells and instants.

Nuclear Winter reinvents some of the more loved characters from the Penguin Brawls original cast in an apocalyptic wasteland, where they must fight tooth and nail simply to survive. This expansion takes close note of Curses and adds six new and interesting Curse cards to the game. Reinvented characters include; The Frozen Phoenix, Van Helking, Long John Shivers, The Mad Flipper, Baron Penedi and Emperor Tesla. The new versions of these characters can be used alongside their counterparts from the original game to increase combo chances and face-off opportunities.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Albedo: Yggdrasil
description:
Albedo Yggdrasil features innovations for the Albedo base game like spaceship cards that can be rotated to retrofit them and simultaneous action selection resulting in minimum downtime and a uniform game length. It introduces a new faction and new planets to the base game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Necromunda Underhive: Badzones Environments & Events Cards
description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in games set in the perilous Badzones of the underhive.

The cards cover a diverse range of Badzones Environments and the Events that can befall the unwary within them.

The six Environment cards define the nature of the Badzone battlefield, ranging from a fathomless Slump Sea to an Unstable Dome. The 20 Badzones Event cards make the battlefield even more perilous, assailing the rival gangs with such hazards as a Toxic Downpour, a Brainleaf Outbreak, a Static Storm or worse...

The cards in this pack make generating which Environment and Events are in play a simple matter, and each features all of the special rules needed to keep track of its effects.

Badzones Environments snd Events can be used in conjunction with most Necromunda scenarios. The rules for doing so are presented in the Necromunda: The Book of Peril gaming supplement.

—description from the back of the box
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Pomegranate Planet
description:
In Pomegranate Planet, take on the role of a pomegranate farmer trying to out-grow the competition. You will use Pomegranate Power Pebbles, or “Pom Pebbles” as the locals call them, to acquire items that you will need from the Market. The Market uses a blind bidding system, and each item in the Market will go to the player that bid the most Pom Pebbles for that item. However, you can only put up a single card for bid at a time, each valued at a different number of Pom Pebbles. Water and Fertilizer will help your seeds grow into delicious, nutritious pomegranates. Pollinate and Greenhouse cards get your fields to produce more pomegranates, and Tractors can help you move items from one field to another, making the most of your farmland. Use your Pom Pebbles wisely; wasting your higher value Pom Pebbles early could allow your opponents to easily snag a more valuable item later on! Win the best items at the market to become the primary purveyor of pomegranates on the planet!

—description from the publisher

name: Drakatak
description:
The people have come together to create a great army capable of resisting dragons. As the best warlord in Drakatak, you have no desire to share in the victory. Get rid of all your cards to send your troops into battle as quickly as possible. Make the most of events and heroes, and test your opponents' strategies by directing dragon attacks at them! You could then become the first warlord to bring back a dragon's head!

—description from the publisher

name: ラムラムパーティー (Lum Lum Party)
description:
ラムラムパーティー (Lum Lum Party) is a bingo-type game where the players are given two blank bingo sheets and following a set of rules, will choose what numbers go in each box.

On a turn, a player chooses from 4 actions in order to "call" the next number the players will hope to circle on their sheets. These actions will vary slightly depending upon the last number "called".

At the end of a round, players score points for their place in getting their first bingo; numbers circled; and tens-digits of numbers circled. The player with the highest total score after two rounds wins.

Nearly a quarter of the rules are devoted to the designer's love of the manga series, Urusei Yatsura; this is where the game gets its name.

name: Superfight Superchest
description: A storage box for Superfight that can contain 1200 cards, and that comes with two hundred new cards.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: Our Village
description:
Use resources to construct buildings to help your village. Each building will help a number of people in your village. The player who helps the most people is the winner!

Each turn players have the option of asking another player for a specific resource card. If the other player has that resource, they must trade it for another card from the active player's hand. If they do not have it, both players draw a card from the resource deck.

They may then construct buildings by playing sets of resource cards matching the next available building on a given pile, or upgrade an existing building (only paying the difference) if they have already built a smaller building of one of the available building cards.

The game ends when one player has built 5 buildings in their village, each other player then has one more turn. Players add up all the people their buildings have helped, the winner is the player who has the highest total.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, City Building, Educational

name: The Little Flower Shop Express
description:
This game is an express version of The Little Flower Shop. It consists of 15 Shop Cards, 15 Star Cards, 1 Turn Card, and 5 rules cards.

In the game, players will build little flower shops consisting of 6 shop cards and 6 scoring cards. By game's end, the shop cards are arranged in 2 rows of 3 cards each. The star cards have scoring conditions that may be turned to point either sideways across the rows or downward along the columns. Players try to maximize points by having the star cards match the items in the rows and columns.

The game is played over 3 rounds. In each round, there is a set method for taking shop and star cards from a common area, as described on the turn order card. Players will take the cards and construct their shops.

At game end, players score for various vases and flowers that match the star cards, plus they can score a bonus for the stuffed animals they've collected.

—description from the publisher

name: The Master Builders of Cologne
description:
Die Baumeister von Köln is a board game for two to four players set in medieval Cologne, Germany. The theme is the construction of the city's 12 large Romanesque churches. Players must use their two carts each to bring building stones from the city gates to the construction sites on a historical city map. There they unload their cargo. Whoever has contributed the highest value of building stones to the construction of a building receives points upon its completion. At the beginning of each turn, dice are rolled to determine which building stone will be delivered to which city gate. The players try to block each other's paths in the city with their carts in order to be faster than the others. Encounter cards bring historical figures such as abbots, abbesses, mayors, thieves, etc. into play, allowing interaction with the other players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Invaders
description:
The Earth was attacked by the aliens and it is in danger!
But, if you cooperate with each other, you can save it.

Invaders is a cooperative and memory-based game that is played in two phases:

the "planning" one where you have to deploy your interceptors based on the aliens that are drawn at every turn
the "invasion" one, where you check how well you did in the planning phase (and where you have few chances to correct your mistakes)


It contains 5 different difficulty levels, each introducing new material and rules.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Maui: Catch the Wave Mini Expansion
description:
With this mini extension, when you choose your towel, you will now have to take into account the pattern represented on your surf tile to score more points and obtain bonuses while advancing on the surf track.

Catch the Wave introduces a new mechanic to the game that you'll find so easy to introduce that you'll want to use it every game.

-description from publisher's website

name: Something Wild! Marvel: Holiday Baby Groot
description:
A fast-paced, light card game for the whole family! Featuring a collectible Baby Groot Pop! mover, as well as your favorite characters from the iconic Marvel universe. Power Cards add fun new twists to the classic card gameplay. Combine with other Marvel Something Wild! games to add more characters, Pop! figures, and Powers to your game!

A line of card games featuring beloved characters and collectible Pop! pocket figures. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs. Score a set to snag the character figure’s special power that helps you win! The first player to score three powers wins the game. Combine multiple games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!

One Pocket Pop! Baby Groot mover that lets you use Powers.
Nine classic Marvel characters in full color card art.
Use new Powers to swap cards, score points, and take the Baby Groot mover away from your opponents!
Baby Groot’s festive Santa hat and special winter versions of the characters make this the perfect holiday gift!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Order Overload: Spiel23
description:
You and your fellow players work in a boardgame booth at Spiel '23, and to keep your jobs, you need to keep a handle on all the orders coming in. Will you be able to deliver the right games?

In a round, you deal a certain number of cards face up and read them aloud so that everyone knows all the orders placed, then you deal these cards out face down to the players. On a turn, you need to name an order that's in someone else's hand. Fail to do so, and you're eliminated from play! If you collectively reveal a set number of drinks before everyone is eliminated, then you clear the level and are ready to take on tougher challenges...

What's the highest level you can clear?
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities

name: Pancho Villa, Dead or Alive!
description: The 1916 expedition of General Pershing and the US Army to punish the Mexican outlaw bandit, Pancho Villa. Chase the wily bandit leader throughout the Sierra Madre, while trying not to get lost, destroy your horses, or get into trouble with the local carrancistas.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Golden Ei
description:
Can you get the bunny trio to the Golden Ei inn before the fox catches up to them?

In Golden Ei, you win or lose together. To set up, shuffle the 28 double-sided trail cards, flipping half the deck repeatedly to randomize which sides are face up, then lay out the cards in a trail with the Golden Ei inn card at one end and the Fox at the other. Place the bunnies 8-10 spaces away from the fox depending on how difficult you want the game to be, with each bunny on their own card.

To start, roll the die, then move the matching colored bunny (blue, red, yellow) forward one space. Next, choose the closest vacant trail card either in front of or behind the bunny just moved, then flip it. If the card shows 1-2 eggs in yellow, red, or blue, move the matching bunny forward 1-2 spaces, then once again flip over the closest vacant trail card either in front of or behind the bunny just moved. If you instead reveal 1-3 fox paws, move the fox forward 1-3 spaces, then pass the die to the next player, who rolls the die to start a new turn.

If the fox lands on a bunny, you lose, but if any bunny first lands on the inn, then they all reach safety!

Golden Ei includes six helper cards, such as a dice squirrel and a taxi stork, that you can add to the game. You start only 6-8 spaces away from the fox, but each helper animal provides a one-time benefit that will ideally keep you out of the fox's jaws.

name: Zoo Police
description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2015/2016 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.
For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

There are no unsolvable mysteries for the Zoo Police detectives!
The Zoo Police know no impossible crimes, but when they are perpetrated by Zebras and Rhinos, they sure are unlikely crimes! Framing the real culprits will be a challenge!
1 – Play your Suspects in secret.
2 – Score points by guessing the other players’ Suspects.
3 – Get the Crime cards up for grabs, but watch out: you can only keep three types!
Who will be the best “zoocop”?

In Zoo Police every player is an animal-policeman. At the beginning of each round there are formed four rows of Crimes represented by cards. Each row may consist of one or several cards. When the Crimes are known the players place their Suspect cards simultaneously face-down one card per row. Now we're moving to the guessing phase. Each player in her turn gets one guess and says what's the value (from 1 to 5) of chosen opponent's Suspect card. If the guess is right the Suspect is removed and the player who guessed correctly receives a point card. If the guess is wrong the card stays face-up and nothing happens. When each card is turned face-up or removed the Crime phase occurs. The player that placed the highest Suspect card in each row gets the appropriate row of Crime card(s). In case of a tie the tied cards are removed and the next high wins if any.

After several rounds the players score the points for the best three types of Crime cards that they gathered plus the bonuses for right guessing. The player who scored the most points is the winner.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dream Team
description: Dream Team is a communication game in which members of team create lists of items, then try to get their teammates to surf the same thought waves in order to guess these items.

name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Warlords
description:
A Samuri vs. Samurai battle in the setting of AD&D Oriental Adventures. One player plays Prince Matabei, the rebel commander. The other player plays Lord Kenshin, the Daimyo of Tsuke.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

name: Der kleine König und seine Freunde
description:
The little king and his friends want to paint a pretty picture for his aunt on her birthday, but they've misplaced all the pails of paint. Help them find the paint so that they can paint their colorful picture. Who will collect the most colors?

Der Kleine König includes simplified rules so that children as young as 3 can play, while the standard rules are for ages 7 and up.

name: Octi for Kids
description:
Modified version of original Octi especially for kids. The object of the game is to move one of your pieces onto one of your opponent's starting squares. On each move players decide whether to upgrade their existing pieces or move a piece. Simple movement and Checkers-like jumping keep players rethinking their possible strategies.
Recommended for ages 6+

name: Football
description: Table version of football. Players direct the metal ball on the play field in such way to score the goal. Players figures are placed on small springs. Goalkeepers are moving within a small lever.

name: Ale Historia!
description: It's quiz game for whole family about history of Poland since first Prince Mieszko the first till modern times.

name: Outer Rim
description:
For hundreds of years, humanity has been traveling through far galaxies. Many centuries ago humans encountered other sentient – yet alien – races, but only Kalmians were as aggressive and as technologically advanced as the descendants of the inhabitants of Earth. In the remote outer rim of the universe Tellurians and Kalmians keep fighting in their spaceships for domination. In those fierce and deadly skirmishes only a few things really count: commanders’ skills to maneuver huge astral vessels, the ability to foresee your opponent’s next move as well as wise management of energy in different ship sectors and proper assignment of power to shields and laser cannons.

Only one ship shall leave this accursed vastness of space, while the burnt-out wreck of its rival shall remain here as a warning to all enemies or a prized loot for lucky scrappers...

Outer Rim is a simple and quick, science-fiction battle game for two players. One player commands the starship of Tellurians, while the other player becomes the captain of the star vessel belonging to the alien race of Kalmians. Players wage a deadly duel in the cosmic space. Victory depends on proper allocation of energy around the starship, a little luck when rolling dice and smart use of special abilities of modules and crews.

The battle ends when one of the starships has two sectors destroyed. The commander of such vessel loses and his opponent wins!
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Gravelotte 1870
description:
Gravelotte 1870 covers the decisive battle of Gravelotte/St Privat on the 18th of August 1870 in the early stages of the Franco-Prussian War. Each player plays either the French or the Prussian in an epic battle to surround the city of Metz.

The gameplay is simple: players have their own deck of 6 cards and plan for a sequence of action each turn that will be resolved simultaneously. To support their actions they both have access to Asset cards, specific to each faction that can be triggered if the timing is right.

The design is based on the Japanese game Houten 1905, and implements some new mechanics to expand on it. It is a fast paced (5 to 15 minutes), historical bluffing game for everyone.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Tod im London-Express
description: Great Britain in the year 1936. The entire commonwealth is in excitement since Edward VIII will ascend the throne this very week. The overnight express is on its way to the capital with passengers who would like to attend the coronation. But the journey takes an unforeseen twist: The conductor is found dead in his compartment. Only one thing is certain: one of the first class travellers is the murderer...

name: Armored Knights: Operation Gazelle
description:
The Israeli offensive in Sinai / October 15 - October 24, 1973

Gazelle: Israel's most daring battle to cross the Suez Canal. General Sharon's Ugda (an Israeli Division) leads the offensive into Egypt and in a hard fought set of small fights ends up cutting off the Egyptian 3rd Army.

Armored Knights: Operation Gazelle the battle of the Israeli offensive to cross the Suez Canal and invade Africa and cut off the Egyptian Army elements that were on the east side of the canal. This game focuses on combat at the battalion level on a scale that makes representing large battles real fun. It will also have its own innovative and unique way to handle the combat mutlipliers for engineers, anti-tank, intelligence, and recon elements. The players will find this does not always work the way they want and the support troops sometimes fail to do the mission they are assigned to do. They might even have a detrimental effect. Both players will be challenged from the start of the battle. The Egyptians will find that counter-attacking is very difficult as the higher command did not beleive what they were told about the Israeli positions on the west bank of the Suez Canal. The Israelis will find that getting across the canal is one thing, holding the crossing is another, and spreading out across the west bank is another still. Players will be rewarded for mixing the different combat support elements to enhance each attack or defense. As happened during the battle the Israelis will find it very hard to attack Egyptian infantry alone or against their anti-tank screens. Six scenarios are available to play the whole battle through the cutting off of the Egyptian 3rd Army, or just some important parts dealing with the attacks on Ismailia or Suez City.

This game comes with:
(8) 11x17 Color Map Sections
(4) Color Order of Battle Cards
Approximately 600 Die Cut Counters

(from publisher's website)

name: The Great Cheese Chase
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Great Cheese Chase is on! Start with one player spinning the spinner. If you land on a 1 or 2, move any mouse forward one or two spaces. If the spinner lands on Tiger the Cat, move Tiger one space. Takes turns spinning! If Tiger lands on a mouse, that mouse goes back to the start! Land on the catnip and tuck it aside to use later to move Tiger back one space. Get all three mice to the attic before Tiger gets there and you all win!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Car Wars Reference Screen
description:
From the front cover:

"Al the charts, tables, and diagrams you need for CAR WARS adventures - plus a new super-detailed collision system - on one convenient screen. Bonus insert: new large-sized vehicle and pedestrian record sheets!

Compiled by the staff of Autoduel Quarterly"

Steve Jackson Games product number 7108
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare

name: Autokrator Mini Expansion
description:
This expansion contains 6 new cards for use in Autokrator.

The 6 battle cards of the Neutral Generals.
These cards are used for the attacks (raids) of the Neutral Generals.

The 6 battle cards of the Neutral Areas. (already in the base game)
These cards are used for the defense of the Neutral Areas.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management

name: Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata"
description:
User summary
キズナと螢の物語 (Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata") is a story of boys and girls who fight against insane gods, consuming their lives.

Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata" is a co-operative game. Players are members of Luciola cruciata, the defending organization. Their goal is to defend their town against invaders from nowhere, named Old Rebellion.

With multiple scenarios and multiple characters to choose from, this game can be played many times.

Be one of the characters and experience their battles.

Published in Japanese and English,the game plays like a mix of Pandemic and Tragedy Looper, with the characters having special abilities and playing through scenarios. This allows for solitaire play. The game has been turned into a theatrical show and has been performed on stage in Japan.

Publisher's summary
少年少女たちは命を燃やして戦い続ける――
狂った神と戦う、少年少女たちの物語。

「キズナと螢の物語」の目的は、旧穢神（オールド・リベリオン）の手から街を守ることです。
対抗組織「ルキオラ・クルキアタ」に所属する仲間（他プレイヤー）たちと協力し、目の前の戦いを乗り越えましょう。
キャラクター選択、シナリオ選択によってプレイ感覚も難易度も大きく変わるため、何度でも遊べます。
さあ、いますぐ少年少女たちの戦いを”追体験”しましょう。
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Wyatt Earp
description: You are in Jolly Town. You need stock from all businesses in Jolly Town. Some ways to get stocks are serious, others are illegal. You fight against the other players with dice.

name: Get Hooked
description:
A light card & board game that simulates a fun day on the water fishing for that trophy fish. Players can take one of three actions on their turn (move their boat, change their lure, or catch a fish). If you have the right lure and are at the right part of the lake, you are able to play fish cards to win. Other cards allow you to thwart your opponents' actions with cards like "Broken Line".

A fun concept that is easy to grab on to. Perfect for the person who enjoys fishing and may or may not enjoy a good game as well.

name: Therapie: Jetzt oder nie
description:
( First of all: Excuse me for my bad english )

Therapie is a Game where Doctors ( Psychatrists ) have to heal their Patients. But it all depends on the Money, cause Money rules the World and even a Psychatrist will have a part of the wealth.
You better don´t take this Game too serious, it isn´t meant this way.
You can give your Patients Psycho Drops to improve healing chances...........or kill them with these drops....shit happens.
There are different kinds of Therapys and different possibilities for success, it´s all on you Doctor !
And there may be this one Patient, send to you by another Doctor in order to destroy your prestige.
It´s just a Fun Game !

name: Car Wars Deluxe Road Sections Set 1: Starter Set
description:
This is one of three sets of road sections for Car Wars. Owning all three parts gives you huge flexibility in laying out regular or "autobahn" style tracks. Set 1: Starter Set includes 5 double-sided sheets of regular curves, tight curves and straight road sections along with counters.

Expands:

Car Wars

name: Go With The Flow
description:
A ship loaded with treasure has been wrecked near your island.

Whirlpools, storms and sharks lie amongst the changing currents between your island and the wreck. Instruct your pirates to build rafts and salvage treasure from the wreck or steal it by attacking other player's rafts!

This is a quick tile turning game suitable for 2-4 players from age 8.

(Publisher Blurb, Copyright 2011)

name: Артефактум (Artefactum)
description:
Artefactum – strategic card game in the mystical Sigillum universe, in which players are pitted against each other until only one remains.

Hire and level up your heroes to expand and adapt your army to everchanging situation.
Summon creatures on the battlefield to utilize their attacks and unique abilities.
Combine heroes. Characters of same faction or class grant access to powerful artifacts that can tip the battle in your favour.
Utilize efficient formations. Each unit has predetermined combat behavior - similar to auto battler systems.

name: Tofu God
description:
Tofu God is a party game of story snippets.

You will use cards showing silhouettes, mostly of animals, in an attempt to fill out the proverbial blanks you are dealt in the form of questions. Meanwhile, everybody else will try to intuit your answers and, more importantly, also which silhouettes you have chosen to represent them.

When it is your turn, you will answer one of two randomly drawn conundrums. To do this you will have eight of your ten silhouettes to pick from. For each of the three questions that make up your conundrum you will secretly decide on the best and the worst answer from your point of view. Question by question, everyone else will try to guess your favorite answer. Whenever someone is correct, both you and that player will get a point. However, if a player mistakenly thinks that your least favorite answer might be your favorite one, that player loses one point. The game ends when everyone has had the same amount of turns. If you manage to earn the most points, you win.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Synapse-Ice
description:
An Icehouse game in which players alternate turns playing pieces onto a 5×6 grid. Each piece must be played in the spot "pointed to" by the previous piece, and must point at an empty square. The first player unable to make a valid move, loses.

Synapse-Ice was designed by Joseph Kisenwether and tied for 4th in the Winter 2005 Icehouse Game Design Competition. It was inspired by Pierre Berloquin's Le Synapse.

The rules are available at icehousegames.org.

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Reviewer/Tom Vasel
description:
Tom Vasel Dice Tower 2013 Kickstarter funding campaign promo character for Pixel Tactics

The Game Reviewer/ Tom Vasel brings dice to Pixel Tactics. Depending how the card is played, the card has the ability to add 1d6 to attacks, give 2 extra actions or reduce a hero's life to the difference between 2d6. Played as the starting hero (Tom Vasel) there is a chance to rout opposing units.

Finally played as a single time effect, it lets you challenge your opponent to another 2-player game, allowing the winner to destroy three heroes of his choice.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Pass the Pasta
description:
Grab matching pasta shapes from the grid to make tasty sets in this simple, yet strategic card game!

On their turn, a player can either collect card(s) from the grid or bank 1-7 matching cards from their hand. As no one starts the game with cards, everyone must collect from the grid on their first turn.

Collect card(s) from the row and column that the chef's hat is on. If there are multiple matching cards, you get to take all of them (as long as it doesn't take you over 7 cards in your hand!). Draw new cards to replace the card(s) you collect, and move the chef's hat token to a newly placed card. All cards, apart from the card underneath the chef's hat, are face up. Instead of selecting the available face up cards, players can choose to take the mystery face down card underneath the chef's hat.

Collect the biggest sets, while cunningly moving the chef's hat to stop other players grabbing the pasta they want. Create the same set as another player and you can shout "Pass the Pasta" and steal one of their cards... but be careful not to lose points by making things too al dente! Whenever you bank less than 3 cards, you must take the al dente token and place it in front of you.

The game ends as soon as the draw pile runs out. Each banked card is worth 1 point at the end of the game. The player with the al dente token must minus 2 points from their score. Whoever has the most points, wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Ultimate Werewolf: Inquisition – Full Moon
description:
In Ultimate Werewolf: Inquisition – Full Moon, the full moon is rising, and when it does many of the players will get new abilities. As soon as one werewolf is killed, the players have a new option each turn; instead of visiting the home of a resident, they can use the ability that the full moon gives them...but only once per game.

Full Moon includes a full moon card and six new player Inquisitor cards — three new werewolf team roles, two new villager team roles, and a brand new team role, the Purist — each with a unique full moon ability.

name: Chief Surprise
description:
[from the instructions]
Hours of sunshine for a rainy day

Early peoples in every part of the world harvested from riverbanks, oceans, fields and forests, what brought them life and happiness. Games were fashioned from everything imaginable, often from the same objects that brought them food.

Wherever people have organized socially, whether in bands, tribes, nation or nations, they have usually sought to develop knowledge, tools, and resources, in order to increase the harvest and standard of living for all, from one generation to the next.

Chief Surprise uses the symbols for wealth, and the tools of implement, rewarding each when correctly applied.

name: Le Jardin Fou
description: This is a children's tile laying game published in French. Players construct a garden from tiles containing ladybugs (that grant a player an extra turn), various fruits, grains and nuts. There also ways to make other players lose a turn if they don't have the right tile. The first player to use all their tiles wins.

name: Rise and Decline of Hitler's Empire
description:
In Rise and Decline of Hitler's Empire, players play strategic war in the Europe in WW2.

Contents:
160 Counters
42 x 59 cm map (printed in Japanese)
16 page Rulebook (printed in Japanese)

Europe, North Africa, Turkey and Soviet Union are printed in a map.
Turn length: 6 months
Unit Size: Army and Fleet.
No. of Players: 1-2
Playing Time: 2-3
Solitaire Suitability: High (on a scale of Low-Medium-High)
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Sho-Kikaku

name: Tiger Island
description:
You and three friends are trapped on a tiny island. Also on the island is a 30 foot tall tiger armed with a giant club. You spin the tiger, and suddenly he locks onto one of your locations. You have to fling a marble into the tiger's mouth before he bops you on the head with the giant club.

Obviously a toy/dexterity game, but with a cool giant tiger.

name: The Mission
description: The Mission is an exciting new Christian collectible card game based on modern Christian life with all its challenges and rewards. Players take part in The Mission of life as they reach out to the lost, pursue their relationship with God and guard themselves against the works of the enemy.

name: SSN: Modern Tactical Submarine Warfare
description:
SSN: Modern Tactical Submarine Warfare, is a simulation of modern tactical submarine/anti-submarine warfare set in 1970-1979. Players each direct 1 to 17 ships or submarines (with associated helicopters) over a plain hex map to recreate cold war naval doctrine.

The players plot movement and missions for their units secretly before moving, attempting detection, evading and attacking simultaneously.

Three peacetime and nine wartime scenarios are included. Vessels range from Soviet SS to US CVN types. British, Canadian and French units are also represented.

The combat system is based on an odds-based CRT with different effects for nuclear and conventional weapons systems.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 6 minutes
Hex: 1000 yards / 914 meters
Units: Individual Ships, Submarines & Helicopters

Solitaire Playability: Low
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Abandon Ship!
description:
Bonus game from Dragon Magazine #273.

Cards can be discarded or used in a battle. When the draw deck is empty, the ship sinks, and there is a showdown to see who ends up in which lifeboat. Points are totaled for the hand, and multiple hands add up to a game target of 200.

A variation for 6-8 players and two decks is included.

Components are the rules and a "battle mat" depicting the pirate ship and lifeboats. Illustrations by John Kovalic.

From the intro paragraph:

The rats are long gone, but you're still here. You and your greedy pirate pals are hustling around the deck of a sinking pirate ship, trying to scoop up as much treasure as you can hold. You've got to have a little treasure to buy your way into a lifeboat, and the best lifeboats are the ones with the most treasure in them. It's kind of complicated. Then again, maybe you're just not very smart.
publishers: Arclight Games, Cheapass Games, Paizo Publishing

name: Chess on the Loose
description: Four games in one, this is no ordinary chess set. Take Chess to a whole new level! Add a new challenge to your game by adding the Frankencheck monster to the board in Frankencheck. Dig for treasures and uncover special points in Treasure Chessed. Or win UFO Spell Check by collecting letters, spell words, and add bonus words to the board. You may never want to play chess the same again!

name: Tomoko
description:
Tomoko ... a convoluted ball-rolling game for 2-4 sophisticated tacticians - that includes: 1 game board, 30 wooden balls, 36 pattern cards, 1 cotton bag, large print instructions.

Each player receives two pattern cards - both of which show a pattern of 9 balls.

Players try to achieve their patterns by pushing balls onto the board.

The card is laid on the table, by the player, each time a pattern is completed.
3 x 3 balls forms an ideal combination.

Thinking ahead before moving, to see the right pattern forming, will win the game - which ends when one player has collected 10 (5 or 3) pattern cards.

name: Ratzolino
description:
This game for Ages 3 and up and premiered at Essen 2000.

Included are 19 various wooden play figures, mainly animals, and 10 game markers.

In the first game the pieces are laid out in plain sight of all. An older player reads a story and when any of the figures is named, each player tries to be the first to grab it. If the figure has already been named, the player takes a marker instead. At the end of the story the player with the most pieces wins.

In the second game, the pieces are laid out in an order and the player must identify them to get a point.

The last game is one of remembering which pieces have been named.

It is similar to the earlier Ratz-Fatz and some of the scenarios can be used to make a larger combined game, so in some ways this is an expansion kit.

Integrates with:

Ratz-Fatz

name: Race Master
description:
This is a Swedish racing game, endorsed by the former F1-driver Reine Wisell. The race track is filled with squares, but you drive on the crossed line points. The steering mechanism is a simple grid, on which you move your marker according to where you want the car to be after your next move. You can have up to four players racing or you can race against a clock, that counts your number of moves.
The game contains the rules, one race track, 4 cars (plus 4 extras), 4 markers to the gearbox/throttle, clock hands and some hay barriers to change courses or make a chicane.

name: D&D Miniatures Quick Rules
description:
A highly simplified set of miniatures rules for use with D&D Miniatures, or suitable for use with most other fantasy miniatures. The designer states he created these rules so he could play with his six year old son.

“Designer Notes: These rules are sufficient for a 6 year old. He has fun just fiddling with the figures (so do I). It should be obvious to determine unit size and type. Medium & Large units have the same size base but I consider anything larger than human as Large. Big & Huge units have the same size base but some units are noticeably larger. For now we treat Clerics as Fighters & Mages as Shooters.”

name: Enkidu: El viajero del tiempo
description:
Enkidu is a cooperative game designed by Oriol Comas i Coma, and developed by Ibermática, a Spanish enterprise.

Enkidu is a historian from the future that travels in a time machine to the past to discover a great secret. To achieve his goal, he must decode the clues hidden in Sumerian clay tiles marked with cuneiform signs.

During the game the players are characters from around the hero, and they will try to get new tiles to discover the enigma hidden in the tile. To fulfill their challenge they must compete, but also collaborate, helping each other and negotiating, as well as to take on risks and make decisions.

The game has two phases: the initiation phase to the secrets of the Sumerian Gods, and the phase of the full development of the technologies that will appear in the future.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Zozzle
description:
Zozzle challenges players to complete a nine-piece puzzle before any opponent, but players will need a good memory to put all the pieces in the right place.

To start the game, the 45 tiles – five tiles each of nine different images, with the nine images combining to form a 3x3 square – are placed face down and shuffled. On a turn, a player turns over two tiles. If the images match and that player doesn't already have that image in her puzzle, she claims one of the tiles, turns the other face down, and takes another turn. If the images don't match or the player has previously claimed that tile, she turns the two tiles face down and ends her turn. Finish your image before anyone else, and you win.

name: Trip 50
description: Choose one of the 50 United States as your "takeoff" state to begin a "Trip of Cards" across the U.S.A.! The object of Trip 50® is to play a series of Trip Cards in a connecting chain. Each card played must share a border with the takeoff state or with another Trip Card already played. The first person to properly play all of his cards goes "Trip 50®" and wins the round! Players then continue with several rounds of play. The first player to score 250 points wins the game! (From the rules sheet)

name: Horde of the Dead Minigame
description:
You are Giraffe the hero of this game and you arrived in a small inn. Suddenly during the night something was attacking the inn. It’s a horde of ZOMBIES!!!. Nobody survive except you and the inn keeper’s daughter, Mari-chan. Survive the game in 3 nights without anyone dying.

This game is inspired by the genre tower of defense, where a horde of zombie, comes and attack the inn wave by wave. Your job is to control Giraffe, Mari-chan and occasionally Dogmeat by moving them through the inn, defending against the zombies, set barricade, buy stuff to upgrade and protecting Mari-chan while surviving yourself.

You need at least 1 six sided-die (the more the faster the game goes), 4 counters(different kind or colour) in which 1 of them represent zombie (which you need at least 7), a pencil and an eraser to jot down equipment, hp, bp and so on.

download the game here http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2010/11/horde-of-...
categories: Animals, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Role Playing

name: Monkey Queen
description:
Monkey Queen is a two-player game, played on a 12x12 checkerboard. The board is initially set up with two queens - one stack of 20 for each player, set on the 'F' and 'G' files on opposite sides of the board.

A monkey queen captures exactly like a Chess queen. Slide in any direction along a straight line of unoccupied squares ending with the capture of an enemy piece.

When not capturing, a queen moves any distance in any direction, again like a Chess queen, except it leaves its bottom checker behind on the originating square, reducing its stack height by one. The queen monkey has thus given birth to a baby monkey.

A monkey baby, like a monkey queen, captures exactly like a Chess queen.

Babies also have a non-capture move. During non-capturing moves, babies must move closer to the enemy queen.

You win if you capture the enemy queen, or deprive your opponent of moves.

.

name: Exile Sun: Tech Interrupt Cards
description:
This is a set of supplemental technology cards that were only available to those who pledged to support the "Exile Sun" project on Kickstarter.

These cards will add a little variety to the base game. The standard technology cards that come with Exile Sun are one time use abilities that players can buy and then use on their turn to gain different advantages in many categories. The details of this standard set of tech cards are outlined on the back of the Exile Sun rulebook.

The Kickstarter exclusive reward Tech Interrupt Cards are different in that they are termed 'interrupt' other tech cards. They allow players to effect the game outside their own turns. Using these cards will be an optional variant to the base game. Shuffled in among the regular Tech cards, these Kickstarter only cards will be rare, but when used at the right time, they provide some additional interaction and strategic planning.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Эй! Это моя рыба!
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Эй! Это моя рыба! is a non-authorized version of Hey, That's My Fish!. According to designer Günter Cornett, Zvezda issued this game without credit to him nor Alvydas Jakeliunas, thus it is set apart from the official entry of Hey, That's My Fish!.




Players catch fish by moving penguins around the play areas, claiming fish tile they leave at the start of their turn. Pieces must move in a straight line and cannot cross voids, and thus the game board becomes smaller and the options fewer as the game progresses.

This edition has fewer penguins than the original (13 each instead of 16) and adds a shark figure that moves according to a die roll and a six-point compass printed on a board. A player loses a fish whenever one of their penguins encounters the shark.

name: Warcard: Afganistan
description:
Warcard: Afganistan is a two player card game. One player will play as Talibans, the other as a group of Polish soldiers who get ambushed by the Afghans.

Before the game each player will pick several characters that will represent his forces. The goal of the game is to gain victory points by killing the opponents characters. Stronger characters will be of more use during the game but will also give the opponent more points once killed.

The game lasts four rounds and each round last three phases:

- Straighten + draw phase
Each player straightens his characters so he can use them in the new round. Also each player draws cards until they have four cards in hand.

- Action phase
In the action phase players can perform actions until both of them decide to pass. For an action they can play a card from their hand (events or attachments), use an ability of a character or shoot using one of their characters. Each character can shoot once per action phase.
When a character shoots players form an "exchange fire" pool by adding into it two "miss" cards and as many "hit" cards as is indicated on the shooting characters card. Now players can manipulate the "exchange fire" pool by playing cards that add either "hit" or "miss" cards. When both players don't want to play anymore cards they randomly pick one card from the pool. If it is a "miss" nothing happens, if it is a "hit" the shot character loses one life point. If his life points are reduced to 0 he dies and victory points are awarded.

- Discard phase
Each player may discard one card from his hand.

After the fourth round the player with the most victory points wins the game.

If players own more than one copy of Warcard: Afganistan they can build their own decks before the game.

name: Night falls in Palermo
description:
It's a deduction game in which each player takes a secret role.
There is a big variation of roles with different abilities, but the essential ones are the murderers, their spy, the cup and the victims.

The game starts and the cup knows one murderer and the spy. Each day after discussion players vote to lynch one player, who is eliminated without making known his identity, and without participating for the rest of the game. After the day, during the night murderers show to the already eliminated players, who they are killing.

Game ends if all murderers are killed, or if the number of murderers is the same with all the 'good' players.

name: Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge: Bonus Promo Cards
description:
Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge — Bonus Promo Cards are five additional Trend Cards for use in Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge.

The five additional Trend Cards include: Montezuma's Revenge, Dia De Los Muertos, Circus Circus, Artsy Fartsy, and A Pirate's Life For Me.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building

name: 10 UP!
description:
From the publisher:

Stack them if you can! A clever game of quick thinking with numbers - race to be the first to stack all your number tiles in sequence.

1. Distribute all the tiles, face down, evenly amongst all players.
2. All players look at their own tiles and when they turn over a "1" place it face up in the middle of the players.
3. Players all play at the same time to stack them into piles of 1 to 10.

The aim is to get rid of all your tiles as quickly as you can. Players race to put 2 on a 1, 3 on a 2 and so on. Stacks complete from 1 to 10. The winner is the first player with 3 tiles or fewer left.

name: Mega Man: The Board Game – Proto Man Expansion
description:
Before Dr. Light created Mega Man, he made DLN-000 - Proto Man! Now is your chance to use this character to battle the forces of Dr. Wily.

Contents:
1 Proto Man Figure + Character Card
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Nimbee: The Bee's Knees
description:
Nimbee: The Bee's Knees is a small expansion for the Nimbee base game that consists of five new bonus cards to swap in to offer a new balance to in-game decisions.

The Bee's Knees deck was developed by BGG users in an August 2017 competition to create new bonus cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Kwis 't!
description:
Kwis ‘t! is a quizgame with a twist. You are able to win without answering most questions correct. You win Kwis ‘t! by psychology, knowing your facts and a little luck. Every player answers the same five questions per round. After the correct answers have been given to you, you put your marker on how many questions you’ve answered correct. However, you can bluff! You can earn bonus by fooling your opponents and by calling a bluff of an opponent. Use your reputation as a walking encyclopaedia or a notorious braggart. If you outsmart your opponents, you win Kwis ‘t!

Kwis ‘t! is Dutch for Quiz it. If you pronounce it fast, it sounds like ‘I knew it’ (In Dutch). The game has easy game rules and contains lots of verbal and non-verbal interaction.

Kwis ‘t! has more than 1.150 original questions in all different kinds of categories. Every set of five questions consists of two open questions, two multiple choice questions (with A, B and C) and one 50/50 question. If you don’t know the answer, you can still make an educated guess. You guessed wrong? You can still bluff that you gave the correct answer.

name: Slap Down!
description:
50 Cards - 25 pairs matched by colors and shapes. Spread them across the table and grab the two dice, one for colors and one for shapes. Roll the dice and be the first player to slap both cards of the matching shape and color shown on the dice, then add them to your collection. Sounds easy enough, right?

Think youre ahead? Just wait! If the cards that match the dice arent still in the middle of the table then theyre around the edge, in somebodys collection. Other players collections still fair game! Protect your collection as you slap your opponents pairs away from them and into your collection.

—description from the publisher

name: カラフルピラミッド (Colorful Pyramid)
description:
User summary
カラフルピラミッド (Karafuru Piramiddo) (Colorful Pyramid) is a Japanese card game which can be played solitaire. As the Pharaoh falls ill, the possible heirs to the throne each builds a pyramid for the Pharaoh. The player who builds the biggest and tallest pyramid shall be the next Pharaoh.

In the game of Colorful Pyramid, you build a four-tier pyramid with stone cards.

There are 64 stone cards in the game, each of which has a color and a number. At the beginning of the game, each player has four stone cards in front of them as bottom tier of their pyramid.

Each turn, you may take one stone card from the six revealed cards. To do so, you must use the power of your stones. Rotate or discard at least two of your cards so that the bottom digit of the total of these cards is equal to the number of the card to be taken.

When you add a stone at second tier or above, look at the two stones immediately below it. Both must share its color or number with the stone to be added.

Instead of taking a stone card, you may rest and return all your rotated stones to upright position.

You win the game when you have made a perfect four-tier pyramid. When the stone deck runs out, the player whose pyramid is closest to perfect is the winner.

Your goal is simple: complete a four-tier pyramid, but to do so, you have many aspects to consider. You must plan ahead, or other players will go ahead of you. Watching your stones built into a colorful pyramid will satisfy your eyes.

Publisher's summary
ピラミッドを４段まで積み上げる単純明快な目的ですが色と数字の縛りが効いており考え所はたくさんです。計画的に石を購入しなければ兄弟（他のプレイヤー）達に先を越されてしまうでしょう。石を積み上げていく視覚的充足感は楽しさを彩ってくれるでしょう！

name: Top Spot
description:
Top Spot is a multi-player card game for 3-5 players that features cards with holes. Players score points and win rounds by strategically combining cards to create value. The player with the highest point total at the end wins.

—description from the publisher

name: ガニメデ戦記 (The War Chronicles of Ganymede)
description:
ガニメデ戦記 (Ganimede Senki) The War Chronicles of Ganymede is a Japanese deck-building game.

A large-scale war broke out over Jupiter's resources, splitting the world in two. Control the weapons known as Mechs and destroy your enemies.

Fight as either the Red Faction or the Green Faction in this deck-building battle game. The system is based on Blackjack. As the game progresses the number of Mechs you control with special abilities increases. The number of cards you use will damage your opponent, and victory is yours if you can reduce your opponent's HP to 0.
Can you survive the foreseeable future?

木星の資源をめぐり、世界を二分する大戦争が勃発した。
メックと呼ばれる兵器をあやつり、敵をせん滅せよ。

このゲームは赤と緑の陣営に分かれて戦う、デッキ構築型対戦ゲームです。
ブラックジャックをベースとしたシステムで、ゲームが進むにつれて特殊効果のあるメックが増えていきます。
使ったカードの枚数が相手へのダメージとなり、相手のヒットポイントを0にしたら勝ちです。

君は生き延びることができるか。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Fast Flip Pizza
description: Fast paced card game where you race to find the match between the symbols printed on the fronts and backs of cards.

name: TIMETRAP
description:
タイムトラップ (TIMETRAP) is a card game from Japan.

In the year 2X77, humans have developed a time machine that can travel to the distant past for seven days. However, the past environment was terrifyingly harsh for those who went back in time. The physical phenomena in the surroundings are not stable, and it is necessary to keep the time machine running in order to keep the existence of the time traveler stable.

If the time machine stops, the existence of the time traveler disappears into emptiness. If you can safely reach the seventh day, you can return to the future. Return earlier than anyone else and share the experience with the world!

『2X77年』人類は遠い過去の7日間を旅する事が出来るタイムマシンを開発した。しかし、時を遡り過去に戻った者にとって過去の環境は恐ろしく過酷だった。周囲の物理現象は安定せず、タイムトラベラーの存在を安定的に存続させる為にはタイムマシンを稼働させ続ける必要がある。もしタイムマシンが停止したなら、タイムトラベラーの存在は『虚無』へと消える。 無事に7日目を迎えることが出来れば、未来へ帰還が可能だ。誰よりも早く帰還し、その経験を世界に伝えよ！
publisher's summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Player Elimination, Trick-taking
