name: Penny Dreadfun Second Edition: The Great London Adventure
description:
Penny Dreadfun (Second Edition) is the new game set in Penny Dreadfun universe - made with new and exciting mechanics and art!

Queen Victoria disappeared. Armed with a sword, two axes, throwing knives, and a pistol, she jumped out of the Buckingham’s Palace window, straight into the darkness of the night. The rumours say that the queen was bored and decided to conquer a new colony – Hell itself. There must be something going on because London is getting quite… hot. And there are more and more infernal hounds around and no one to clean after them. And more infernal chasms… and portals… Whew!

It sounds like a true adventure.

Penny Dreadfun: Second Edition will take you to the year 1888, to Victorian England, full of occultism, British humour, and more or less historical characters. You play as one of many unusual heroes, who – driven by various motives – set off to the city to find the source of disaster and save the world, which is becoming more and more taken over by forces of hell.

Join The Adventure

Action-packed adventure with British humour: Penny 2nd Edition offers various game modes – story driven campaign, co-op boss rush mode and an open world experience. All this takes place in the world of Penny Dreadfun – Victorian England full of geek jokes and crazy historical gags.
But there’s more – Joke’s on You mechanic will blast you with humour… literally. This game will mess with you, or mess you up.

Unique Game System

Penny Dreadfun 2nd Edition is an adventure game where everything is based on your decisions thanks to the unique game system – create your custom hero class deck during the playthrough and use it well to move through London streets, fulfill quests, collect items and plot with encountered characters. Also the fights driven by the PD card system are simple, dynamic and they plays just like rolling dices but without randomness!

New approach to move and board mechanics

With each round the world known to us (or at least to those who are well over 120 years old) is getting more and more infernal. This will be reflected in the constantly changing board with playable 3D elements. That’s a completely new take on the point-to-point move system.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Market, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Pact Winter
description:
We hate the cold in winter, so we want to complete the winter tasks as quickly as possible so that we can retreat into the warmth.

Pact Winter, an expansion for Pact, you can play the game with up to six players. Various new winter tasks and winter specialists promise a dramatic endgame.

—description from the publisher

name: リアルタイムデコイ (Realtime Decoy)
description:
A fully cooperative game for 2-4 players. Non-turn-based, real-time progression! Don't try and rush things, work together aim to win together! With 89 cards and over 60 quests this RPG-style board game can be played over and over again for a long time!

How to win
Players must work together to complete all events.
When a player loses all the lives in their hand, everyone loses and suffers consequences.
If you're in too much of a hurry and have four TEKI cards in your hand, everyone loses and suffers consequences.

How to Play:
The game begins with everyone being dealt four different cards: enemy, life, recovery, and camp. Then deal out the deck to all players. Cards can be played by any player at any time (real-time) to try complete/defeat the events and advance the track token. There is no turn order. Players can also gain skill card to help them in the events.

How the cards work
An enemy card will reduce a decoy's life.
When a camp card is played, players can discuss and choose who is the decoy.
Play two enemy cards and the event progresses.
Save the decoys with a recovery card.

name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Boss Bake-Off 3
description:
A 3-Card Solo Expansion for Arcane Bakery Clash.

SETUP
Select one of the Contessa cards and place it face up. Place the other two cards face-down on either side, these are Contessa's moves. Place a coin at the top of Contessa's energy track.

Remove the Cheesequake and Omen Biscotti cards. Shuffle the remaining recipe cards.

HOW TO PLAY
Play using the standard game rules, adding the rules listed below:

At the start of Contessa's turn, move down each time track by 1. If a time track is at 0, take the action shown, then remove the coin. After removing time tracks, roll 1 die. If a die matches a move that doesn't have a coin on its time track, place one on the highest number of the track.

VICTORY
If Contessa has 0 energy and you still have any, you win. If you are ever reduced to 0 energy, you lose.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Serealian
description: Serealian is a trick-taking game about collecting cards with different cereal grains on them. There are only 12 cards in the game.

name: Murder Mystery: A World of Dreams and Secret Love
description:
Murder Mystery Game is an experiential mystery game where the player becomes a strange character and aims to solve riddles and cases.

Each player has a character, and setting materials containing secrets unique to that character are provided. Through information exchange with other players, the truth of the incident was revealed.

name: Hamilcar: First Punic War
description: HAMILCAR, set during the first conflict between Rome and Carthage, known as the First Punic War, is a companion game to HANNIBAL, sharing components and using similar mechanics. It introduces a naval system and naval battles. Both players compete for control of the world’s primary sea, in a conflict which will be described as the first war between an elephant and a whale - the struggle of a land-based empire versus the world’s naval power. Rome's goal was to break out through the island chain of Sicily, Corsica and Sardinia - Carthage's defensive line to contain Rome on the Italian peninsula.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Christmas Eve: The Race to Help Santa
description:
Description from the designer:

Christmas Eve, The Race to Help Santa will be the go-to Christmas board game for players around the world.

We have one goal: to be a fun filled, Christmas board game for families and friends alike - a game that becomes an annual tradition.

Not only will Christmas Eve, The Race to Help Santa appeal to families and children alike, but a variation of the rules will also allow for more adult versions of the game play.

Christmas Eve, The Race to Help Santa is more than just a dice rolling game; it includes mini games, challenges and card duelling as well, creating an intensive, fun and competitive Christmas experience that can be tailored to the age of the players.

The Game Concept

Here is an introduction to some of the detail behind the game mechanics:

Objective of the Game

Reach Santa first, with a minimum of 4 presents that you've found, fought for or won on your journey to the North Pole
Move around the board via the dice, player interactions and by completing game tasks

Interactions with other players

You can work with other players to help you achieve your ultimate goal of reaching Santa and winning the game (co-op Vs. the Grinch), or use the mini games and your card deck to try to sabotage other players and take their presents. Winners earn their Christmas wish, which they declare at the start of the game.

Interactions with the board and mini-quests:

As well as the classic board game and board game spaces you could expect, Christmas Eve, The Race to Help Santa goes further to include strategy, fighting, collaboration and challenges. Some of the mini games include:

Card Battling: where playing cards you have collected can be used to fight with other players with the goal of stealing presents.
Avalanche: where you can roll a snowball in an attempt to knock down a player's piece - allowing you to take their presents.
High-Low Bridges: where you must correctly guess the next card to be turned.
The Dark Cave: close your eyes and try to get through the cave with your presents.
Present Throwing: throw your presents to the catcher piece on the mini-game, each catch gets one of your presents across the frozen lake.
Snowman Sleigh Ride: roll a ball to knock down at least 3 snowmen to make it to the bottom and continue with the game.
Interactive Player Challenges: move away from standard board game etiquette and complete a Christmas themed challenge to enter the North Pole.

The game, its goal, challenges and quests exist to put you and your fellow players in the spirit of Christmas whilst providing a fun and rewarding gaming experience. We are now working on the song play-list to go with the game.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Legacy: Gears of Time – Kickstarter Backer Promo Card
description:
The Kickstarter Technology Card is an exclusive promo card for Legacy: Gears of Time given to people who backed the project on Kickstarter. This technology card is added to the deck and can be played like any other technology, provided the prerequisites to do so are met:


The Internet 6
Radio
Electricity

Logic
Printing Press
Writing


Currency 4
Writing
Mining
Basic Tools
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: West of Africa Extra
description:
Contains one wooden ship ("pirate ship") and four large cardboard tiles plus rules in German and English for the game.

All five "extra" items may be incorporated into the base game separately or altogether.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Aquitaine: Strategy and the Medieval War Ride
description:
A simulation of the Black Prince's campaigning in south-western France, 1355-6. Published within A Book of Sandhurst Wargames.

Aquitaine is a game for two players which simulates the strategic operations of English and French armies during a part of the Hundred Years' War. The game is quick and simple to play, despite the apparent bulk of the rules.

Scale: 10 day turns, 12 mile hexes.


1 die
6 Tactical posture cards
2 time marker counters
9 English Unit counters incl. command, siege train & fighting units
12 French main army unit counters incl. command, siege train & fighting units
14 French local unit counters - fighting units
16 Garrison counters
24 Baggage Train counters


Society of Ancients published a version of the game in 1998. This version, although faithful to the original, has been updated with a larger map and improved illustrations.

name: Play 5
description:
Play 5 is a game that combines mechanics from scrabble and poker.

Players create interlocking poker themed hands in a crossword fashion to attain the highest hand score to win the other player's chips. The hand scores are achieved by adding the face values on the tiles and strategizing to take advantage of the bonus squares on the board, that multiply the tile or hand values.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Math
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Sports Franchise
description:
Sports Franchise is the board game that makes every player the owner of a major league Sports Franchise. Your luck and competitive instinct will be tested while you attempt to become the most successful owner.

The object of the game is to become the wealthiest Franchise Owner. This is done by shaping your original team of rookies into stars and by acquiring money, stadiums, concession stands, and souvenir stands. You will build your Franchise on the board's outside track and play a scheduled series of games against your opponents on the inside track. When the regular season is over and a championship game has been played, the Franchise Owner that has accumulated the most wealth will be the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Trading
publishers: Irwin Toy Ltd., Lamark Games Inc.

name: Ko-An
description:
Richard Breese in Sumo 16/17/18:

The Ko-An board comprises of thirty six octagonal green spaces, interlinked with twenty five square yellow spaces and surrounded by a red border. Each player has six octagonal and five square playing pieces and plays with either the black or the red pieces. To start the game each player's pieces are placed on the nearest two 'rows' to that player, on the spaces the same shape as the pieces. The object of the game is to get any one of your own playing pieces onto the opponent's back row.

All the playing pieces can move onto either the octagonal or the squared shaped spaces, however they can only move forward, not sideways or backwards. It should be noted that as the squared shaped spaces do not touch each other, a player cannot move directly from one squared shaped space to another. In addition, octagonal shaped pieces can capture any of the opponent's pieces standing on octagonal shaped spaces and squared shaped pieces can capture any of the opponent's pieces standing on square shaped spaces. Considering its simplicity, the game can develop in a surprising variety of ways. For example, pieces of both players may bunch up on one side of the board, several 'skirmishes' may occur all over the board, or a large stand off may arise across the center of the board. This variety adds to the attractiveness of the play.

name: Dragonsgate College: Mini-Expansion
description:
This is a mini-expansion for Dragonsgate College. It is available at conventions and in BGG Store.

This expansion consists of:
1 Professor tile
1 Apprentice tile
1 Room tile

Note: If the value of your Stealth skill drops below 0, treat it as if it was 0 for all intents and purposes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Омерзительное Средневековье (Disgusting Medieval)
description:
Disgusting Medieval is a new addition to Medieval Suffering. It will diversify your playing games with cards of new townspeople, the most vicious and disgusting characters that could only get into this fun game.

You and your friends will plunge into the trash atmosphere of the Middle Ages, where unsanitary conditions coexist with extreme religiosity, entire cities go crazy eating bread with ergot, and feudal lords settle their political differences by means of duels and assaults. Take on the role of ruler of a medieval castle and put the most devout citizens under your protection, but don't let goats among the herd of lambs: witches, heretics and other sinners. It is better to leave them to the rivals and let them suffer their own wicked wickedness!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: PiFroG
description:
Do you feel like a Pig or a Frog?
Agile and Jumper or heavy and crusher?
PiFroG allows you to be whichever you feel like being, in a easy and fast 2-player boardgame, in which 7 Frogs oppose 7 Pigs to fight for victory!
On your turn you can ROTATE OR MOVE one of your pawns.

If you ROTATE you can change the front of one pawns along one side or on the diagonal of the square.
If you MOVE you can place one pawn in the square in front of it, following the direction its front is facing


Frogs capture by "jumping", like in checkers.
Pigs capture by "crushing", like in chess.

There are defensive positions and victory conditions in the short rulesheet.
PiFroG will be premiered at Essen Fair 2009 at Angelo Porazzi Games Hall 9, Booth 30, with english rules.

Official Page in English
http://warangel.it/PFe.htm
For any info or order feel free to contact the designer Angelo Porazzi
anporaz@libero.it

January 24 2011
PiFroG published by NestorGames
www.nestorgames.com

name: Armalion
description:
Armalion is a fantasy strategy game (also known as tabletop), located in Aventuria, the world of the German role-playing game "Das Schwarze Auge" (Dark World).
One player plays an army of orcs, the other an army of knights. The playing field on which the armies are marshalled and moved, can range from a simple table to detail made landscapes.
Before the game begins, players decide which scenario is to be played. This may be a simple "last man standing"-battle, or a scenario containing certain tasks, such as to escort an important person or to defend a special building for a certain time.
Types and numbers of terrain pieces that are placed on the field, depend on the chosen scenario - the most common types are woodland, hills, roads, houses and fences.

name: Fieser Zauber
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Six brave travelers have set off to find the philosophers' stone. To do so they first have to traverse the mysterious magic wood, where a rather crazy magician with strange magic powers is hiding. He sneakily bewitches the travelers transforming them into a camel, egg or even a roast chicken.

Help the travelers transform themselves back and continue on their way! The magic dice disclose what you need to free them from the spell. You have to react in a matter of seconds and snatch the right things. Whoever is the best at snatching will also be the first to transform the six travelers back to their true selves and find the philosophers' stone.

name: Dragon Dance
description:
Who will scale up? Each player puts together a dragon by sliding cards into each other, one by one. The goal is to end up with the grandest and tallest dragon. Easy enough, if the dragon does not topple due to miscalculation of your own or an attack by another player. So beware of the spouts of fire, the lashes of tail or the trembling caused by the dragon dance! The player whose dragon overcomes the attacks and stands tallest when the cards run out wins.

The game is a simple building challenge. The cards are coasters, with slits in them, so you can slide them together and they'll hold fast fairly well - at least until the whole thing comes crashing down.

You won't lose the game (necessarily) if that happens - the game isn't over until all the cards are played. That's a nice change of pace from most dexterity games, where a crash is a loss.

—user summary

name: Escape Room Das Spiel: Isolation Demo
description:
15 Minute Demo Game for "Escape Room the Game". A double-sided flyer given out at Spiel 2019 to explain the game.

Story: You are arrested and have to break out in less then 15 minutes until you are taken to the high-security track of the prison. You are informed that your new cellmate will be none other than Daniel Cortez (a notorious member of Salvatores). Salvatores is known for not being such a fan of you and is looking to tie off some loose ends. The bottom line is that you only have 15 minutes to escape this holding cell before your life is finally over…

Install the 'Escape Room The Game' app on one of your devices and select 'Isolation'. The app provides a 15 minute countdown and a place to enter the 4 digit code you are trying to find. Have scissors, pen and paper ready. There are 5 puzzles to solve in order to determine the code.

name: Manimals: Ozeane, Küsten & Pole 1
description:
(from the rules) There are millions of different animal species world-wide, which have not even yet been studied. Likewise there are many animals living in the oceans, at the coast and pols which most people have already seen, but sometimes cannot put a name to or say much about.

GOAL OF THE GAME

Simultaneously, all of the players try to collect as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. Whoever collects the most animals wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: A Night at the Dogs
description:
Components:

Folding Game Board, Set of 6 Dogs, set of "DOG" cards, set of "FORM" cards, betting chips for 8 players, race meeting cards and instructions.

Publisher's Description:

"Its a gamble! Study the form (different for each race), check the odds (favorites don't always win) and place your bets! Betting chips are provided so you don't have to bet with real money.

Fortunes to be won or lost! By studying the odds you may have more chance of winning -but, just as in real life, the outsiders can take the race -so a lucky name or number, a whim or a fancy, can sometimes serve you just as well!

The "Dogs" run against the turn of a set of specially formulated cards which automatically adjust the odds and form, which is determined before every race, so that the outcome of each race is as predictable (and unpredictable) as in the real world of dog racing.

Each race lasts around 5-8 minute. There are 10 races per card but you can play as many races as you like as each is excitingly different and unpredictable.

This really is an exciting game and you don't know the outcome of each race until the last card is played!"

Brief Notes:

Fast and interesting wagering game. Since you can play as many races as you want, it can be as quick as 10 minutes, or an all evening game if you wish.

name: Hooyah: Navy Seals Card Game – Mission – Hostage Rescue Promo Card
description: Promo card from Essen 2012 adding another mission (scenario)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Bumpershot
description:
From the box, "The game with a thousand ways to play the angles! Bounce your puck off the bumpers and into the scoring holes....or go for a reject and cancel your opponent's score!"

This is a dexterity game, with a spring loaded launcher and rubber band bumpers all along the edges. It slightly resembles a game of shuffle board, but you must bounce the puck off the walls, as direct shots are blocked by the board.

name: Robots: Battle for the Coal Heart
description:
During a routine excavation of a coal quarry, the robot miners found a unique artifact: The Coal Heart of Unlimited Power. Any robot that possesses it for 24 hours will become all-powerful! Soon, robots from all over the world sought out the Coal Heart. Play as the greatest robot fighters in the world to capture the Coal Heart and become ALL-POWERFUL!

Robots: Battle for the Coal Heart is a fast-paced role-selection robot-building game. Seize control of the Coal Heart and syphon the health of your enemies. Will you stand as the last unbroken champion, or will you fall to the wayside with the rest of the junkyard?

Theme - Everyone plays as a robots that they build up using resources to build parts and fights with the other robots throughout the game.

Goal - To be the last unbroken (HP > 0) robot or to completely finish your robot.

Gameplay - Each round players take select an action hex that allows everyone to take an action but the player who selects it gets a perk. You can Mine, Upgrade, Fight, Gear, Capture, and Scavenge.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Sneaking Mission: Solo
description:
Sneaking Mission: Solo is a solitaire game of stealth operations. Players take control of a Special Agent, who must infiltrate the enemy base to recover the secret files, while watching out for Guards, Security Systems, and using strategic hiding places to avoid being caught!

SM:S's tiles are modular, so every mission will be different than the last.

Sneaking Mission: Solo is a free game, ready to play after printing a single page of cut-outs. Aside from that, all you'll need are a form of "blips" (such as game counters, small beads, or even loose change) and 1 two-sided coin.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Goal! Game
description:
Get together with your friends and have a Soccer match! To honor the Soccer Championship in Africa 2010 the czech author Jirka Mikoláš releases a Soccer card game, that is both easy to learn, quick to play and fun to live through! You can have a friendly match, or get more involved and play through a small championship or a series of matches!

Two starter decks are available, featuring Czech Republic vs. Germany and Slovakia vs. UK. Many nicely illustrated cards with well-known players are available... of course you would not find the exact names in newspapers ;) But you recognize them surely!

More countries will be available also for you all to mix and play with in your decks (France, Italy, Netherlands and Spain). Therefore you can play a player vs. player match, or multiplayer up to 8 people.

Dice are also featured in the game and used to get various poker-like combinations for you to score the best combination. These combinations are always compared and the better combination wins the current turn!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: İttihat
description:
İttihat ("The Union") is a strategy board game based on the power struggle between the Young Turks and Sultan Abdülhamid II in the late imperial era of Turkey. The Sultan's absolute reign has lasted 33 years and he has no intent to surrender his power. He controls his entire Empire using the spy network he created. He suspect the Young Turks would dethrone him. thus, the Sultan rules the Empire and paranoia rules the Sultan.

In İttihat, there are 3 factions: The Unionists, the Sultan Abdulhamid II and his Spies, and (with at least seven players) and the Separatists. In the game, the roles of unionists and spies are hidden, while the player who plays the Sultan has his card face up. Other players build their strategies without seeing each others' roles. Players bid for control of key provinces, some of which grant military strength. The Unionist players win if their side controls four of the of the provinces in play at the end of the game or when they stage a successful coup. The Separatist player wins if no other faction controls four provinces at the end of the game. Otherwise, the faction of the Sultan and of the Spies wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Roles

name: Ahotnik
description:
DISCLAIMER
One of our authors is Moldavian and she loves her culture and her language so much she wanted to put some of that love in our game. We can assure you that everything you see in Ahotnik is related to the fictional world we created for our game. The only place we can accept fighting and war is in a boardgame, other than that, as authors, players and human beings, we strongly reject war and violence and we firmly stand for peace and inclusivity.


In Ahotnik, the players form pairs and act as the pilots of giant robots called “Ahotniks”—each of which has its own unique designation of “OXO-##”, for this reason, they are also known as “OXOs”. Their goal is to be the first team to eliminate a rival Ahotnik. But, during their battles, otherworldly creatures referred to as “Demons” emerge from mysterious Portals and try to wreak havoc on Earth by destroying the Ahotniks. The teams must fight on both fronts if they are going to be the one to bring glory to their nation! But beware: Your thirst for power must not come at the cost of total global annihilation…

A game of Ahotnik is played over a series of rounds which are divided into 4 phases:


Pilot Phase:
Pilot pairs try to coordinate by using their Action tiles, which represent the cerebral commands they send to the Ahotnik. The success of their strategy depends on their level of synchrony.
Ahotnik Phase:
The Ahotniks operate in this phase depending on the actions thought up by the pilots in the Pilot Phase. In order, the OXOs will carry out:
Tactical Actions: A set of actions that can have offensive, defensive, or strategic effects.
Movement Actions: Move the OXO on the game board.
Attack Actions: The main (though not the only) method to damage your enemies.

Demon Phase:
Beware of incoming threats! This is the turn of any Demons in play. The Radar will also indicate if any new Portals open and increase the Global Threat Level this turn.
Recovery Phase:
Certain game elements are restored so a new round may begin.


Rounds are repeated until an Ahotnik falls victim to another OXO or a Demon. Who will achieve total dominion of the planet?
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Evolution
description:
extrapolated from user review:

The object is to be the first player to evolve along the 6 stages of evolution into man. You start as a lungfish. Over the course of a turn, you roll a die to determine if you get to mutate, and then move to run away from predators.

Mutation is easier if you are in a warm climate. And if you are lucky enough to get a mutation card, you will either evolve, or pick up some mutation which can affect your movement or mutation abilities.

At the end of your turn, you flip up a card which lets you move and introduce certain type of new predators, evolve predators, and move continents.

Yes, the continents drift around the board, offering you chances to break a land bridge to strand your opponents on a plate along with a few hungry dinosaurs. Or drift yourself southward to bask and mutate in the sun.

The only other twist is that predators can only eat during certain player evolutionary stages. So trying not to mutate can be a very good idea at certain stages of the game. Being eaten costs you an evolutionary stage-so picking on the leader can help keep the game even.

name: ABOYNE
description:
Aboyne is a simple, fast-paced, print and play abstract game.

On their turn, a player must move one stone of their own color that is not adjacent to any enemy stone. A stone may (i) move to an adjacent empty cell or (ii) jump over a friendly stone, or a line of friendly stones, landing on the cell immediately beyond. If that cell is occupied by an enemy stone, that stone is captured. A stone cannot move into the opponent's goal cell. The winner is the player who moves a stone into their own goal cell (at the opposite end of the board) or stalemates the opponent.



The Term AboyneThe term Aboyne is taken from a humorous dictionary The deeper meaning of Liff. by Douglas Adams and John Lloyd. In there Aboyne is defined as beating an expert at a game of skill by playing so appallingly that none of his clever tactics or strategies are of any use to him.

Furthermore there exists a village in Aberdeenshire, Scotland, named Aboyne (Scots: Abyne, Scottish Gaelic: Abèidh).

name: Dragon's Nest
description:
Dragon’s Nest is an exciting board game where players hatch their own dragon eggs and compete for victory points.

Each player starts with 12 egg cards and 4 secret dragon cards, creating their nests as they play. During the game, players strategically draft eggs and unleash their dragons’ unique abilities to maximize points.

Dragon cards offer various ways to score, from balancing nests to forming number straights. The player with the most points at the end of the game emerges as the ultimate dragon keeper.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Up For Grabs
description:
Up For Grabs: The Make or Take It Word Game

The object of the game is to create or steal as many scoring words as possible. You can create new words from the tiles that are flipped over. Or you can "Grab" a word by adding a letter to it to form a new word.

Mindware has a new release of this game and here is their description:
Up for Grabs! Is a quick-to-learn language building game. Hexagon-shaped letter tiles are revealed one at a time. Be the first player to see a word and grab the letter tiles, and the word is yours. Letters will continue to be turned over; at any time, a player can take over your word by adding at least one new letter to it. At the end of the game, words with more than four letters are tallied, and the person with the highest score wins! Includes 100 tiles, score pad and instructions.

name: Blast Out
description: This game consists of a scoring basket suspended over a motorized blower that is surrounded by a circular fence with four catapults situated on its perimeter. Each player uses their catapult to launch small foam balls into the air stream above the blower in an attempt to get their balls into the scoring basket above the air stream. The round ends when one person gets 3 of their balls into the scoring basket. Each ball scores 1 point, and the first person to score 10 points wins the game. Ages 6 and up

name: The Rules of Everything
description:
In this fast-paced card game, each player takes their turn picking up a card from the deck, reading out the rule and following that rule. Every player will have their own set of rules to follow, determined by which cards they pick up.
The rules on the cards consist of things like movement, speech, and memory challenges.

The more cards a player has, the more challenging the game becomes for them. However, a quarter of the deck contains beneficial cards that allow a player to gain points, drop their cards, or win the game if they have enough points.

If a player breaks a rule on one of their cards, they must pay the penalty written in red. If they don't have any points, they must drop all of their cards and start again. So stay alert and call out rule-breakers when you see them. Using the in-game decisions, players can use strategy along with their skills to win the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: My World Cup 2010
description:
This game is made for World Cup 2010 South Africa. As a chief coach, you need to guess your opponent's thoughts, and apply your tactics carefully to defeat others.

In this game, player acts as the chief coach of one or several teams. Every team has its own skills. Player needs to apply these skills and tactic cards, which express the strategy of the team, to have matches with other teams. When a player controls several teams, he has to decide how to distribute his tactic cards for these teams in order to win the final champion. The result of a match will be decided by several dices, however, the number of dice may be influenced by tactic cards and team skills.

name: Every Round Counts
description:
A Dice and Card game
You are Bartenders serving drinks to customers in the Trolls Head Tavern, the head bartender has come up with a competition "who can serve the most beers wins"
All you have to do is guess how many beers you are going to roll on the Custom designed dice, sounds easy but the others will play cards that may hamper your guess!
The cards represents customers, cards to give you extra points and bonuses, cards that allow you to re-roll dice, and of coarse cards to play on the other bartenders to hinder them!

name: Magic: The Gathering – Chronicles
description:
An extension of Magic: the Gathering 4th edition. Drawn from the first four Magic: the Gathering expansions. All cards in the set were from the Arabian Nights, Antiquities, Legends, and The Dark expansions (14 from Arabian Nights, 21 from Antiquities, 71 from Legends, and 19 from The Dark). Each card was white-bordered, while the cards in their original sets were black-bordered. Also, each card carried the expansion symbol from the set it was originally printed in.

The set was printed in English and Japanese only. The Japanese version was black-bordered, because as it was the first time those cards were printed in the language. A similar black-bordered set called Renaissance was released into German, French, and Italian markets. These contained a different array of cards.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Golden Snitch: Snitch Snatcher – The Quidditch Game: Expansion Set
description:
Golden Snitch simulates the fast-paced Wizarding game of Quidditch. It is a game of skill and magic to be played by two people, each representing a Hogwarts house team. Use this expansion set to play Golden Snitch with teams Ravenclaw and Hufflepuff. Play them against each other or match one of them against Gryffindor or Slytherin. Play tournaments among the four Hogwarts teams.

Includes:
7 Hufflepuff Playing Pieces
7 Ravenclaw Playing Pieces
2 Sets of Playing Cards
1 Score Pad
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Take That

name: D.A.K.
description:
D.A.K. is a Strategic level board-wargame covering the battle for North Africa during WWII. The key feature of this game is its operation points which represent supply. These points are expended when units move or fight and also just to maintain a unit's existence. They're moved from the ports to the forward battle area and require record keeping.

This game's supply system portrays the situation that existed. Even if you're just digging in and awaiting an attack, you still need supplies flowing to your troops to feed (and water) them. Also, because all units must be able to trace supply to exist, players are rewarded well when successfully able to cut off enemy units from their rear areas. You can even capture enemy supply depots that are located too close to the front.

It can be linked with the game La Regia Marina, also published by Simulations Canada. When playing this way, the available number of operations points is based on how well you manage your fleets and convoys in La Regia Marina rather than the fixed supply schedule that comes with D.A.K.

One full map is divided into Eastern map and Western map. The whole map covers from Damascus to Casablanca. This is one of the widest map of this theatre, I think.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Statis Pro Hockey
description:
Tabletop hockey simulation game that was simpler than Strat-o-matic but not as precise. Jim Barnes was the original creator and it is now offered as "Status-Pro Hockey" by Taylor Marketing.

This NEW STATIS PRO HOCKEY game from byonusho has also been entirely re-built from the original game play, has all seasons avaialble, custom game boards, ONE FAC DECK, and documented accurate season replays unlike cheap knock-offs. All information can be seen at -http://forums.delphiforums.com/statprohockey/start. Note this rebuild is like the original version with advancements and nothing to do with Taylor Marketing or other off-brand listings.

name: Chinchiller Dice
description:
Chinchiller Dice is a bluffing game of literal blind trust.

When it is your turn, you roll the two dice, trying to score as much sand from the general supply as possible. You may re-roll any die that has not landed special side up as often as you like. Sooner or later though you will roll two chinchillers and have to close an eye.

Once both your eyes are closed, you can not re-roll any dice any more when it is your turn again. Instead, your left neighbor will tell you what you have rolled after just one roll. Your neighbor will also be the one who will have to pay for any sand you are scoring while blind. As a result, there is a good chance your neighbor will try to cheat you. It will be up to you to either accept your neighbor's word blindly or to try to catch them in the act. However, if you are greedy while your neighbor is telling the truth, you will be the one losing precious sand.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Scribbletown
description:
Scribbletown is a roll-and-write with very low luck about building your own city. Any number of players can play simultaneously as all players use the same die results.

Players draw areas such as neighborhoods, businesses, factories, farms, and parks that each score in different ways along with drawing the roads to connect them all. Each game is made different by the inclusion of a set of special building cards that can be drawn under special circumstances for big points. These special buildings help direct players into a strategy.

But you must be careful when drawing. Certain types of roads and buildings generate waste and when you get too wasteful, an opponent can fill up one of your empty spaces with an unusable junk pile!

Since any number of players can play at a time, Scribbletown is a a great “thinky filler”–it plays in around thirty minutes, but has a ton of heavy tradeoffs without a lot of setup or teardown time. It can even be played easily over Zoom or other conference software.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Zondance
description:
Welcome to Zondance Academy. Here they will learn all the necessary movements for the correct mastery of Zonda Control. Let's not waste any more time, put on your tights and don't forget to warm up each muscle well... let's dance!

Goal
To be the best master of Zonda Control you must be very attentive and follow all the steps indicated by the instructor. When one or more players make a mistake, they will add an error. When a player accumulates 5 errors, the game ends and whoever has the least errors will be the winners.

Preparation
The deck, consisting of 18 cards, is shuffled and placed face down on the table. All players must stand around it.

How to play
On his turn, the active player must draw a card from the deck and place it in the center of the table face up, so that all players can see it. If there are more cards on the table, the new card must cover them so that only the last revealed card is visible. Then you must carry out all the STEPS that have come out so far in the correct order, or, in the event that an evaluation letter has come out, follow its instructions.


Bienvenidos a la academia Zondance. Aquí aprenderán todos los movimientos necesarios para el correcto dominio del Zonda Control. No perdamos más tiempo, pónganse las mallas y no olviden calentar bien cada musculo… ¡a bailar!

Objetivo
Para ser el mejor maestro de Zonda Control debes estar muy atento y seguir todos los pasos que indica el instructor. Cuando uno o varios jugadores se equivoquen sumaran un error. Cuando un jugador acumule 5 errores la partida finaliza y quien o quienes tengan menos errores serán los ganadores.

Preparación
Se mezcla el mazo, compuesto por 18 cartas y se coloca sobre la mesa boca abajo. Todos los jugadores deben estar de pie alrededor de este.

Cómo jugar
En su turno el jugador activo debe sacar una carta del mazo y colocarla en el centro de la mesa boca arriba, de modo que todos los jugadores puedan verla. De haber más cartas sobre la mesa, la nueva carta deberá cubrirlas de manera que solo se vea la última carta revelada. Acto seguido deberá realizar todos los PASOS que hayan salido hasta el momento en el orden correcto, o, en el caso de que haya salido una carta de evaluación, seguir las instrucciones de esta.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: High and Tight
description:
A favorite pastime has finally found its way into the ballpark of VPG's Sports Series. High & Tight, from designer Hermann Luttmann, is a simple game of baseball strategy for two players, utilizing teams to the fullest and going head to head in the field, anywhere from basic training to the intensity of the World Series. It is said that every baseball team will win one-third of its games and lose one-third of its games. Now, step onto the field and find out what it takes to win “that other one-third”!

Focus on how to best form your team line-up, and battle inning by inning in an effort to emerge victorious! Think you have what it takes to efficiently manage your players, maximizing their specific talents as well as utilize Strategy cards to subtly increase the odds of scoring and preventing runs?

Manage your team’s assets, take advantage of the opportunities, and knock it out of the ballpark on the “field of dreams.” Step up to the plate with High & Tight ... And let’s play ball!

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each stand is a player on a team, and each turn represents approximately 5 minutes of real time.

Game Components:

• One 8-page, color Game Rules booklet
• 40 color, die-cut 1/2” mounted game pieces
• 80 color, die-cut 1/2” x 1” mounted ballplayer pieces
• 50 Strategy cards
• 8 Team cards
• 2 "Rally Caps" cards
• One 11” x 17” color game map
• One Scoreboard sheet
• Polybag packaging and component storage

name: Bitwa Morska
description:
The Bitwa Morska is a war game for two players, that reproduces The World War II naval battle. The game includes battleships, carriers with aircrafts, cruisers and submarines. The game is of light complexity.

Contents(1):
Board
Rules
Info about famous warships
32 Ship miniatures(2)
24 Aircraft miniatures(2)

(1) game was also available in "small" version with 50% smaller armadas
(i.e. 16 Ship miniatures and 12 Aircraft miniatures).

(2) ships were available in divfferent colours, known colours: silver, green, red
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 2
description:
Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 2 includes twelve new word cubes and sixty new cards (with 120 definitions) for use with the Faux•Cabulary base game.

For those not familiar with the game, in Faux•Cabulary, players create new words for descriptions that lack appropriate nomenclature by using randomly drawn "word segment" dice included in the game.

Each round, one player is the Wordmeister while the other players draw three word cubes at random from the box. The Wordmeister reads a Faux•Cabulary card out loud, e.g., "The compulsion to pop bubblewrap", then each player creates a word using 1-3 of his cubes – perhaps "Bust-O-Ific" – and conceals the word in a plastic holder. The Wordmeister mixes the words in their plastic holders (so that she doesn't know who created which word), reveals them one-by-one, then awards the card to whoever submitted the word that (in her mind) best matches the definition. Players then return all the dice, and the Wordmeister position rotates clockwise. Whoever claims the required number of Faux•Cabulary cards first wins!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Setting Sun, Rising Sun: The Russo-Japanese War 1904-1905
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Setting Sun, Rising Sun: The Russo-Japanese War" is an uncomplicated wargame centered on the naval aspects of the Russo-Japanese War of 1904-1905. The game depicts this conflict at a strategic level, with most operational and tactical details represented by fast and easy-to-play systems, rather than intricate mechanics. The intent of the game is to provide a broad overview of the historical events while being fun to play. The object of the game for the Japanese player is to control the sea areas around Japan to prevent Russian combatants from bombarding and cutting off supplies to the island nation, and to destroy the naval forces of Russia. The object of the game for the Russian player is to disrupt Japanese sea control, retain sea control around the Russian and Manchurian coastline for as long as possible, and destroy Japanese naval forces. Both players must obtain their objectives by deploying their naval resources into the sea areas on the map, earning victory points at the end of each of six turns for areas under their control, and for opposing units destroyed.

Setting Sun, Rising Sun owes its original inspiration to War at Sea, designed by Jon Edwards and Don Greenwood and published by The Avalon Hill Game Company, a game which covered the war in the Atlantic in World War Two. Setting Sun, Rising Sun borrows a number of concepts from this earlier game as a starting point, such as area movement, individual capital ships, battle line resolutions, and rolling sixes to hit, and then diverges significantly to reflect the Russo-Japanese War situation. The game includes about 280 counters, a 22"x28" map sheet of the combat areas including charts and tables, and a set of rules to play the game.

name: PicTwist: Bob Ross
description:
Plan, position, and win in this puzzle game of speed and strategy!

In PicTwist: Bob Ross, the scenic landscapes from The Joy of Painting have been scrambled up, appearing upside down, sideways, and out of order. Put your planning skills to the test with Action Cards to race against other players and reconstruct his works of art. Be the first one to correctly restore your painting to win!

name: Daytona Challenge
description:
Officially Licensed by NASCAR, it is an exciting game of both chance and strategy. Players compete against each other as they race their favorite drivers around the racetrack.

The game play is developed using true racing procedures and consequences including qualifying, and pitting - with actual results achieved at Daytona; drafting, and clever techniques used by the real drivers.

name: Assault on Tobruk
description:
Assault on Tobruk is a game type simulation of the successful assault by German and Italian forces in North Africa lead by Erwin Rommel on the Allied held fortress of Tobruk in the summer of 1942 ... [It] has an historic scenario and six alternate scenarios covering the actual and potential events at Tobruk. After choosing a scenario one player takes command of the Allied forces and the other player the Axis forces.

Each turn represents 2 hours, each hex is 650 meters, and counters represent company size units.

Description from “The SimCan Newsletter” #2 Fall 1980

From March to December of 1941, the forces of Rommel’s Africa Korps surrounded the Allied held fortress of Tobruk in North Africa but were unable to subdue it. On 20 June 1942, Rommel got another chance to cut off Tobruk as the Allies retreated from the loss of the Gazala battles. This time Tobruk fell and it did so in a swirling action lasting less than a day. Assault on Tobruk depicts this situation.

The map covers the the entire fortress of Tobruk past its perimeter strongpoints in hexes equalling about 670 meters across. Double impulse turns represent 2 hours and most units are of company size. Seven scenarios are provided, one of the historic and the other six examining the various effects of improved Allied command control tactics and artillery coordination as well as alternate attack plans for Axis forces. Assault on Tobruk is a fast playing game of low complexity showing an assault that could very easily have come out differently.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: La Petite Mort: Course à la Science
description: With this expansion, there are actually TWO new expansions, one brings you new events, the other, a whole new game mode: a race to the death!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Bootleg: A Rum-Running Card Game
description:
Bootleg is a gorgeous card game featuring the fast-paced life of a rum runner in historic, Prohibition-era America. The alcohol is all gone, and it is up to you to give the people what they want! Challenge up to four of your friends as you each race to collect enough sets of booze to satisfy the populace of a roaring American city and catch a sweet ride to get there. Just remember, the first one there gets the business while the others get caught! Use your connections with the crime families and famous gangsters to sabotage your opponents and bolster your own operation. And if you’re feeling lucky, your whole situation could change with the roll of the dice using the exciting underground casino cards!

This simple to learn, competitive game for two to five players is a great way to liven up any game night. No two games are ever the same as you strive to pull off the most profitable bootleg operation each round!

The game is played by drawing two new cards from the deck on each turn. You may then take up to three actions playing action / casino cards, placing a booze card into your collection or cash / action card (for cash value) in your bank, or buying one of three cards from the shared Speakeasy. Additionally, you may use an entire turn (don't draw or take any other actions) to purchase either a vehicle or drop-off location. Make sure you have plenty of cash in the bank because if you don't, other Bootleggers can take booze from your collection as payment for actions taken against you!

The first Bootlegger to have three full sets of booze in their collection, a vehicle, and a drop-off location satisfies their city's craving first to win the whole round! Play can be extended by tracking the total value of the winning Bootlegger's haul and compete to be the first to a pre-set value.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Ownership

name: Stix & Stones
description:
The prehistoric picture-making race!

A prehistoric picture–making race! Create like a caveman using only sticks and stones—no drawing skills required! Dare each other to make a picture with as few pieces as possible, then challenge the other players to guess what it is. Remember, the clock is always ticking!

Builds fine motor, creative and social skills through game play that's perfect for mixed age groups

Features 75 game cards providing 450 words of varying difficulty, ensuring a different game every time and an engaging experience for players of all ages

Includes 40 plastic sticks (twenty 4"L, twenty 2"L), 15 plastic stones (1" in diameter), arrow (1.25L"), die, 60 second sand timer, and burlap bag to store the game pieces and instructions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Pirates vs. Dinosaurs: Expansion Cards
description:
A set of 5 limited edition cards produced for Kickstarter supporters and the Boardgamegeek.com game store.
Castaways (2), Giant Ape, Island Ninjas, & Zombies.

name: Checkpoint: Danger!
description:
This is a distant relative of Battleship. Each player deploys four agents over a world map. Then, using probes you try to deduce the position of the enemy agents before he deduces the positions of yours. Basically, when you probe a grid location, the opponent announces how many of his agents can be reached in a straight line (including diagonals) from the probed location --excluding any of his agents which may be hidden behind others.

Some extra complications occur because both are playing on the same map: for example, you may not probe where the opponent has probed, which opens up strategic opportunities... "Checkpoint: Danger!" is what you call out when you're convinced one of his agents is in the same location as one of yours.

name: Road to the Palace
description:
Once upon a time, there was an old kingdom, where executives manipulated complicated relationships in order to gain fame and fortune. The players are these executives; the goal of the game earning as much influence in the royal palace as possible, all the while downing the rivals.

Character cards are lined up in a 3 x 4 grid. Players take turns gaining one of these cards each, combined with a so-called "mission disc". After each player has taken a card, discs and possibly cards are refilled, and the next player chooses a card to take. When the round is finished, players earn points for the discs of the colours of which he has the most influence, and penalty points for certain others.

Game goes on for two rounds, and the player with the most points at the end wins.

The game was published with the English title on the box as 'Road To the Place'. This was a typo, it should have been Road To the Palace.
user summary

name: Scientia
description:
Scientia is a tactical game for 2~4 players who compete to develop in four scientific fields: physics, chemistry, biology and astronomy. The game includes three different cards from each field, thus a game can show 12 different effects.

On their turn, players choose one of two options.


Take a card and place it in front of their personal board as long as it does not exceed its slot limit. There are two slots at the beginning of the game, and more can be added during the game.
Rotate one card twice (180º) or two cards once (90º each).


If a card is fully rotated (360º), that card is moved to the completion area. As soon as a card moved to the completion area, follow this process:

1: Advance the technology token of that card's field.
2: If the tech token has reached the rightmost space of a track, take another tech token from reserve and place it on the first space of that track.
3: Apply completed card's effect.
4: Put the card back in the center's appropriate position.

The game ends if all flask tokens or all tech tokens run out. Then calculate various scoring factors: flask tokens, tech tokens, fields, etc.

All cards are always visible to players and this is the game with no luck element. No random cards draw, no hidden components or no rolling dice.

In a game, always use 12 types of cards among 48 types. So every time in play, players are needed to set the strategy regarding the combination of visible cards.

name: Poppin' Hoppies
description: All of the Poppin' Hoppies (spring-loaded figures with suction cups) are depressed at the same time so that their suction cups stick to their feet. Player then try to catch them as they pop up. For every Hoppie successfully caught, the player earns a plastic figure piece of the same color as the Hoppie. P. Henry Hoppie (the white Poppin' Hoppie) is wild and its catcher can choose a figure piece of any color. Players then use these figure pieces to construct the figure of a man with the following limitations: 1) matching colored pieces can not touch, 2) each figure must have pieces of all 4 colors, and 3) no more than two pieces of one color are allowed in a figure. The first player to construct his figure wins!

name: Unexploded Cow: Around the World
description:
In this small promotional expansion an alternate city deck is provided.
These cards can be used instead of the ones provided with the game. This deck has 10 cards in it. These could even be shuffled in for an even longer campaign of find land mines with mad cows (however, the card backs are different from those in the base game).

The new cards are:

Cairo (2): Take any cow from the discard pile and play it into another player's herd.
Istanbul (3): You may take any number of Spies from the table into your hand.
London (4): Every player with at least one card in their hand passes one card to the left.
Los Angeles (1): Take 200 from every player.
Moscow (1): Draw four cards. Pass one of them to the player on your left.
New York (2): Take 400 from another player.
Paris (4): Choose a random card from the normal city deck and follow its instructions.
Rome (5): Every player who has at least one cow passes one cow to the left.
Sydney (3): Swap hands with another player.
Tokyo (5): Take 200 from the pot. Put any cow on the table into the discard pile.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Wacky Blasters
description:
Each player chooses a Wacky Blaster - Squeaky, Corky, Schnoz or Wheezer and a puffball matching the colour. The board is a mountain trail obstacle course. Players must use their Wacky Blasters to blow their puffballs across the trail and make it to the top of the mountain. In a turn the player rolls the die. If a player rolls a 1 - 5, he/she may puff his/her ball 1 - 5 times; if a player rolls the 'blaster' (which replaces the 6 on the die), he/she puffs another player's puffball backwards once. Players can follow the main path or choose to use the shortcut.
The first player which puffs his/her ball to the top wins the game.

name: Wadi: The Watchmen
description:
Wadi - The Watchmen is an expansion for Wadi.

Wadi - The Watchmen brings more depth to Wadi. Every player possesses his own Watchman. This Watchman protects his land tile and every land tile bordering directly on it horizontally or vertically. Nothing can be changed at these land tiles.

Players can use their Watchman to reserve a certain area for themselves, to later build a shadoof there.

Wadi - The Watchmen is played without Building Rule B!

name: Italia Mia
description:
An educational travel game regulated by the draw of movement cards (that allow one to choose routes combining different means of transportation) rather than dice. It includes a trivia component (wrong reply to a trivia question concerning the visited location makes player miss a turn).

The first to visit a pre-set, random list of locations wins.

The board is double-sided including two versions of the Italian map (political and physical), offering some added variety.

Publication date is uncertain: I would venture the educated guess 1988-1990 (Yugoslavia is still showing as a neighbouring country).

name: Find the code! Fantasieland
description: Players embark on a fantastic adventure and find a padlocked treasure chest. To crack the combination, they must cooperate to piece the jigsaw treasure map together, solve the riddles on the riddle card and move the wooden figure the correct number of squares in order to open the valuable treasure chest.

name: Sobrevivência na Amazônia
description:
Explorers parachutes into the Amazonia Forest with a mission. They have to explore the forest while moving towards the rescue point inside the jungle. On their way they have to collect food, water and others resources to survive.
Every four rounds day turns into night and all players have to mount camp. Each movement is made based on a choice from three directions - forwards, left or right - that will lead into different areas of the jungle. The options are represented by event cards (that can be either river or forest).
Full moon nights trigger magical happenings in the forest that are revealed by special cards dealt individually to each player.
On the way you can photograph animals at risk of extinction and expose situations that harm the forest life. These forest-aiding actions give extra bonuses.
The first player to arrive at the rescue point receives extra bonus points and declares the last round of the game. The game winner is the player who helped the forest the most and survived well, gathering victory points in resources collected and good actions made.
mechanics: Area Movement, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Terra Kids: Länder der Welt
description:
Geography trivia games for children. The board shows a map of the world and flags of over 50 countries. The active player gets one hint and has to correctly name the country - the hint might be a number on the world map, the flag or the capital city. When a player knows the country with one hint, he/she proceeds three fields. When two hints are necessary, one field. When three are necessary, one field. The first player to reach the finish line is the winner.
Depending on the current position, the categories can be chosen or are pre-determined. If a player cannot guess the correct country even after three hints, he/she stays in position and gets a wild card. A player with two wild cards has to discard them and gets to name a country that was already used in the game again.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Grabolo Junior
description:
With Grabolo Junior you have to show that you have the best eyes and the fastest hands at the table. The dice indicate the color and animal combination you should look for. Try to be the first to pick up the corresponding card.

How to play:

Step 1: Place all the cards face up in the center of the playing area.

Step 2: Both dice are rolled; Resulting in a combination of color and animal, all players try to be the first to put their hand on top of the correct card to win it.

Step 3: In the event that the combination is not available, the players can shout the name of the one who has that card. The game ends the moment the first player gets the last card needed to achieve victory.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Con Grabolo Junior tienes que demostrar que tienes los mejores ojos y las manos más rápidas en la mesa. Los dados indican la combinación de color y animal que debes buscar. Intenta ser el primero en coger la carta correspondiente.

Como se juega:

Paso 1: Colocar todas las cartas boca arriba en el centro de la zona de juego.

Paso 2: Se tiran ambos dados; resultando una combinación de color y animal, todos los jugadores tratan de ser el primero que ponga su mano encima de la carta correcta para ganarla.

Paso 3: En el caso de que la combinación no esté disponible, los jugadores pueden gritar el nombre del que tiene esa carta. El juego termina en el momento en que el primer jugador obtiene la última carta necesaria para conseguir la victoria.

—description from the publisher

name: Cuestión de Honor: Annual 1921
description:
Grand-tactical level game of the 1921 campaign in the Rif. The retreat from the Annual encampment in 1921.
750 meters /hex, Company level units.

Published in Alea Magazine #36 (April 2021)

Note: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Annual

name: Quest Adventure Cards
description:
A fantasy based game where you have to win quests using various characters (heroes and monsters), items (components, magical items, treasures and equipment) and spells. Special Event cards are used during gameplay to spice up the gaming experience.

Players compete against each other and score points while completing quests. Each player take their turn trying to match cards according to the current quests in play which vary during gameplay (as quests are completed). Strategically players may play special Event cards to steal cards, force trading of cards, etc. Each turn players pick two (2) cards from the draw pile and can at most play three (3) cards per turn.

The goal of the game is to have the most points before the maximum completed quest is reached which varies according to the number players:


4 quests for 2 players (a rather quick game - appx. 15-20 mins.)
6 quests for 3 players (a longer game - appx. 30-40 mins.)
8 quests for 4 players (longest game - appx. 45-60 mins.)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Math, Medieval

name: King of the Creepies
description:
In King of the Creepies, up to six players try to build their ultimate teams by collecting creepie cards and outfitting them with gear and special abilities to fight in fast-paced battles. Players bet their hard-earned monies in the hope of buying the perfect cards to crush their enemies, but goblins are always hiding just out of sight to cause all sorts of mischief! Bet, bribe, and battle your way through the marketplace and the arena to become the King of the Creepies!

Each round of the game is played in three phases. In the market phase, players buy and sell cards to try to assemble a team of well-equipped creepies. In the match phase, players reveal their chosen combatants, then bet their monies on the outcome; after bets have been placed, a mischief card is drawn, which affects the battle in an unpredictable way. The battle phase is where the majority of the game takes place. Players battle each other using one of thirty unique creepies, using gear, items, and special abilities to help their cause. The winner earns a victory crystal, and whoever collects five crystals first wins!

The game includes a variant ruleset for "poker mode". In this version of the game, players draw an entirely new hand each round and go through a series of rounds of betting before battle, with the combat winner gaining the pot. Players then draw a whole new hand and try again until one player has all the monies!
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Zock!
description:
A children's tile game in a limited edition of 300, with cute ducks, cows and piggy-wiggies.

Re-released by Goldsieber Spiele with different rules as Affenraffen.

name: Insight
description:
A pure party "game" players view 54 cards which can be spread about a room or rooms. Each card will ask the player to make choices based on the card graphics.

In the next phase, all the other players attempt to guess which choices each other player made. The winner is the one who guesses correctly most often.

name: An Evening of Murder: Resort to Murder
description:
One in the series of "Max Haines Invites You To An Evening of Murder (tm)" party games. Plays like the popular "How to Host a Murder" series. This particular edition is "Resort to Murder." From the box...

Crime Scene: The tranquil Caribbean beauty of the Flamingo Island resort was shattered when Sid Tanner was shot dead in his beach cottage. Everyone assumed that Tina Elston, his beautiful fiancee, pulled the trigger, until guests discovered her lifeless body. She had been killed by a rattlesnake bite while attempting to prove her innocence, the second victim of murder.

The Suspects:

Bernie Smith: A millionaire who built his burger empire from scratch... What could he have to 'beef' about?

Karyn Roberts: A gorgeous movie star and true humanitarian... or is it all just an act?

"Rattler" McPayne: A professional wrestler with a passion for deadly snakes. What would it take to make him lose control?

Roxy St. Ives: Did she dream of being an investigative journalist badly enough to make her own headline?

Jacob Holloway: An undertaker with a permanent look of gloom. Was he digging his own grave?

Terri Masters: A woman who lives life her way. No pressures, no reason to kill.. or was there?

The Great Trosini (GT): A famous illusionist... could he make his troubles disappear?

Emma Jean: A bag lady whose total belongings fit into a cart, but her secrets could fill an ocean.
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Hodin, Pentalpha Game Corporation, Spear's Games

name: Tac-Tic-Turn
description: A simple variant of Tic-Tac-Toe. The board measures 6x6 and is subdivided into nine 2x2 "boardlets" which can individually be turned. On your turn, you either place a marker *or* turn a boardlet ninety degrees. First player to line up four or more markers horizontally, vertically or diagonally wins.
publishers: IRWIN Games, Ohio Art, Otto Simon: Holland

name: Monster Maker 3: Nihon Youkai
description:
Monster Maker 3: Japanese Monsters is a card game for players to compete at defeating the mythological beasts of Japan.

Players start the game with cards in hand. They can each play up to three Character cards in front of them, forming their party of mythological heroes. As they play their cards on their turns, they draw from a common deck to replenish their hands. Players can play Monster cards on their parties, challenging the monsters with their heroes, or pit the creature against one of another player's heroes. Dice are rolled and Assistance cards played to help either heroes or monsters. The side with the higher resultant value wins the battle, eliminating the opposing cards from play.

Each monster is worth a score to its vanquisher, and each defeated hero penalizes its player. When a player has accumulated a predetermined score (which depends on the number of players), he or she wins the game.

name: Monster Maker 4: The Four Elements
description: 4th in the Monster Maker card game's main series. Somewhat closer to the original's system than the last couple in the series, but without the corridors (only the original Monster Maker and a few of the Monster Maker boardgames used that).

name: Epoch Wargame Electronics #3: The Battle of Sekigahara
description:
3rd of 12 games in the Epoch Wargame Electronics series. Each of the games features easy to learn rules (in Japanese), quick games that average about 30 minutes (not including setup), magnetic pieces on a set board, and an electronic dice-roller with 6 LED dots to work out the effects of combat.

As long as one player knows the rules, the other player does not need to know any Japanese in order to play the game.

This particular entry in the series takes place in Japan in 1600.

name: Dragon Buster
description:
The 3rd in Namco's series of boardgames based off their videogames. This one is based off the old side view action/ROPG Dragon Buster.

The boardgame plays closest to Talisman, although it's not that close of a connection. You roll the dice to move around the board and complete quests. The game includes a variety of event cards, charts for randomizing events and encounters,counters for monsters and items and such. The point of this game to kill the dragon and rescue the princess (yes, a horribly cliched plot, but it was based off a very early videogame).

There is a considerable amount of Japanese not only in the rules, but on all the event cards and charts.

name: Commando
description:
One of the games in Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames (#64).

This one is based off the videogame Commando. It is a simple roll-and-move type game, with symbols on the board indiciating what happens when you land on that spot. There are multiple choices on which direction to go, but not too much in the way of required thinking. There are many different boards that you progress through, each board representing one 'stage' of the game.
categories: Video Game Theme, World War II

name: GOOT! (Get Out Of That!)
description:
GOOT!(Get Out Of That!) is a game of tall tales, ripping yarns and outrageous excuses for 3 to 6 players or teams. Over the course of the game you will find yourself in a series of sticky situations and as your fellow players try to thwart your efforts, you must endeavor to talk yourself out of them.
Contains 1 VHS video tape, 250 word cards, 150 last line cards, 18 'I got out of that' cards, 1 2-minute timer, 2 d6 and one write on/wipe off score card with pen.

name: Slobberin' Sam
description:
This is a children's dexterity game featuring a motorized dog which eats up the bones players try to flip into his mouth.

From the box:

He's a big, friendly dog
with a long, sloppy tongue.
When you toss Sam a bone,
he slurps it up for fun!

Sam loves his tasty treats.
He quickly licks 'em up.
So give him all you can.
He's a very hungry pup!

Sam slobbers up his lunch,
and now he wants his dinner.
Try to feed him all your bones,
and you're the lucky winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: Who?
description:
Character Guessing Game
Players randomly choose one of 10 character cards which depict one of the cast of characters. Accountant, Bootblack, Clergyman, Doctor, Editor, Financier, Grandfather, Hobo, Investigator, Judge. Places which players visit as they move around the board give clues as to who they are. The Hobo for example can visit the Soup Kitchen, The Police Station, The Bus Line and The Drug Store - but, of course, cannot visit the Country Club. Players try to guess the identity of their opponents while remaining unidentified themselves. Disguise Caps spaces on the board allow players to move onto spaces they normally would not be allowed to visit. The winner is the player who manages to conceal his identity from the other players until he alone remains in the game.

name: The Battle of Saratoga
description: Medium complexity wargame of the Battles of Saratoga during the American Revolutionary War. Generals Gates and Arnold with Colonel Morgan's Virginians triumph in the most important battle of the Revolutionary War. 144 counters. Rare. Limited Printing.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Jumble Plus
description:
Players form up to four teams. A card is drawn to determine the puzzles for the team taking its turn. All the letters to be used to spell out the answers to the questions on the card are placed in front of the team.

The reader reads the category aloud. The team now has two minutes to answer as many questions as possible and spell on the answers on the gameboard. There are a three-letter, a four-letter, a five-letter, a six-letter and a seven-letter word. In addition, those five words' initial letters are an anagram for another word. If time still remains there is a ten-letter word to unscramble!

Teams can by a hint at the cost of one point. Score is based on the number and length of words solved.

The winning team is the one with the most points after five rounds of play.

name: Battle Stations: An Operational Game of Modern Seapower
description:
Battle Stations is a low complexity board game of naval conflict concentrating on the operational level. The game depicts the various areas of potential conflict on a series of maps scaled to about 24 miles to a hex. The interactions of surface, subsurface, and naval air forces are depicted by silhouette style counters. The data base of Seapower & the State, our strategic modern naval game, is used for the unit
values, thus providing a degree of mateability between the games. The operational nature of the game is emphasized by five-hour turns and a simple but effective combat system that reflects the lethality of modern weapons systems. A number of scenarios are provided for likely conflict areas as well as a system to use Seapower & the State as a campaign game scenario generator.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: H-Hour
description:
A game of man-to-man urban combat in World War II featuring German, Russian, and American forces. Each turn is fifteen seconds and each square is 10 feet across.

From the rulebook: "The game is designed to recreate, as close as possible, the 'feel' and 'flavor' of infantry combat and the problems and decisions faced by the small unit leader . . . The combat units involved represent the average organizations of the U.S., Germany, and the U.S.S.R. The playing area represents typical European buildings and streets. All names on the maps are in German, but represent typical small town architecture and street plans left over from the Middle Ages . . . Proceed with caution: the town is unfriendly, the enemy is experienced and your men aren't expendable. You have your mission and your organization. As soon as you read the rules and set-up, it will be H-HOUR."

From designer's William A. Comito's comments in the rulebook: "A game is one man's view of a particular subject, and is only as good as the author's research and experience. I designed this game from the viewpoint of a professional soldier who has spent 6+ years in the infantry, including two combat tours, and who has been an instructor in small unit tactics and map reading. My training has been in all aspects of infantry combat, and my research has included not only books but interviews with combat infantry veterans of WWII . . . The game is, honestly, an attempt to combine a miniatures game and a boardgame together. Most of the rules are written from a boardgame viewpoint, but can be readily applied to miniatures."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Wickie
description:
Wickie is a German board game for children; it is designed to promote recognition of colors and numbers. Thematically, it is uses elements from a television series of the same name. Players assume the roles of Wickie and his friends as they race each other to board a Viking ship.

Each player selects a character and takes four tokens. They play their turns by first rolling the dice. There are four lanes to reach the ship. The squares (of which some are colored) on the lanes are printed with the faces of a die. A player can move his or her token to the next square if one of the rolled dice matches the square's.
