O

T

A

S

name: Colour Magic
description:
Colour Magic

From the makers of Math Magic™ and Math Magic 2™ comes a new challenge as a puzzle for a single player or a game for two players. Colour Magic relies on your power of deduction to place your tiles on the board so they do not cover any of a designated color. The player who places the most tiles wins. Sounds simple? This game will challenge all who love games of logic and strategy. Great for travel! Contains small parts, not suitable for children under the age of four.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Summon the Dragon
description:
An open bidding trump game designed so that you can't say, "I never get a hand I can bid on."

Has a custom deck of 53 cards, four suits (Earth, Wind, Fire, Water) of 13 cards (1-8, Mage Warrior, Queen, King, Elemental) and one Dragon card.

name: Ironclad
description:
From the introduction: "Ironclad is intended to be a set of quick-moving, hard hitting rules, best suited for those who wish to sacrifice a certain amount of realism for the sake of the game. It is not intended to be comprehensive and cover every possible situation that could arise out of the U.S. civil war. It is, rather, a playable game... a framework around which you can build as elaborate set of rules as you wish."..."The game is extremely bloody."
The game is intended for 1:1200 miniatures on a table top of at least 3' by 5'. Each turn represents 5 minutes of real time, and ships move 1" (100 yards) for every knot of speed. Each ship gets a card with hit boxes for armor, speed, midships, stacks, draft, guns, and battering ram. A ship is sunk when all draft boxes are gone. Forts get similar cards.
The rules are only about 12 pages, plus a couple more for charts, pictures and background data. There are charts for penetrating and non-penetrating gunfire, critical hits, lucky hits, ramming, minefields, and loss of stack. There are also three different turning circles.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: 3er Schach
description: A 3 players variation of chess, played on a special board.

name: Super Tank I
description:
Super Tank I is an expansion to SPI's Tank! Armored Combat in the 20th Century game. Super Tank is more than just an expansion of SPI's game, however, it is a complete revision of the infantry rules. Armored Vehicle rules are mostly in SPIs's rules folders for Tank. The infantry in Super Tank are played sequentially while the vehicle and gun units remain simultaneous. This makes large numbers of infantry easier to game...

The hexes on the large map are one inch to allow play with 1/285 miniatures.

The player will find that he has all the units he needs for all WWII types of attack and defense, including cavalry, machine guns, mortars, bridge laying AFV, rocket launchers and many other new types of units. Super tank is truly a combined arms game.

Game components include one 34" by 54" map (!) two mini 11" by 17" plotting maps, two Terrain and combat tables, eight (!) 11" by 14" die cut counter sheets (448 infantry, 960 Armored Vehicles) one booklet of rules, and three zip Lock bags.

Game includes just about every tank made by anyone in WWII, each unit rated for Front, Side and Rear armor, as well as AP/HE factors, Range and Movement. An awesome game!

Expands:

Tank! Armored Combat in the 20th Century
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Mix 'N' Match
description:
Each player selects one playing board which can be used either side up. Once a playing board is selected it must be used throughout the game.
Each player in turn takes one card from the draw pile.
The Draw Card is placed against the matching color on the playing board. Red goes with red blue with blue etc.
If that color is already covered on the playing board the draw card is placed in a discard pile.
The first player to complete 3 words in a row wins the game.
An excellent game for 4-8 years old to learn word making.

name: Waverley
description: Players vie to connect either pair of opposite sides of the board using their pawns. After an initial placement phase, pieces are then maneuvered between orthogonally adjacent points. When a diamond is formed by a player, a block counter is placed in the center reserving that point for that player. Pieces can jump an opponent's piece, & that taken piece is returned to the board either along one of the 2 adjacent sides marked in its color or onto one of its owner's blocks. Connections are made orthogonally & diagonally, & the first player to form a chain across the board from side to side wins. Originally marketed by the Design Centre, London (iirc).

name: Das Piratennest
description: The players try to rescue their friends from the pirates who have abducted them to the pirates' island. There are three variants, one for 4-year olds, one for 8-year olds, and one for older children and grown-ups.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle Cry
description: Unlike the other well known games called Battle Cry, this one is about modern warfare from the 70´s. You fight with ground and air units, but you don´t have atomic strike forces. There are two parties (red and blue), but you can play it with up to ten people, so that everybody can lead a part of the army. There is a large board, 80x150cm, with a painting on it, including power stations, railroads, roads, hills and rivers. Each party rules the following units: Commandos, Infantry, Recon, Grenade launchers, Engineers (Anti-mines and bridges), Tanks, Artillery, Flak, Minefields, Air-bases, Paratroops, Jet-fighters and bombers. Every unit has different move and battle strengths. You must coordinate your movements with the players in your team. A commander in staff will be elected, before the battle starts. First the units will be set-up face-down, so that your opponent can´t see your troops. Every player has 100 numbers, to determine each unit on a small sheet of paper, showing the whole map. Unfortunately this game is not well known.

name: Advanced Tracks to Telluride
description:
Expansion kit published for Tracks to Telluride that significantly lengthens the game.

The expansion does away with the chance cards and gives an extended set of rules covering such things as snow ploughs, dual gauge track, track maintenance and seasonal weather variations. It also introduces a more varied set of victory conditions as well as "personality cards" in the form of special engineers, lawyers and promoters to help you with your track building, court injunctions and financing. More flavour and more interest, but at the almost inevitable cost of a longer playing time.

name: Car Wars Supplement, Division 5 Vehicle Guide
description:
Hit The Road!

They're small but deadly! A dozen hot new Division 5 cars with counters for regular and variant versions, plus their dropped weapons and scenarios to use them. This book includes two different counters for each car - 24 in all - plus obstacles and other bonuses.

This is a supplement. You need at least one Car Wars Starter Set to play.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Imperium Romanum Lite
description:
The simplified version of West End Games' Imperium Romanum II.

A game for 2-5 players (depending on scenario). The game is a province based simulation of Ancient Rome and her struggles, both internally and with surrounding foes.

http://www.kerpob.com/games/imperium.html

name: Open Sesame
description: The Open Sesame Game is a game for up to four players. Spin the spinner and put 1, 2, or 3 jewels into the mountain. If the spinner lands on the Open Sesame space then each player quickly puts their marble into the mouth of the volcano. The first marble down the hole will open the door and spill the jewels.

name: Minigolf
description: Minigolf: the Roll-a-Coin game is a game for any number of people to play. The wooden board is reconstructed with a different obstacle on each turn, and play consists of aiming and rolling a large coin towards a hole on the opposing end. Score is kept like golf, with each roll counting against the player as one stroke.

name: Afriboria
description:
DESIGNER'S NOTES:
This is the third set in my card driven wargame rules, and although still loosely inspired by the Battle Cry & Memoir '44 games by Richard Borg, the game no longer has a battlefield divided in 3 sections. Battlefield sections are great for ACW and WWII, but spreading a (smaller) imperial force across the battlefield would not always be realistic or playable, since in most colonial battles a smaller well armed imperial army faces hordes of natives. The left-center-right wing Battle Cry/Memoir '44 principle has here been replaced by color-coding the units red, green and blue (activated by cards of the same color) thus enabling the imperialist player to concentrate his units anywhere on the battlefield if he wishes to. Also, compared to ACW or WWII, there was a much bigger difference in quality of weapons used by imperialists and natives. Therefore the symbols on the dice are no longer representing the targets but rather the type of ammo/weapon used, whereby the more modern weapons have a better chance of scoring hits than outdated ones (see rules).

Since many colonial games are played in "Darkest Africa", an (optional) set of "event cards" is added in order to spice up the "adventure" type games. When using the fast play variant, games with 20-30 native units (and about half of that number of imperial forces) can be concluded in 90-120 minutes (ideal for a club night). In order to have a balanced game, the number of victory points to be scored by imperialist armies should be around 1.5 times higher than for native forces.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Justified Ancients
description:
Justified Ancients is 10 page element-based set of ancients period miniatures rules. "Designed for experienced wargamers, these rules are 'rules light' and it's assumed that players know their Cataphracts from the Schiltrons, how to move a unit by wheeling from the outside edge and all that malarkey."

If you haven't guessed by now, the rules are written in an amusing style (e.g. "In a Turn each player gets to Do Stuff."), but the rules are not designed to be a joke.

Each unit requires a dice score in order to move, reform, charge, etc. Melee combat is done by adding a D3 to the units base modifiers. Results are based on the overall difference of the modified die rolls. Stands which are damaged in combat can become disorganized, depleted, or dispersed (removed from the table).

name: Cavaliers and Roundheads
description: Miniatures rules for the English Civil War. Interestingly, this was the first product released by Tactical Studies Rules, which later became TSR, Inc.
categories: Civil War, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Linie
description:
"Linie" is played on a unusual board: 4 spiraled lines in 4 colors lead from every edge of the board to the center. These 4 spirals are intersected by 4 straight diagonals leading from the center to the edges.

The game includes 3 tokens per color/player, 1 die of each of these colors and 2 neutral white dice.

Movement is very unusual again, since a player can move any token on the board! During a turn, a player rolls 5-6 dice and each die roll allows the move of 1 token, using the white dice as jokers, who allow the movement of a token of any color.

Captures are possible on the diagonal lines only and the player who is the first to reach the center with all his 3 tokens is the winner of the game.

name: Her Mit Dem Fisch
description:
There is a lot going on in Adelie Land. Catch fish together with Mama and Papa Penguin and feed the little penguins. Be careful, as the little penguins can still help to catch the fish for dinner!

dupe of Hey, That's My Fish! ??

name: Martello
description:
Martello is played on a 6x6 grid board. 36 stones in 6 different colors and 6 different patterns are shuffled and placed on the board before the game begins.

The game can be played with 1, 2 or 3 players. While the basic rules are equal for any number of players, the playing area can be different and the winning condition is always different!

Movements can be done vertically or horizontally, but a move without capturing another stone of the same color or pattern is not allowed.

Differences between the 3 versions:

1 player game: played on the whole board, trying to capture all stones and ending up with only 1 single stone on the board.

2 player game: each player plays on 4 rows (meaning that 2 rows are for both players) and tries to clean his rows better than the opponent

3 player game: played on the whole board and trying to eliminate all stones of a secretly chosen color first

name: R.A.F
description:
"MY KRIEG IS MORE TOTALER THAN YOUR KRIEG."

The seventies wasn't just free sex and scary looking trousers. It meant blowing things up in the name of a better, brave future. Try fighting the power - German style. An exiting, almost historical, card game.

R.A.F is a revolutionary card game that takes you back to the explosive German seventies.
Try your skills at running a terrorist group, known in German as a “Liga”. The success of your Liga is of course measured by how much publicity it gets, because as we all know: nothing has truly happened unless it happens on TV. Therefore, to win R.A.F you must collect the most Media Points. How much riot can you run before the government close you down. Teutonic Style.

name: Imperial Commander
description:
Imperial Commander is a set of miniature wargame rules for science fiction combat. It was based around the Tabletop Figures range of 15mm Sci Fi figures and was designed to give a fast game when using around 50 figures per side.
The rules cover light infantry through to power armor, force shields and vehicles. They also contain some army lists and conversions from Laserburn and Combat 3000.

name: Twin Cities
description:
The object of the game is to choose two city sites across the river from each other and join them with a minimum of six road pieces and one bridge. The city sites are placed at the intersection of hexagonal pieces which have numbers on them, and each turn dice are rolled and cities adjacent to pieces with the rolled numbers produce resources, just as in CATAN. Also as in Settlers, players trade resources with each other and then use them to build roads and bridges. Unlike Settlers, Twin Cities uses three dice with 1-5 and a question mark on the faces; rolling question marks gives you action cards, and rolling certain combinations has special effects.

Game contents include:
12 city pieces
66 interlocking plastic board pieces
8 board frame pieces
360 resource cards
85 action cards
72 road pieces
24 bridge pieces
3 dice
1 board piece bag
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Trivial Pursuit: Olympia Edition (Austrian)
description: Its another version of this trivia game, including questions about Olympia and special questions about the Austrian Olympic history. It's not an expansion set, its a full game version.

name: Brain-O-Matic
description: Brain-O-Matic is a trivia game. Players answer questions to get to roll and move their piece along the board track. On most spaces they must press the button on the "brain". The brain makes sounds and cycles lights through the six categories until it settles on one. The player must answer a question from this category. There are three questions on each card for the three level of difficulty in the game. Children could play the easy level while adults could play from the two harder levels. The players race to get to the end of the track.

name: Dragon Ball GT TCG
description: Use Dragonball GT Warriors and try to defeat your opponent! Can either be played as a stand alone game, or with the cards from the Dragon Ball Z CCG in Extended Format.

name: KHAN!
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple game of Kublai Khan's 1281 invasion of Japan. One player controls the forces of Kublai Khan while the other controls the Japanese forces. Khan needs to move his fleets from Korea to Japan, avoiding a moving hurricane, to defeat the outnumbered samurai units. The game uses a compact area movement map.

name: Physogs
description:
This is a card game with a difference, combining the principles of an identikit, with the game play of collecting and matching sets typical of card games.

The object of the game is not merely the piecing together of features but the building of faces, the features of which are consistent with each other. The eyes, nose, mouth etc. must not, in its respective ‘character’, conflict with any other feature. It is possible, by various combinations of these cards, to form 13 different types of facial character and the types are described on the type cards and in the key book.

This game is not to be likened in any way to a jigsaw puzzle. It is a definite character analysis by the use of real photographic reproductions, invented by Jacques Penry, the author of "Character from the Face" (published by Hutchinson) and contributions to the "Sunday Express".
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Quartal
description:
This is an economic game self-published bye Joe Zihlmann from Switzerland.
Winner of the game is the player who first build a trust of 7 companies. The 5 different kind of companies must be part of the winning trust.
Every player starts with 2 companies, fixed by the rules.
The 5 different companies are:
Producer of oil, Producer of metal, Producer of energy, a Factory and a commerce.
Every player has industry-terrain on which he places his company and the elements produced there.
The producers supply the resources, and the factory builds the end-product with 1 of the three resources. Then with the commerce you try to sell that product to the market.
In addition, all things can be traded between the players or the market (when available).
The Market is defined with a "wheel", in every round it will be turned/shuffled and shows the buy- and sell-numbers for this turn.
A Turn (all players):
1. Shuffle the market
2. Player produce resources.
3. Buy and/or trade resources with the market and/or the other players.
4. Production of end-products from the players factories
5. All players try to sell their end-products
6. All players must pay their storage-costs and taxes
7. Buy or sell of companies.

name: Trox
description:
This small game consists of 12 trapezoids showing 3 triangles in red, yellow and black each. The players have 2 red, 2 yellow and 2 black counters each. The object of the game is to create a winning triangle of four of one's marked counters on their appropriate colored tile areas. Players take turn laying tiles and placing counters on them or placing a counter on a tile already laid. Once all 12 counters have been played, remaining tiles are put aside. Now players may move their counters trying to form a triangle. Capturing an opponent's counter is possible by surrounding it with one's own counters.

Trox is a small print run game of high production quality.

Home Page: http://homepages.tesco.net/~peteandrew/trox.htm

name: Action in the Persian Gulf
description:
Considered a novel in game form in which you are placed in the position of Convoy Commander who must make decisions such as - warn or shoot down an unidentified aircraft - as your fleet moves through the Persian Gulf to complete it's mission.

Using metal scale models of your convoy, you guide your ships on a map Persian Gulf through hostile aircraft, naval vessels and guided missile batteries - your course and confrontations differ with every game using a ten sided die. The game includes navigation charts and tables outlining the capabilities of each of the ships and weapons in your convoy.

name: Survival of the Fittest
description:
Survival of the Fittest is a fanboy retelling of the Battle Royale saga. In the game, a class of international students are ferried over to a deserted island by a teacher on a field trip. Unfortunately for them, the teacher is a big fan of the novel "Battle Royale". Once the students awake on the island, their biggest fears are realized: There is only one way off the island - to be the last one standing. Kill or be killed, true survival of the fittest.

Intended as a party game, Survival of the Fittest mixes together hand-management and bluffing of Bang! with the second guessing and alliances of Werewolf, bringing in up to 12 players to play as twelve of the fourteen unique characters which are dealt out randomly (along with a starting weapon) to the players.

Each turn the players secretly (or openly!) choose one of the twelve map co-ordinates to go to that turn, each space giving different advantages (an extra health, a new melee weapon). However, once there, it's time for action! Players ally together to take down other players before turning on their friends. Killing an opponent allows the player to take the weapon, strengthening their own position and in turn making themselves more of a target. However, hiding like a coward is an acceptable tactic, as players can only attack others in the same co-ordinate. With plenty of meta-gaming and whispering going around the table, you can never be sure who to trust!

As the game goes on, co-ordinates get randomly taken out of play to close down the areas and force confrontation until only one player remains - the fittest, the survivor.

Designed by Luke Morris and published by Games On The Way, Survival Of The Fittest aims to push itself head first into the big group and party game genre.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Negotiation, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Matchday
description: As Team Manager, the player's goal is to lead his football (soccer) team to win the League Championship during the course of one season's play. Game uses some ideas from Monopoly, but also features the matches, injuries, transfers, gate attendance, and other aspects of being a football manager.

name: Kick Off
description:
A football (soccer) game where players take the role of running a club, acquiring a stadium, chairman, sponsor, manager and squad, then try to top the league.

www.kickoffboardgame.com

name: Football Fantasy
description: A series of books, each representing a different football (soccer, not American football) team. The mechanics are similar to the Lost Worlds series of books: each page shows a view of that team, so a player holds the book of his or her opponent's team (and the picture shows a view of the opposing team as he or she sees it). On each turn, each player chooses one of six available maneuvers and calls out the corresponding letter. A 6x6 grid at the bottom of each page indicates the result (new page) for each player.

name: Back of Beyond: Army Lists and Campaign System for Contemptible Little Armies – Central Asia 1919-1926
description:
This is a supplement to Contemptible Little Armies: Third Edition – World War I Era: Fast Play Wargame Rules 1910-1928. It includes some historical background, army lists, a simple campaign system, special characters and new optional rules for terrain and weather specific to warfare in Central Asia from 1919- 1926.

The armies in the lists represent historical forces as well as a few “what ifs”. They include: Bolsheviks, the “Army of God”, White Russians, the Army of Baron Ungern-Sternberg, Chinese Warlord Armies, Chinese Chinghai Fontier Armies, Chinese Bandits, Mongolian Tribes, Tibetans, Ngoloks, Basmachis, the Afghan Army, Central Asian Bandits, the Army of British India, the Turkish Army, the Japanese Army, and Dinosaur Hunters.

The book has 41 single sided pages that are cerlox bound with a plastic cover on the front. There are a couple of black and white photos within and one map.

Expands:

Contemptible Little Armies: Third Edition – World War I Era: Fast Play Wargame Rules 1910-1928
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
publishers: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)

name: Need a Fourth?
description: Scores of Bridge variants for fewer than four players have been invented, most of them for two players. The few games created for a threesome vainly searching for a fourth tend to be unexciting and overly dependent on luck. This is an attempt to fill the breach. Game play is very much like the parent game, although some changes in the scoring rules have been made. The major twist: the players who win the bidding must play defense—and they still have to take a majority of the tricks!

name: Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory, The Game
description:
From the box
"GREETINGS CHOCOLATE LOVERS.

You are the lucky winner of a Wonka Golden ticket. Come with me on a magical journey through the factory. In you wildest dreams you cannot imagine the surprises I have in store.

You have waited a long time, but, at last the day has arrived, so lets not wait any longer. Follow me on your adventure which you will not forget for the rest of your lives.

Who knows you may be the lucky person to reach the end of our journey and win all the sweets and chocolate that you can eat.

Contains
1 Dice
1 Game board
6 Golden tickets playing pieces
6 plastic stands"

name: Heroes of Asfar: The Finieous Fingers Expansion Set
description:
This is the third expansion for Heroes of Asfar, the entertainingly chaotic card game in which you try to subdue an opponent's character cards, thereby scoring enough points to win. This final expansion set of HOA contains 8 legendary Character Cards, and 12 additional Play Deck Cards, including Finieous and many of his friends (from early issues of Dragon Magazine), and items such as Bored-Flak's Wand of Fireballs and the Magic Slingshot Stone.

Expands


Heroes of Asfar



Microbadges:




- Finieous

- Mergatroid



- Fred

- Bored Flak



- Charley

- Grond



- Ranger Rupert

- Evil Wizard Kask
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Marinva!
description:
Marinva! is a memory and dexterity game. The "board" is a 7x7 grid of hidden cards that the players must reveal to make identical couples. But the shape and colors of the drawings are specially designed for a hard recognition and confuse the memory. In addition, there are special cards that force the players to make fast moves with his hands (applaud, hit the table...) for win extra turns, change the situation on the table or reveal new cards.

"Marinva!, el joc" is a non-commercial game, published in Spain for "Marinva, Jocs i educació" (www.marinva.es), catalonian company dedicated to introduce the gaming in the world of education, for celebrate his 10th anniversary.

Marinva! es un juego de memoria y rapidez de reacción orientado a público adulto. Sobre un tablero de 7x7 cartas ocultas, los jugadores deberán descubrirlas para formar parejas idénticas. Pero los motivos geométricos y colores de las cartas están especialmente diseñados para dificultar su reconocimiento y crear confusión. Además, hay cartas especiales con las que los jugadores pueden robarse el turno entre ellos, pueden cambiar de sitio en la mesa o destapar más de una carta si son los más rápidos al hacer determinados gestos con las manos (aplaudir, golpear la mesa...).

"Marinva, el joc" fue editado en España como obsequio con motivo del décimo aniversario por "Marinva, Joc i educació" (www.marinva.es), empresa catalana dedicada a introducir el juego en el mundo educativo.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game
publishers: Educa Borras, Educa Sallent SA, Marinva, Joc i educació

name: Angels Two-Zero
description:
FJGaming builds on the foundations of Biplane Barmy and Blazing Jets to release Angels Two-Zero. This self-contained PDF print-and play game allows you to simulate the air to air battles of World War II from the European Air War to the Pacific campaigns.

Like Biplane Barmy and Blazing Jets, the emphasis is on quick play (ten minutes or less) and tactics over luck, using FJGamings unique “Choose and Move” game mechanics.

Angels Two-Zero presents rules for air to air combat in the early years of World War II. The approximate cut-off date is mid-1942. This allows the playing of the Battle of Britain and the opening salvos of the Pacific war.

Two or more players take sides, one side being the Allied forces and the other the Axis forces.

Angels Two-Zero shares many rules with Blazing Jets and Biplane Barmy, its Contemporary and World
War I predecessors.

The game is a 79 page book including:

Hand-painted full colour watercolour covers,
Complete rules of play
Axis and Allies Jargon Guide
315 counters including:
Counters and rules for 35 different aircraft types;
Miscellaneous counters including AA weapons,
ships and airfields;
Maneuver Charts
19 unique terrain maps in full colour


Taken from (and occasionally paraphrased) game introduction and promotional copy.***
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hände hoch!
description:
From the introduction to the rules:
"Policeman Paul has a lot of work to do today as quite a number of crooks are hanging around town. Studying the "personal description" given by the dice in the tumbler, you can help Paul track down the crooks in a thrilling chase. Who will be the best assistant policeman and the quickest at catching the right crook?"

This is a game in Haba's range of tumble-dice games, which include dice inside a sealed tumbler with a clear plastic dome. This game has 3 six-sided dice, two of which are essentially D3s, with 3 different faces repeated once. There is a die with dots (1, 2 or 3 dots), a colour die (yellow for the beach, green for the park and blue for the town) and a crook die (Policeman Paul, a chubby crook, a woman crook [on 2 faces] or a crook with a loot bag[on 2 faces]). Besides the dice and the rules, there's a large wooden piece representing Policeman Paul and a deck of 27 cards, showing all possible combinations with crooks of the three dice.

The 27 cards are placed face up on the table around the Policeman Paul piece. A player shakes the tumbler. Depending on what the dice in the tumbler show, players try to claim the corresponding cards on the table. If the crook die shows the Policeman Paul face, the other dice are ignored and players try to grab the Policeman Paul piece - the successful player gets to choose any card on the table and place it in front of himself. If the crook die shows a crook, the players try to cover with their hand the card showing the corresponding number (on the die with dots) of that kind of crook in the venue specified (by the colour die). Players can only use one hand and the player who successfully covers the correct card with his hand gets to place the card in front of him. Players who wrongly grab Policeman Paul or cover the wrong card can make no further attempt to claim the right card that turn. Cards in front of players can be captured by other players if the same combination of dice get rolled again.

The first player to claim five crook cards wins.

name: Silly Stix
description:
A clever little memory game where children drop brightly colored rods of varying lengths down hollow blocks of varying depths. The first player to line up three level heads in a row wins the game! When the rods are dropped, will they fall to the bottom of the block or stop somewhere in between? Switch the blocks and heads around each time you play to encourage memory development and essential silly skills!

Contents:
9 wooden blocks of various depths, 2 rod holders, 2 sets of 9 colored rods of various lengths, instructions.

name: Bratz Girl Talk
description:
From the Manufacturer:

The Stylin' Game of Truth or Dare

Want to laugh with your friends? Express your passion for fashion? Do krazy things? Then dare to play BRATZ GIRL TALK.

Sing a song...strut your stuff...tell a tale...and lots more. That's what BRATZ GIRL TALK is all about!

Spin the spinner and see if you'll have to do a funadelic stunt or answer a "tell all" question. Not hip enough to complete the dare? Then you won't score the points for that turn! Be the first to get 25 points and you rule. Ten check out the BRATZ CHAT cards you've collected to see just what your friends really think of you!

Ages 8 and up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Criblets
description:
Play starts by placing random tiles (there are 52 and they match the 52 cards in a standard deck, but with no suits) in the corners of the board, then alternate taking turns placing tiles to one side of the board to score the cards/tiles as a Cribbage hand. You can play up to 4 tiles to get a bonus and score all the rows and columns you play tiles into.

Contains:

52 tiles
drawstring bag
4 tile racks
game board
rules

name: Hastings 1066
description: Hastings 1066 is a Tactical level miniatures wargame which was inclued with Practical Wargamer magazine, Jan/Feb 1997 vol 10 no 7. It includes a separate map, rules and counters. Movement and combat are very simple, and are described as a basic outline framework for refighting the battle, with opportunities for improvements and extensions by the players.

name: Battle Zone
description:
Players roll dice to determine which colored pieces they can activate. When activated, a player can do the following with the piece:

* Place a small piece onto your home row under your control.
* Upgrade a piece you control or one that is standing.
* Move a piece you control
* Activate a lying piece you control by standing it up.
* Activate a standing piece by downgrading it. Apply area after downgrade.
* Take control of a standing piece.

If, during play, a piece is moved over and off your opponent's side of the board, place it aside. It is out of play and counts towards your win.

The first player to have a piece of each color cross over and off your opponent’s home row wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Matrix
description:
Matrix is an older boardgame from 1954 based on classical mathematical game theory of games with simultaneous selection of actions from a payoff matrix. The game has 2 phases:

First the two players (or 1 player vs several, in a multi-player variant) first take turns placing their 8 tiles valued 1, 2, 3, 4, 4, 5, 6, 7 on a 4x4 square grid to create a payoff matrix which will be more favorable for them than for the opponent. Then simultaneously one player chooses a row and the other a column for that payoff matrix to earn points, i.e. directly playing a classical game theoretic game, until one side reaches 25 points.

The multi-player variant in fact gives no upper bound on the number of players, but the example uses 4 players.

name: Cardinal's Guards
description:
A Solitary Confinement game for the piecepack

The year is 1626, and France is under the control of Cardinal Richelieu. The King and Queen are weak, and there is no love lost between the King’s musketeers and the Cardinal’s guards. In a castle in Normandy, four musketeers have just broken out of solitary confinement. The castle is well garrisoned, with a full company of the Cardinal’s guards, but the musketeers are determined to locate evidence of the Cardinal’s treachery against the King, that they know is somewhere within the castle. They form a plan; each musketeer will search a different set of particular halls and chambers, and then attempt to escape from the castle while defeating as many guards as possible. Hopefully the musketeer with the evidence will reach the King. The task ahead won’t be easy, but there is hope, and the musketeers have knowledge of a secret network of underground passages beneath the castle that the guards are unaware of.

In Cardinal’s Guards, the player moves the musketeers around the castle, defeating or luring guards, while searching various chambers, before trying to escape.


The musketeers are represented by the four pawns.
The coins represent the guards.
The tiles represent castle chambers.
The dice are used to keep track of the chambers searched.


The player’s score at the end of the game is based upon the number of chambers searched, the number of guards defeated, and the number of musketeers who escape.

name: Moscow Defended
description:
This is Moscow Attacked's smaller and simpler "little brother" (about the Battle of Moscow in late 1941)

Map scale: 100 kms per hex
Time scale: 1 turn = 20 days
Units: 14 ground and air units for the Germans and 16 for the Russians.

The game is available for FREE at http://LCoat.tripod.com/MoscDef.htm
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Princess Wishes Card Game
description:
Players compete to collect the most cards by recalling through memory the sequence of cards put into play.

The game is based on the Disney Princess license.

name: A Invasão da Alemanha
description: Wargame on the invasion of Germany in 1944-1945. Can be combined with Barbarossa and Normandia, two other games in the "II Guerra Mundial" series of wargames.

name: Was führt die Hilde denn im Schilde?
description:
A game with 5 turtles in different colors.

On a 8 x 8-field board each player tries to reach the adverse corner of the board with his turtle first. Game motor is a die with different functions.

name: Lucky Break
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to move all of their pawns into their home base. Players can use Lucky Break shortcuts to cut across a clover section in order to save time. Beware the Black Cat (dice and spaces labeled "Tough Break")! He'll stop you from winning if he can!

name: Perykles
description:
Perykles is a game about Greek ancient wars against Persian. It comprises a full colour map, counters need to be cut. The rules are in Polish.

Game is based on same system that as Hannibal Ante Portas

Game has 2 main elements
- There is strategical map of ancient Greece and parts of Asia minor, where players control countries, and provinces, gather taxes and recruit armies. Each territory produces up to fixed amounts of recruitment potential measured in men. Regions differ both in potential numbers and kinds of units that are recruitable.
Units are simple graded - Light/ Heavy infantry, light/ heavy cavalry.

Map movement is by army counters.
When an army crosses neutral province system of friendliness let players decide possible outcome from war, through neutrality to joining trespasser as ally.
There are rules for sieges, forced marches and pillaging.

-When 2 armies meet, Game is using metagame to play a battle.
Battle board has 12 fields
each players Right-flank , centre and right flank, and respective second lines.
Players place their forces in secret and give each part of the field an secret order such as Attack or Defense.

Game features historical scenarios, but is quite open.

name: Fang die Maus
description:
Content: 90 playing cards, 9 joker, 1 big mouse

Each player tries to get rid of his own cards (=mice). All players play simultaneously and put down their cards on the 3 to 4 decks on the table. The first player who get s rid of his cards catches the mouse, and wins the game.

name: Chicken Run: Chicken Warriors 2
description:
(Translated from the Japanese rulebook):
The goal of this game is to collect the most money for your marriage. But it's not just any money. It's the treasure of the dragon that you (think you) defeated.
As the players enter the dragon's lair and start collecting treasure, the dragon will eventually awaken. The players must then run away from the maddened dragon, while holding onto as much treasure as they can. But if they have a lot of treasure, they'll be slowed down. If the dragon gets them, not only will they get hurt, but they'll also drop the treasures, one after the other! So stack you items carefully, equip and re-equip, trip the other player's legs as much as you can and run for your life.
The player who gets out with the most treasure is declared the winner

name: Timelock
description:
Someone's gone and broken the TimeLine again.

An agent of the Time Repair Agency, you must create a Timelock to stop the TimeLine from arbitrarily changing. When everything went haywire, an alternate version of yourself was created. If your alter-ego sets their Timelock first, they will take your place in the TimeLine and vice-versa. Once it's done, who is the real you?

Timelock is a 2-player semi-abstract strategy game where players race to match Stacks of pyramids to their Goal... before their Goal changes, that is. Players will need two Treehouse sets (ideally one Rainbow set and one Xeno set), two 6-sided dice, one Treehouse die, and a Volcano board or other 5x5 square board.

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - 3rd place in 7th Competition

name: Red Ops 5
description:
Red Ops 5 is a fast-paced modern Zombie skirmish miniature game for 15mm and 28mm scales. Powered by the award winning game engine found in all games by Two Hour Wargames, Red Ops 5 is next evolution in tactical Zombie warfare.

Red Ops 5 can be played co-op and even solo.

Red Ops 5 is NOT All Things Zombie(ATZ), it just uses the engine that is also in ATZ. Red Ops 5 is a stand alone game system.

This set of rules is currently supplied in a downloadable PDF, but hard copies will be released soon. The game is also supported by a set of 15mm miniatures.

So Lock and Load, you’ve got a few Zombies to kill...
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Taktvoll Punktierte
description:
An expansion for Taktvoll which adds dotted notes. Contains 112 cards.

Expands:

Taktvoll
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music

name: Hot Dice
description:
Contents:
20 dices
2 special dices
3 wooden pieces

Hot Dice is the game where your dice is burning in your hands. You have to throw the right combinations and be alert about what your opponent throw at you. You can steel the turn if you are quick and the game is over when the first person has filled in the protocol correctly. May the dice be with you!!

name: Hanging Gardens
description:
King Nebuchadnezzar II has ordered the construction of a grand terraced garden complex, filled with trees and plant beds, to present to his wife as a gift. As royal engineers, the players compete for the king's favor by offering the most beautiful view upon completion of the gardens.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: San Andreas
description:
The big one is coming! Don't wall in the Pacific Ocean.

Players place coins to establish cities and roll dice to determine when quakes will happen. Tiles will shift and cities will be destroyed. If your cities are closer to the Ocean at game end you'll have the most valuable property and win the game.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Army Man Backgammon
description:
This game is played on a Backgammon board using opposing sets of 15 green army men and 15 tan army men (or any other contrasting colors available). The game also requires two six-sided dice.

The types army men are rated based on the weapon carried (which establishes attack range) and stance (which sets the maximum movement and saving throw values). Units that are standing or running can move faster but are more vulnerable, while units that are prone or kneeling can’t move as fast but are less vulnerable.

When one of your men is hit, it is removed from the game. If the piece designated as your Sergeant is removed from the game, then your remaining men must either dig-in or charge on every turn. The winner is the first player to move a man off the opponent’s side of the Backgammon board.

name: General Backgammon
description:
“2 Player Dice and Board Game. Backgammon Variant with specialized pieces. Napoleonic Military Theme.”

The game is played on a regular Backgammon board. Each player uses three six-sided dice and has a set of sixteen pieces composed of four Infantry, two each of Skirmishers, Horse Artillery, Field Artillery, Light Cavalry, and Heavy Cavalry, one General and one Lines of Communication. Units are rated for two capabilities – shoot and move. In addition, each type of unit has one or more Special Abilities.

There are five types of victory: Strategic - capture your opponent’s Lines of Communication Unit; Morale - kill or capture your opponent’s General and 4+ other Units; Attrition - destroy any 8+ enemy Units; Outflank - have 4+ of your units on your opponent’s back six points; and Positional - have 8+ of your units on your opponent’s front six points.

name: Battle Dice
description:
“A two player game of Fantasy battles using Dice to represent individual units. Object: Play continues until one side routs or is utterly destroyed. Dice: Dice are also referred to as troops and units.”

Each type of die represents a different type of Unit in the game. A four-sided die is a General Unit (Leader or Warlord), a six-sided die is an Infantry Unit, an eight-sided die is an Archer Unit, a ten-sided die is a Cavalry Unit, a twelve-sided die is a Mage Unit, and a twenty-sided die is a Monster Unit. The players start with an equal number of dice, but each may choose a different assortment (with each player being limited to one type of monster).

Each turn begins with the players rolling all of their dice. Combat is then resolved by first consulting the Monsters followed, in sequence, by combat separate resolution for Leaders, Mages, Cavalry, Archers, and Infantry.

name: New World Disorder: urban skirmishes in a dark future
description:
New World Disorder (2E) is an easy-to-learn, 25-28mm miniatures-based tabletop game that takes place in a very near and very dystopian future. Create deadly crews of vicious characters that improve as they accumulate experience from their firefights. Equip them using an extensive list of modern and near-future weapons that may just save their lives. Pit gangs of urban warriors against each other, as corporate mercenaries, mob-hit men, cannibals, and who-knows-what-else fight for survival on the streets of this world gone wrong.

Available in PDF format, and as a Printed Starter Set with full-color paper miniatures, area-effect templates, plastic bases (for miniatures), dice, and cardboard counters.

Expanded by:

New World Disorder: Zombie Apocalypse!
New World Disorder: CyberZone

name: Chaos on Cronos
description:
Chaos on Cronos is Pulp Sci-Fi miniatures rules from Scott Pyle of Four-Color Figures. These rules use Scott's Goalsystem.

From the author:
"Rocket into the far future with Chaos on Cronos, the Goalsystem tabletop miniature game of Pulp Science Fiction! Chaos on Cronos is a skirmish game designed for heroic scale 28mm miniatures, and uses designs and characters from Blue Moon Manufacturing's excellent line of Spacemen and Aliens. Cronos works great with as few as 5 figures per side, and using the Goalsystemʼs innovative Robot Legion rules, can accommodate as many as 20-30 figures per side! All you need to play are these rules, a handful of six-sided dice, and some Blue Moon miniatures! Cronos also features complete model creation rules so you can stat up your favorite Pulp sci-fi heroes, villains, and soldiers for battle!"

Available in PDF.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pearl Harbor
description:
"Solo Card Game. December 7, 1941. The player takes the role of the Japanese Imperial Navy First Air Fleet. Objective: Destroy as many US targets as possible."

The game is played with a custom deck of approximately 80 cards. There are four types of cards in the deck: Target, Strategy, Weapon, and Defense. The player attacks targets by playing a combination of Target, Strategy, and Weapon cards.

name: Solitaire Conquest
description:
"Solitaire board and card game with a fantasy conquest theme." The object of the game is to eliminate all of the Hordes from the continent.

The map depicts a continent made up of twelve connected regions. Each region is large enough to hold a stack of cards. Cards from the Foe Deck are dealt equally into eleven of the regions. These stacks are known as the Hordes. The player starts in the vacant region with a force drawn from the Ally Deck.

name: Fantastical Factory Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"Join Charlie and the other Golden Ticket winners on a fun-filled race through the Chocolate Factory!

All your fantastical favourites are here - the Chocolate Room, the Inventing Room, the Nut Room, along with the best of Mr. Willy Wonka's wonderful inventions, like Television Chocolate and the Great Gum Machine!

Each room is a game itself. Dodge the traps and the various surprises te Oompa-Loompas and squirrels have waiting along the way and be the one who wins a ride with Mr. Willy Wonka in the Great Glass Elevator!"

name: LIMITE 10
description:
The game of the 10 clues.
The players must guess the secret word on the card with as few clues as possible, the fewer number of clues needed to guess the word the more spaces your team can move. The board consists in a track, the first player or team on go around for ten times wins the game.

Components:
- 500 cards
- 1 board
- 12 player pieces

name: Deathsville Assassin The Board Game
description:
“The President is about to start a tour of Deathsville, despite warnings from a known terrorist group that an attempt will be made on his life. Deathsville’s finest law enforcement officers have vowed to protect the President throughout the tour and to hunt out any possible threats.

As a member of the Deathsville Police Department you must use search warrants to look for assassins, before the President encounters them. However with all the usual red tape getting in the way, even acquiring the necessary search warrants may take some time.

To make matters worse, it appears that a member of the Police Department is working with the terrorist and will not rest until the President is dead... let the tour commence!”

Deathsville Assassin is an exciting Print and Play board game for 3 to 6 players.

Players move around the game board searching for Assassins, but one player will secretly be working with the terrorists and must plot to ensure that the President does not survive his tour of Deathsville.

All the files needed to enable you to Print and Play this game are available from the site below. You will need to provide a 6 sided die.

http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=714&;pics
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: les 7 sages
description:
Box contents: a 15×15 board, 7 red square pawns and 7 red square pawns representing the wise men, 1 big red pawn representing the fool.

Each player uses his and his opponent's wise men in order to push the fool into his opponent’s base lines. The wise men moves like chess queen. Once pushed by a wise man, the fool bounces upon the other wise men at right angle.

name: Spectrum
description:
A card game based on the colors produced when white light is divided by a prism.

The deck of fifty-two cards includes seven cards of the following colors: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, and Violet. There are seven cards in each suit. There are also two wild cards (Infra-Red and Ultra-Violet) and a Prism card.

The object of the game is to be the first player to play a combo. The combos that may be played involve cards of the same color or cards in spectrum order.

name: ChampionChip
description:
This game can only be played while you and your friends are watching a football match (preferably on television).

Every player has his own set of coloured chips he uses to place bets on the the playing mat before or during the match.

Bets include:
- team to score first goal
- end result
- who'll get a yellow/red card first
- who scores the goals
- which team spits on the pitch first
- ...

Depending on the difficulty level of the bet you get payed by the bank and by the other players who lost the bet.

name: Operation: Darkstar – an Ambush Alley Scenario Pack
description:
In conjunction with Ambush Alley Games, Rebel Minis is releasing OPERATION: DARK STAR.

OPERATION: DARK STAR contains an exclusive mini-campaign written by Ambush Alley!

The campaign consists of three interlocking scenarios revolving around a Task Force Black mission that begins as a simple hostage rescue and culminates in a desperate battle to prevent the release of a biological agent in Baghdad's Green Zone.

This is a pdf booklet that can also be purchased as an attachment to "Operation: Dark Star Battle Box", that contains the 15mm miniatures to play the scenarios.

Expands:

Ambush Alley! A Game of Modern Urban Combat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Battle: The Napoleonic Wars
description:
The Classic Just Got Better!

Will "the Guard" take the hill at Waterloo this time? Wellington called the battle "a near run thing," and in fact, many of the battles of the period were just that... close affairs that tilted on a key decision or a critical error.

Now, LBG gives you a chance to explore some of those great battles, with an evolution of a proven system. From Battle™ the American Civil War , now comes, Battle: The Napoleonic Wars™. Pick a battle, or make up your own — you have 24 geomorphic hex tiles, printed on both sides for a multitude of possible battlefield combination. Pick an army—you have five major nations to choose from, plus minor allies, each with the full range of troop types that make the period so interesting... each troop type offering different strengths or weaknesses. Use historical scenarios, explore the "what might have been" of great campaigns, or use a "points’ system to build your own optimal force.

The diceless combat system means it all depends on your tactical skill... to know how unit strength compares with terrain advantages and enemy capabilities. You may groan at an error, but you’ll never wail about bad die rolls—the results are entirely up to you and your opponent.

(Game description taken from Lost Battalion Games Website)

name: A Fist Full of Coins
description:
In Fist Full of Coins players arrange playing pieces according to instructions on a card and receive coins based on the complexity of the task and how well it was carried out.

With the game comes a game board that serves as the holding area for the games pieces, the four levels of game cards, and is where the player assembles the pieces. The pieces in the game are various unique boxes and colored items which are arranged to match the instructions on a particular game card. There are four levels of card complexity in which the amount of instructions, and memory work increases. Players decided on how many turns to take, and at the end of those turn the person with the most coins is the winner.

The game can be used daily to aid in communication and reading comprehension, dyslexia, and memory. Designed for solo up to four players. For ages 5 and up.

The game is in English but French and Spanish add-ons are available.

Home Page: http://www.nomorelearningdisorders.com

name: USX Modern Day Heroes
description:
What is USX?

Designed to compliment RAFM's USX and Cthulhu range of figures the 32-page rulebook offers players a fun and fast game system. Printed in full color the book fills in areas that were hinted at in the Basic set with rules for:

-Vehicles

Rules for vehicles enhance the game play of USX by making cars and trucks more than just terrain pieces to hide behind, although they are still great cover! Damage, speed and handling all play a part in how your vehicle performs with a skid table, collisions and Hollywood type explosions all covered.

-Armor

Armor is handled through a simple yet effective modifier system that can be applied to vehicles and special units within the game.

-Mythos creatures

RAFM's Cthuhlu range of miniatures adds an element of horror to the game and allows players to face off against Mythos creatures. The use of a unique Horror check system compliments the Cthulhu element of the USX rules.

-Spells

You'll need some extra juju to deal with those horrors from beyond so we have included a few basic spells to help the budding cultist or investigator.

Specialty weapons and ammo such as flash bangs and man stopper rounds augment the game with special "Advanced rules" that work well when fighting off hordes of zombies or blinding the bad guys before your forces make their assault.USX is a flexible and fast game system capable of handling 2 player contests or group games with 4 and more players. Additional players do not slow USX and games will be concluded in 2 hours or less depending on the scenario. USX also features our "Dual initiative system" making the game more fun for all players involved.

name: Monopoly: Detroit
description: Advance to GO! and play the Detroit edition of the world's most famous board game. Or so the back of the box proclaims! This version highlights the Motor City!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: La Course au Large
description:
The name roughly translates to "Open Sea Race". This is a sailing game where players decide on a course to run (St. Malo to Quebec, Lorient-Bermudas round trip, The Rum Route and others on the North Atlantic). Each player runs a boat and tries to be the first to finish the course. Winds will change from turn to turn, and players must adjust sail and attitude to the wind (i.e. course) according to the winds encountered. A unique mechanism is that players can master risks (incurred by carrying an inappropriate amount of sail in the prevailing wind conditions) by answering trivia questions about sailing. The questions come in 3 levels of difficulty; the correct answer allows to continue travel unharmed, a wrong incurs a penalty. Penalties can damage the boat, but each player has two repair cards to be used in case of emergency.
The game board shows a map of the Atlantic Ocean from the equator to Newfoundland overlaid with a square grid. Certain currents and prevailing wind zones are marked and influence actual movement. Also on the map are obstacles in the form of completely blocked squares (ships, icebergs, large islands) and partly blocked squares (small islands).
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Bosh
description:
A Somali mancala game with Indian-style sowing.
From Mancala World:

"Bosh is a game played by the Darod clan in Somalia. It was first described by the ethnologue G. Marin in 1931. The game is similar to Indian mancala games such as Pachgarhwa and Sat-gol.

Rules

Bosh is played on a board of two rows, each consisting of five holes dug in the ground. There are four stones in each hole at the outset of the game.

At his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes anti-clockwise, one by one, into consecutive holes. After the last stone has been sown, the contents of the next hole are taken and distributed. These are Indian-style laps.

If the next hole is empty, the move is over. The contents of the hole immediately next to the empty one are captured. However, if the hole where a player has dropped his last stone is followed by two empty ones, he gets nothing.

If a player cannot move because all the holes on his side are empty, he forfeits all the remaing stones to his opponent.

Next round: each player fills his holes with four stones from his winnings. Any hole with less than the full amount is closed down with sand and considered as non-existent, but can be re-opened in a later round.

The aim of the game is to close down all the opponent's holes, that is to reduce his provision to less than four stones."

name: Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
description:
This is a Formula Dé track available for free download online - created by Alessandro Crespi.
It is a course based on Trieste City (Italy, Friuli Venezia Giulia).
You will race near Adriaticum Sea at the City Dock.
This is part of a track series called ITALY SERIES.

01. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Centro
02. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Colosseo
03. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Isola Tiberina
04. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Milano Castello Sforzesco
05. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Stadio Dall'Ara
06. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Palermo Marina
07. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
08. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Agrigento Valle dei Templi
09. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
10. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Firenze Lungo Arno
11. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Commemorative Track
12. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Misano, Santa Monica

name: Age of Sail
description: Age of Sail is a set of tabletop combat rules for naval engagements. The rule sets allow play in these eras/settings: Ancient, Renaissance, Napoleonic, American Civil war.
categories: American Civil War, Ancient, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Mediterranean Salvo!
description: Mediterranean Salvo! is a game module that may be used on its own, or in conjunction with any previously published modules of the Salvo! system. Mediterranean Salvo! contains the basic rules of the Salvo! system (in the form of the postcard game which includes ten ships), a sheet of 42 ships from WWII Mediterranean fleets, and a rule sheet containing optional rules and ship roster.

name: La Batalla de Cardedeu
description:
La Batalla de Cardedeu is a wargame on the Battle of Cardedeu (also known as the Battle of Llinars), which took place on December 16th 1808 near the town of Cardedeu].

In the battle 15,000 French troops commanded by Saint-Cyr faced some 9,000 Spanish troops commanded by Vives and Reding. The historical result was a French victory.

name: The Ukraine on Fire: French Debacle at Odessa 1919
description:
WW1 had barely ended when the Allies began to interfere with the Russian Civil War in 1918. France, eager to continue flexing its military muscle, sent troops to colonize and control the Ukraine region while disarming the German troops there. The local population welcomed them to some degree thinking the French and Greek troops were sent to liberate them from the Red menace. Armed with tanks, aircraft and armor cars, the French sent the Greeks out to remote areas to secure it. However, the Red followers had secured vast amounts of weapons from the Germans, much to the dislike of the French, and were more than eager to fight. By March 1919, the Ukraine was on fire. The French and Greek troops were greatly disliked by all Russians after their true intentions had been revealed to the general public. This further emboldened the Red forces who were outnumbering the Allies. In the coming weeks, numerous battles were fought until the last bastion at Odessa.

Game using the 'Russian Civil War Series' system.

Game components:

•One 11" x 17" map sheet depicting the terrain the battle was fought over.
•One sheet of 260 counters.
•One Players’ Aid Sheet.
•The series core rulebook that include the game rules used.
•A rulebook specific to The Ukraine on Fire.

name: Babel
description:
In Babel each player gets ten cards and trades cards with the other players in an attempt to form poker combinations. When a player has a good enough hand - two five-card combinations which are high enough, or a ten-card straight or flush - they go out. When a player reaches a certain target score the game ends.

With three to five players a single deck is used and players all sit at the same table. Trading is free-form and players may trade unequal numbers of cards. If trading bogs down and all players agree, they all draw one card from the deck but do not discard any (obviously not possible with five players). A player must have two combinations of flushes or better (or a ten-card set) to go out; when a player goes out the hand ends and all players score. Combinations lower than flush still score for the players not going out. If players drew extra cards only ten can be scored.

With more than five players multiple decks are used and the game is played as a party game with players circulating around the room. All trades must be equal since no extra cards can be drawn. When a player has two combinations of straight or better (or a ten-card set) they can take their hand to be scored and get a fresh hand. Pairs and triplets are not scored. This version is called Super-Babel in some editions.
categories: Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time
publishers: dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Funk & Wagnalls, Games and Puzzles (magazine), GAMES Magazine, Langewiesche-Brandt, Stein and Day

name: Scene It? To Go!: Disney
description:
Questions based on Disney Pixar characters and movies with real movie clips and trivia questions. Comes with on-screen trivia cards and dice, 1 game DVD, game board and 4 magnetic tokens. Similar to Disney Scene it, but travel form.

* Requires a DVD player and viewing screen(not included)
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Arabian Nights
description:
This Arabian Nights adventure appeals to all ages with its fantastical tale of Abu, the little thief who befriends Achmed, the prince of Bagdad and foils the nefarious plans of the evil grand vizier Jaffar, who seizes control of Bagdad and covets the princess of Basra. From its gorgeous, epic-scale sets to flying horses, magic carpets, all-seeing crystals, blue rose of forgetfullness, and, best of all, Rex Ingram's towering Djinni of the bottle.

Free all locations and the regime headed by Jaffar from power in Basra so that Achmed was married with the princess.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Finland '39-'40-The Winter War
description: Ten scenarios and four campaigns set in Finland during the Winter War of 1939-40. The Orders of Battle are written to be compatible with several miniatures rules including Battleground, Beer and Pretzels Skirmish (BAPS), BattleFront, Overlord, TAC:Skirmish, Skirmish '90 and The Face of Battle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Mecha Duel
description:
A card game for 2-4 players. The theme is that of Mechas ( giant human piloted robots ) fighting until only one is left standing.

Each player has a mat that allows them to track the amount of Damage and Disruption their Mecha has suffered during the combat.

The game proceeds through the playing of cards, and careful hand management makes for more lethal play.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
